Text

HAVE [you]517-you ever been to [Wales]1-wales ? [I]0-i do not ask this question of [any one in particular]518-any one in particular ; [I]0-i merely address it to [the universal British public]519-the universal british public , or , rather , to such member or [members of the same as]520-members of the same as shall be wise enough to sit down and read the ensuing true and moving love story — true as the loves of [wicked Abelard]129-wicked abelard and [Heloise]130-heloise , moving as those of [good Paul]131-good paul and [Virginia]2-virginia . Probably [those wise ones]521-those wise ones will be very few ; numerable by tens , or even units : [they]521-those wise ones will , [I]0-i may very safely aver , not form the bulk of [the nation]522-the nation . However high may be [my]0-i estimate of [my]0-i own powers of narration , however amply [Providence]132-providence may have gifted [me]0-i with self - appreciation , [I]0-i may be sure of that , seeing that the only books [I]0-i know of which enjoy so wide a circulation are the Prayer - book and [Bradshaw]133-bradshaw . [I]0-i am not going to instruct [any one]523-any one in religion or trains , so [I]0-i may as well make up [my]0-i mind to a more limited audience , while [I]0-i pipe [my]0-i simple lay ( rather squeakily and out of tune , perhaps ) , and may think [myself]0-i very lucky if [that same kind , limited audience]524-that same kind , limited audience do not hiss [me]0-i down before [I]0-i have got through half a dozen staves of the dull old ditty . Have [you]525-you ever been to [Wales]1-wales ? If [you]525-you have ever visited [the pretty , dirty , green spot where [Pat]134-pat and [his]527-his brogue]526-the pretty , dirty , green spot where pat and his brogue , where potatoes and absenteeism and head - centres flourish , alias [Ireland]3-ireland , [you]525-you have no doubt passed through a part of it , rushing by , most likely , in the Irish mail ; but in that case [your]525-you eyes and nose and ears were all so very full of dust and cinders — [you]525-you were so fully employed in blinking and coughing and enjoying the poetry of motion — as to be totally incapable of seeing , hearing , or smelling any of the beauties , agreeable noises , or good smells , which in happier circumstances might have offered themselves to [your]525-you notice . Perhaps [you]525-you are in the habit , every midsummer , of taking [your]525-you half - dozen male and female olive shoots to have the roses restored to their twelve fat cheeks by blowy scrambles about the great frowning Orme 's Head , or by excavations in [the Rhyl Sands]4-the rhyl sands . Perhaps [you]525-you have gone wedding - touring to [Llanberis]5-llanberis on the top of [a heavy - laden coach]528-a heavy - laden coach , swinging unsafely round sharp corners , and nearly flinging [[your]525-you Angelina]529-your angelina from [your]525-you side on to [the hard Welsh road below]530-the hard welsh road below . Perhaps [you]525-you have wept with [Angelina]135-angelina at [the spurious grave of [the martyred Gelert]532-the martyred gelert]531-the spurious grave of the martyred gelert , or eaten pink trout voraciously at [Capel Curig]6-capel curig , and found out what [a startlingly good appetite Angelina]533-a startlingly good appetite angelina had . But have [you]525-you ever lived in [the land of]534-the land of [the Cymri]136-the cymri ? Have [you]525-you ever seen how drunk [the masculine Cymri]136-the cymri can be on market days , or what grievous old hags [the feminine Cymri]535-the feminine cymri become towards [their]535-the feminine cymri thirtieth year ? have [you]525-you ever , by bitter experience , discovered the truth of that couplet — [I]0-i have lived in [Wales]1-wales , so [I]0-i speak with authority ; and for [my]0-i part [I]0-i do n't think that [Taffy]137-taffy is much more given to the breaking of the eighth commandment than the canaille of [any other country]536-any other country . [He]537-he is not [a bright fellow]538-a bright fellow , is not [Taffy]137-taffy ; happiest , [I]0-i think , when rather tipsy , or when yelling psalms in [[his]537-he conventicle]539-his conventicle or schism - shop — for [Taffy]137-taffy is addicted to schism ; [he]537-he will tell [you]525-you plenty of lies , too , and will not season them with the salt of a racy , devil - [me]0-i - care wit , as [Pat]134-pat would . But [he]537-he is very civil - spoken , and rather harmless ; seldomer , [I]0-i think , than [[his]537-he cleverer neighbour]540-his cleverer neighbour over the border does [he]537-he hanker feloniously after [[his]537-he neighbour]541-his neighbour 's spoons , or hammer [[his]537-he wife]542-his wife 's head with the domestic poker . But why am [I]0-i drivelling on , like a sort of Murray and water , on the manners and character of this , to [my]0-i thinking , not very interesting nation ? [I]0-i will waste no more " prave ' ords "[0-i] upon [them]543-they , as [the few men and women whom [I]0-i am going to tell [you]525-you about]544-the few men and women whom i am going to tell you about , and whom [I]0-i shall want [you]525-you to like a little , or dislike a little , as the case may be , are not [Taffies]138-taffies , only [they]543-they happen to have stuck up [their]543-they tent - poles in [[Taffy]137-taffy - land]545-taffy - land when [they]543-they first make [their]543-they low bow to [you]525-you . [These men]546-these men and [women]547-women were nothing out of the way for goodness , or beauty , or talent ; [they]546-these men did a hundred thousand naughty things , each one of [them]546-these men . [Some of [them]546-these men]548-some of them did [them]546-these men with impunity , as far as [this world]549-this world goes ; some of [them]546-these men , capricious [Megæra]139-megæra and [Tisyphone]140-tisyphone lashed with scorpions for [their]546-these men derelictions . This is going to be neither a " Life of [Saints]3378-saints , "[546-these men] nor a " History of [Devils]3379-devils ; "[3380-a " hedley vicars] these are memoirs neither of [a " Hedley Vicars]3380-a " hedley vicars , "[3380-a " hedley vicars] nor of a " [Dame aux Camellias]141-dame aux camellias ; "[3380-a " hedley vicars] so , whoso expects and relishes either of those styles of composition may forthwith close this volume , and pitch it ( if it be [his]550-his own , and not the battered property of [a circulating library]551-a circulating library ) into the fire . [Those who love a violent moral , or violent judgment for sins and follies]552-those who love a violent moral , or violent judgment for sins and follies — [a man struck dead for saying " damn , "]3381-a man struck dead for saying " damn , "[3381-a man struck dead for saying " damn , "] or [a woman]553-a woman for going to a ball , as the Record would charitably have [us]554-us believe is the way of Providence — equally with [those who enjoy the flavour of violent immorality]555-those who enjoy the flavour of violent immorality , will be disappointed if [they]555-those who enjoy the flavour of violent immorality look this way for the gratification of [their]555-those who enjoy the flavour of violent immorality peculiar idiosyncracies . Of [[my]0-i friends]556-my friends presently to be made known to [you]557-you , and criticised by [you]557-you , " the more part remain unto this present , but [some]3382-some have fallen asleep . "[557-you] Once upon a time — [I]0-i like that old , time - honoured opening ; it makes [one so nobly free]558-one so nobly free , gives [one]559-one so much room to stretch [one]559-one 's wings in , ties one down to [no king]561-no king 's reign , [no hampering , clogging century]562-no hampering , clogging century — once upon a time there was [a valley in [Taffy - land]137-taffy]563-a valley in taffy - land ; there is still , unless some very recent convulsion has upheaved it to the top of [a mountain]564-a mountain , or submerged it beneath the big Atlantic waves ; [a valley lovelier than that one in " [Ida]9-ida , "[566-no dangerous , good - looking parises] where " [beautiful Paris]108-paris , evil - hearted [Paris]108-paris]3383-a valley lovelier than that one in " ida , " where " beautiful paris , evil - hearted paris , "[566-no dangerous , good - looking parises] pastured [his]565-his sheep and [his]565-his jet - black goats , and inaugurated [his]565-his rakish course ; a valley where there are [no dangerous , good - looking Parises]566-no dangerous , good - looking parises , only one or two red - headed Welsh squires , who have [each married , or will in the fulness of time each]567-each married , or will in the fulness of time each marry , [one lawful wife]568-one lawful wife — red - headed , too , very likely ; and have never made , will never make , love to [any Enones or other ill - conducted young shepherdesses]569-any enones or other ill - conducted young shepherdesses . In fact , in that [Arcadia]10-arcadia there are [no such shepherdesses]570-no such shepherdesses ; [the daughters of [the Cymri]136-the cymri]571-the daughters of the cymri do not " ply [the homely shepherd]3384-the homely shepherd 's trade , "[571-the daughters of the cymri] nor would [they]571-the daughters of the cymri shed much romance over it if [they]571-the daughters of the cymri did ; for with sorrow be it spoken , blowsy are [they]571-the daughters of the cymri mostly , hard - featured , toothless ; and , moreover , [the little nimble , lean sheep that go scrambling and jumping and skurrying about the rough crags and [steep hill - sides]573-steep hill - sides]572-the little nimble , lean sheep that go scrambling and jumping and skurrying about the rough crags and steep hill - sides do not need [any crook'd and melodious Dowsabellas]574-any crook'd and melodious dowsabellas or [Neæras]143-neæras to look after [them]572-the little nimble , lean sheep that go scrambling and jumping and skurrying about the rough crags and steep hill - sides and guide [them]572-the little nimble , lean sheep that go scrambling and jumping and skurrying about the rough crags and steep hill - sides in the way [they]572-the little nimble , lean sheep that go scrambling and jumping and skurrying about the rough crags and steep hill - sides should go . In [that valley]575-that valley there are plenty of [houses]576-houses , [[squires]577-squires ' houses]578-squires ' houses and [[peasants]579-peasants ' houses , where the propagation of [the Cambrian]11-the cambrian]580-peasants ' houses , where the propagation of the cambrian is conducted with much success ; houses big and little , red - faced and white - faced and dirty - faced , old and new . But [we]581-we have at present to do with only [one of [those houses]583-those houses]582-one of those houses , and it comes under the head of [the littles]584-the littles and [the olds]585-the olds . Halfway up [a hill - side]586-a hill - side [it]582-one of those houses stands , looking across [the valley]587-the valley to [other higher hills that swell out softly against the sky]588-other higher hills that swell out softly against the sky , and go sloping gently down to [the sea twenty miles away]589-the sea twenty miles away . [They]590-they always remind [me]0-i — [I]0-i do n't know why — of [the distant hills in [Martin]144-martin]591-the distant hills in martin 's picture of [the " [Plains of Heaven]12-plains of heaven]3385-the " plains of heaven ; "[590-they] so mistily do they rise in their hazy blueness . [It]582-one of those houses is [a snug , unpretending little house]592-a snug , unpretending little house enough , with [its]582-one of those houses black and white cross - beamed front and unwalled [kitchen - garden]593-kitchen - garden straggling steeply up the slope at the back . Many and many a day has it stood there , seeing generations and fashions come in and go out ; has stood [there]594-there since the far - away days when [men]595-men wore curly wigs half - way down [their]595-men backs , and sky - blue coats , and fought and died for prerogative and [King Charles]145-king charles , or fought and lived for [England]13-england and liberty : when [most houses]596-most houses were black and white , like [its]596-most houses little elderly self , before plate glass or stucco , or [commodious villa residences]597-commodious villa residences , five minutes ' walk from [a station]598-a station , were dreamed of . The name of [the little house]599-the little house is Glan - yr - Afon . " [JACK]146-jack and [I]148-esther got in [our]3386-our last hayload to - day , without a drop of rain ; the first bit of good luck that has come to [us]3386-our , [I]148-esther do n't know when . If [we]3386-our had [any land]3387-any land , [I]148-esther should imagine that [we]3386-our must have a bit of consecrated ground among [it]3387-any land , to account for [our]3386-our ill - fortune ; but as [we]3386-our have not of [our]3386-our own enough to pasture a goose upon , that can not be it . Such an odd thing happened to - day — [Robert Brandon]147-robert proposed to [me]148-esther : it is the first offer [I]148-esther ever had , though [I]148-esther was seventeen last month . If it is never a more pleasant process than it was to - day , [I]148-esther hope sincerely it may be the last . [I]148-esther said ' Yes , ' too ; at least , a species of Yes after half - a - dozen Noes ; [I]148-esther can not imagine why , for [I]148-esther certainly did not feel Yes . [I]148-esther suppose [I]148-esther must have been pleased at any one wishing for [my]148-esther company during the term of [his]3388-his natural life . "[148-esther] The name on the fly - leaf of this journal - book is [Esther Craven]148-esther , [Glan - yr - Afon]24-glan - yr - afon , and the date July 10 , 186—. July is very often a rather wet month — not so this year ; all through its one - and - thirty days the sky was like brass , as it looked to [Elijah]149-elijah ( [the Seer]150-the seer 's ) eyes on [the top of [Carmel]15-carmel]600-the top of carmel , when , by [his]149-elijah faith , [he]149-elijah brought up the tarrying rain from [[the sea]601-the sea 's chambers]602-the sea 's chambers . [London]16-london is pouring out [[her]16-london noble army of [haberdashers and greengrocers]604-haberdashers and greengrocers]603-her noble army of haberdashers and greengrocers into [Ramsgate]17-ramsgate and [Margate]18-margate , and [Scarborough]19-scarborough and [Llandudno]20-llandudno . [The John Gilpins of to - day]605-the john gilpins of to - day are not satisfied with a modest outing to [the " Bell "[16-london] at [Edmonton]21-edmonton]606-the " bell " at edmonton , " all in a chaise and pair . "[607-armies of schoolboys] [Armies of [schoolboys]608-schoolboys]607-armies of schoolboys are devouring arid sandwiches and prime old buns in [railway refreshment rooms]609-railway refreshment rooms — [schoolboys]608-schoolboys emptied out of [every school]611-every school and [seminary and college]612-seminary and college all over [the country]613-the country . [Highly paid instructors of [youth]615-youth]614-highly paid instructors of youth are stretching [their]614-highly paid instructors of youth cramped legs up [the steep sides of [Helvellyn]22-helvellyn and [Mont Blanc]23-mont blanc]616-the steep sides of helvellyn and mont blanc , and surveying the " frozen hurricane "[614-highly paid instructors of youth] of the glaciers through [their]614-highly paid instructors of youth academic spectacles . And [young Craven]148-esther 's ( of [Glan - yr - Afon]24-glan - yr - afon ) last hayload is safely stacked , as [you]617-you heard from [[his]618-his sister]619-his sister 's diary . This morning [the highest lying of [the upland fields]621-the upland fields]620-the highest lying of the upland fields was hilly with haycocks : to - night it is as flat as [Salisbury]25-salisbury Plain . All day long the waggons have gone grinding and crunching up and down [the rocky mountain road]622-the rocky mountain road between [field]623-field and [rick - yard]624-rick - yard . All day long [Evan]151-evan and [Hugh]152-hugh and [Roppert]153-roppert ( sic ) with [their]625-their waistcoats open and [their]625-their brown arms bared , aided and abetted by [various Cambrian matrons]626-various cambrian matrons , with bonnets standing upright on [their]625-their heads , and pitchforks in [their]625-their lily hands , have been tossing the scented bundles — sweeter in death than in life , like [a good man]627-a good man 's fame — into the carts ; loading [them]628-them till of the shaft horse nought but ears and nose and forelegs appeared , save to the eye of faith . All day long [Esther]148-esther has been sitting under a haycock , as one might fancy [[Solomon]154-solomon 's wise woman]629-solomon 's wise woman doing , " looking well to the ways of [[her]148-esther household]3389-her household . "[148-esther] The hay moulds itself pliably into a soft arm - chair for [her]148-esther young , slight figure , and [the big hay - spiders]630-the big hay - spiders walk up [her]148-esther back at [their]630-the big hay - spiders leisure , and explore the virgin forests of [her]148-esther thick dusk hair . [She]148-esther has had [her]148-esther luncheon brought out to [her]148-esther there — bread and milk in a white bowl . It is unsocial , surly work , eating alone ; [one]559-one feels reduced to the level of a dog , cracking bones , and lapping up gravy out of [his]559-one trencher , all by [himself]559-one , with tail well down , like a pump handle , and a growl and a snap for [any brother dog who may approach to share [his]559-one feast]632-any brother dog who may approach to share his feast . [The haymakers]633-the haymakers were much cheerier—"couched at ease "[633-the haymakers] under the nutty hedgerow , bringing slices of unnaturally fat bacon out of blue and white spotted pocket - handkerchiefs , gabbling to one another in the Welsh tongue , which , to one who occupies [the room of the unlearned]634-the room of the unlearned , has always a querulous , quarrelsome , interrogative sound , and digging [their]633-the haymakers clasp knives into the ground to clean [them]633-the haymakers , when [their]633-the haymakers services were no longer required . [Jack]146-jack is out for the day , and [the place]635-the place feels stupid without [him]146-jack . There is not much melody in " [I]559-one paddle [[my]559-one own canoe]3390-my own canoe , "[559-one] but [one]559-one misses it when [one]559-one is accustomed to hear it echoing gaily over [the crofts]638-the crofts and through [the farm - yard]639-the farm - yard and [orchard]640-orchard . It would be impossible to talk more dog - Welsh than [Jack]146-jack does to [[his]146-jack workmen]641-his workmen ; but even the mellifluous tongue of [the Cymri]136-the cymri , with its three or four consonants standing together , undissevered by any vowel , is made harmonious , enunciated by [a young , clear voice , that sounds as if it had never been the vehicle for sorrowful words]642-a young , clear voice , that sounds as if it had never been the vehicle for sorrowful words . " [The village]3391-the village seems asleep or dead , Now [Lubin]155-lubin is away , "[148-esther] and [Esther]148-esther , though [she]148-esther has entered upon [her]148-esther eighteenth year ( an age which a century ago would have been rather overripe — [Chloe]156-chloe and [Cynthia]157-cynthia and [Phyllis]158-phyllis being considered in [their]643-their prime at fifteen , and toasted accordingly ) , has as yet no [Lubin]155-lubin but [[her]148-esther brother]644-her brother . Now and again , [Gwen]159-gwen [the cook]645-the cook , and [[Sarah]160-sarah [the housemaid]647-the housemaid]646-sarah the housemaid , came panting up [the hill]648-the hill in lilac cotton gowns and trim white aprons , bearing beer in every jug and mug and tin pipkin that [Glan - yr - Afon]24-glan - yr - afon affords , as [Evangeline]161-eve brought the nut - brown ale to [the reapers of [the village of]650-the village of [Grand Pré]27-grand pré]649-the reapers of the village of grand pré . And [the haymakers]633-the haymakers drink insatiably , and wipe the thirsty mouth upon the convenient sleeve as [artless Nature]162-nature bids . By - and - by artless Nature makes [them]633-the haymakers rather unsteady on [their]633-the haymakers legs . As [they]633-the haymakers lead [the heavy - laden cart]652-the heavy - laden cart to the last remaining haycock , the one on which [[their]633-the haymakers mistress]653-their mistress sits enthroned , [I]0-i am not at all sure that [they]633-the haymakers do not see two haycocks , two wide - leaved white hats , [two Esthers]654-two esthers . Perceiving [their]633-the haymakers condition , though too old [an inhabitant of [Wales]1-wales]655-an inhabitant of wales to be in any degree surprised at what is , after all , the normal condition of [the Welsh]163-the welsh , [Miss Craven]164-st. john rises precipitately . Driven from [[her]164-st. john fortress]656-her fortress , [she]164-st. john picks up [her]164-st. john needles and threads , and [Jack]146-jack 's shirt , from which , as usual , the frequent button is missing , and runs lightly down [the mountain path]657-the mountain path in [her]164-st. john strong country boots , which bid defiance to the sharp stones that crop out at every step through the limestone soil . At [the hall]658-the hall door — a little arched door like [a church 's]659-a church 's , with a trellised porch and benches , such as [one]559-one sees [Dutch boors]661-dutch boors sitting on with [their]661-dutch boors beer and schnapps , in [Teniers]165-teniers ' pictures — [Sarah]160-sarah meets [her]164-st. john . [Sarah]160-sarah is [an Englishwoman]662-an englishwoman . " [Mr. Brandon]166-mr. brandon is in [the parlour]3392-the parlour , ' m. "[160-sarah] " [Parlour]28-parlour ! [A little room that looks towards the sun - setting]664-a little room that looks towards the sun - setting ; [a little room full of evening sunshine and the smell of tea - roses]665-a little room full of evening sunshine and the smell of tea - roses ; a light paper , with small , bright flower - bunches on the walls ; white muslin curtains ; a general air of crisp freshness , as of [a room that there are]666-a room that there are [no climbing , crawling , sticky - fingered children]667-no climbing , crawling , sticky - fingered children to crumple and rumple . [A young woman , rather red in the face]668-a young woman , rather red in the face , standing in one corner . At a rough calculation , [you]663-you would say that [the young man]670-the young man was seven feet high ; but put [him]670-the young man with [his]670-the young man back against the wall , with [his]670-the young man heels together , and [his]670-the young man chin in , and [you]663-you will find that [he]670-the young man is exactly six feet four ; that is , four inches taller than [any man who wishes to do work in [the world]672-the world , and find horses to carry [him]670-the young man]671-any man who wishes to do work in the world , and find horses to carry him , ought to be . [His]670-the young man clothes are rather shabby , and [he]670-the young man looks poor ; but , from the crown of [his]670-the young man close - clipped head to the sole of [his]670-the young man big feet , [a gentleman]673-a gentleman , every inch of [him]670-the young man , though [he]670-the young man has no " gude braid claith "[670-the young man] to help to make [him]670-the young man so . [His]670-the young man features may be [Apollo]168-apollo 's or [Apollyon]169-apollyon 's , for all [you]663-you can see of them , so thickly are they planted out with a forest of yellow hair ; but tears do not seem to be at any immense distance from eyes blue as the sky between storm clouds , fearless as [a three - years ' child]674-a three - years ' child 's . " Do n't [you]670-the young man think that [we]3397-we do very well as [we]3397-we are ? "[675-the young woman] says [the young woman]675-the young woman , suggestively . This is what has been over - roasting the mutton . [He]670-the young man has been asking [her]148-esther to take [his]670-the young man heart , [his]670-the young man large hand , and the half of one hundred and twenty pounds a year ( the exorbitant pay of [a lieutenant in [[Her]678-her Majesty]679-her majesty 's infantry]677-a lieutenant in her majesty 's infantry ) , of an old hunting watch , and a curly retriever dog ; and [she]148-esther has been declining these tempting offers , one and all . The minute hand of the gilt clock , on which [Minerva]170-minerva sits in a helmet and a very tight gown , with [her]170-minerva legs dangling down , has travelled from 6.30 to 7.5 , and within these five - and - thirty minutes [Miss Craven]164-st. john has refused three proposals , all made by [the same person]680-the same person : the first , very stoutly and mercilessly , from [Jack]146-jack 's arm - chair , where [she]164-st. john had originally taken up [her]164-st. john position ; the second , decisively still , but with less cruelty , from the music - stool , to which [she]164-st. john had next retired ; and the third , in a hasty and wavering manner , from the corner , in which [she]164-st. john has taken final refuge , in a strong , fortified entrenchment behind the writing - table . " It really is so silly , "[148-esther] says [Esther]148-esther , presently , compassionate but impatient . " Do try and get the better of it ! " Perhaps [you]148-esther are afraid of marrying on small means ? "[166-mr. brandon] suggests [Brandon]166-mr. brandon , diffidently , after a while . "[147-robert] " What would [you]147-robert have [me]692-i say ? "[692-i] [she]692-i cries , standing with fluttering colour , tapping feet , and irritated eyes . " [I]147-robert have not much to recommend [me]147-robert , [we]3418-we all know that , and [I]147-robert start with the disadvantage of [your]147-robert thinking [me]147-robert rather [a bore]3419-a bore than otherwise ; but [other men]3420-other men have overcome even greater obstacles ; why should not [I]147-robert ? "[694-i] " No . "[694-i] " [You]695-the young fellow are certain ? "[694-i] " Certain . Whatever [you]147-robert do , [I]695-the young fellow shall love [you]147-robert to - day , and to - morrow , and always , "[695-the young fellow] says [the young fellow]695-the young fellow , very solemnly ; and [his]694-i eyes go away past [her]696-her , through the window , and up to the blue sky overhead , as if calling on the great pale vault to be witness between [him]694-i and [her]696-her . As for [her]696-her , [her]696-her prosaic soul has wandered back to the mutton ; [she]696-her takes the opportunity of [his]694-i eyes being averted to steal a glance at the clock . Apparently , however , [he]694-i has eyes in the back of [his]694-i head , for [he]694-i says hastily , with rather a pained smile : " [You]696-her are longing for [me]694-i to go . "[694-i] " No — o. "[694-i] " [I]694-i ought not to have come at this time of night . [I]694-i ought to have waited till to - morrow , [I]694-i know . "[694-i] " It is rather late . "[694-i] " But to - morrow seemed such a long time off , that [I]694-i thought [I]694-i must know the worst or the best before the sun came up again . [I]694-i do n't quite know which it is now ; which is it , [Esther]148-esther ? "[694-i] " It 's neither [the one]3424-the one nor the other ; it 's the second best , "[696-her] [she]696-her answers , all smiles again at seeing some prospect of [[her]696-her admirer]697-her admirer 's departure , and forgetting , with youthful heedlessness , the price at which that departure has been bought . " It is that [I]694-i really am very much obliged , though , all the same [I]694-i wish [you]148-esther would think better of it , and that [I]694-i 'll try ; [I]694-i will , really ; do n't look as if [you]148-esther did not believe [me]694-i . "[694-i] So with this half - loaf [he]697-her admirer goes , passes away through [the little wooden porch]698-the little wooden porch , that is so low it looks as if it were going to knock [his]697-her admirer tall head , past [the stables]699-the stables , and through [the oak woods]700-the oak woods , [home]701-home As saith that most delicious of love poems that makes [us]702-our all feel immoral as [we]702-our read it . It is the hour when [chanticleer]172-chanticleer retires to [his]172-chanticleer perch in [the henhouse]703-the henhouse , lowers [his]172-chanticleer proud tail , sinks [his]172-chanticleer neck into [his]172-chanticleer breast , and goes to sleep between [[his]172-chanticleer two fattest wives]704-his two fattest wives . It is the hour when animal life and wild humanity retire to bed ; the hour when [tamed humanity]705-tamed humanity sits down to dinner . The more [we]702-our advance in civilisation the farther back [we]702-our push the boundaries of sleep and forgetfulness . When [we]702-our reach [our]702-our highest point of culture , [I]0-i suppose [we]702-our shall hustle [the blessed]706-the blessed , [the divine Nepenthe]707-the divine nepenthe , off the face of [the earth]708-the earth altogether . [The dining - room]688-the dining - room at [Glan - yr - Afon]24-glan - yr - afon is , like the rest of [the house]687-the house , rather small and rather pleasant . [It]688-the dining - room will not dine more than twelve comfortably ; it is seldom asked to dine more than two ; and these two , being young and void of gluttony , do not spend much of [their]711-their time in it . In youth [the dining - room]688-the dining - room is not [[our]702-our temple]713-our temple , [[our]702-our sanctuary]714-our sanctuary , [our]702-our holy of holies , as it often is in riper years . In youth [our]702-our souls are great , and [our]702-our bodies slender ; in old age [our]702-our bodies are often great and [our]702-our souls slender . The one wide open window looks on [the gay little garden]715-the gay little garden — the window , all around and about which the climbing convolvulus is blowing great white trumpets . There are two or three pictures on the walls ; good ones , though dim and dusty . [Thomas Wentworth]173-thomas wentworth , [Lord Strafford]174-lord strafford , very dark and haughty and saturnine , in blue grey armour , scowing at whosoever looks at [him]174-lord strafford , as [he]174-lord strafford might have scowled at [Pym]175-pym and [Hollis]176-hollis . [Erasmus]177-erasmus , astute and lean , in a black skull cap : and [Mary]178-mary , [Queen of Scots]716-queen of scots , very pale and peaky and indistinct , for time has washed and scrubbed all the carmine out of the cheeks and lips that sent [Europe]179-europe mad three centuries ago . [An old sheep - dog]717-an old sheep - dog is lying on the hearth - rug , with [his]717-an old sheep - dog wise old eyes fixed on [[his]717-an old sheep - dog master]718-his master , licking [his]717-an old sheep - dog chops every now and then when [he]717-an old sheep - dog sees some morsel more tempting than ordinary conveyed to another mouth than [his]717-an old sheep - dog . This evening [Lord Strafford]174-lord strafford is scowling , [Mary Stuart]178-mary simpering , down upon [two people dining together]719-two people dining together , and on [a third person whisking about in a clean cap]720-a third person whisking about in a clean cap and an aggressively well - starched print dress in attendance upon [them]719-two people dining together . There is a great pot , full and brimming over with roses — a beanpot [[our]721-our forefathers]722-our forefathers would have called it — in the middle of the table . [They]719-two people dining together were plucked but half an hour ago , and [their]719-two people dining together faces were still wet with the dew - tears that [they]719-two people dining together wept at being torn away from [[their]719-two people dining together brothers]723-their brothers and sisters on the old gnarled rose trees up the [kitchen - garden walk]724-kitchen - garden walk . But the freshest , the sweetest , the largest of the roses is not in the beanpot with the others ; it is on a chair by itself ; there are no dew - tears on [its]725-its cheeks , it has no prickles , and its name is [Esther]148-esther . " Have some roast chips , [Essie]180-essie ? [I]148-esther can not offer [you]180-essie any roast mutton , because there is n't any ; [I]148-esther dare say there was an hour ago , but there certainly is n't now . "[148-esther] This speech is made by [Jack]146-jack . [Jack]146-jack is [a young person]726-a young person with not a single good feature in [his]146-jack face ; with a baby moustache , which , like the daguerreotypes of fifteen or sixteen years ago , is only visible at rare intervals in one particular light ; and with cheeks and nose and chin and throat all as brown as any berry that ever ripened under the mellow autumn sun . " It 's a fault on the right side , [dear boy]3425-dear boy ; it 's better than quivering and being purple , "[148-esther] says [Esther]148-esther , with a pout which [a lover]727-a lover would have thought entrancing , but which [a prosaic brother]728-a prosaic brother , if [he]728-a prosaic brother perceived it at all , considered rather a distortion than otherwise . " [I]728-a prosaic brother wish that [people]3426-people would remember that there is a time to call and a time to dine , and that the two times are not the same , "[728-a prosaic brother] [he]728-a prosaic brother grumbles , a little crossly . [A man]3402-a man may bear the untimely cutting off of [[his]3402-a man firstborn]730-his firstborn , the disposition evinced by [the wife of [his]3402-a man bosom]731-the wife of his bosom to love [[his]3402-a man neighbour]541-his neighbour as [himself]3402-a man , the sinking of [his]3402-a man little all in [the Agra Bank]733-the agra bank , with resignation and fortitude truly [Christian]181-christian ; but what [hero]734-hero , what sage , [what archbishop]735-what archbishop , can stand the over - roasting or under - boiling of [his]3402-a man mutton , the burning of [his]3402-a man soup , or the wateriness of [his]3402-a man potatoes , and bear an æquam mentem " [Esther]148-esther looks rather conscious , purses up [her]148-esther pink mouth into the shape of a noiseless "[181-christian] Hush ! " and says "[181-christian] Pas avant , " which idiomatic phrase is intended to convey to [[her]148-esther brother]644-her brother the indiscreetness of making comments in [Sarah]160-sarah 's presence on [Mr. Brandon]166-mr. brandon 's enormities . From long familiarity with the sound , [Sarah]160-sarah has become entirely acquainted with [Esther]148-esther 's specimen of Parisian French , and always pricks up [her]160-sarah ears when it appears on the scene . Then [they]3428-they are silent for a little space . [One]559-one is not apt to say very brilliant things in [one]559-one 's family circle ; it requires the friction of mind with mind before bright sayings spring into being , as the flint and the steel must be married before the spark leaps into life . "[181-christian] How long the days are now ! " [Jack]146-jack says presently , as [he]146-jack looks out on the evening light lying like a great bright cloak all over [the land]3431-the land . [The earth]708-the earth is so very fair , all pranked with "[181-christian] smalle flowres " and green leaves , that the sun is grievously loth to leave [her]148-esther . [Fair - weather friend]3433-fair - weather friend as [he]146-jack is , [he]146-jack can not be in too great a hurry to desert [her]148-esther , when [she]148-esther lies poor and bare and faded in the dull November days . "[559-one] [One]559-one always says that this time of year , " [Esther]148-esther says , smiling . "[559-one] It would be much more worthy remark if [they]737-they did n't get longer ; if one kept a journal of [one]559-one 's remarks for a year , what an awful tautology there would be in them ! What a pity that one can not say a thing once for all , and have done with it ! " "[739-you] If [you]739-you resolved never to say anything that [anybody]740-anybody had said before , [you]739-you would make mighty few observations , [I]0-i take it , " [Jack]146-jack answers , a little drily . "[739-you] Most remarks have been pretty well aired in the course of the last six thousand years , [I]0-i fancy . " So , with a little flagging talk , the dinner passes , and the modest dessert appears : scarlet pyramids of strawberries , great bag - shaped British Queens , and little racy , queer - tasted hautbois . "[190-bob] Why do [people]3426-people give [babies]781-babies gin?—it is not good for [them]781-babies , but it keeps [them]781-babies quiet ; that is precisely [my]0-i principle . Being engaged to [me]0-i may not be good for [Robert]147-robert , but it is gin to [him]147-robert ; it keeps [him]147-robert quiet , " answers [Esther]148-esther , on the battle - field of whose small face smiles and tears are fighting . "[0-i] [I]0-i wo n't have [you]0-i playing fast and loose with [him]190-bob , " [he]644-her brother says , very decisively , shaking a stern young head — stern , despite its curliness and its total dearth of those care - lines that are supposed to be [Wisdom]191-wisdom 's harsh footprints . "[0-i] [He]190-bob is much too good [a fellow]3408-a fellow to be played tricks with ; mind that , [Miss Esther]148-esther ! " "[148-esther] [I]0-i have not the slightest desire in life to play tricks with [him]190-bob ; if [I]0-i ever do play tricks , [I]0-i hope it will be with some one more amusing , " answers [Essie]180-essie , very pettishly , looking excessively mutine and ill - humoured . "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't care if [I]0-i never hear [his]190-bob ugly name again ; [he]190-bob has spoilt the dinner and made [you]0-i as cross as two sticks ; and — and — [I]0-i wish [he]190-bob was dead , that [I]0-i do ! " concludes happy [Mr. Brandon]166-mr. brandon 's fiancée weeping . MORNING is come again . The sun can not bear to be long away from [[his]190-bob young sweetheart]3444-his young sweetheart , [the earth]708-the earth , so [he]190-bob has come back hasting , with royal pomp , with [his]190-bob crown of gay gold beams on [his]190-bob head , with [his]190-bob flame - cloak about [his]190-bob strong shoulders , and with a great troop of light , flaky clouds — each with a reflex of [his]190-bob red smile on its courtier face — at [his]190-bob back . [He]190-bob has come back to see [himself]190-bob in the laughing blue eyes of [her]3444-his young sweetheart seas and streams , and to rest at noontide , like a sleepy giant , on [her]3444-his young sweetheart warm green lap . The daily miracle — the miracle that none can contest , to which all are witness , has been worked — the resurrection of [the world]672-the world . And this resurrection is not partial , not limited to humanity , as that final one is towards which the eyes of [the Christian church]3447-the christian church have been looking steadfastly for eighteen centuries and a half ; but every beast and bird and flower has shaken off [Death]192-death 's sweet semblance , [his]192-death gentle counterfeit , and is feeling , in bounding vein and rushing sap , the ecstatic bliss of the mystery of life . If [we]3448-we never slept , [we]3448-we should not know the joy of waking ; if [we]3448-we never woke , [we]3448-we should not know the joy of sleep . How , [I]0-i marvel , shall [we]3448-we feel the happiness of heaven , if [we]3448-we never lose , and consequently regain it ? The thrushes and blackbirds are already in the midst of [their]3449-their glees and madrigals and part songs . [They]3449-their sing the same songs every day , so that they are quite perfect in them ; and they are all very joyful ones . In [their]3449-their sweet flute - language there are no words expressive of sorrow or pain ; [they]3449-their know of no minor key . There were twenty roses born last night , and the flowers are all rejoicing greatly . [They]3449-their are smiling and whispering and gossiping together ; the sweet peas , like pink and purple butterflies , "[0-i] .... on tiptoe for a flight , With wings of delicate flush o'er virgin white , " each half - inclined to hover away with the young west wind that is sighing such a little gentle story all about [himself]190-bob into [their]3449-their ears . The lambs , grown so big and woolly that one might almost mistake [them]3449-their for [[their]3449-their mothers]3450-their mothers , are leaping and racing and plunging about in the field below [the house]687-the house , in the giddiness of youth , unprescient of [the butcher]3452-the butcher . Hated of [Miss Craven]164-st. john 's soul as much as ever were [the blind and lame of [King David]193-king david 's]3453-the blind and lame of king david 's are those too , too agile sheep . Grievously prone are [they]3449-their to ignore the low stone wall of partition , and work havoc and devastation among the aster tops and cabbage shoots of [[her]164-st. john garden]3454-her garden . [The King of [Glan - yr - Afon]24-glan - yr - afon]3455-the king of glan - yr - afon is not counting out [his]3455-the king of glan - yr - afon money , because [he]3455-the king of glan - yr - afon has not any to count , [poor young fellow]3456-poor young fellow . [He]3455-the king of glan - yr - afon is sitting on a garden - chair , reading the Times , and thinking how much better [he]3455-the king of glan - yr - afon would rule [the Fatherland]3457-the fatherland , how much less mean and shabby and selfish [he]3455-the king of glan - yr - afon would make [her]164-st. john in [other nations]3458-other nations ' eyes , if [he]3455-the king of glan - yr - afon might but have the whip and reins for six months or so . [Old Luath]186-old luath lies at [his]186-old luath feet , with dim eyes half closed , snapping lazily at the flies , and catching on an average about one every quarter of an hour . [Esther]148-esther is in [the stack - yard]3459-the stack - yard , holding a levy of ravenous fowls . [She]148-esther has tied a large white kitchen - apron round [her]148-esther waist ; with one hand [she]148-esther is holding it up , with the other [she]148-esther is scattering light wheat among a mixed multitude . [Baby Cochins]194-baby cochins , in primrose velvet ; hobbledehoy Cochins , au naturel , with not a stitch of clothes on [their]194-baby cochins bare , indecent backs ; [adult Cochins]3460-adult cochins , muffled and smothered up to the chin in a wealth of cinnamon feathers , and with cinnamon stockings down to [their]194-baby cochins heels ; Rouen ducks , and scraggy - necked turkeys . [She]164-st. john is doing [her]164-st. john very best to administer justice to [[her]164-st. john commonwealth]3461-her commonwealth , to protect [the weak]3462-the weak , to prevent aggression and violence ; but like [many another lawgiver]3463-many another lawgiver [she]164-st. john finds it rather up - hill work . Strive as [she]164-st. john may , the ducks get far the best of it . [They]194-baby cochins have no sense of shame , and can shovel up such a quantity at a time in [their]194-baby cochins long yellow bills . [The turkey - cock]3464-the turkey - cock , on the other hand , gets much the worst , by reason of the long red pendant to [his]3464-the turkey - cock nose , that gets in [his]3464-the turkey - cock way and hinders [him]3464-the turkey - cock . [They]194-baby cochins say that [Nature]162-nature never makes anything for ornament alone , divorced from use ; but [I]0-i confess to being ignorant as to what function [that long flabby dangler]3465-that long flabby dangler has to fulfil . [The stack - yard]3459-the stack - yard is all on the slant ; [it]3459-the stack - yard slopes down with [its]3459-the stack - yard many stack - frames , to [the old rough grey barn that is stained all over - walls and roof and door — with the stormy tears of a score of winters]3467-the old rough grey barn that is stained all over - walls and roof and door — with the stormy tears of a score of winters . There is no lack of voices all about [the farm]3468-the farm to - day : voice of [Sarah]160-sarah chattering in the drying ground , where [she]160-sarah is hanging [Esther]148-esther 's cotton gowns and [Jack]146-jack 's shirts on the lines ; voice of [Evan Evans]151-evan , [the carter]3469-the carter , talking friendly to [[his]151-evan heavy team]3470-his heavy team in that deplorable tongue which , [we]3471-we trust , will soon be among the abuses of the past ; voice of [Seryn]195-seryn ( Welsh for [Star]196-star ) , from [the pasture]3472-the pasture , lowing for [her]195-seryn calf , which a day ago became veal , and a day hence ( Oh blessed short memory ! why can not [we]3471-we take lessons from a cow ? ) [she]195-seryn will have forgotten utterly . Presently comes another voice , clearer , stronger , nearer than the others — comes sailing up through the July air . "[0-i] Es — ther ! " "[783-you] [Ye]783-you — es ! " responds [Esther]148-esther at the tip - top of [her]148-esther voice , and consequently not particularly harmonious . It is only the lark that can talk at the top of [his]146-jack voice and yet not be shrill . "[783-you] Where are [you]783-you ? " ( [Forte]197-forte . ) "[783-you] In [the stack - yard]3459-the stack - yard . " ( [Fortissimo]198-fortissimo ) . Obedient to this direction , in about two minutes [the owner of the voice]3473-the owner of the voice , and of the excellent lungs which sent it out , makes [his]146-jack appearance in loose cool clothes and a smile — [Jack]146-jack , in fact , looking very ugly and pleasant and good - natured . "[783-you] [Jack]146-jack , [dear boy]3425-dear boy , open the gate . Quick ! Out of the way ! Do n't let [him]146-jack get under the stack - frame . Shoo ! " cries [Esther]148-esther , in great excitement , rushing wildly about in [her]148-esther big apron , in pursuit of [a large drake with a grasping soul]3474-a large drake with a grasping soul , and a wonderful rainbow neck , who , with bill wide open and wings half extended , is waddling , flying , quacking away from [Nemesis]199-nemesis as hard as [his]146-jack splay feet and [his]146-jack full crop will let [him]146-jack . [Jack]146-jack obeys . "[786-a person in the drawing - room] There is [a person in [the drawing - room]787-the drawing - room]786-a person in the drawing - room wanting to speak to [you]783-you , " [he]146-jack says , leaning [his]146-jack arms on the top of the gate , and looking rather malicious . "[788-what sort of a person] [What sort of a person]788-what sort of a person ? "[146-jack] There [he]146-jack is again ! Shoo ! " "[146-jack] What was the name of [[Esther]148-esther 's husband]789-esther 's husband ? " [Esther]148-esther 's apron drops from [her]148-esther fingers and the wheat rolls down in a shower on to the broad backs of [the Cochin householders]3477-the cochin householders . Fiercely the war of chickens — the pushing , the fluttering , the pecking — rages about [her]148-esther feet . "[190-bob] Already ! " [she]148-esther says : and in [her]148-esther voice there is none of love 's sweet quiver , nor on [her]148-esther cheeks is there any sign of love 's pretty flag being hung out , neither the red nor the white one . [She]148-esther only looks a little blank — a little troubled . "[190-bob] Yes , already , " says [Jack]146-jack , mercilessly ; "[789-esther 's husband] and not only has [he]789-esther 's husband come [himself]789-esther 's husband , but [he]789-esther 's husband has brought all [[his]789-esther 's husband household gods]793-his household gods with [him]789-esther 's husband . " "[796-a notary] Nonsense ! " says [Esther]148-esther , and [she]148-esther comes all over to the gate , and clasps two little petitioning hands on [his]789-esther 's husband shoulder . " "[146-jack] [Jack]146-jack , is [my]0-i hair pretty tidy ? " stroking it down with the improvised brush and comb of [her]0-i slim fingers . "[146-jack] Extremely so : it looks as if the chickens had got into it , and been scratching there by mistake . " [Meanwhile Master Brandon]166-mr. brandon and [[his]146-jack old women]3478-his old women , to wit , [[his]146-jack mother]3479-his mother , [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon , and [[his]146-jack sisters]3480-his sisters , [the two Misses Brandon]3481-the two misses brandon , are posed about [the drawing - room]787-the drawing - room , waiting . Waiting is always a painful process , from the modified form of suffering involved in the ten minutes before dinner , when [every man]3483-every man 's tongue is tied , and [his]3483-every man wits congealed by the frost of expectant hunger ; upward to the Gehenna of [[a dentist]3484-a dentist 's antechamber]3485-a dentist 's antechamber . [Robert]147-robert is all on wires this morning : [he]147-robert can not sit still ; [he]147-robert keeps shuffling and twisting [his]147-robert long , awkward legs about , beating the devil 's tattoo on the floor with [his]147-robert nailed boots , and hammering an ugly little tune with a paper knife on an old Book of Beauty on the table . [Miss Elizabeth Brandon]203-miss elizabeth brandon is ten years older and about ten feet shorter than [[her]203-miss elizabeth brandon brother]644-her brother ; [she]203-miss elizabeth brandon is in process of souring , like cowslip wine that has been kept too long , or small beer in thunder . [She]203-miss elizabeth brandon is not so very sour , after all , [poor little virgin]3488-poor little virgin ! only ten years ago [she]203-miss elizabeth brandon was , and ten years hence [she]203-miss elizabeth brandon will be mellower than [she]203-miss elizabeth brandon is now . "[146-jack] All right ! " says [Bob]190-bob , "[0-i] [I]0-i wo n't ; " and [he]190-bob stops , only to commence , two seconds later , a new noise , seven times worse than the first ; a very disagreeable sort of scraping with the hind legs of [his]190-bob chair . [They]205-the misses brandon had never kissed [her]201-mrs. brandon before , and [she]201-mrs. brandon felt as if the manacles were being fastened round [her]201-mrs. brandon wrists , and the gyves about [her]201-mrs. brandon ankles . [She]201-mrs. brandon longs to cry out and say , "[801-your brother] What are [you]805-you all about ? " Had [she]201-mrs. brandon been alone with [Robert]147-robert , [she]201-mrs. brandon would probably have said this ; have said it without much difficulty , but now the words seemed infinitely , impossibly hard to frame . When [a person]759-a person says to [one , if not in words , yet with looks and gestures]3500-one , if not in words , yet with looks and gestures , "[809-they] [[Our]810-our people]811-our people shall be [[thy]812-thy people]813-thy people , and [[our]810-our God [thy]812-thy God]814-our god thy god , " it is not easy for [a plastic , gracious nature]3501-a plastic , gracious nature to say "[812-thy] No , [they]815-they shall not ! " however little [they]815-they may relish the arrangement . So , in [her]201-mrs. brandon muteness , [Esther]148-esther accepts [the Brandon God]3502-the brandon god and [people]3426-people as [hers]148-esther . Wordless and demure , [she]201-mrs. brandon sits down on a little low seat as far removed as may be from [Robert]147-robert . [Esther]148-esther will , no doubt , be [an ugly old woman]3504-an ugly old woman ; [she]148-esther makes rather an ugly photograph ; but who can deny that [she]148-esther is a delicious bit of colour as [she]148-esther sits there right in the eye of the morning sun , and not at all afraid of [his]147-robert strict scrutiny ? [So many women]3505-so many women , now - a - days , are neutral - tinted , drabbish , greyish , as if the colours that [God]435-god painted with were not fast , but faded , like [Reynolds]207-reynolds ' . [Esther]148-esther 's colouring is as distinct , as decided , as clean and clear as that on a flower 's petal or a butterfly 's wing . [Nobody]3405-nobody speaks , except the clock with the short - waisted Minerva on it , and it does not say anything particularly original . Then [the old woman]3507-the old woman bends towards [the young one]3508-the young one , and says in a kind , low voice , "[816-you] [You]816-you see [Robert]147-robert has told [us]817-we [his]147-robert news , [[my]0-i dear]804-my dear . " There is flowing in through the French window a broad river of yellow light from the great fountain in the sky ; it is deluging [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon 's bonnet and [Esther]148-esther 's hair . The bonnet is black , and the hair is black ; but there are blacks and blacks . The May grass is green , and a beer bottle is green ; but the resemblance between the two is not striking . [Esther]148-esther has not the remotest idea what answer to make ; so [she]148-esther chooses one of the shortest words [she]148-esther knows of , and says "[147-robert] Yes ! " half - assentingly , half - interrogatively . "[147-robert] And [we]817-we could not rest till [we]817-we came and told [you]816-you what good news [we]817-we thought it , " pursues [the old lady]3509-the old lady , encouragingly . [Esther]148-esther says nothing . [Her]148-esther eyelids feel glued down to [her]148-esther cheeks ; [she]148-esther is conscious , with inward rage and vexation , of looking blushing , bashful , everything that [a young betrothed]3510-a young betrothed should look . "[817-we] [I]0-i 'm [an old woman]819-an old woman , " concludes [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon , rather moved by [her]0-i own eloquence , "[819-an old woman] and [I]0-i can not expect a great many more years of life . [You]816-you know what [the Psalmist]820-the psalmist sweetly says , love ; but [I]0-i trust [I]0-i may be spared to see [God]435-god bless both [[my]0-i children]821-my children , and make [them]821-my children [[His]435-god happy servants]822-his happy servants for [this world]549-this world and the next . " As [she]0-i speaks [she]0-i lays one hand on [Esther]148-esther 's head . " in a breath . [Esther]148-esther is half - frightened . "[825-your son] [I]0-i did understand [you]0-i , " protests poor [Bob]190-bob , eagerly , jumping up , upsetting [his]825-your son chair , and never thinking of picking it up again , "[0-i] [I]0-i did , indeed . There is another pause , then [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon rises and puts out [her]0-i hand to [Esther]208-esther brandon — in farewell this time . "[826-mother] [I]0-i 'm afraid [I]0-i 've been in too great a hurry , [[my]0-i dear]804-my dear , " [she]0-i says , trying not to speak stiffly , and not succeeding quite so well as [she]0-i deserved . "[0-i] But [you]804-my dear 'll forgive [me]0-i , [I]0-i 'm sure ; [you]804-my dear see , [mothers]830-mothers are apt to be [partial people]831-partial people , and [I]0-i could not imagine any one trying to love [[my]0-i boy]832-my boy , and not succeeding . " But [Miss Craven]164-st. john can never let well alone . [She]164-st. john would marry [Old Nick [himself]3514-old nick himself]3514-old nick himself sooner than that [[his]3514-old nick himself mother]3479-his mother or [sister]3516-sister should look askance at [her]164-st. john , or seem hurt and grieved with [her]164-st. john for expressing any want of relish for [him]3514-old nick himself , hoofs and tail and horns and all . "[804-my dear] Oh no , [you]804-my dear must not go ! " [she]0-i cries , in [her]0-i quick , eager way , putting up two anxious hands in deprecation ; "[804-my dear] [you]804-my dear must not be vexed with [me]0-i ; [I]0-i did not mean to be disagreable . [I]0-i shall like very much to belong to [you]804-my dear , [I]0-i 'm sure . [I]0-i was only afraid of [your]804-my dear expecting more from [me]0-i than [I]0-i had to give yet , " [she]0-i ends , with head drooped a little , and cheeks reddened like a peach 's that the sun has been kissing all the afternoon . The stiffness goes away : [nobody]3405-nobody can be stiff for long with [Esther Craven]148-esther , any more than a snow - ball can remain a snow - ball under the fire 's warm gaze . "[0-i] [We]833-we do n't want [you]804-my dear to belong to [us]833-we if [you]804-my dear do n't wish it [yourself]804-my dear , " [the old woman]3507-the old woman says , very gravely , yet not ill - naturedly . "[804-my dear] [I]0-i hardly know what [I]0-i wish , " answers [the girl]682-the girl , naïvely , in a sort of bewilderment . "[0-i] Oh , [my]0-i cheeks ! [my]0-i cheeks ! will [they]834-they ever get cool again ! "[0-i] [You]0-i look rather as if [you]0-i had been poking [your]0-i countenance between the bars of the kitchen grate , " responds [Jack]146-jack , with all [a brother]3525-a brother 's candour . [Jack]146-jack has been dodging behind the laurel bushes , after the fashion in which [the English gentleman]3526-the english gentleman is fond of receiving [[his]3526-the english gentleman friends]3527-his friends when [they]3527-his friends come to call on [him]3526-the english gentleman . "[0-i] Why did not [you]0-i come to [my]0-i rescue , [[you]0-i unnatural brother]835-you unnatural brother ? " "[837-mamma] When [a person]759-a person gets into a scrape [themselves]759-a person , [I]0-i make it a rule to let [them]759-a person get out of it [themselves]759-a person , as it makes [them]759-a person more careful for the future , " replies [Jack]146-jack , with philosophy . "[0-i] But [I]0-i 'm not getting out of it ; [I]0-i 'm floundering deeper and deeper and deeper in , like [a man in [an Irish bog]840-an irish bog]839-a man in an irish bog , " says [Esther]148-esther , ruefully . "[0-i] Oh , [Jack]146-jack ! " [she]0-i concludes , laughing , yet vexed ( laughter is as often the exponent of annoyance as of enjoyment , [I]146-jack think ) , "[146-jack] if [you]841-you could have heard the stories [I]0-i was forced to tell , [I]0-i 'm sure [I]0-i deserve to be wound up , carried out , and buried , as much as ever [Ananias]209-ananias did . " [THIS world]549-this world is divided into [poor and rich]3529-poor and rich ; into those who do things for [themselves]759-a person , and [those who get [other people]3531-other people to do them for [them]759-a person]3530-those who get other people to do them for them . [The Cravens]210-the cravens belong to [the former class]3532-the former class . On the afternoon of the day mentioned in [my]209-ananias last chapter , [Miss Craven]164-st. john is doing for [herself]164-st. john what [she]164-st. john had much rather that [some one else]3400-some one else should do for [her]164-st. john . [She]164-st. john is sitting at [her]164-st. john sewing - machine , with a pile of huckaback cut up into towel - lengths beside [her]164-st. john . As long as civilization remains at its present ridiculous pitch of elevation , [people]3426-people must have towels , and there is a prejudice in favour of hemmed versus ravelled edges . In [the kitchen garden]3535-the kitchen garden [the maid - servants]3536-the maid - servants are all busy , picking currants and raspberries for preserving . [Owen]211-owen , [the gardening man]3537-the gardening man , is helping [them]3536-the maid - servants ; [they]3536-the maid - servants are combining business with pleasure ; fruit - picking with persiflage . How loudly and shrilly [they]3536-the maid - servants laugh ! and yet loud , shrill laughter expresses mirth and cause for mirth , as well as low and silvery . [Esther]148-esther , grave and alone , catches [herself]148-esther wondering what the joke was that caused such general merriment two minutes ago . Probably , did [she]148-esther know it , [she]148-esther would not laugh at it , would see no point in it , perhaps , but [she]148-esther would be glad to hear it . The huckaback is thick and heavy ; bending down [one]559-one 's head over one 's work sends all the blood in [one]559-one 's body into it . Phew ! How hot ! How much pleasanter to be out of doors , tweaking off dead rose heads , watching the great red poppie straightening out their folded creases , pulling the green nightcaps off the escholtzia buds ! A shadow darkens the French window , causing [Miss Craven]164-st. john to give one of those starts that make one feel as if one literally jumped out of one 's skin , and fill one with ungodly wrath against the occasion of [them]3536-the maid - servants . "[209-ananias] [I]0-i rang several times , " says [Robert Brandon]147-robert , apologetically , "[0-i] but [nobody]3405-nobody came . " "[3405-nobody] Oh ! it 's [you]0-i , is it ? " [she]164-st. john says , with a tone not exactly of rapture in [her]164-st. john voice ; "[0-i] [[our]843-our servants]844-our servants always manage to be out of the way on the rare occasions when [any one]523-any one calls . [They]844-our servants are all in [the garden]846-the garden , picking currants ; one would have been plenty , but [they]844-our servants prefer working , like [convicts]847-convicts or [navvies]848-navvies , in [gangs]849-gangs . " "[0-i] [I]0-i came to see whether [you]850-you were inclined to take a walk ? " [he]147-robert says , hesitatingly , for [her]164-st. john manner is not encouraging . "[850-you] Too hot ! " [she]164-st. john answers , lazily , leaning [her]164-st. john head on the back of [her]164-st. john chair , and closing [her]164-st. john eyes , as if [his]147-robert presence disposed [her]164-st. john to sleep . "[850-you] Not in [the wood]851-the wood ? " [he]147-robert rejoins , eagerly . "[850-you] Under [[our]852-our oaks]853-our oaks it is as cool and almost as dark as night , and there there is always a breeze from [the brook]854-the brook . " "[0-i] [I]0-i am busy ! " [she]164-st. john says , pettishly , annoyed at [his]147-robert persistence , and taking in with a dissatisfied eye [his]147-robert tout ensemble — yellow beard , frayed coat - sleeves , vigorous rustic comeliness . [He]147-robert does not pursue the subject further , but stands leaning wistfully and uncertain against the window . "[0-i] [Jack]146-jack is not at [home]701-home , [I]0-i 'm afraid , " [she]164-st. john says , stiffly , by - and - by . "[0-i] [I]0-i did not come to see [Jack]146-jack , " [he]147-robert answers , bluntly . [She]164-st. john does not invite [him]147-robert to come in , but [he]147-robert , crossing the threshold diffidently , takes a seat near , but not aggressively near , [her]164-st. john . "[0-i] Do n't let [me]0-i interrupt [you]0-i ! " [he]147-robert says , deprecatingly . [She]164-st. john takes [him]147-robert at [his]147-robert word , and continues [her]164-st. john homely occupation . Up and down , up and down [her]164-st. john foot goes , keeping the wheel in motion ; prick , prick , prick , the needle travels with its quick , regular stabs . If , as [I]0-i have said , the process of bending over work on a July afternoon is heating , the consciousness that [another person]3540-another person is watching every quiver of [your]3541-your eyelids , counting every breath [you]3541-your draw , and every displaced hair that straggles about brow or cheek , does not conduce to make it less so . The magnetic influence that sooner or later compels the eyes of [the looked at]3542-the looked at to seek those of [the looker]3543-the looker , obliges [Esther]148-esther , after awhile , to raise [hers]148-esther — reluctant and protesting — to [Robert]147-robert 's . "[0-i] [I]0-i wish [[my]0-i mother]3406-my mother could see [you]0-i ! " [he]147-robert says , with a smile of placid happiness . [Mr. Brandon]166-mr. brandon carries [[his]166-mr. brandon mother]3479-his mother metaphorically upon [his]166-mr. brandon back , almost as much as [pious Æneas]212-pious æneas did [the old Anchises]213-the old anchises literally . [Esther]148-esther suspends [her]148-esther employment for a moment . "[0-i] [I]0-i beg [your]0-i pardon ; this machine makes such a noise that [I]0-i did not catch what [you]0-i said . " "[0-i] [I]0-i was only wishing that [mother]826-mother could see [you]0-i now . " "[826-mother] It is a pleasure [she]826-mother enjoys pretty frequently . Why now particularly ? " "[826-mother] [She]826-mother would see how thrifty and housewifely [you]0-i can be . " "[826-mother] [I]0-i am glad [she]826-mother does not , then , " answers [the girl]682-the girl , drily , beginning to work again faster than ever , and flushing with annoyance ; "[826-mother] [she]826-mother would form a most erroneous estimate of [me]0-i . [I]0-i dislike particularly to be found by [people]3426-people in one of [my]0-i rare paroxysms of virtue ; [they]3426-people take it for [my]0-i normal state , and judge and expect of [me]0-i accordingly . " "[0-i] [I]0-i shall tell [her]826-mother that , at all events , [my]0-i judgment of [you]0-i was nearer the truth than [hers]826-mother , " says [Robert]147-robert , triumphantly . [Esther]148-esther laughs awkwardly . "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't know whether [you]0-i are aware of it , but [you]0-i are conveying to [my]0-i mind the idea that [[your]0-i mother]3422-your mother has been pronouncing a very unfavourable verdict upon [me]0-i and [my]0-i character . " "[826-mother] [She]826-mother thinks [you]0-i are too pretty and lively , and — and — " ( frivolous had been the word employed by [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon , but [Robert]147-robert can not find it in [his]147-robert heart to apply it to [his]147-robert idol)—"too[826-mother] fond of society to care about being useful in tame , humdrum , everyday ways . " [Esther]148-esther gives [her]148-esther head a little impatient shake . "[201-mrs. brandon] [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon adheres to the golden axiom , so evidently composed by some one to whom beauty was sour grapes , that it is better to be good than pretty ; an axiom that assumes that the one is incompatible with the other . " So speaking [she]0-i relapses into a chafed silence , and [he]147-robert into [his]147-robert vigilant dumb observation of [her]0-i . At the end of a quarter of an hour , as [he]147-robert still shows no signs of moving , finding the present position of affairs no longer tolerable , [Miss Craven]164-st. john jumps up , flings down [her]164-st. john heap of huckaback on the floor , and says abruptly , with a sort of forced resignation : "[0-i] [I]0-i will come to [the wood]851-the wood , if [you]0-i wish ; it will be all the same a hundred years hence . " "[0-i] [I]0-i am perfectly happy as [I]0-i am , " [he]147-robert answers with provoking good humour , looking up in blissful unconsciousness at [her]164-st. john charming cross face , and the plain yet dainty fit of [her]164-st. john trim cheap gown . "[0-i] But [I]0-i am not , " [she]164-st. john rejoins brusquely ; "[0-i] indoors it is stifling to - day ; please introduce [me]0-i as quickly as possible to that breeze [you]0-i spoke of ; [I]0-i have not been able to find a trace of one all day . " [She]164-st. john fetches [her]164-st. john hat and puts it on ; too indifferent as to [her]164-st. john appearance in [his]147-robert eyes to take the trouble of casting even a passing glance at [herself]164-st. john in the glass , to see whether it is put on straight or crooked . [The Glan - yr - Afon wood]3546-the glan - yr - afon wood is [a fickle , changeable place]3547-a fickle , changeable place ; like [a vain woman]3548-a vain woman , it is always taking off one garment and putting on another . Three months ago , when [the April woods]3549-the april woods were piping to it , it had on a mist - blue cloak of hyacinths — what could be prettier?—but now it has laid it aside , and is all tricked out in gay grass , green , flecked here and there with rosy families of catch - fly and groups of pur- ple orchis spires . Do [you]3550-you remember those words of the sweetest , wildest , fancifullest of all [[our]861-we singers]3551-our singers ? [They]3552-they describe [[Glan]30-glan - yr - [Afon wood]31-afon wood]3553-glan - yr - afon wood much better than [I]0-i can . [It]3553-glan - yr - afon wood is [a great green cathedral]3554-a great green cathedral , where choral service goes on all day long , and where [the rook]3555-the rook preaches impressive sermons from the swinging tree - tops . "[0-i] Had [we]861-we not better walk arm in arm ? " asks [Esther]148-esther , sardonically , as [they]861-we march along in silence . "[0-i] [I]0-i believe it is the correct thing on these occasions ; at least [Gwen]159-gwen and [[her]159-gwen sweetheart]862-her sweetheart always do on Sunday evenings . " [He]3556-his turns towards [her]148-esther ; an expression of surprised delight upspringing into [his]3556-his eyes . "[0-i] Do [you]0-i mean really ? " [She]148-esther is mollified , despite [herself]148-esther , by the simple joy beaming in [his]3556-his poor , good - looking face — face that would be more than good - looking if only some great grief would give [it]3557-it fuller expression ; if only a few months of late hours and mundane dissipations would wear off its look of exuberant bucolic healthiness . "[0-i] No , no ; [I]0-i was only joking . " "[0-i] Shall [we]861-we sit here ? " asks [Brandon]201-mrs. brandon , presently , pointing to a rustic seat that stands under a great girthed oak , taller and thicker - foliaged than [[its]3558-its neighbours]3559-its neighbours . "[0-i] See ! did not [I]0-i tell [you]0-i true ? Hardly a sunbeam pierces through these leaves , and the brawling of [the brook]854-the brook comes up so pleasantly from below . " [Esther]148-esther looks , but the situation does not please [her]148-esther ; it is too secluded , too sentimental ; it looks like a seat on which [Colin]214-colin and [Dowsabel]215-dowsabel might sit fluting and weaving "[0-i] . . . . belts of straw and ivy buds , " and simpering at one another over the tops of [their]861-we crooks . "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't fancy it , " [she]0-i says , beginning to walk on ; "[0-i] it looks earwiggy . " "[0-i] Only the other day [you]0-i said it was quite a lovers ' seat ! " [he]3556-his exclaims , in surprise . "[0-i] Exactly ; and for that very reason [I]0-i prefer waiting till [I]0-i am more qualified to sit upon it . " By - and - by [Miss Craven]164-st. john finds a position that suits [her]164-st. john better ; one nearer the edge of [the wood]851-the wood , in full view of [the Naullan road]3561-the naullan road , along which [market women]3562-market women , [coal carts]3563-coal carts , [stray limping tramps]3564-stray limping tramps , go passing , and where loverly blandishments are out of the question . The sun slides down between two birch stems that stand amid rock fragments , and riots at [his]3556-his will about [her]164-st. john head , as [she]164-st. john sits at the birch foot on a great grey stone , all flourished over with green mosses and little clinging plants . Below , [the baby river]3565-the baby river runs tinkling ; it is such [a baby river that it has not strength to grapple with the boulders that lie in its bed]3566-a baby river that it has not strength to grapple with the boulders that lie in its bed ; it comes stealing round their hoary sides with a coaxing noise , in gentlest swirls and bubbled eddies . The squirrels brought their nuts last autumn to [Esther]148-esther 's stone to crack ; the shells are lying there still ; [she]148-esther is picking them up and dropping them again in idle play . Little dancing lights are flashing down through the birch 's feathery - green locks , and playing Hide and Seek over [Esther]148-esther 's gown and [Robert]147-robert 's recumbent figure , as [he]147-robert lies in the repose of warmth , absolute idleness , absolute content at [her]148-esther feet . An hour and a half , two hours to be spent in trying to like [Robert]147-robert ! [Faugh]216-faugh ! [She]148-esther yawns . "[0-i] That is the seventh time [you]864-you have yawned since [we]865-we have been [here]3398-here , " remarks [[her]148-esther lover]683-her lover , a little reproachfully . "[0-i] [I]0-i dare say ; and if [you]864-you wait five minutes longer , [you]864-you will probably be able to tell [me]0-i that it is the seventy - seventh time . " "[864-you] [You]864-you did not yawn while [we]865-we were [indoors]867-indoors . " "[864-you] [I]0-i had [my]0-i work ; what is [a woman]553-a woman without [her]553-a woman work ? "[553-a woman] Does [every one]869-every one find being courted as tedious a process as [I]0-i do ? " ( Aside . ) Aloud : "[686-some one] [Some one]686-some one said to [me]0-i the other day , that [no woman]871-no woman could be happy who was not fond of work . "[0-i] Yes ; [I]0-i am glad there is so much difference in age between [us]878-us . " "[0-i] Why ? " "[0-i] Because [you]0-i are the more likely to outlive [me]0-i . " [She]0-i passes by the little sentimentalism with silent contempt . "[0-i] [I]0-i shall certainly outlive [you]0-i , " [she]0-i says confidently . "[0-i] [Women]547-women mostly outlive [men]595-men , even when [they]595-men are of the same age . [We]878-us lead slower , safer lives . If [I]0-i spend all [my]0-i life here , [I]0-i shall probably creep on , like a tortoise , to a hundred . " "[0-i] But [you]0-i will not spend all [your]0-i life [here]3398-here ? " "[0-i] That will not be very long , [I]0-i prophesy , " cries [Brandon]190-bob , cheerfully . "[0-i] [A farmer]883-a farmer requires [a wife]884-a wife more than [most men]885-most men . " "[886-a soldier] More than [a soldier]886-a soldier , certainly , " retorts [she]0-i , with a malicious smile . [He]146-jack laughs ; too warm and lazy and content to be offended , and makes ineffectual passes at a gnat that has settled upon [his]146-jack nose . " [he]146-jack asks , feeling a more personal interest than [he]146-jack had ever before experienced in [Jack]146-jack 's amours and amourettes . [An old woman]819-an old woman , with a myriad - wrinkled Welsh face rides by along [the road]3569-the road on a drooping - headed donkey ; a large blue and orange handkerchief tied over [her]819-an old woman bonnet and a basket on each arm . "[0-i] [I]0-i wish [you]0-i would not look so happy , " [Miss Craven]164-st. john says suddenly , flashing round an uneasy look out of [her]0-i great black eyes at [[her]0-i companion]3572-her companion . "[0-i] Why should not [I]0-i ? [I]0-i am happy . " "[0-i] But [you]0-i have no right to be , no reason for being so , " [she]0-i cries , emphatically . "[0-i] [I]0-i have , at all events , as much reason as the birds have and they seem pretty jolly ; [I]0-i am alive , and the sun is shining . " "[0-i] [You]0-i were alive , and the sun was shining , this time yesterday , " [she]0-i says drily ; "[0-i] but [you]0-i were not so happy then as [you]0-i are now . " At the decided damper to [his]3572-her companion hilarity so evidently intended in this speech , a slight cloud passes over [the young man]670-the young man 's face ; [he]670-the young man looks down with a snubbed expression . " "[898-the best woman] It is a pity that when [you]0-i went , like [Cœlebs]219-cœlebs , in search of [a wife]884-a wife , [you]0-i did not try to find some one more like [her]884-a wife , " rejoins [Esther]148-esther , piqued and surprised , despite [her]148-esther utter indifference to [his]3577-his opinion of [her]148-esther , at finding that , notwithstanding the imbecile pitch of love for [herself]148-esther at which [she]148-esther believes [him]3577-his to have arrived , [he]3577-his can still set [a dowdy , havering , brown old woman]3578-a dowdy , havering , brown old woman on a pedestal , above even that which [she]884-a wife , with all the radiant red and white beauty of which [she]884-a wife is so calmly aware , all the triumph of [her]884-a wife seventeen sweet summers , occupies in [his]3577-his heart . "[0-i] [You]0-i are young and [she]884-a wife is old , " says [Robert]147-robert , encouragingly ; "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't see why [you]0-i should not be like [her]884-a wife when [you]0-i are [her]884-a wife age . " "[0-i] [I]0-i think not ; [I]0-i hope not , " says [Miss Craven]164-st. john , coolly , strangling [her]0-i twenty - fifth yawn .
