" Another long pause . ( Have [we]3579-we been [here]3398-here an hour yet ? ) The brown bees go humming , droning , lumbering about , velvet - coated : a high - shouldered grasshopper chirps shrilly : the dim air vibrates . "[0-i] Just listen to that cricket ! " says [Esther]148-esther , presently , for the sake of saying something . "[0-i] How noisy [he]901-he is ! [I]0-i read in a book the other day that if [a man]3402-a man 's voice were as strong in proportion to [his]3402-a man size as a locust 's , [he]3402-a man could be heard from here to [St. Petersburg]32-st. petersburg . " "[3402-a man] Could [he]3402-a man ? " says [Bob]190-bob , absently , not much interested in [[his]190-bob betrothed]3581-his betrothed 's curious little piece of entomological information ; "[3402-a man] how unpleasant ! " Then dragging [himself]190-bob along the grass and the flowers still closer to [her]148-esther feet , [he]190-bob says , "[148-esther] [Esther]148-esther , [mother]826-mother hopes to see a great deal more of [you]148-esther now than [she]826-mother has done hitherto . " "[826-mother] Does [she]826-mother ? [she]826-mother is very good , [I]0-i am sure , " answers [Esther]148-esther , formally , with a feeling of compunction at [her]148-esther utter inability to echo the wish . "[0-i] [She]826-mother bid [me]0-i tell [you]148-esther that [she]826-mother hopes [you]148-esther will come in as often as [you]148-esther can of an evening . [We]904-we are all sure to be at [home]701-home then ; [the girls]906-the girls read aloud by turns , and [mother]826-mother thought that — " "[826-mother] That it might improve [my]0-i mind , and that it needs improving , " interrupts [Esther]148-esther , smiling drily ; "[826-mother] so it does . [I]0-i quite agree with [her]826-mother ; but not even for that object could [I]0-i leave [Jack]146-jack of an evening ; [he]146-jack is out all day long , and the evening is the only time when [I]0-i have [him]146-jack to [myself]0-i . " "[908-you] [You]908-you find plenty to say to [him]146-jack always , [I]0-i suppose ? " says [Robert]147-robert , with an involuntary sigh and slight stress upon the word [him]146-jack . "[908-you] Not a word , sometimes . [We]904-we sit opposite or beside [each other]909-each other in sociable silence . " "[904-we] How fond [you]908-you are of [that fellow]910-that fellow ! " says [Robert]147-robert , sighing again , and thinking , ruefully , what a long time it would be before [any one]523-any one would say to [her]908-you , "[904-we] How fond [you]908-you are of [Bob Brandon]190-bob ! " "[190-bob] [He]190-bob is the one thing upon [earth]911-earth that [I]0-i could not do without ! " [she]908-you answers shortly , turning away [her]908-you head . There are [some people that [we]3584-we love]3583-some people that we love so intensely that [we]3584-we can hardly speak even of [our]3584-we own love for [them]3583-some people that we love without tears . "[0-i] [I]0-i should be afraid to say that of [any one]523-any one , " says [Bob]190-bob , bluntly , "[0-i] for fear of being shown that [I]0-i must do without [them]523-any one . " "[0-i] What have [I]0-i in all [the world]672-the world but [him]190-bob ? " [she]0-i cries , a passionate earnestness chasing the slow languor from [her]0-i voice , all [her]0-i soft face afire with eager tenderness ; "[0-i] neither kith nor [kin]914-kin ; neither [friends]915-friends nor money . [I]0-i am as destitute , in fact , though not in seeming , as [that girl that passed just now , shuffling [her]0-i bare feet along in the dust , and with three boxes of matches — [her]0-i whole stock - in - trade — in [her]0-i dirty hand]916-that girl that passed just now , shuffling her bare feet along in the dust , and with three boxes of matches — her whole stock - in - trade — in her dirty hand . But for [Jack]146-jack , " [she]0-i continues , in a lighter strain , "[146-jack] [you]146-jack might at the present moment be carrying half a pound of tea or four penn'orth of snuff as a present to [me]0-i in [the Naullan almshouses]917-the naullan almshouses . " [Robert]147-robert looks attentive , and says "[146-jack] Hem , " which is a sort of "[146-jack] Selah " or "[146-jack] Higgaion , " and does not express much beyond inarticulate interest . "[146-jack] [I]0-i often think that [he]190-bob is too good for [this world]549-this world , " says [the young girl]3585-the young girl , mournfully , picking an orchis leaf , and looking down absently on the capricious black splashes that freak its green surface . [Bob]190-bob is a little embarrassed between [his]190-bob love of truth and [his]190-bob desire to coincide in opinion with [[his]190-bob beloved]3586-his beloved . [Jack]146-jack is not in the least like [the little morbid boys and girls in [[his]146-jack sister]619-his sister [Bessy]202-bessy 's books , who retire into corners in play - hours to read about hell - fire , to whom marbles and toffee and bull's - eyes are as dung , and who are inextricably entangled in [his]146-jack mind with the idea of "[146-jack] too good for [this world]549-this world]3587-the little morbid boys and girls in his sister bessy 's books , who retire into corners in play - hours to read about hell - fire , to whom marbles and toffee and bull's - eyes are as dung , and who are inextricably entangled in his mind with the idea of " too good for this world . " [He]146-jack evades the discussion of the alarming nature of [young Craven]146-jack 's goodness by a judicious silence . "[0-i] [I]0-i am such an expense to [him]190-bob , " continues [Esther]148-esther , lugubriously , the corners of [her]148-esther mouth drooping like [a child]3412-a child 's about to cry—"what[0-i] with clothes , and food , and altogether . Even though [one]559-one does not eat very much every day , it comes to a great deal at the end of the year , does it not ? " "[0-i] If [you]0-i come to [me]0-i , [you]0-i would be no expense at all to [him]190-bob , " [Robert]147-robert answers , stroking [his]147-robert great , broad , yellow beard ( beard that will have to disappear before [he]147-robert rejoins [[his]147-robert gallant corps]3590-his gallant corps in [Bermuda]33-bermuda ) , and looking very sentimental ; yet not that either , for sentimental implies the existence of a little feeling , and the affectation of a great deal more . "[190-bob] [He]190-bob would have to provide [me]0-i with a trousseau and a wedding - cake , even in that case . " "[0-i] [I]0-i would excuse [him]190-bob both . " "[0-i] Would [you]0-i ? " [she]0-i says , jestingly ; "[0-i] [I]0-i would n't ; it has always seemed to [me]0-i that the best part of holy matrimony is the avalanche of new clothes that attends being [we]921-we d. " "[0-i] [You]0-i shall have any amount of new clothes . " "[0-i] [I]0-i should be an expense to [you]0-i , then , " [she]0-i says , giving [him]190-bob a smile that is grateful and bright and cold , all in one , like a January morning . Cold as [her]0-i smile is , it is a smile , and [he]190-bob is encouraged by it to refer to a subject nearer [his]190-bob heart than [Jack Craven]146-jack 's excellences . "[0-i] If [you]0-i can not spare time to come to [us]921-we of an evening , would [you]0-i let [me]0-i — might [I]0-i — would [you]0-i mind [my]0-i joining [you]0-i and [Jack]146-jack — now and then — for half an hour or so — if [I]0-i should not be in the way ? " [Her]0-i countenance falls , more visibly than [she]0-i is [herself]0-i perhaps aware of . "[0-i] Of course , " [she]0-i answers , in a constrained voice , "[0-i] if [you]0-i wish ; [we]921-we shall always be glad to see [you]0-i , of course . " "[0-i] [I]0-i would not come often , " says [the poor young man]3591-the poor young man wistfully ; "[826-mother] once a week perhaps — so that [we]921-we might get to know [one another]922-one another better ; [mother]826-mother says — " "[826-mother] Do n't tell [me]0-i any more of [[your]0-i mother]3422-your mother 's speeches to - day , or [we]921-we shall have none left for to - morrow , " interrupts [Esther]148-esther , with a sort of ironical playfulness , flapping about with [her]148-esther pocket - handkerchief at a squadron of young midges , and looking mild exasperation at [the unlucky six - foot slave at [her]148-esther feet]3592-the unlucky six - foot slave at her feet . Then [she]148-esther stretches out [her]148-esther hand , plucks a dandelion , or what was a dandelion a week ago , but is now a sphere of delicatest , fragilest , downspikes , and blows it like [a child]3412-a child to see what o'clock it is . "[826-mother] One , two , three , four , five , six . Time to go [home]701-home ! " [she]148-esther says , flinging away the hollow stalk and springing up . "[826-mother] It seems only five minutes since [we]921-we came , " says [Robert]147-robert , with a great sigh of good - bye , looking down at the long stretch of bruised grass that indicates [his]147-robert late resting- place . "[826-mother] Do [you]926-you think so ? " exclaims [Esther]148-esther , opening [her]148-esther eyes very wide , and [the most violent negative]3594-the most violent negative could not have expressed dissent more clearly . So [they]921-we pass [home]701-home through the loudly vocal wood , and [he]147-robert parts from [her]148-esther under [the porch]3524-the porch . [He]147-robert had meant to squeeze [her]148-esther hand at parting ; perhaps still bolder forms of adieu flitted before [his]147-robert mind 's eye , but a certain expression in [her]148-esther face makes all such plans take to [their]921-we heels . [He]147-robert looks as if [he]147-robert would come in if [he]147-robert were asked ; but [he]147-robert is not asked , therefore , courage failing [him]147-robert , [he]147-robert departs . [She]148-esther stands in the shadow watching [him]147-robert , and thinks , "[926-you] What bad boots ! and is not one shoulder rather higher than the other ! " It is not the least bit higher ; [no young fir]3597-no young fir is straighter than [he]147-robert ; but when a thing belongs , or may possibly belong , to [oneself]3598-oneself , [one]559-one waxes marvellous critical . "[926-you] SOMETHING new ! something new ! " cried [the Athenians]220-the athenians ; and across two thousand years [we]3600-we catch up and echo [their]220-the athenians greedy cry . But why do [we]3600-we ? [We]3600-we all know well enough that there is nothing new ; there was not even in [King Solomon]154-solomon 's time — not even in all [[his]154-solomon treasure - house]3601-his treasure - house , nor among [[his]154-solomon seven hundred wives]3602-his seven hundred wives . What an advantage [those ancients who saw [the world]672-the world 's infancy]3603-those ancients who saw the world 's infancy had over [us]3600-we — over [us]3600-we , who have to content [ourselves]3600-we with the lees of the wine , which the few dropped ears scattered about [the great reaped harvest field]3605-the great reaped harvest field ! Who would not fain have lived in the days when nothing had yet been said — when everything , consequently , remained to be said ? Who could be trite then , in that blest epoch when platitudes were unborn , when [Tupper]221-tupper was an impossibility , and even the statement that two and two make four had something startlingly novel about it ? Then [a man]3402-a man 's thoughts were [his]3402-a man own , [his]3402-a man very own , [his]3402-a man own by the best of all rights — creation ; now they are the bastard product of [ten thousand buried men]3607-ten thousand buried men 's dead ideas . Original is a pleasant word , is it not?—fair and well - sounding ; but it is like the sample figs at the top of the box : it represents nothing , or something infinitely smaller than itself behind and underneath it . Is it too much to say that it is impossible to find an original idea in [any writer [we]3600-we wot of]3608-any writer we wot of ? [You]3609-you meet , perhaps , some day in a book a thought , an image that strikes [you]3609-you . [You]3609-you say , "[926-you] This is [this thinker]927-this thinker 's own ; there is the stamp of [this one individual mind]928-this one individual mind upon it ; " when lo ! mayhap but a few hours later [you]3609-you are reading the thoughts of [some elder scribe]3610-some elder scribe , one that has been dust nigh ten or twenty centuries back , and [you]3609-you find the same thought , half fledged or quarter fledged , only in the egg , perhaps — but still it is there . There is nothing new under the sun . And if this is true of other subjects , how much truer of that most outworn , threadbare old theme , Love ! [The world]672-the world has been spinning round six thousand years at the lowest , most exploded computation ; in any thousand years there have been thirty or forty generations , and [each unit in every one of those generations]3612-each unit in every one of those generations , if [he]3402-a man has lived to [[man]3613-man 's estate]3614-man 's estate , has surely loved after one fashion or another . Whosoever has done any worthy thing , whosoever has sent out [his]3402-a man thoughts in writing or speech or action to [the world]672-the world , has felt the stirrings of this strange instinct ; unconsciously it has moulded and permeated [his]3402-a man deeds and [his]3402-a man words : and yet , old as it is , [we]3600-we are not tired of it , any more than [we]3600-we are of the back - coming green of the spring , or the never - extinguished lamps of the stars . "[928-this one individual mind] The harvest is past , the summer is ended ; " at least well nigh ended . [Jack]146-jack and [Esther]148-esther are at breakfast : outside the scarlet geraniums are blazing away in the morning sun , trying [their]3616-their best to shine as brightly as [he]146-jack is doing , and the gnats are dancing round and round on the buoyant floor of [[their]3616-their ball - room]3617-their ball - room — the air . [I]928-this one individual mind wonder that that incessant valsing does not make [them]3616-their giddy . [I]928-this one individual mind am not sure that [human beings]3618-human beings , like the lions and tigers and uneasy black bears in the Zoological , look [their]3618-human beings best at feeding - time ; but such as [they]3618-human beings are , here [they]3618-human beings are . [Esther]148-esther in a chintz gown , sown all over with little red carnations as thickly as the firmament with heavenly bodies . [She]148-esther looks as fresh as a daisy — as [an Englishwoman , to whom morning déshabille , wrapper , slippers , undressed hair , are unknown Gallic abominations]3619-an englishwoman , to whom morning déshabille , wrapper , slippers , undressed hair , are unknown gallic abominations — and is eating porridge with a spoon . [Jack]146-jack reading [his]146-jack letters , which look all bills and circulars , after the fashion of [men]595-men 's correspondence ; for what [man]3613-man made after the fashion of [a man]3402-a man , would sit down to indite an epistle to [another man]3623-another man , were it [his]3613-man alter ego unless [he]3613-man had something to say about a horse or a dog or a gun ? Presently [he]146-jack finishes this cursory survey , crumples up the last blue envelope in [his]146-jack hand , flings it with manly untidiness into the summer - dressed grate , and says , resuming a conversation which had been interrupted a quarter of an hour ago by the entrance of prayers and the urn , "[928-this one individual mind] [I]0-i can not imagine what [you]929-you have done to [the fellow]930-the fellow ! [he]930-the fellow used not to be [half a bad fellow]931-half a bad fellow to talk to . Never [a genius]932-a genius , [you]929-you know , but still [I]0-i used to like to have [him]930-the fellow to walk over [the farm]3468-the farm with [me]0-i — not that [he]930-the fellow knows a swede from a mangold : do n't see much sign of [[his]930-the fellow old mother]3520-his old mother 's farming mantle falling upon [him]930-the fellow . But now [he]930-the fellow has not a word to throw to a dog ; [he]930-the fellow is as stupid as a stuck pig . " "[0-i] [I]0-i have not cut out [his]930-the fellow tongue or tied it up in a bag , if that is what [you]929-you are hinting at , " says [Esther]148-esther , with a smile as confused as a dog 's , when , not quite sure of [his]930-the fellow reception , [he]930-the fellow sneaks up to [you]929-you sideways , lifting [his]930-the fellow upper lip , and from tail to muzzle one nervous wriggle . "[0-i] Perhaps [he]930-the fellow is like the birds , and gets silent towards the end of the summer . " "[929-you] Why [you]929-you keep [him]930-the fellow dangling after [you]929-you , like the tail of a kite , [I]0-i can not conceive , " [Mr. Craven]222-mr. craven cries , crumbling [his]222-mr. craven bread with a little irritation . "[929-you] It must be such a nuisance having a great long thing like [him]930-the fellow knocking about under [your]929-you feet morning , noon , and night . " [Esther]148-esther is silent ; only [her]148-esther head droops lower , lower , till [her]148-esther little nose almost immerses itself in [her]148-esther stirabout . "[223-whereas] [Whereas]223-whereas , " pursues [Jack]146-jack , helping [himself]146-jack to a great deal of cold beef , "[223-whereas] if [you]929-you were to give [him]930-the fellow [his]930-the fellow congé now ( [Jack]146-jack is by no means neglectful of the g in the French word ) , [he]930-the fellow would be all right again in a fortnight , ready for the shooting . " "[930-the fellow] [He]930-the fellow would , would [he]930-the fellow ? " says [Esther]148-esther , lifting up [her]148-esther nose and reddening with vexation . [No woman]871-no woman likes to think of [her]871-no woman empire as anything short of eternal . "[930-the fellow] If [you]929-you do n't like to do it [yourself]929-you , [I]0-i 'll do it for [you]929-you , " pursues [[her]148-esther brother]644-her brother , making a magnanimously handsome offer . "[0-i] [I]0-i would say to [him]930-the fellow , ' [[My]0-i dear fellow]935-my dear fellow , it is no good , [she]936-she does not seem to care about [you]930-the fellow , ' as soon as look at [him]930-the fellow . " "[936-she] What a delicate way of breaking the news ! " cries [Esther]148-esther , ironically . "[936-she] Commend [me]0-i to [a man]3402-a man for gentle finesse . " "[936-she] [I]0-i do n't believe in breaking news , " replies [Jack]146-jack , sturdily . "[0-i] If [you]929-you were to go off in a fit , or the bay colt was to break [his]930-the fellow leg , or anything to go wrong , [I]0-i 'd far sooner [people]3426-people would tell [me]0-i so without any humming and hawing and keeping [me]0-i on the tenter hooks . Breaking news is like half cutting [your]929-you throat before [you]929-you are hanged , making [you]929-you die two deaths instead of one . " "[930-the fellow] But suppose [I]0-i do seem to care a little about [him]930-the fellow ? " suggests [Esther]148-esther , blushing furiously , but holding up [her]148-esther head bravely , and looking straight at [[her]148-esther brother]644-her brother . "[0-i] Suppose the cow jumped over the moon , " replies [Jack]146-jack with incredulity . "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't know whether the cow has accomplished [her]939-her feat , but [I]0-i have accomplished [mine]0-i , " says [Esther]148-esther , trying to make [her]148-esther face as brass , and failing signally . [Jack]146-jack puts up [his]146-jack hand , and strokes the future birthplace of [his]146-jack moustache , to hide an unavoidable smile . "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't wish to be rude , " [he]146-jack says ; "[0-i] but may [I]0-i ask , since when ? Was it a week ago , or less , that [you]929-you requested [me]0-i to accompany [you]929-you on one of [your]929-you joint excursions to that everlasting wood , and told [me]0-i [you]929-you thought [your]929-you watch wanted cleaning , the time seemed to go so slow ? " "[180-essie] A week ! " cries [[his]146-jack sister]619-his sister , indignantly . "[180-essie] Three weeks , or a month , at least . " "[180-essie] Wrong , [Essie]180-essie , wrong ; it was this day fortnight , [Ryvel Horse Fair]34-ryvel horse fair , which was the reason why [I]0-i had to decline [your]929-you invitation . " "[180-essie] What does a week one way or another signify " [she]619-his sister cries , becoming irrational , as [a worsted woman]3628-a worsted woman mostly does . "[180-essie] Nothing to [a woman]553-a woman or [a — weathercock]941-a — weathercock . " This last insult is too much for [Miss Craven]164-st. john . "[0-i] [I]0-i see [you]929-you are determined to turn [me]0-i into ridicule ; [I]0-i see [you]929-you do n't believe [me]0-i ! " [she]619-his sister cries , preparing to rush from [the room]3629-the room like a tornado . "[0-i] [My]0-i good [Essie]180-essie , " says [Jack]146-jack , jumping up , taking [her]180-essie two hands , and manfully repressing [his]146-jack inclination to laugh—"here[0-i] [I]0-i am ; tell [me]0-i anything , and [I]0-i 'll swear by the tomb of [[my]0-i grandmother]942-my grandmother to believe it . " "[0-i] Why should not [I]0-i like [him]943-he ? What is there in [him]943-he so hateful as to make [my]0-i being fond of [him]943-he incredible ? " asks [Essie]180-essie , unreasonable and sobbing . "[943-he] Nothing that [I]0-i know of — except [his]943-he boots , and [you]0-i told [me]0-i they were — " "[0-i] So they are , " [she]180-essie says , smiling through [her]180-essie tears—"more[0-i] than hateful ; they haunt one like a bad dream . " "[943-he] [He]943-he is not the least penitent about them , [I]0-i can tell [you]0-i : only yesterday [he]943-he showed [them]944-them [me]0-i with ungodly glee , told [me]0-i [he]943-he had got them at [Hugh Hughes]35-hugh hughes 's , at [Naullan]36-naullan , and advised [me]0-i to go and do likewise . " "[943-he] But — but — [his]943-he boots are not [he]943-he ; [he]943-he is not [his]943-he boots , [I]0-i mean , " remarks [Miss Craven]164-st. john , with meek suggestion ; "[0-i] mercifully , they are separable . " "[943-he] [He]943-he was not born in them , [you]0-i mean ? [I]0-i did not suppose [he]943-he was ; [he]943-he would have been worse than [Richard the Third]224-richard the third , who made [his]943-he appearance with all [his]943-he teeth in [his]943-he head — did n't [he?—if]945-he?—if [he]943-he had . " "[943-he] It is quite true — perfectly true , " continues [Esther]148-esther , leaning [her]148-esther two hands on the back of a chair , and tilting it up and down , "[946-you] what [you]946-you say about [his]943-he being so stupid ; [he]943-he is extremely stupid : often [I]0-i feel inclined to box [his]943-he ears , for the thing [he]943-he says , and for not understanding things , and having to have them explained to [him]943-he ; but after all , do [you]946-you know , [I]0-i am not sure that it is [the people who say clever things , and snap one up all in a minute , that are the best to live with]947-the people who say clever things , and snap one up all in a minute , that are the best to live with . " "[946-you] [You]946-you contemplate living with [him]943-he then , eh ? Last time [I]0-i was favoured with [your]946-you plans , [you]946-you were to be [a vestal to the end of the chapter]948-a vestal to the end of the chapter . " "[948-a vestal to the end of the chapter] A provision for old age : [I]0-i can not expect [you]946-you to be satisfied with [me]0-i always , " [she]0-i answers , with rather a sad smile . "[946-you] And when [I]0-i am superseded , [a good worthy simpleton]949-a good worthy simpleton , with obsolete chivalrous ideas of Woman in the abstract — Woman with a big W — who will laugh at [my]0-i worst jokes whether [he]943-he sees them or not , and make none [himself]943-he , is better than nothing . " "[943-he] All right , " says [Jack]146-jack , calmly , walking towards the door , and unfolding the Times with a crackling that nearly drowns [his]146-jack voice : "[946-you] please [yourself]946-you and [you]946-you 'll please [me]0-i : only be so good as to tell [me]0-i when the wedding day is fixed , as [I]0-i must get a new coat . [I]0-i suppose that the one [I]0-i had for [Uncle John]225-uncle john 's funeral will not do , will it ? " Who is it says in the "[0-i] Tempest , " if neither [Ferdinand]226-ferdinand nor [any other beautiful young Prince]3630-any other beautiful young prince had come on the scene , yet if [Miranda]227-miranda had remained alone with [[her]227-miranda father]3631-her father , and the storms and winds and water - spirits , [she]227-miranda would have ended by loving [Caliban]228-caliban ? [I]0-i do not know about [Miranda]227-miranda , but [I]0-i am sure that if [Esther]148-esther had been in [[Miranda]227-miranda 's place]3632-miranda 's place [she]148-esther would have so ended ; would have carried faggots in [her]148-esther slender arms for [the shaggy monster]3633-the shaggy monster — have called [him]3633-the shaggy monster caressing diminutives , and asked [him]3633-the shaggy monster little interested questions about [his]3633-the shaggy monster dam Sycorax . The desire to be loved is strong enough in [us]3634-we all ; in [this girl]3635-this girl it amounted to madness : it is the key to all the foolish , wicked , senseless things [you]3636-you will find [her]3635-this girl doing through this history 's short course . If [she]3635-this girl could have had [her]3635-this girl will , [every man]3483-every man , [Woman]3638-woman , and [child]3639-child , every cow and calf and dog and cat that met [her]3635-this girl , would have watched [her]3635-this girl coming with joy and [her]3635-this girl going with grief . Add to which , in the summer time [most women]3640-most women like to have [a lover]727-a lover ; it is almost as necessary to [them]3640-most women as warm clothes at Christmas . In winter the fire is lover enough for [any one]523-any one . The frosty splendour of the stars and the chill flashing of the northern lights provoke no yearning in [any one human soul]3643-any one human soul towards any other ; [we]3634-we peep at [them]3640-most women through [our]3634-we icy casements , then drop the curtain shivering , and leave [them]3640-most women alone to [their]3640-most women high cold play in the sky . But who can look at a July moon alone ? [You]3636-you will say that [Esther]148-esther was not alone , that [she]148-esther had [[her]148-esther brother]644-her brother to look at it with [her]148-esther ; but who will deny that [a brother who makes agricultural remarks about [the Queen of Night]3646-the queen of night]3645-a brother who makes agricultural remarks about the queen of night , and observes that the haze round [her]148-esther royal head looks well for the turnips , is worse , immeasurably worse than [nobody]3405-nobody ? To [me]0-i it seems that there is nothing absolute , positive in all this shifting , kaleidoscope world ; everything is comparative . There is nothing either good , bad , pretty , ugly , large , small , except as compared with something better , worse , prettier , uglier , larger , smaller . [Measure two men]3648-measure two men together , and [you]3636-you find [one tall and the other short]3649-one tall and the other short ; put [the short one]3650-the short one by [himself]3650-the short one or among a world of pigmies , and straightway [he]3650-the short one grows tall . Lacking a standard to go by , [we]3634-we make egregious errors . [I]0-i have known many [a woman]553-a woman to pass through life with a pigmy beside [her]553-a woman , taking [him]3650-the short one for a giant all the while , nor undeceived to the end . [Esther]148-esther has [no man]873-no man to measure [her]148-esther Robert by ; none at all , save [the cowman]3653-the cowman , [the carter]3469-the carter , and [the groom]3655-the groom . Intellectually , morally , physically , [he]3650-the short one outtops [them]3648-measure two men in stature , and that is all [she]148-esther can as yet know about [him]3650-the short one . Moonlight , propinquity , total absence of objects of comparison — these three must be [Esther]148-esther 's excuses . [Robert]147-robert is not much like [her]148-esther ideal , certainly — the ideal whose picture [she]148-esther has been painting life - size on the canvas of [her]148-esther mind during the vacant moments of the last two transitional years ; but if [we]3634-we all waited to be [we]3634-we d till [our]3634-we ideal came knocking at [our]3634-we doors , [the world]672-the world would be shortly dispeopled of [legitimate inhabitants]3657-legitimate inhabitants . [Miss Craven]164-st. john 's ideal is dark ; at seventeen , most ideals are dark : [he]147-robert has long , fierce , sleepy , unfathomable eyes . [Robert]147-robert is straw- coloured : [his]147-robert eyes are blue ; very wide awake : [they]3658-they say exactly what [his]147-robert tongue does , neither more nor less , and there is absolutely no harm in them — a doubtful recommendation to [a woman]553-a woman . [The ideal]3660-the ideal 's nose is fine cut , delicately chiselled ; [his]147-robert cheeks are a little haggard , slightly hollowed and paled by five and thirty years or so of the reckless life of one that has lived , not existed . [Robert]147-robert 's nose is broad and blunt ; [his]147-robert cheeks have the roundness and bloom of [a countryman]3661-a countryman 's five and twenty . [The ideal]3660-the ideal breaks most of the commandments with easy grace ; is inclined to be sceptical and a little sarcastic over the old world beliefs , and facts hoary with time and reverence . [Robert]147-robert nightly prays on bent knees to be "[0-i] not led into temptation but delivered from evil ; " [he]147-robert believes firmly every thing that [he]147-robert ever was taught , from the Peep of Day upwards , and [he]147-robert could no more shape [his]147-robert honest lips into a sneer than [he]147-robert could square the circle . Before the fell shafts of the ideal 's eyes [women]547-women lie slain as thick as [Greeks]229-greeks lay beneath the arrows of [Apollo]168-apollo in the Iliad 's opening clash ; the number of [[Robert]147-robert 's female victims]3664-robert 's female victims is represented by a duck 's egg . "[0-i] Je ne comprends pas l'amour sans effroi , " says [one of the characters in the best French novel [I]0-i have read this many a day]3665-one of the characters in the best french novel i have read this many a day . The ideal inspires fear equally with love ; [you]3666-you can imagine [his]147-robert being harsh , fierce , cruel , to [the woman [he]147-robert loves]3667-the woman he loves . In [none of the most hard - hearted of created beings]3668-none of the most hard - hearted of created beings could [Robert]147-robert provoke alarm . [Children who see [him]147-robert for the first time]3669-children who see him for the first time come and thrust [their]3669-children who see him for the first time little dimpled hands into [his]147-robert , and laugh up with confident impudence in [his]147-robert face . [Dogs to whom [he]147-robert has never been introduced]3670-dogs to whom he has never been introduced come and rub [their]3670-dogs to whom he has never been introduced shaggy heads against [his]147-robert knees , and curl and wriggle about [his]147-robert friendly feet . [Esther]148-esther can indulge no faintest hope that [he]147-robert will bully [her]148-esther . [The ideal]3660-the ideal rides straight as a die , and is as much a part of [his]147-robert horse as a centaur . [Robert]147-robert is very fond of getting a day 's hunting when [he]147-robert can afford the two guineas requisite for the hiring of a horse , which is not very often ; and [he]147-robert likes to get [his]147-robert money 's worth by blundering blindly over everything that comes in [his]147-robert way , but [he]147-robert has about as much idea of riding as [a tailor]3672-a tailor or a cow . The ideal is [an idol to be set up and worshipped]3673-an idol to be set up and worshipped — [a Baal to be adored with tears and blood and knife - gashings]3674-a baal to be adored with tears and blood and knife - gashings . [Robert]147-robert is [a worshipper]3675-a worshipper to be encouraged by a cold look and smile flung to [him]147-robert every now and then , like a bone to a dog , or spurned away with disapproving foot , as [Cain]230-cain was from [his]230-cain unaccepted altar . To worship is to [a woman always sweeter than to be worshipped]3676-a woman always sweeter than to be worshipped . To worship [one]559-one must look up ; to be worshipped [one]559-one must look down . . . . Come with [me]0-i this August Sunday through the wood from [Glan - yr - Afon]24-glan - yr - afon to [Plas Berwyn]38-plas berwyn — from [[Esther]148-esther 's home]3679-esther 's home to [[Robert]147-robert 's]3680-robert 's . [It]3681-it is but a few hundred yards of shade and shine , a small , scarce trodden wood - path whose narrow , faint track the ripe grasses and the seeded ferns have well - nigh obliterated , flinging themselves across [it]3681-it in all the abandon of [their]3682-their unspeakable grace . The apples ' round faces are reddening in [the little Plas Berwyn orchard]3683-the little plas berwyn orchard ; [the shorn fields]3684-the shorn fields slope barely , slantwise along [the hill - side]3685-the hill - side in their yellow stubble . For weeks and weeks the corn has been whitening under the sun 's hard , veilless stare , and now at last it has fallen ; the barley has bowed its bearded head beneath the sickle 's stroke , and the oats their tremulous ringlets . [They]3682-their are all gathered in , and garnered in [[Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon 's stout , well - thatched stacks]3686-mrs. brandon 's stout , well - thatched stacks ; to thatch a stack is the one thing [a Welshman]3687-a welshman can do . It is an hour past noon , and [the Reverend Evan Evans]151-evan has released [the bodies of [[his]151-evan congregation]3689-his congregation from [that white - washed , tumble - down old barn]3690-that white - washed , tumble - down old barn that [he]151-evan is pleased to call [[his]151-evan church]3691-his church]3688-the bodies of his congregation from that white - washed , tumble - down old barn that he is pleased to call his church , and [their]3689-his congregation minds from the tension necessary to take in the ill - strung - together , misapplied texts that [he]151-evan is pleased to call [his]151-evan sermon . [Plas Berwyn]38-plas berwyn is [a house of about the same size as [Glan - yr - Afon]24-glan - yr - afon]3692-a house of about the same size as glan - yr - afon , but [the rooms]3693-the rooms do not look so large , [they]3693-the rooms are so full of large things and [large people]3694-large people . [The dining - toom]3695-the dining - toom is crowded up with a great mahogany table , a great mahogany sideboard , great mahogany chairs — inconvenient relics , fondly clung to by [people who from [a larger house]3697-a larger house]3696-people who from a larger house have subsided into a smaller one — a sort of warranty of past respectability like [the cottager]3698-the cottager 's japanned tea - tray and brass candlesticks . There is an atmosphere of lumbersome age and gravity about [the whole place]3699-the whole place ; none of the fragrance and light and melody that youth , sheer youth , even divorced from any other attractive qualities , brings with it . Of [all the gods of the Greek mythology]3700-all the gods of the greek mythology [I]0-i will bring [my]0-i votive crowns and [my]0-i salt cakes to [Bacchus]231-bacchus . Not [the bloated old gentleman]3701-the bloated old gentleman striding drunk over a barrel , as [we]3702-we figure [him]231-bacchus , but [Bacchus]231-bacchus eternally young . What is there so worthy of adoration in this aging , wrinkling world as never ending youth ? [Most people]3703-most people are cross and [most people]3703-most people are unusually hungry on Sunday . [I]0-i do not know why it is , but if [you]3705-you observe [your]3705-you acquaintance [you]3705-you will find it to be true . Hungry or not , [the Brandons]232-the brandons are at dinner , dining frugally and sparely on cold roast beef and cold apple tart . Nothing hot ever figures on [the Brandons]232-the brandons ' Sabbath table , not even potatoes ; indeed , unless [they]232-the brandons boiled [themselves]232-the brandons , and hopped out of the pot judiciously when [they]232-the brandons found [themselves]232-the brandons done , [I]0-i do not see how [they]232-the brandons could , as on the Sabbath morn [every living soul at [Plas Berwyn]38-plas berwyn]3706-every living soul at plas berwyn , [every reluctant scullion and recalcitrant housemaid]3707-every reluctant scullion and recalcitrant housemaid , is trundled off to [church]3708-church , the house - door locked , and the key deposited in [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon 's pocket . [All the Brandons]232-the brandons hate dining in the middle of the day , consequently [they]232-the brandons always dine in the middle of the day on Sunday . [Everybody]3709-everybody knows that there are few things more distinctly unpleasant than to sit in [the same room in which [you]3705-you have [your]3705-you meals]3710-the same room in which you have your meals ; to live with the unending smell and steam of departed viands up [your]3705-you nose and eyes and ears : consequently [the Brandons]3711-the brandons always sit in [the dining - room]688-the dining - room on Sunday . Sunday is to [them]3711-the brandons a sort of aggravated Ash Wednesday and Good Friday rolled into one . On Saturday night [Miss Bessy Brandon]202-bessy swoops down upon all novels , travels , biographies , magazines , poetry books , that may be lying about , makes a clean sweep of [them]3711-the brandons and consigns [them]3711-the brandons to disgrace and a cupboard till the return of Monday releases [them]3711-the brandons . [The Brandon family]3713-the brandon family at the present moment have got [their]3713-the brandon family Sunday faces and [their]3713-the brandon family Sunday clothes on , and [they]3713-the brandon family misbecome most of [them]3713-the brandon family very sorely . [Very few men]3714-very few men look [their]3714-very few men best in [their]3714-very few men Go - to - Meeting clothes . For some unexplained reason , a black coat made by [a country tailor]3715-a country tailor shows its shortcomings more plainly than a coloured one . The garment that [cases Bob]190-bob 's broad shoulders would draw tears from [Mr. Poole]233-mr. poole 's eyes , could [he]233-mr. poole see it . As for [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon , [she]201-mrs. brandon always has more or less of a Sunday face on — which [I]0-i do not say in any dispraise , but merely to express [a sober , steadfast face , unfurrowed by any violent gust of mirth or blast of anger]3716-a sober , steadfast face , unfurrowed by any violent gust of mirth or blast of anger . [She]201-mrs. brandon is like [Enid]234-enid and [[her]234-enid mother]3717-her mother , "[0-i] clad all in faded silk , " and on [her]201-mrs. brandon breast [she]201-mrs. brandon has a miniature of [the departed Brandon]201-mrs. brandon , in Geneva gown and bands , about as big as a teacup , and with two small glutinous curls of the departed 's hair at the back . It is so long ago since [he]233-mr. poole died , that [she]201-mrs. brandon must have forgotten all about [him]233-mr. poole — what [he]233-mr. poole was like , even ; but [site]235-site still wears [his]233-mr. poole effigy , as [an old inn]3718-an old inn continues to hang out the sign of [the Saracen]236-the saracen 's Head , though it is centuries since ever [a Saracen]3719-a saracen has been seen on [the earth]708-the earth 's face . Opposite each other , like little bad mirrors of [one another]922-one another , sit [the Misses Brandon]205-the misses brandon , in melancholy little gowns of no particular stuff and no particular colour , and little wisps of thin , fine hair well down over [their]205-the misses brandon ears , and minute chig . nons on the napes of [their]205-the misses brandon necks — [their]205-the misses brandon little , bustless , waistless , hipless figures , long plaintive noses , and meek , dull eyes proclaiming [them]205-the misses brandon of that virgin band to whom [St. Paul]131-good paul has awarded the palm of excellence . "[180-essie] [I]0-i believe it is because [you]0-i are going to be rid of [me]0-i for a fortnight . " "[0-i] Partly , [I]0-i think , " replies [Esther]148-esther , nonchalantly . " "[0-i] Hush ! " [he]3740-he cries , hurriedly , putting up [his]3740-he hand before [her]148-esther mouth . "[0-i] Do n't say that ; it is bad luck . "[0-i] [I]0-i wish to [Heaven]182-heaven [you]0-i were not so fond of [me]0-i ! " [she]0-i says , hastily ; "[0-i] please do try not to be : it makes [me]0-i feel as if [I]0-i were cheating all the time — having things and not paying for them . " "[0-i] [I]0-i could have given [you]0-i up at first , if [you]0-i had told [me]0-i it must be so positively ; [I]0-i 'm sure [I]0-i could have made shift to do without [you]0-i , as [I]0-i have made shift to do without many a thing that [other fellows]1002-other fellows consider necessaries of life ; but now — " [He]3741-he has seized [her]148-esther two hands , and now holds [her]148-esther standing there before [him]3741-he . To hold [her]148-esther hand is the one familiarity [Robert]147-robert is permitted ; not once in all [his]3741-he life has [he]3741-he kissed [[his]3741-he betrothed]3581-his betrothed . " The church bell has ceased ; there is no sound in [the quiet room]3744-the quiet room but that of one fat - bodied bluebottle , labouring and buzzing up the pane , and then tumbling back again . [Robert]147-robert has abandoned the window - sill , finding it a painful and not luxurious seat : [he]147-robert is walking up and down , up and down ; one stride and a half of [his]147-robert long legs taking [him]147-robert from end to end of [the little room]3745-the little room . [Esther]148-esther has thrown [herself]148-esther into an American rocking chair , and is rocking violently backwards and forwards , trying [her]148-esther best to tip [herself]148-esther over . " Nine o'clock ! [The maid - servants]3536-the maid - servants are at [evening church]3752-evening church , combining the double advantage of making [their]3536-the maid - servants souls and meeting [[their]3536-the maid - servants sweethearts]3753-their sweethearts . [Esther]148-esther , happily rid of [hers]148-esther , is sitting on the ground at the French window of [the study]3754-the study , beside [[her]148-esther brother]644-her brother . The rooks that blackened [the meadow]3756-the meadow awhile ago have flapped heavily home to [the mile - off rookery]3757-the mile - off rookery . It is such [a great , still world]3758-a great , still world ; who would fancy that there were so many [noisy men]3759-noisy men , barking dogs , snorting steam - engines in it ? It seems [a world of stars and flowers]3760-a world of stars and flowers , as one would imagine it after reading one of [Mrs. Heman]248-mrs. heman 's poems . [Jack]146-jack is smoking ; now and then [Esther]148-esther takes the pipe out of [his]146-jack mouth , gives a little puff , coughs and chokes , and puts it back again . Oh , blessed state of intimacy , when [you]147-robert may sit by [a person]759-a person for hours and never utter to [them]759-a person ! [Esther]148-esther is thinking what a pretty , pleasant Idyllic life [hers]148-esther is ; like [an Arcadian shepherdess]3762-an arcadian shepherdess 's in [this lovely valley]3763-this lovely valley , far away from [smoky towns]3764-smoky towns and vulgar cares and sordid toils . Young and beautiful ( what [pretty woman]3765-pretty woman is mock - modest to [her]3765-pretty woman own thoughts ? ) , living with [a brother who is to [her]148-esther what [father]3767-father , [mother]826-mother , [brothers]3437-brothers , [sisters]3770-sisters , [husband]3771-husband , [children]3772-children]3766-a brother who is to her what father , mother , brothers , sisters , husband , children , are to [other women]3773-other women ; [a brother who is only three years older than [herself]148-esther , consequently not likely to die much before [her]148-esther]3774-a brother who is only three years older than herself , consequently not likely to die much before her . [She]148-esther is thinking , a little regretfully , that , fair and poetic as this life is , it is passing , and that as it passes [she]148-esther does not feel its beauty as acutely as [she]148-esther ought — does not suck out all its sweetness , as [a man]3402-a man swallows a delicious draught hastily , carelessly , without tasting and dwelling upon its rare flavour . It is the same sort of thought ( only much weaker ) as those that torment [us]3776-us as [we]3776-us sit alone by the hearth mourning [our]3776-us dead , and reproach [ourselves]3776-us , with a yearning pain , that while [they]3777-they were yet with [us]3776-us [we]3776-us did not draw [our]3776-us chairs half close enough to [theirs]3777-they — did not take hold of [their]3777-they hands and kiss [their]3777-they faces half often enough — did not half often enough tell [them]3777-they , with eager lips , how preciouser than life [they]3777-they were to [us]3776-us . "[180-essie] [THE 2.25 train]1052-the 2.25 train from [Brainton]43-brainton is due at [Felton]44-felton at 5.30 . [It]1052-the 2.25 train is drawing near [Mither]251-mither now , escorted by [a vanguard , bodyguard , and rearguard of dust - clouds]1053-a vanguard , bodyguard , and rearguard of dust - clouds ; it rushes along , with the sun beating down on the roofs of [the carriages]1054-the carriages , making [them]1054-the carriages like [little compartments of Hades]1055-little compartments of hades . If [the devil]748-the devil took a hint from [the Coldbath Fields cells]1057-the coldbath fields cells for " improving [the prisons of Hell]3787-the prisons of hell , "[748-the devil] [he]748-the devil certainly might take a hint from the Brainton train for improving [the travelling conveyances of [the same locality]1059-the same locality]1058-the travelling conveyances of the same locality . In [one of [the first - class carriages]1061-the first - class carriages]1060-one of the first - class carriages there is [a baby]1062-a baby : it has got a cold , and seems rather inclined to be sick ; so both [the nurse]1063-the nurse , on whose lap it lies gaping and blowing bubbles , and [the idolising mother , who sits over against it]1064-the idolising mother , who sits over against it , insist on keeping its window tight up . There is a rusty old divine , in gilt - rimmed spectacles and a jowl , reading the Guardian ; [a commercial traveller]1065-a commercial traveller , with [his]1065-a commercial traveller hat off , [his]1065-a commercial traveller legs up , and a gaudy cap on [his]1065-a commercial traveller head , fast asleep ; and , lastly , [a little young lady]1066-a little young lady , sitting facing the engine , with the dusty blast driving hot and full in [her]1066-a little young lady face , blinking , coughing , choking , with the utmost patience . On [her]1066-a little young lady lap lies a huge bunch of red and yellow roses and heavy - scented double - stocks , all limp and drooping and soiled . [Bob]190-bob gave them to [her]1066-a little young lady when [he]190-bob came down to [the station]1067-the station to see [her]1066-a little young lady off - and very kind of [him]190-bob too , and very nice [they]1068-they are ; but all the same , as [she]1066-a little young lady has already a bag , a box , and a parasol to carry , [she]1066-a little young lady thinks ( though [she]1066-a little young lady barely owns it to [herself]1066-a little young lady ) that [she]1066-a little young lady would almost as soon have been without them . " Well , odder things have happened ! But for [Bob]190-bob ! "[1076-some country people] As [they]1076-some country people pass [[Lady Gerard]239-lady gerard 's model school]1078-lady gerard 's model school , [twenty little charity girls]1079-twenty little charity girls come trooping out in the uniformity of [their]1079-twenty little charity girls cotton frock and straw bonnet livery , and drop twenty bob courtesies to [Esther]148-esther , who feels as [the man in the " Arabian Nights]3792-the man in the " arabian nights "[3792-the man in the " arabian nights] did who woke and found [himself]1080-himself [Sultan]254-sultan . [Labouring men]1081-labouring men go stumping heavily [home]701-home , with [their]1081-labouring men tools over [their]1081-labouring men shoulders and [their]1081-labouring men heads bent earthwards , as is always the case with [the tillers of [the soil]1084-the soil]1083-the tillers of the soil , who must — oh , hard necessity!—be ever looking down . Park palings , through which the strong brake fern is thrusting itself , slide past ; then [a red lodge]1085-a red lodge , picked out with blue bricks , where [an obsequious old woman]1086-an obsequious old woman rushes out from the washtub , with hands all soapsuds , to open the gates ; then [a grassy , knolly park]1087-a grassy , knolly park ; then [a great red house]1088-a great red house , likewise picked out with blue bricks ; then stones clattering under an echoing portico ; then the pumpkin stops , and [Cinderella]252-cinderella descends . " [Miss Craven]164-st. john ! "[1089-the butler] announces [the butler]1089-the butler , opening a tall door ; and [Miss Craven]164-st. john , plucking up heart , marches into [a high , dark library]1090-a high , dark library , lined with high , dark books — marches in , looking very much like a chimney sweep . Dust lies in ridges on [her]164-st. john once white bonnet ; dust , instead of belladonna , in streaks under [her]164-st. john eyes ; dust on the parting of [her]164-st. john hair , on [her]164-st. john eyelashes , up [her]164-st. john nose ( on which there is also , though , happily for [her]164-st. john , [she]164-st. john does not know it , a large smut ) , and a double portion of dust on the great , faded , yellow roses , to which [she]164-st. john cleaves with as much pertinacity as the idiot in " Excelsior "[164-st. john] clave to that senseless banner which [he]1091-he was so determined to run up hill with . As [she]164-st. john enters , [a goddess]1092-a goddess rises like an exhalation ( as Pandemonium did ) , and comes floating on lilac clouds towards [her]164-st. john . This is as things seem to [her]164-st. john ; in reality , [a large , fair , young woman]1093-a large , fair , young woman comes forward in a long - tailed mauve muslin . "[1095-the goddess] The tea is poured out ; it has been standing on the table an hour , and is perfectly cold . [She]239-lady gerard is fat to make [you]1108-you shudder ; [she]239-lady gerard has a short , turn - up nose , short legs , a red skin , and next to no hair — all very good points in a pig , but hardly so good in [a lady]1109-a lady . Then [he]247-mr. gerard looks across through the partition wall of great bigonias in silver pots , and sees a little face peeping at [him]247-mr. gerard under and over the broad crimson leaves . [No one]891-no one would ever call [Esther]148-esther 's a Madonna face . [No artist]1118-no artist would ever ask [her]148-esther to sit for [St. Catherine]259-st. catherine , or [St. Cecilia]260-st. cecilia , or [St. Anybody else]1119-st. anybody else ; [hers]148-esther is essentially beauté du diable — one of those little , sparkling , provoking , petulant faces that have a fresh dress of smiles or tears , or dimples or blushes , for every trivial , passing question ; one of those little faces that have been at the bottom of half the mischiefs [the world]672-the world has seen . " [I]258-miss blessington only saw a pair of legs , "[258-miss blessington] replies the face , exculpating itself ; " how could [I]258-miss blessington tell whether they were young or old legs ? "[258-miss blessington] [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington looks rather shocked , as if [she]258-miss blessington thought that [Esther]148-esther 's modes of expression were somewhat libre ; and indeed at the rate of purity at which [we]1121-we are advancing , legs will soon walk off into the limbo of silence and unmentionableness ; arms will probably follow [them]1122-them , and then perhaps noses . Although [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington looks shocked , [St. John]164-st. john only laughs . [He]1123-he looks pleasant when [he]1123-he laughs ; [he]1123-he did not look pleasant just now , when [he]1123-he was turning up [his]1123-he nose at [his]1123-he cold soup . The birds have gone to bed , and the slugs come out to walk on [the damp garden paths]1149-the damp garden paths . Now and then a little wind gets up , whispers a word or two to the polished laurel leaves , and lies down again . There is a carpet of thin , smoke - grey clouds over heaven 's blue floor . [The two girls]1150-the two girls are strolling up and down [the terrace walk]1151-the terrace walk . [Esther]148-esther has got a red cloak thrown about [her]148-esther shoulders ; [she]148-esther is not in the least afraid of taking cold , and declined the offer of it in the first instance ; but on second thoughts , reflecting that the dining - room windows look on [the terrace]1152-the terrace , and that [the fairy prince]1153-the fairy prince may see and like the combination of black eyes and red cloth ( [fairy princes]1154-fairy princes being always partial to gay colours ) , accepted it . [I]0-i have called [Esther]148-esther " little , "[258-miss blessington] and [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington " large ; "[0-i] but the truth is they are much of a height . The difference between [them]1150-the two girls is , that one is a young , slight sapling that has , been so busy shooting up skywards , that it has had no leisure to grow broad , and that the other is a full - grown , spreading , stately forest tree . And yet [they]1150-the two girls are the same age ; but [some women]1155-some women develope , mind and body , much quicker than others . From the unshuttered dining - room windows comes a great square of yellow lamplight , and lies smooth upon the gravel . Looking in [you]1156-you see rifled fruit dishes , half - filled wine - glasses , moths flying round and round the lamp globes , trying [their]1155-some women best to find an entrance to fiery death . " ) Below [the terrace]1152-the terrace spreads a large square of grass , uninvaded by flower - bed or shrub , mowed and rolled , rolled and mowed , into the similitude of a pancake for flatness . There croquet - hoops glance whitely in the soft half - light ; mallets lie strewn like dead soldiers after a battle ; balls red , blue , and yellow , like great ripe fruit tumbled among the grass . "[164-st. john] Is this [[your]258-miss blessington croquet - ground]1167-your croquet - ground ? " "[164-st. john] Yes . " "[164-st. john] Nice and level ? " "[164-st. john] Yes . " "[258-miss blessington] Better than doing nothing , is n't it ? " answers [Esther]148-esther , cheerily ; [she]148-esther being [a young woman to whom the words rest and enjoyment]3826-a young woman to whom the words rest and enjoyment are not synonymous , as they mostly grow to be to [people in later years]3827-people in later years . From [the dining - room]688-the dining - room comes the faint melody of the trombone , played with the skill of much practice by [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas 's nose . [Some one]686-some one comes to the window , looks out , puts a hand on the sill , and jumps down . [St. John]164-st. john apparently has an aversion from going out and coming in by the authorised modes of exit and entrance . Now that [one]559-one can see [him]3831-him without any bigonia interposing , [one]559-one notices that [he]3831-him has kind , eager eyes — eyes that seem to be looking , looking for something that [they]559-one have not found yet — and rather a long nose , that the sun has got hold of and browned , as [a cook browns mashed potatoes]3832-a cook browns mashed potatoes . "[258-miss blessington] Wo n't [you]258-miss blessington join [us]1168-us , [St. John]164-st. john ? " asks [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington , stooping to reinstate a fallen hoop , and looking calm invitation at [him]3831-him out of [her]258-miss blessington great , fine , passionless , cow eyes . "[258-miss blessington] [Gooseberry]269-gooseberry [I]0-i may be , " [she]148-esther thinks , "[0-i] but , at all events , [I]0-i wo n't be instrumental in making [myself]0-i so . " "[258-miss blessington] Do [I]0-i ever play ? " asks [he]3831-him , with petulance , walking off in a huff . "[1169-he] [He]1169-he did not accept [your]1170-your invitation with the exultant gratitude [one]559-one would have expected , did [he]1169-he ? " says [Miss Craven]164-st. john , maliciously . "[1169-he] [He]1169-he hates the game , " replies [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington , rather sharplier than is [her]258-miss blessington wo nt — "[1169-he] particularly playing with odd numbers . " "[1169-he] Oh ! " The match begins ; it is about as fair as a foot race between [Deerfoot]270-deerfoot and [a lame baby]3833-a lame baby . [Esther]148-esther has played about six times in the course of [her]148-esther life ; [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington about six thousand . [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington makes the round of the hoops in triumphant solitude , while poor [Essie]180-essie struggles feebly , ignorantly , unscientifically , to ring a bell that refuses to emit the faintest tinkle . "[1169-he] [Hare]271-hare and tortoise ! " cries [she]180-essie , laughing at [her]180-essie own discomfiture ; "[1169-he] [you]1169-he 'll go to sleep presently , and [I]0-i shall crawl in and win . " "[0-i] Since [you]1170-your wish [me]0-i , [I]0-i do n't mind taking a mallet , " says [St. John]164-st. john , appearing suddenly round a big Wellingtonia , and looking confusedly conscious of being seen descending very awkwardly from [his]1169-he high horse . "[0-i] How do [you]1169-he know [we]1172-we wish [you]1169-he to take one?—we never said so , " says [Essie]180-essie , flashing at [him]1169-he with [her]180-essie wicked , laughing , half - lowered eyes . ( "[1173-another 's] Since [I]0-i am [another 's]1173-another 's and [he]1174-he is [another 's]1173-another 's , [I]0-i do n't see why [we]1172-we should not try to amuse [each other]909-each other , " [she]0-i says to [herself]0-i . ) "[0-i] It is [your]1169-he turn to play , [Miss Craven]164-st. john , " interposes [Constance]256-constance , coldly . "[0-i] [I]0-i make one stipulation before [we]1177-us start , " cries [Esther]148-esther , gaily , "[0-i] and that is , that [you]256-constance make no remarks upon [my]0-i play except such as are of a laudatory nature . " [Fate]272-fate does not smile upon the union of [St. John]164-st. john and [Esther]148-esther . "[0-i] Why , [you]256-constance play worse than [I]0-i do , " cries [she]148-esther , delighted at the discovery . "[256-constance] Take that , [[you]256-constance fool [you]256-constance]1179-you fool you ! " ( this is addressed to the ball , not to [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington ) hurling [his]1169-he mallet at it as it scuds swiftly over the sward and lodges in the pink and purple breast of an aster bed . The head and handle of the mallet fly asunder from the violence of their passage through the air , and [Mr. Gerard]247-mr. gerard is reduced to the ignominy of picking up the disjecta membra and hammering them together again . "[256-constance] [You]256-constance must make a sensation when [you]256-constance go to a croquet party , " remarks [Esther]148-esther , sarcastically . "[256-constance] Do [you]256-constance think so badly of [me]0-i as to suppose [I]0-i ever do ? is [[thy]256-constance servant]1180-thy servant a curate that [he]1180-thy servant should do this thing ? " [he]1169-he answers , coming over and standing close to [her]148-esther . "[1180-thy servant] Please attend to the game , [St. John]164-st. john ! It is [you]256-constance to play ! " exclaims [Constance]256-constance , with suppressed , lady - like irritation , from the other end of the ground , where [she]256-constance stands in majestic solitude . It is the penalty of greatness to be lonely . A few more egregious blunders on the part of the firm of [Gerard]247-mr. gerard and [Craven]148-esther , [a few more masterstrokes]3836-a few more masterstrokes by [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington , and the game draws to a conclusion . "[256-constance] It is ridiculous playing against such luck as yours , [Constance]256-constance , " cries [St. John]164-st. john , flinging down [his]1169-he weapon in an unjust , unreasonable fury . "[1182-the most unlucky devil under the sun] [He]1182-the most unlucky devil under the sun is rather odd - tempered , " answers [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington , composedly ; "[1182-the most unlucky devil under the sun] and the most singular thing is , that it is always [the people [he]1182-the most unlucky devil under the sun is fondest of with whom [he]1182-the most unlucky devil under the sun is most easily irritated]1183-the people he is fondest of with whom he is most easily irritated . " "[1182-the most unlucky devil under the sun] How fond [he]1182-the most unlucky devil under the sun must be of [you]1184-you ! " says [Esther]148-esther , internally . [DEATH]192-death and the sun are very much alike in one respect , and that is , [their]3837-them utter impartiality and stupid want of discernment . [They]3837-them make no difference between those who love [them]3837-them and [those who hate]3838-those who hate . [They]3837-them pay [their]3837-them visits equally so [those who are longing for and lifting up eager hands]3839-those who are longing for and lifting up eager hands towards [them]3837-them , and [those who would much prefer to be without [them]3837-them]3840-those who would much prefer to be without them . [I]1182-the most unlucky devil under the sun will drop the parallel , which can not be carried much farther , and talk of the sun only . [He]1182-the most unlucky devil under the sun certainly shows very little judgment , and less taste , in these matters . [He]1182-the most unlucky devil under the sun gives [his]1182-the most unlucky devil under the sun great , warm light just as readily to a scullery as a boudoir , to an ill - smelling dunghill as to a bed of mignonette ; kisses with just as much relish the raddled cheeks of [an old fish - wife]3841-an old fish - wife as the fresh scarlet lips of [a young countess]3842-a young countess . This present August morning [he]1182-the most unlucky devil under the sun is blazing full and hot on that very grievous daub of [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon in a no - waisted black satin , out of which [she]201-mrs. brandon appears to be bursting , like a chrysalis from its sheath , in [the Plas Berwyn dining - room]3843-the plas berwyn dining - room , and not a whit more fully or more hotly on the exquisite "[1182-the most unlucky devil under the sun] Monna Lisa " of [Da Vinci]273-da vinci , which is the chief jewel of [the Gerard collection]3844-the gerard collection . [The same sunbeam that brings out with such clearness]3845-the same sunbeam that brings out with such clearness [Monna Lisa]274-betsy 's faint , weird smile , takes in also within its compass [Esther]148-esther 's small , swart head , round the back of which coils a great , loose , careless twist of burnished hair , like a black snake . [She]148-esther is standing outside the dining - room door , with [her]148-esther lithe , svelte figure stooped forward a little . [The family]3846-the family are at prayers , as [she]148-esther ascertained by applying [her]148-esther ear to the key - hole , and hearing [a harsh , elderly voice going at a good round trot through a variety of petitions]3847-a harsh , elderly voice going at a good round trot through a variety of petitions , for [himself]1182-the most unlucky devil under the sun , [[his]1182-the most unlucky devil under the sun children]3848-his children ( [he]1182-the most unlucky devil under the sun has only one , and hates [him]1182-the most unlucky devil under the sun ) , [[his]1182-the most unlucky devil under the sun friends]3527-his friends , [[his]1182-the most unlucky devil under the sun enemies]3850-his enemies , [[his]1182-the most unlucky devil under the sun queen]3851-his queen , [[his]1182-the most unlucky devil under the sun bishops]3852-his bishops and [curates]3853-curates , [[his]1182-the most unlucky devil under the sun black brethren]3854-his black brethren , & c. , all without the vestige of a comma between [them]1185-them . [Lady Gerard]239-lady gerard never appears at breakfast . About twenty years ago [she]239-lady gerard had an illness , and , on the strength of it , has kept up a character for invalidhood ever since . [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington takes [her]258-miss blessington place at the head of the table ; [she]258-miss blessington is sitting there now . [Her]258-miss blessington shapely hands are busy among the teacups ; [her]258-miss blessington white lids drooped over [her]258-miss blessington calm eyes . There is a great gold cross on [her]258-miss blessington breast , that rises and falls in soft , even undulations . [Eve]161-eve , as [she]161-eve was when first [she]161-eve grew into separate entity and embodiment out of [Adam]276-adam 's side ; [Eve]161-eve , of creamiest flesh , and richest , reddest blood , before a soul — a tormenting , puzzling , intangible , incomprehensible soul — was breathed into [her]161-eve . When [Constance]256-constance marries , [[her]256-constance husband]3858-her husband will gaze at [her]256-constance as [a man]3402-a man might gaze at [Gibson]277-gibson 's "[266-venus sleeping] [Venus]266-venus sleeping , " supposing that [he]3858-her husband had bought for a great price that marvel of modern sculpture , and had set it up in the place of honour in [[his]3858-her husband gallery]3860-his gallery . [He]3858-her husband would half - shut [his]3858-her husband eyes , the better to appreciate the exquisite turn of the cold , stately throat , the modelling of the little rounded wrist ; would put [his]3858-her husband head on one side , and look at it this way and that , to determine whether [he]3858-her husband liked the tinting . "[266-venus sleeping] Faultily faultless , icily regular , splendidly null , " as the pithy line that [everybody]3709-everybody knows , and that next to [nobody]3405-nobody could have written , hath it . At forty [Constance]256-constance will be [a much handsomer woman]3863-a much handsomer woman than [Esther]148-esther . At forty those clean - cut , immovable , expressionless features will be hardly the worse for wear ; that colourless marble skin will be hardly less smoothly polished than it is now . At forty [Esther]148-esther ( if [she]148-esther live so long ) will have cried and laughed , and fretted and teased [herself]148-esther into a mere shadow of [her]148-esther present self . [Every one]869-every one 's letters at [Felton]44-felton are put on [their]869-every one plate for [them]869-every one . As [Esther]148-esther takes [her]148-esther seat , [she]148-esther perceives that there is one for [her]148-esther — one directed in a scrawling , schoolboy hand . The blood rushes to [her]148-esther face , as it does to a turkeycock 's wattles when [he]190-bob is excited or angry , and [she]148-esther thrusts it hastily into [her]148-esther pocket . To [her]148-esther guilty imagination it seems that written all over it , in big red letters , legible to every eye , is , "[266-venus sleeping] From [Bob Brandon]190-bob , [[Esther Craven]148-esther 's lover]1193-esther craven 's lover . " As [her]148-esther eyes lift [themselves]3865-themselves shyly , to see whether [St. John]164-st. john is observing [her]148-esther , [they]3865-themselves meet [his]190-bob , looking at [her]148-esther curiously , interestedly , puzzledly . "[1194-we] [We]1194-we allow [people]3426-people to read [their]3426-people letters at breakfast here , " [he]190-bob says , with a friendly smile ; "[1194-we] [we]1194-we are not particular as to manners , as [I]0-i dare say [you]148-esther have found out by this time . " "[0-i] Oh ! thanks , [I]0-i 'm in no hurry ; it 's of no consequence — it will keep , " answers [Esther]148-esther , disjointedly , with would - be indifference , and the turkeycock hue spreading to the edge of [her]0-i white gown . The morning hours at [Felton]44-felton are not exciting . [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas is building [a new orchid house]3866-a new orchid house , and spends much of [his]238-sir thomas time standing over [the bricklayers]3867-the bricklayers , like [an Egyptian overseer]3868-an egyptian overseer , telling [them]3867-the bricklayers with [his]238-sir thomas usual courteous candour how much more [he]238-sir thomas knows about [their]3867-the bricklayers trade than [they]3867-the bricklayers [themselves]3867-the bricklayers do , who have been at it all [their]3867-the bricklayers lives . [St. John]164-st. john disappears too , and [Constance]256-constance and [Esther]148-esther are left tête - à - tête . [Esther]148-esther has plenty of time to read [Bob]190-bob 's letter , and to understand it , which latter requires some ingenuity , as , from the greater rapidity of [his]238-sir thomas thoughts than of [his]238-sir thomas pen , [he]238-sir thomas omits most of the little words — tos and ands and whichs and who s and [[he s]3869-he s]3869-he s and [she]148-esther s. There is a good deal about [[his]238-sir thomas mother]3479-his mother in it : several messages from [her]3479-his mother ; a great many questions as to what [Mr. Gerard]247-mr. gerard was like , with solemn adjurations to answer them ; a sheet devoted to the exposition of the luxury in which it is possible to live on £ 300 a year ; and , lastly , a sentence or two as to [his]238-sir thomas great loneliness , and [his]238-sir thomas eager longing to have [[his]238-sir thomas darling]3871-his darling [Esther]148-esther back again — not much on that head , as if [he]238-sir thomas were afraid of marring [her]148-esther enjoyment by intruding upon [her]148-esther the picture of [his]238-sir thomas own disconsolateness . It was not an eloquent letter ; in fact , it was rather a stupid one , and had evidently been written with a very nasty scratchy pen ; but for all that it was a nice one , and so [Esther]148-esther felt , and wished that it had been less so . [Bob]190-bob is [a dear fellow]3872-a dear fellow ; and , no doubt , when [she]148-esther goes back to [Glan - yr - Afon]24-glan - yr - afon , [she]148-esther will be very glad to see [him]190-bob , and be very fond of [him]190-bob ; but , for the present , [she]148-esther would like to forget [him]190-bob altogether — to have a holiday from [him]190-bob : [he]190-bob seems to come in incongruously now somehow . "[0-i] Where 's [St. John]164-st. john ? " grunts [miladi]278-miladi , who makes [her]278-miladi appearance towards luncheon time , from the arm - chair which is witness to so many gentle dozes on [her]278-miladi part .
