[LUNCHEON]279-luncheon comes , but no [St. John]164-st. john . After luncheon [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas , [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington , and [Miss Craven]164-st. john go out riding . [Miss Craven]164-st. john 's knowledge of horsemanship is confined to [her]164-st. john exploits on a small , shaggy , down - hearted Welsh pony , concerning whom it would be difficult to predicate which [he]1196-he was fullest of , years or grass . [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington has lent [her]258-miss blessington an old habit ; it is much too big in the waist and shoulders for [her]258-miss blessington , but a well - made garment always manages to adapt itself more or less to any figure , and [she]258-miss blessington does not look amiss in it . It is a matter of very little consequence to [her]258-miss blessington at the present moment how [she]258-miss blessington looks ; [she]258-miss blessington is [the arrantest coward in [Christendom]47-christendom]3876-the arrantest coward in christendom , and [her]258-miss blessington heart sinks down to the bottom of [her]258-miss blessington boots as [she]258-miss blessington sees three horses that look unnaturally tall and depressingly cheerful issue through the great folding - doors that open into [the stable - yard]3877-the stable - yard . "[1206-you] Oh , [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas ! it is a chesnut , is it ? Do n't [they]1207-they say that chesnuts always have very uncertain tempers ? Oh ! please — [I'm]1208-i'm rather frightened . [I]0-i think , if [you]238-sir thomas do n't mind , [I]0-i 'd almost as soon — " "[0-i] Fiddlesticks ! " answers [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas , roughly . "[0-i] Can not have [my]0-i horses saddled and unsaddled every half - hour because [you]238-sir thomas do n't know [your]238-sir thomas own mind . God bless [my]0-i soul , [child]3639-child ! Do n't look as if [you]238-sir thomas were going to be hanged ! Why , [you]238-sir thomas might ride [her]3639-child with a bit of worsted . Here , [Simpson]280-simpson , look sharp , and put [Miss Craven]164-st. john up . " After two abortive attempts , in the first of which [she]3639-child springs short , and glides ignobly to [earth]911-earth again , and in the second takes a bound that goes near to carrying [her]3639-child clean over [her]3639-child steed , after having given [Simpson]280-simpson a kick in the face , and torn a hole in [her]3639-child borrowed habit , [Miss Craven]164-st. john is at length settled in [her]164-st. john seat . It is a hot afternoon ; after all , [I]164-st. john think that miladi has the best of it , sitting in a garden - chair under a tulip tree , eating apricots . The deer , with dappled sides and heavy- horned heads , are herding about the rough , knotted feet of the great trees that stand here and there in [solitary kingship about [the park]3880-the park]3879-solitary kingship about the park . [They]1211-they spread [their]1211-they ancient , out - stretched arms between [earth and heaven]3881-earth and heaven , and [man]3613-man and beast rejoice in the shade thereof . The dust lies a hand - breadth thick upon [the road]3569-the road ; the nuts in the hedgerow , the half - ripe blackberries , the rag - wort in the grass — all merge their distinctive colours in one dirty - white mask . "[164-st. john] Is [she]3639-child going to kick , do [you]1210-you think ? " asks [Esther]148-esther , in a mysterious whisper of [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington , across [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas . "[3639-child] Does not it mean that when [they]1211-they put [their]1211-they ears back ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't think [you]1210-you need be alarmed , " answers [Constance]256-constance , with politely - veiled contempt ; "[0-i] it is only the flies that tease [her]3639-child . " The animal that inspires such alarm in [Esther]148-esther 's mind , is a slight , showy thing , nearly thoroughbred ; [a capital lady]3884-a capital lady 's park hack . It is quiet enough , only that the quietness of [a young , oats - fed mare]3885-a young , oats - fed mare , and of [an antediluvian Welsh pony blown out with grass]3886-an antediluvian welsh pony blown out with grass , are two different things . [She]3639-child is sidling along now , half across [the road]3569-the road , coquetting with [her]3639-child own shadow . "[0-i] Oh , [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas ! " ( in an agonised voice ) "[238-sir thomas] why does not [she]3639-child walk straight ? Why does [she]3639-child go like a crab ? " "[3639-child] Pooh ! " answers [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas , in [his]238-sir thomas hard , loud voice ; "[3639-child] it 's only play ! " "[3639-child] If [I]0-i 'm upset , [I]0-i do n't much care whether it is in play or earnest , " rejoins [Esther]148-esther , ruefully . The glare from [the road]3569-the road , the dust and the midges , make [people]3426-people keep [their]3426-people eyes closed as nearly as [they]3426-people can : so that it is not till [they]3426-people are close upon [him]238-sir thomas that [they]3426-people perceive that [the man who is dawdling along to meet [them]3426-people on a stout , grey cob , with [his]238-sir thomas hat and coat and whiskers nearly as white as [any miller]3891-any miller 's]3890-the man who is dawdling along to meet them on a stout , grey cob , with his hat and coat and whiskers nearly as white as any miller 's , is [St. John]164-st. john . [He]238-sir thomas looks rather annoyed at the rencontre . "[0-i] [I]0-i have been over to [Melford]48-melford , [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas , to see that pointer of [Burleigh]281-burleigh 's . It will not do at all ; it 's not half broken . " "[0-i] [You]0-i had better turn back with [us]1212-us , [St. John]164-st. john , " suggests [Constance]256-constance , graciously . "[164-st. john] No , thanks ; much too hot ! " "[164-st. john] Au revoir , then , " nodding [her]256-constance head and [her]256-constance tall hat , and about a million flies that are promenading on it , gracefully . [Esther]148-esther 's fears vanish . "[164-st. john] Three is no company , " [she]148-esther says in a low voice , and making rather a plaintive little face as [he]238-sir thomas passes [her]148-esther . Drawn by the magnet that has succeeded in drawing to itself most things that it wished — viz . , [a woman]553-a woman 's inviting eyes — [he]238-sir thomas turns the cob 's head sharp round . "[164-st. john] But four is , " [he]238-sir thomas answers , with an eager smile , putting [his]238-sir thomas horse alongside of [hers]148-esther . [She]148-esther was rather compunctious the moment [she]148-esther had said it . It is reversing the order of things — [the woman]3893-the woman after [the man]3894-the man ; "[164-st. john] the haystack after the cow ; " as [the homely old proverb]3895-the homely old proverb says . [The road]3569-the road is broad , and for a little while [they]3897-they all four jog on abreast , as in [a Roman chariot - race]3898-a roman chariot - race or a city omnibus — rather a dreary squadron . "[164-st. john] This is very dull , " thinks [Esther]148-esther . "[164-st. john] Oh ! if [I]0-i could lose [my]0-i handkerchief , or [my]0-i veil , or [my]0-i gloves ! Why can not [I]0-i drop [my]0-i whip ? " No sooner said than done . "[0-i] Oh ! [Mr. Gerard]247-mr. gerard , [I]0-i am so sorry , [I]0-i have dropped [my]0-i whip ! " [Mr. Gerard]247-mr. gerard , of course , dismounts and picks it up ; [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas and [[his]238-sir thomas ward]1111-his ward pass on . "[0-i] What a happy thought that was of [yours]247-mr. gerard ! " says [St. John]164-st. john , wiping the little delicate switch before giving it back to [her]0-i . "[0-i] Happy thought ! What do [you]247-mr. gerard mean ? " ( reddening ) . "[247-mr. gerard] Oh ! it was accident , was it ? [I]0-i quite thought [you]247-mr. gerard had dropped it on purpose , and was lost in admiration of [your]247-mr. gerard ingenuity . " [He]247-mr. gerard looks at [her]0-i searchingly as [he]247-mr. gerard speaks . "[0-i] [I]0-i did drop it on purpose , " [she]0-i answers , blushing painfully . "[0-i] Why do [you]247-mr. gerard make [me]0-i tell the truth , when [I]0-i did not mean to do so ? " "[247-mr. gerard] Do n't [you]247-mr. gerard always tell truth ? " ( a little anxiously ) , "[740-anybody] Does [anybody]740-anybody ? " "[740-anybody] [I]0-i hope so . [A few men]1214-a few men do , [I]0-i think . " "[0-i] As [I]0-i have no pretensions to being [a man]3402-a man , [you]247-mr. gerard can not be surprised that [my]0-i veracity is not [my]0-i strongest point . " "[247-mr. gerard] [You]247-mr. gerard are only joking " ( looking at [her]0-i with uneasy intentness ) . "[247-mr. gerard] Please reassure [me]0-i , by saying that [you]247-mr. gerard do not tell any greater number of fibs than [every one]869-every one is compelled to contribute towards the carrying on of society . " "[247-mr. gerard] Perhaps [I]0-i do , and perhaps [I]0-i do not . " [He]1217-my papa looks only half - satisfied with this oracular evasion ; but does not press the point farther . "[0-i] It is not often that [[my]0-i papa]1217-my papa and [I]0-i take the air together ; [we]1218-we think [we]1218-we have almost enough of each other 's society in - doors . " "[1217-my papa] [He]1217-my papa is [[your]247-mr. gerard father]1219-your father , " says [Esther]148-esther , rather snappishly ; a little out of humour with [him]1217-my papa for having put [her]148-esther out of conceit with [herself]148-esther . "[1217-my papa] [I]0-i never could see what claim to respect that was , " answers [he]1217-my papa , gravely ; "[1217-my papa] on the contrary [I]0-i think that [[one]559-one 's parents]1221-one 's parents ought to apologise to [one]559-one for bringing [one]559-one , without asking [one]559-one 's leave , into such [a disagreeable place]1225-a disagreeable place as [this world]549-this world is . " "[0-i] Disagreeable ! " cries [Esther]148-esther , turning [her]148-esther eyes , broad open , in childish wonder upon [him]1217-my papa . "[0-i] Disagreeable to [you]0-i ! Young and — " "[0-i] Beautiful , were [you]0-i going to say ? " "[0-i] No , certainly not — and with plenty of money to make it pleasant ? " "[0-i] But [I]0-i have not plenty of money . [I]0-i shall have , probably , when [I]0-i 'm too old to care about it ! [he]1227-he is good for thirty years more , [you]0-i know , " nodding respectfully at [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas 's broad , blue back . "[1227-he] It must be tiring , waiting for [dead men]1228-dead men 's shoes , " says [Esther]148-esther , a little sardonically . "[0-i] Tiring ! [I]0-i believe [you]0-i , " says [St. John]164-st. john , energetically ; "[0-i] it is worse than tiring — it is degrading . Do [you]0-i suppose [I]0-i do not think [my]0-i own life quite as contemptible as [you]0-i can ? Take [my]0-i word for it " ( emphasising every syllable ) , "[0-i] there is [no class of men in [England]13-england]1229-no class of men in england so much to be pitied as [heirs to properties]1230-heirs to properties . [We]1231-we can not dig ; to beg [we]1231-we are ashamed . " "[0-i] [I]0-i never was heir to anything , so [I]0-i can not tell . " "[0-i] [I]0-i should have been [a happier fellow]1232-a happier fellow , and worth something then , perhaps , if [I]0-i had been [[somebody]1233-somebody 's tenth son]1234-somebody 's tenth son , and had had to earn [my]0-i bread quill - driving , or soap - boiling , or sawbones - ing . [I]0-i think [I]0-i see [myself]0-i pounding away at a pestle and mortar in the surgery"(laughing ) . "[0-i] [I]0-i should have had a chance , then , of being liked for [myself]0-i too , even if [I]0-i did smell rather of pills and plaister ; whereas now , if [anybody]740-anybody looks pleasant at [me]0-i , or says anything civil to [me]0-i , [I]0-i always think it is for love of [Felton]44-felton , not of [me]0-i . " "[44-felton] " [You]0-i should go about incognito , like [the Lord of Burleigh]281-burleigh . "[1236-her] " [He]281-burleigh was but [a landscape painter]3900-a landscape painter , [you]0-i know . Do [you]0-i know that once , not a very many years ago , [I]44-felton had a ridiculous notion in [my]44-felton head that [one]559-one ought to try and do some little good in [the world]672-the world ? Thanks to [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas 's assistance and example , [I]44-felton have very nearly succeeded in getting rid of that chimera . If [I]44-felton am asked at the Last Day how [I]44-felton have spent [my]44-felton life , [I]44-felton can say , [I]44-felton have shot a few bears in [Norway]49-norway , and a good many turkeys and grebe in [Albania]50-albania ; [I]44-felton have killed several salmon in [Connemara]51-connemara : [I]44-felton have made a fool of [myself]44-felton once , and a beast of [myself]44-felton many times . "[44-felton] " How did [you]44-felton make a fool of [yourself]44-felton ? "[44-felton] pricking up [her]1236-her ears . " Oh ! never mind ; it is a stupid story without any point , and [I]44-felton have not quite come to the pitch of dotage of telling senile anecdotes about [myself]44-felton . Here , let [us]3903-we turn in at this gate , and take a cut across [the park]3880-the park : it is cooler , and [we]3903-we can have a nice gallop under the trees , without coming in for the full legacy of [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas 's and [Conny]256-constance 's dust , as [we]3903-we are doing now . "[44-felton] " But — but — is not it rather dangerous ? "[148-esther] objects [Esther]148-esther , demurring . " Do n't [they]1240-the riders sometimes put [their]1240-the riders feet into rabbit - holes , and tumble down and break [their]1240-the riders legs ? "[148-esther] " Frequently , [I]164-st. john may almost say invariably , "[164-st. john] answers [St. John]164-st. john , laughing , and opening the gate with the handle of [his]1237-his whip . The soft , springy , green turf is certainly pleasanter than [the hard , whity - brown turnpike road]1238-the hard , whity - brown turnpike road , and so the horses think as [they]1239-they break into a brisk canter . The quick air freshens [the riders]1240-the riders ' faces — comes to [them]1240-the riders like comfortable words from Heaven to a soul in Purgatory — as [they]1240-the riders dash along under the trees , stooping [their]1240-the riders heads every now and then to avoid coming into contact with the great , low - spreading boughs . Laughing , flushed , half - fright , half - enjoyment : " [She]1241-she looked so lovely as [she]1241-she swayedThe rein with dainty finger - tips ; [A man]3402-a man had given all other bliss , And all [his]3402-a man worldly worth for this — To waste [his]3402-a man whole heart in one kissUpon [her]1241-she perfect lips . "[891-no one] " [Delicious]283-delicious ! [I]1241-she 'm not a bit afraid now ; [I]1241-she bid defiance to [the rabbit - holes]3906-the rabbit - holes , "[1241-she] [she]1241-she cries , with little breathless pauses between the words . Let [no one]891-no one shout before [they]1240-the riders are out of the wood . Hardly have the words left [her]1241-she mouth , when all at once , at [their]1240-the riders very feet almost , from among the seven - foot - high fern , where [they]1240-the riders have been crouching , rise a score of deer with sudden rustling ; and , [their]1240-the riders slender knees bent , spring away with speedy grace through [the mimic forest]1243-the mimic forest . [[Esther]148-esther 's mare]1244-esther 's mare , frightened at the sudden apparition ( many horses are afraid of deer ) , swerves violently to the left ; then gets [her]1244-esther 's mare head down , and sets to kicking as if [she]1244-esther 's mare would kick [herself]1244-esther 's mare out of [her]1244-esther 's mare skin . " Mind ! Take care ! Hold tight ! Keep [her]1244-esther 's mare head up ! "[164-st. john] shouts [St. John]164-st. john , in an agony . Next moment [the chesnut , with head in the air , nostrils extended , and bridle swinging to and ) fro]1245-the chesnut , with head in the air , nostrils extended , and bridle swinging to and ) fro against [her]1245-the chesnut , with head in the air , nostrils extended , and bridle swinging to and ) fro fore legs , tears riderless past [him]1246-i . In a second [he]1246-i is off , and at the side of the heap of blue cloth that is lying motionless among the buttercups . " [I]1246-i 'm not dead , "[1246-i] says the heap , raising itself , and smiling rather a difficult smile up at [him]1246-i , as [he]1246-i leans over it or [her]1247-her , [his]1246-i burnt face whitened with extremest fear . " Do n't look so frightened ! "[1246-i] " Thank [God]435-god ! "[1246-i] [he]1246-i says , hardly above [his]1246-i breath , and more devoutly than [he]1246-i is in the habit of saying [his]1246-i prayers . "[1246-i] " [I]180-essie must be tied on next time , must n't [I]180-essie ? "[180-essie] " Quite ! "[164-st. john] acquiesces [St. John]164-st. john , laughing heartily in [his]1246-i intense relief . " And [you]164-st. john are quite sure [you]164-st. john are not hurt ? "[164-st. john] " Quite ! "[180-essie] " Really ? "[180-essie] " Really ! "[164-st. john] To prove how perfectly intact [she]180-essie is , [she]180-essie jumps up ; but , as [she]180-essie does so , [her]180-essie face grows slightly distorted with a look of pain , and [she]180-essie sinks back on [her]180-essie buttercup bed . " Not quite sure , either ; [I]180-essie seem to have done something stupid to [my]180-essie foot — turned it or twisted it . "[180-essie] So saying , [she]180-essie thrusts out from under [her]180-essie habit a small foot . It is a small — a very small — foot ; but the boot in which it is cased is country made , and about three times too big for it ; so that it might rattle in it , like a pea in a drum . Even at this affecting moment [St. John]164-st. john can not repress a slight feeling of disappointment . " [I]1246-i 'm awfully sorry ! Whereabouts does it hurt ? There ? "[1246-i] putting [his]1246-i fingers gently on the slender , rounded ankle . " Yes , a little . "[1246-i] " [I]1248-i 'm awfully sorry ! "[1248-i] ( [You]1248-i see there is not much variety in [his]1246-i laments . ) " What can [I]1248-i do for it ? gallop [home]701-home as hard as [I]1248-i can , and make [them]3908-them send [the carriage]3788-the carriage ? " [Brute]285-brute ! [she]3915-her is as cunning as [Old Nick]214-colin ! "[164-st. john] " Not if there are no horses within reach , "[1249-she] [she]1249-she answers , with an innocent smile , which [he]1250-he carries away with [him]1250-he through the sunshine and the fern and the grass . [Essie]180-essie spends full half an hour pushing out , pinching in , smoothing and stroking [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington 's caved - in hat ; full a quarter of an hour in picking every grass and sedge and oxeye that grew within reach of [her]180-essie destroying arm ; and full another quarter in thinking what [a pleasant , manly , straightforward face]1251-a pleasant , manly , straightforward face [St. John]164-st. john 's is — what a thoroughly terrified face it looked when [she]1249-she met it within an inch of [her]1249-she own nose after [her]1249-she disgraceful bouleversement — what a much better height five feet ten is for all practical purposes than six feet four . At the end of the fourth quarter [Mr. Gerard]247-mr. gerard returns , with a fire hardly inferior to [St. Anthony]286-st. anthony 's in [his]247-mr. gerard face ; with [his]247-mr. gerard hair cleaving damply to [his]247-mr. gerard brows , and without the mare . " Would not let [me]286-st. anthony get within half a mile of [her]1249-she ! far too knowing ! [Brute]285-brute ! and now [she]1249-she 'll be sure to go and knock the saddle to pieces , and then there 'll be the devil to pay ! "[286-st. anthony] " [I]148-esther 'm so sorry , "[148-esther] says [Esther]148-esther , looking up sympathisingly , with [her]148-esther lap full of decapitated oxeyes . " So am [I]148-esther , for [your]247-mr. gerard sake : [you]247-mr. gerard 'll have to ride [the cob]3918-the cob [home]701-home . "[148-esther] " [I]148-esther shall have to turn into [a man]3402-a man , then , "[148-esther] [she]148-esther says , glancing rather doubtfully at the male saddle . " No , [you]247-mr. gerard wo n't , "[148-esther] ( laughing ) . [He]247-mr. gerard rises , and unfastens the cob from the tree - branch to which [he]247-mr. gerard has been tied . [He]247-mr. gerard has been indulging a naturally greedy disposition — biting off leaves and eating them — until [he]247-mr. gerard has made [his]247-mr. gerard bit and [his]247-mr. gerard mouth as green as green peas . " [You]1252-his companion must let [me]247-mr. gerard put [you]1252-his companion up , [I]247-mr. gerard think , "[247-mr. gerard] says [Gerard]247-mr. gerard bending down and looking into [[his]247-mr. gerard companion]1252-his companion 's great , sweet eyes , under the rim of [her]1252-his companion battered , intoxicating - looking hat . " Must [I]247-mr. gerard ? "[247-mr. gerard] ( lowering [her]1252-his companion eyelids shyly . ) " Yes ; do [you]1252-his companion mind much ? "[247-mr. gerard] " No — o. "[247-mr. gerard] [He]247-mr. gerard stoops and lifts [her]1252-his companion gently . [He]247-mr. gerard is not [a Samson]1253-a samson or [a prize - fighter]1254-a prize - fighter , and [well grown young women of seventeen]1255-well grown young women of seventeen are not generally feather - weights ; but yet it seems to [him]247-mr. gerard that the second occupied in raising [her]1252-his companion from the ground and placing [her]1252-his companion in the saddle was shorter than other seconds . [A man]3402-a man 's arms are not sticks or bits of iron , that they can hold [a beautiful woman]1257-a beautiful woman without feeling it . [St. John]164-st. john 's blood is giving little quick throbs of pleasure . [His]247-mr. gerard arms seem to feel the pressure of that pleasant burden long after [they]1258-they have been emptied of it . " [I]247-mr. gerard think [you]1252-his companion must let [me]247-mr. gerard hold [you]1252-his companion , "[247-mr. gerard] [he]247-mr. gerard says , gently and very respectfully passing [his]247-mr. gerard arm round [her]1252-his companion waist . " No , no ! "[1252-his companion] [she]1252-his companion cries , hastily , pulling [herself]1252-his companion away—"no need!—no need at all ! [I]1252-his companion shall not fall . "[1252-his companion] [She]1252-his companion feels an overpowering shrinking from the enforced , unavoidable familiarity . It does not arise from any distaste for [St. John]164-st. john certainly , nor yet from any quixotic loyalty to [Bob]190-bob ; it springs from a new , unknown , uncomprehended shyness . " Very well , "[247-mr. gerard] [he]247-mr. gerard answers , quietly , releasing [her]1252-his companion instantly , and taking the bridle in [his]247-mr. gerard hand . " But [I]247-mr. gerard 'm afraid [you]1252-his companion will find that [you]1252-his companion are mistaken . "[247-mr. gerard] [They]1259-they set forward across [the park]3880-the park , at a foot 's pace and in silence . [Esther]148-esther twists [her]148-esther hands in the cob 's mane , and tries to persuade [herself]148-esther that pommelless pigskin does not make a slippery seat . Every two paces [she]148-esther slides down an inch or so , and then recovers [herself]148-esther with an awkward jerk . The sun is hot . Now and then , as [the cob]3918-the cob puts [his]247-mr. gerard foot on [a mole - hill]1262-a mole - hill , or some other slight inequality in the ground , [her]148-esther ankle bumps against the saddle - flap . [She]148-esther feels turning giddy and sick with the heat and the pain . " [Mr. Gerard]247-mr. gerard ! [Mr. Gerard]247-mr. gerard ! [I]148-esther 'm falling ! "[148-esther] [she]148-esther calls out loud , stretching out [her]148-esther arms to [him]247-mr. gerard , and clutching hold of [his]247-mr. gerard shoulder with a violence and tenacity that [she]148-esther [herself]148-esther is not in the least aware of . [He]247-mr. gerard is magnanimous . [He]247-mr. gerard does not exult over [her]148-esther ; [he]247-mr. gerard does not say , " [I]247-mr. gerard knew how it would be ; [I]247-mr. gerard told [you]148-esther so ! "[247-mr. gerard] [He]247-mr. gerard only says , in a kind , anxious voice , and plainlier still with kind , anxious eyes , " [I]247-mr. gerard 'm afraid [you]148-esther are in great pain ? "[247-mr. gerard] and replaces the rejected arm in its former obnoxious position . As [they]1263-they enter [the lodge]1264-the lodge gate , [they]1263-they see [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas and [[his]238-sir thomas ward]1111-his ward advancing down [the avenue]1266-the avenue towards [them]1263-they . [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington is a great favourite of [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas 's . [She]258-miss blessington is good to look at , and hardly ever speaks ; or , if [she]258-miss blessington does , it is only to say , " Yea , yea , and Nay , nay . "[258-miss blessington] " Now for an exchange of civilities , "[258-miss blessington] says [Gerard]258-miss blessington , rather bitterly ; " even at this distance [I]258-miss blessington can see [him]238-sir thomas getting the steam up . "[258-miss blessington] " [Miss Craven]164-st. john has had a fall , [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas , and hurt [herself]164-st. john , "[238-sir thomas] [he]238-sir thomas remarks , explanatorily , as soon as [the two parties]1267-the two parties come within speaking distance . " Broken [the mare]3921-the mare 's knees , [I]238-sir thomas suppose ? "[238-sir thomas] cries [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas , loudly , taking no notice whatever of [Miss Craven]164-st. john 's casualties . " [Some fool]3922-some fool 's play , of course ; larking over the palings , [I]238-sir thomas dare say . Well , [sir]3823-sir , what have [you]3823-sir done with [her]3921-the mare ? where have [you]3823-sir left [her]3921-the mare ? out with it ! "[238-sir thomas] ( lashing [himself]238-sir thomas up into an irrational turkeycock fury . ) " Damn the mare ! "[164-st. john] answered [St. John]164-st. john in a rage , growing rather white , and forgetting [his]238-sir thomas manners . [St. John]164-st. john 's rages , when [he]238-sir thomas does get into them , which is not very often , are far worse ones than [[his]238-sir thomas papa]1268-his papa 's , and so [the latter]1099-the latter knows , and is cowed by the first symptoms of the approach of [one]559-one . [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington looks up shocked . [This jeune personne bien élevée]1271-this jeune personne bien élevée always is shocked at whatever [people]3426-people ought to be shocked at — [Colenso]287-colenso , [Swinburne , skittles]1273-swinburne , skittles , & c. " [You]238-sir thomas are not much hurt , really , [I]258-miss blessington hope ? "[258-miss blessington] [she]258-miss blessington says , suavely , walking along beside [Esther]148-esther , while [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas and [[his]238-sir thomas heir]1274-his heir wrangle in the background . " Which way did [you]238-sir thomas come , and what has become of [your]238-sir thomas horse ? "[258-miss blessington] " [We]3924-we came through [the park]3880-the park , "[148-esther] answers [Esther]148-esther , holding on by [her]148-esther eyelids to the cob 's slippery back ; " so [I]148-esther suppose the horse is there still . [Mr. Gerard]247-mr. gerard tried to catch it , and could not . "[148-esther] " Through [the park]3880-the park ! "[258-miss blessington] repeats [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington , with a slight smile of superior intelligence . " Oh ! [I]258-miss blessington see ; a short cut [home]701-home ! [Poor St. John]288-poor st. john has such a horror of taking a ride for riding 's sake , that [he]288-poor st. john always tries to shorten [his]288-poor st. john penance as much as possible ! "[258-miss blessington] IT is the 1st of September , and the seal of impending destruction is set upon many a little plump brown bird ; but ignorance is bliss , and the little brown birds do not know it , and are walking about [the turnip ridges]1275-the turnip ridges and amongst [the stubble fields]1276-the stubble fields as confidently as if there were [no such man]1277-no such man as [Purdey]289-purdey , and no such infernal machine as a gun . [St. John]288-poor st. john and [[his]288-poor st. john papa]1268-his papa go out shooting together . [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas knocks up by luncheon time , and returns to [[his]238-sir thomas orchid - house]1279-his orchid - house , and to the goading [the bricklayers]3867-the bricklayers , as [King Agamemnon]290-king agamemnon did [[his]290-king agamemnon fellow - chiefs]1281-his fellow - chiefs , with bitter words . [Esther]148-esther spends the day in [[her]148-esther bedroom]1282-her bedroom , lying in state on a sofa with [her]148-esther ankle bandaged up . It hurts [her]148-esther acutely if [she]148-esther attempts to walk on it ; but if [she]148-esther keeps quiet , [she]148-esther is hardly aware of there being anything wrong with it . It is very annoying having to play [the invalid]1283-the invalid for an ailment that is purely local when [you]1284-you feel in riotous health and spirits — to have [your]1284-you dinner sent up to [you]1284-you on a tray when [you]1284-you are so hungry that [you]1284-you could eat double [your]1284-you allotted portion , if it were not that , being [an invalid]1285-an invalid , [you]1284-you are ashamed to say so . [One]559-one has a sense of shamming , malingering . Poor [Miss Craven]164-st. john passes a very dull day ; the red rose on one side the window , and [the travellers]1287-the travellers ' joy on the other , look in and say , " Why is [this lazy child lying all day on a couch]3928-this lazy child lying all day on a couch , when [we]3929-we and so many other flowers have been calling to [her]3928-this lazy child lying all day on a couch with [our]3929-we voiceless voices to come out into the breeze and shine "[1287-the travellers] A bee comes in sometimes , and goes buzz - buzzing about , telling [himself]1288-he how busy [he]1288-he is , and that [he]1288-he has no time to waste now that [his]1288-he honey - harvest is drawing so near to its sweet close . [The room]3629-the room is so still that , but for feeling intensely alive , and not having [her]164-st. john chin tied up , [Esther]148-esther might almost imagine [herself]164-st. john laid out previous to [her]164-st. john interment . Now and again [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington enters noiselessly , says " [I]258-miss blessington hope [you]148-esther are feeling a little easier , "[258-miss blessington] in [her]258-miss blessington soft monotone , and then rustles gently away again . [She]258-miss blessington has provided [Esther]148-esther with a novel and a book of acrostics , and thinks [she]148-esther has done [her]148-esther duty by [[her]148-esther neighbour]1116-her neighbour amply . The novel is one written with a purpose ; a dull one - sided tilt against Ritualism . [Esther]148-esther never found out an acrostic in [her]148-esther life , and has seldom been so completely vacant of employment as to try . [She]148-esther is , therefore , reduced to spending half the day in writing to [Bob]190-bob — half the day ! and yet when the letter is finished it only covers three sides of a sheet . [She]148-esther has written , rewritten , and re - rewritten it . All around and about [her]148-esther lie half - covered , quarter - covered , whole - covered sheets , all stamped with the seal of condemnation . [Gerard]258-miss blessington is the stumbling block ; [his]190-bob name either will not come in at all , which looks unnatural , or else insists on thrusting itself in every second line . This is the form in which [Miss Craven]164-st. john 's billetdoux finally presents itself at [Plas Berwyn]38-plas berwyn : " [DEAR BOB,—Thanks]3930-dear bob,—thanks very much for [your]3930-dear bob,—thanks letter ; please put a few stops next time . [I]1291-i had a very disagreeable journey here — bushels of dust and [a sick baby]3931-a sick baby . This is [a very handsome place]3932-a very handsome place , and [they]3933-they are all very kind to [me]1291-i . ( H'm ! are [they]3933-they ? [I]1291-i do n't know about that ; one of [them]3933-they , is . ) Yesterday [I]1291-i went out riding with [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas and [[his]238-sir thomas ward]1111-his ward ( so [I]1291-i did ; [I]1291-i set out with [them]3933-they ) , and [I]1291-i stupidly fell from [my]1291-i horse , a sort of thing that nobody but [I]1291-i would have done , and hurt [my]1291-i foot a little ; but nothing to speak of . [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington , [the ward]3935-the ward , is remarkably handsome , but looks a great deal older than [I]1291-i do . [My]1291-i love to [[your]1291-i mother]3422-your mother , and thanks for [her]3422-your mother kind messages ; the same to [the girls]906-the girls . Tell [Bessy]202-bessy that it is hardly worth while sending [me]1291-i ' The Sinfulness of Little Sins , ' as [I]1291-i shall have more time for reading when [I]1291-i get [home]701-home again . "[1291-i] [Yours]1291-i affectionately , " E. C. "[1291-i] P.S. — [Mr. Gerard]247-mr. gerard is not at all good - looking ; [he]247-mr. gerard seems very fond of shooting ; [he]247-mr. gerard has been out all to - day . " "[247-mr. gerard] The long day wanes : the slow moon climbs . " Dinner is over ; nothing to look forward to but bed - time . Yah ! How dull ! A knock comes at the door . [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington enters with flowers in [her]258-miss blessington hand — jessamine , heliotrope , everything that smells sweetly and not heavily — unlike [Bob]190-bob 's well meaning but annihilating double stocks . "[247-mr. gerard] [I]0-i hope [you]1291-i are in less pain now " ( the usual formula , that comes as regularly and frequently as the doxology in [church]3708-church ) . "[247-mr. gerard] Oh yes ! thanks ; [I]0-i 'm very well " ( yawning and looking woefully bored . ) "[0-i] What lovely flowers ! " ( with animation , the bored look vanishing . ) "[247-mr. gerard] How very kind of [him]247-mr. gerard ! " "[247-mr. gerard] [He]247-mr. gerard always is so good - natured , " answers [Constance]256-constance , with a cold generality . [Constance]256-constance sweeps to the window , slightly discomfited . " [she]0-i says , in a somewhat constrained voice ; "[247-mr. gerard] but [I]0-i daresay [you]1291-i would rather be left in peace up here ; and [I]0-i should think that the quieter [you]1291-i kept [your]1291-i foot the better for it . " "[0-i] On the contrary , [I]0-i should like it of all things , " cries [Essie]180-essie , with perverse alacrity . "[0-i] In [your]1291-i cheerful company [downstairs]1293-downstairs , [I]0-i shall be more likely to forget [my]0-i sufferings , such as they are , than all by [my]0-i dull self up here ; to tell the truth , [I]0-i was meditating asking [[your]1291-i maid]3789-your maid to come and talk to [me]0-i about haberdashery . " Outside [Miss Craven]164-st. john 's door [St. John]164-st. john pauses , as one that is devout hesitates on the threshold of [a sanctuary]3940-a sanctuary . Chintz curtains rose - lined , white - dressed toilet - table , simple valueless ornaments lying about , two little slippers , that look as if they had been just kicked off — [his]1291-i eye takes in all the details . [He]1291-i feels like [Faust]291-faust in [[Marguerite]292-marguerite 's chamber]3941-marguerite 's chamber . And [Marguerite]292-marguerite [herself]292-marguerite , lying careless , restful on [her]292-marguerite couch , [her]292-marguerite two arms flung lazily upwards and backwards , to make a resting - place for [her]292-marguerite head ; the smooth elbows and shoulders gleaming warm , cream - white , through the colder blue - white of [her]292-marguerite dress ; and the up - looking face , childish in its roundness , and blooming down — but oh ! most womanish — in the shafts of quick fire that greet [him]1296-him from the laughing , sleepy eyes : Where did [she]292-marguerite learn that art of shooting ? From the pigs and cabbages at [Glan - yr - Afon]24-glan - yr - afon ? From [old Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon ? From [Miss Bessie]293-miss bessie ? " "[3426-people] Has [Miss Craven]164-st. john changed [her]164-st. john mind , [St. John]164-st. john ? " asks [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington from the doorway . " [He]3943-he stoops , and lifts [her]164-st. john carefully , as a thing most precious ; as [he]3943-he does so , a little foolish trembling passes over [her]164-st. john , as a baby - breeze passes over some still pool 's breast , hardly troubling the sky and the trees that lie far down in the blue mirror . Down the grand staircase [he]3943-he bears [her]164-st. john , and [Constance]256-constance follows to see that there is no loitering by the way . [The morning - room at [Felton]44-felton]3944-the morning - room at felton ( so called because [the family]3846-the family always sit there in the evenings ) is very lofty . [You]3946-you have to crane [your]3946-you neck up to see the stucco stalactites , faintly imitative of [Staffa]295-staffa and [Iona]296-iona , pendant from the ceiling . There are statuettes in plenty standing about in niches and on pedestals . [Venuses]297-venuses and [Minervas]298-minervas and [Clyties]299-clyties , all with [their]3947-their hair very elaborately dressed , and not a stitch of clothes on . There is a great litter of papers and magazines on the round table : [the Justice of the Peace]3948-the justice of the peace , that is [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas 's ; [the Field]3949-the field , that is [St. John]164-st. john 's ; [the Cornhill]3950-the cornhill , that is [everybody]3709-everybody 's . [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas and [miladi]3952-miladi are playing backgammon ; [miladi]278-miladi is compelled to do so every night as a penance for [her]278-miladi sins — four rubbers , and if [he]3952-miladi wins , as [she]278-miladi prays and endeavours that [he]3952-miladi may , five . "[164-st. john] Do n't take the dice up in such a hurry , [miladi]3952-miladi , " [he]3952-miladi says , snappishly ; "[3952-miladi] how [the deuce]1310-the deuce can [I]0-i see what [your]3952-miladi throw is ? " "[164-st. john] Seizes , [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas , " responds [miladi]278-miladi , meekly . "[238-sir thomas] Seizes ! do n't believe a word of it ! much more like seize ace ! " [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington , dressed by [Elise]300-elise in Chambéry gauze , and by Nature in [her]258-miss blessington usual panoply of beautiful stupidity , which [she]258-miss blessington wears sleeping and waking , at [home]701-home and abroad , living and dying , is at work at a little table , [a nude Dian , with cold , chaste smile and crinkly hair]3954-a nude dian , with cold , chaste smile and crinkly hair , on a red velvet shrine just above [her]258-miss blessington head . [Shams , Flunkeyism]301-shams , flunkeyism , [Woman]3638-woman 's Rights , [Dr. Cumming]302-dr. cumming , [the Girl of the Period]3956-the girl of the period — they have all been passing through [his]238-sir thomas eye into [his]238-sir thomas brain , and , mixed with [Esther Craven]148-esther , make a fine jumble there . [St. John]164-st. john has been rather unlucky in [his]238-sir thomas experiences of [women]547-women hitherto . [He]238-sir thomas has got rather into the habit of thinking that [all good women]3958-all good women must be stupid , and that [all pleasant women]3959-all pleasant women must be bad . [Esther]148-esther is not stupid . Is [she]148-esther bad , then ? Those glances of [hers]148-esther , [they]3960-they give [a man]3402-a man odd sensations about the midriff ; they inspire in [him]3402-a man a greedy , covetous desire for more of [them]3960-they ; but are [they]3960-they such as [Una]303-una would have given [her]303-una [Red Cross Knight]53-red cross knight ? Are [they]3960-they such as [a man]3402-a man would like to see [[his]3402-a man wife]542-his wife bestow on [[his]3402-a man men friends]3964-his men friends ? The wilder [a man]3402-a man is or has been [himself]3402-a man , the more scrupulously fastidious [he]3402-a man is about the almost prudish nicety of [the women that belong to [him]3402-a man]3966-the women that belong to him . [He]3402-a man likes to see the sheep and the goats as plainly , widely separated as [they]3960-they are in the parable ; it moves [him]3402-a man to deep wrath when [he]3402-a man sees [a good woman]3967-a good woman faintly , poorly imitating [a bad one]3968-a bad one . [I]1312-they do not think that [good women]3969-good women believe this half generally enough ; or , if [they]1312-they do , [they]1312-they do not act upon it . " "[256-constance] Does [she]3406-my mother live [here]3398-here always ? " "[3406-my mother] Always . " "[3406-my mother] Wrong , but pleasant , as the monkey said when [he]1318-he kissed the cat , " remarks [Esther]148-esther , flippantly . "[1318-he] [You]238-sir thomas are very fond of [her]3406-my mother , [I]0-i suppose ? " "[3406-my mother] H'm ! " shrugging [his]238-sir thomas shoulders . [I]0-i never should have grown fond of a spider , though ; [they]1320-they have got such a monstrous lot of long legs ; but the principle is the same . " "[238-sir thomas] Why are not [you]238-sir thomas fond of [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas then ? " "[1321-we] [We]1321-we 'll have another rubber , [miladi]3952-miladi ? " [Poor miladi]278-miladi , strangling a gigantic yawn , begins to set [[her]278-miladi men]3970-her men again ; [she]278-miladi had hoped that [her]278-miladi punishment was ended for the night , and that [she]278-miladi might be dismissed to the otium cum dignitate of [her]278-miladi armchair and nap . [St. John]164-st. john jumps up and walks over to [the players]3971-the players ; there are few things in life [he]238-sir thomas hates so much as playing backgammon with [[his]238-sir thomas father]1115-his father , but [he]238-sir thomas hates seeing [[his]238-sir thomas mother]3479-his mother bullied even more . If [a man]3402-a man is cursed with a necessity foi loving something , the chances are that [he]3402-a man will love [[his]3402-a man mother]3479-his mother , even if [she]3406-my mother bear more resemblance to a porpoise than to [a Christian lady]3976-a christian lady . "[0-i] [I]0-i 'll have a rubber with [you]0-i , [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas ; [[my]0-i mother]3406-my mother is tired . " "[3406-my mother] Fiddlesticks ! " growls [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas . "[3406-my mother] Tired ! what the devil has [she]3406-my mother been doing to tire herself?—fiddle - faddled about [the garden]846-the garden , picking off half a dozen dead roses . Very good thing for [her]3406-my mother if [she]3406-my mother is . " But [the man]3894-the man 's will is stronger than the turkey - cock 's , and the latter yields . A SPRAINED ankle takes mostly a tedious weary time in getting mended . [Esther]148-esther 's , however , is but a slight sprain , and entails only a week 's lying on a thoroughly comfortable , well - stuffed sofa close to one of [the library]1101-the library 's windows , where mignonette ends up continual presents of the strongest and sweetest of all flower - perfumes to [her]3406-my mother grateful nostrils — entails also being made a fuss with . If [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington had had [her]258-miss blessington will , the sofa would have been [upstairs]3979-upstairs , and the being made a fuss with , save by [[a compassionate lady]3980-a compassionate lady 's maid]3981-a compassionate lady 's maid , dispensed with . [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington desires sincerely , in [her]258-miss blessington affectionate solicitude for [her]258-miss blessington welfare , to keep [the young patient]3982-the young patient in a graceful and pleasing solitude [upstairs]3979-upstairs . [The young patient , being of a gregarious turn of mind]3984-the young patient , being of a gregarious turn of mind , desires sincerely to be brought down : and [the son of [the house]687-the house]3985-the son of the house , although not particularly young , and in general not particularly gregarious , desires sincerely to bring [her]164-st. john down . It is a case of Pull , [Devil]304-devil ; Pull , [Baker!—Baker]3987-baker!—baker being represented by [Constance]256-constance , Devil by [St. John]164-st. john and [Esther]148-esther . But two pull stronger than one , and [they]3988-they gain [their]3988-they point . "[3406-my mother] Is [Miss Craven]164-st. john ready to come down ? " asks [St. John]164-st. john , one morning , addressing the question to [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington as [they]3988-they stand together after breakfast . "[164-st. john] [I]0-i do n't know , [I]0-i 'm sure . [St. John]164-st. john ? " "[164-st. john] Well ! " "[3406-my mother] If , " [she]0-i says , giving a little factitious cough , and speaking with [her]0-i usual amiable smile , "[3406-my mother] it is any object to [Miss Craven]164-st. john to get well — " "[0-i] [I]0-i should imagine that there could be no doubt on that point , " [he]3989-he answers , picking up [the Pall Mall]3990-the pall mall . "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't know , " [she]0-i rejoins , with a certain air of doubtful reserve . "[0-i] It is generally considered pleasanter to have two legs to go upon than one , is n't it ? It is not many people that , like [Cleopatra]305-cleopatra , can ' hop forty paces through [the public streets]1325-the public streets . ' Have [you]0-i any reason for imputing to [Miss Craven]164-st. john a morbid taste for invalidhood ? " "[0-i] No ; but [she]164-st. john is hardly [an invalid]1285-an invalid , and to be made so much of as [you]0-i , with [your]0-i usual good - nature to the waifs and strays of [humanity]1327-humanity , make of [her]164-st. john , must be a sensation as pleasant as novel . " "[0-i] [I]0-i am wonderfully good - natured , are n't [I]0-i ? " [he]3991-he says , laughing broadly to [himself]3991-he behind the little yellowy sheets of [the Pall Mall]3990-the pall mall . "[0-i] There is [not one man in a hundred that , in [my]0-i place]1328-not one man in a hundred that , in my place , would do the same , is there ? " [She]164-st. john is silent ; the resentment of a slow nature , that has a suspicion of being laughed at , but is not sure of it , smouldering within [her]164-st. john . "[164-st. john] Come , [Conny]256-constance , [you]256-constance began a sentence just now which [you]256-constance left unfinished , like a pig with one ear . ' If it is really an object to [Miss Craven]164-st. john to get well'—what then ? " "[164-st. john] If it is really an object to [Miss Craven]164-st. john to get well , [I]0-i should think that [she]164-st. john would be more likely to attain it by lying quietly [upstairs]3979-upstairs than by being continually moved from place to place ; that is what [I]0-i was going to say . " "[0-i] [I]0-i am sorry [you]256-constance think [me]0-i such [an Orson]1330-an orson as to rush up and [downstairs]1293-downstairs with such tremendous violence as to run the risk of dislocating [her]164-st. john limbs . " [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington turns away pettishly . "[0-i] [I]0-i wonder [the girl]682-the girl likes to give [you]256-constance the trouble of perpetually carrying [her]682-the girl about [the house]687-the house . " "[682-the girl] [She]682-the girl is well aware that trouble is a pleasure . " "[682-the girl] Fully half [her]682-the girl day is spent on the staircase and in the passages in [your]256-constance arms . " "[256-constance] What a horribly immoral picture — vice stalking rampant through [the Felton corridors]1334-the felton corridors in the shape of [me]0-i carrying [a poor lame child that can not carry [herself]682-the girl]1335-a poor lame child that can not carry herself ! " "[256-constance] It may be a pleasure to [you]256-constance , " says [Constance]256-constance , harking back to [her]256-constance former speech , "[256-constance] but it can hardly be so to [her]682-the girl — to be haled about like a bale of goods by [a total stranger like [yourself]256-constance]1336-a total stranger like yourself . If [you]256-constance were [[her]682-the girl brother]644-her brother , [I]0-i grant [you]256-constance , it would be different . " "[256-constance] If [I]0-i were [[her]682-the girl brother]644-her brother it would be different , " assents [Gerard]258-miss blessington , blandly . The sentence is [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington 's own , and yet , by fresh accentuation , it is made exactly to contradict itself . "[0-i] [You]256-constance mean it good - naturedly , [I]0-i do n't doubt , but [I]0-i am riot at all sure that it is not mistaken kindness . " "[0-i] That what is not mistaken kindness ? " "[0-i] [You]256-constance are very dull of comprehension this morning , [St. John]164-st. john . " "[164-st. john] [I]0-i always am at these untimely hours ; it requires the flame of evening to light up the torch of [my]0-i intellect . Be lenient to [my]0-i infirmities , and explain ; [I]0-i am all attention . " "[0-i] [My]0-i meaning is sufficiently clear , [I]0-i should imagine , " [she]0-i retorts , with lady - like , gentle exasperation . "[0-i] If [you]256-constance had left [the girl]682-the girl in [her]682-the girl original obscurity , it would have been all very well ; but to be taken up and dropped again — " "[256-constance] Like a hot chesnut ! " "[256-constance] Pshaw ! to be taken up and dropped again is hardly pleasant . " "[256-constance] Hardly . " "[256-constance] And when [you]256-constance drop [her]682-the girl — " "[256-constance] Literally or metaphorically?—on the stone floor , or out of the light of [my]0-i favour ? " "[256-constance] When [you]256-constance drop [her]682-the girl " ( disdaining to notice the interruption ) — "[256-constance] Well , what then ? " [he]3993-his says , laying down the paper , and turning [his]3993-his face , kindled by a certain honest self - contempt , towards her—"To[0-i] be dropped by [me]0-i ! what a prodigious calamity ! Hitherto , [Conny]256-constance , [your]256-constance sex has made , with regard to [me]0-i , more use of the active than the passive voice of the verb to drop . " "[256-constance] Nonsense ! " [she]682-the girl says , scornfully ; "[0-i] that is the pride that apes humility . Of course , so much notice as [you]256-constance lavish on [her]682-the girl is likely to turn the head of [a girl who has hitherto probably received no attentions more flattering than those of [some Welsh grazier]1341-some welsh grazier]1340-a girl who has hitherto probably received no attentions more flattering than those of some welsh grazier ; and when [you]256-constance drop [her]682-the girl — " "[256-constance] When [I]0-i drop [her]682-the girl , " [he]3993-his repeats , impatiently , tired of the subject , and of the repetition of the phrase — "[0-i] [she]682-the girl will be no worse off than [she]682-the girl was before that misfortune happened to [her]682-the girl . " So [Esther]148-esther lies all day long in lazy contentment upon the sofa , looking out at [the garden]846-the garden , and at the fountain where four bronze dolphins spout continual showers of spray in the autumn sunlight : dips into [Owen Meredith]306-owen meredith 's last poems ; peeps between the crisp uncut leaves of new magazine or novel ; and looks forward towards the ante - dinner hour , when [St. John]164-st. john will come in from the day 's amusement or occupation , and passive content will be exchanged for active enjoyment . [Esther]148-esther has , as [you]256-constance know , made but light of [her]148-esther accident in [her]148-esther letters to [[her]148-esther lover]683-her lover ; fearing lest , in [his]3993-his eager anxiety on [her]148-esther account , [he]3993-his might get into [the train]1069-the train , and give [her]148-esther the unexpected pleasure of seeing [him]3993-his arrive at [Felton]44-felton — seeing [him]3993-his arrive in [his]3993-his threadbare shooting jacket , through whose sleeves [he]3993-his always appears to have thrust [his]3993-his long arms too far , and [his]3993-his patched , creaking , Naullan boots . Imagine [St. John]164-st. john introduced to those boots ! A cold shiver runs down [her]148-esther spine at the bare idea . [St. John]164-st. john is [no dandy]3997-no dandy , it is true , but coats from [Poole]233-mr. poole 's are as much a matter of course to [him]3993-his as a knife and fork to eat [his]3993-his dinner with , or a bed to lie upon . On the afternoon of the day on which the above - reported short dialogue took place , [St. John]164-st. john and [[his]3993-his father]1115-his father , converging from different points of the compass to one centre , enter almost at the same moment [the library]1101-the library . [Two canary - coloured Colossi]307-two canary - coloured colossi have just deposited tea on a small table . [St. John]164-st. john has neither neckerchief nor collar ; [his]3993-his brown throat is bared in a négligé as becoming to [most men]885-most men as the à quatre épingles exctitude of [their]885-most men park get - up is unbecoming . [A man in the loose carelessness of [his]4001-a man in the loose carelessness of his every - day country clothes every - day country clothes]4001-a man in the loose carelessness of his every - day country clothes is [a man]3402-a man : in the prim tightness of [his]4001-a man in the loose carelessness of his every - day country clothes Pall Mall pltte [he]4001-a man in the loose carelessness of his every - day country clothes is [a little , stiff , jointless figure out of [Noah]308-noah 's ark]4003-a little , stiff , jointless figure out of noah 's ark . "[0-i] Slops again ! " says [Paterfamilias]309-paterfamilias , very gruffly . "[0-i] [I]0-i never come into [this room]1342-this room at any hour of the day or night without finding [[you]1343-you women]1344-you women drinking tea ! Why on earth , if [you]1343-you are thirsty , can not [you]1343-you drink beer or water , instead of ruining [your]1343-you insides with all that wash ? " At this courteous speech a silence falls on [the company]1130-the company . [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas mostly brings silence with [him]238-sir thomas ; [he]238-sir thomas is half- conscious that at [his]238-sir thomas entry voices are choked and laughter quenched , and it serves to exasperate [him]238-sir thomas the more . "[1343-you] [You]1343-you sit with [your]1343-you knees into the fire in [air - tight rooms]1345-air - tight rooms all day long , " pursues [he]238-sir thomas , in [his]238-sir thomas loud , hectoring voice , "[1343-you] and destroy [your]1343-you digestions with gallons of hot tea , and then [you]1343-you are surprised at having tallow in [your]1343-you cheeks , instead of lilies and roses , as [[your]1343-you grandmothers]1346-your grandmothers had ! " "[1343-you] Perhaps , " says [St. John]164-st. john , drily , "[1347-the ladies] [the ladies]1347-the ladies deny the justice of [your]1343-you conclusions , [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas ; perhaps [they]1347-the ladies do not own the soft impeachment of tallowy cheeks which [you]1343-you so gallantly ascribe to [them]1347-the ladies . " As [he]238-sir thomas speaks , [his]238-sir thomas eyes involuntarily rest on the clear , rose brilliance of [the young stranger]4005-the young stranger 's happy , beautiful child - face . ' " "[1349-you] [He]1349-you must have been [an ancestor of [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas 's in direct male line]1350-an ancestor of sir thomas 's in direct male line , must not [he]1349-you ? "[1349-you] What are [you]1349-you making , [Conny]256-constance ? " "[1349-you] Braces . " "[1349-you] For [me]0-i , no doubt ? Well , never mind ; though [I]0-i have made the discovery rather prematurely , [I]0-i 'll be as much surprised as ever when the day of presentation arrives . " "[1349-you] They are not for [you]1349-you , [St. John]164-st. john ; they are for [the bazaar]1351-the bazaar . " "[164-st. john] [The bazaar]1351-the bazaar ! " [he]1349-you repeats , little testily . " "[310-humbug] [Bazaar]54-bazaar ! [Humbug]310-humbug ! " growls [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas , rising and walking towards the door . "[310-humbug] A parcel of [idle women]1354-idle women getting together to sell trash and make asses of [themselves]1354-idle women ! " Then [he]1349-you goes out , and bangs the door . "[0-i] [I]0-i would not for worlds have given [him]1355-him the satisfaction of agreeing with [him]1355-him while [he]1355-him was in [the room]3629-the room , " says [St. John]164-st. john , insensibly speaking in a louder key now that [the autocrat before whom all voices sink]4008-the autocrat before whom all voices sink has removed [himself]0-i ; "[0-i] but , for once in [my]0-i life , [I]0-i must confess to coinciding in opinion with [aged P.]311-aged p. : to be pestered with unfeminine , unladylike importunity to buy things that [one]559-one would far rather be without — to be lavishly generous , and get no credit for it — to be swindled without any hope of legal redress ; this is the essence of [a charitable bazaar]1358-a charitable bazaar ! " "[0-i] Dear [me]0-i ! " says [Esther]148-esther , with a crestfallen sigh . "[0-i] And [I]0-i had been looking forward to it so much ! " [He]4009-he sits down on a low chair beside [her]148-esther sofa . "[0-i] Looking forward to a bazaar ! " [he]4009-he echoes , with a half - incredulous smile . "[0-i] [[My]0-i dear]804-my dear [Miss Craven]164-st. john , what a revelation as to [your]164-st. john past history that one sentence is ! Why , [I]0-i should as soon think of looking forward to a visit to the dentist , or to [[my]0-i mother]3406-my mother 's funeral ! " "[891-no one] [No one]891-no one expects to enjoy it ; it is a necessary evil , " says [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington , with resignation . "[256-constance] Like dancing with [married men]1362-married men , or going to church ? " "[256-constance] [Conny]256-constance ! [Conny]256-constance ! " "[1364-they] [They]1364-they are beautiful , [I]0-i suppose — refined , witty , as [I]0-i always picture [the women of [your]164-st. john world]1365-the women of your world ? " "[164-st. john] So [I]0-i did — so [I]0-i do : and if [they]1364-they were to rise in number from two to fifty , like [[Falstaff]312-falstaff 's highwaymen]1367-falstaff 's highwaymen , [I]0-i should express greater joy still . " "[0-i] And why ? " raising [herself]0-i from [her]0-i cushions to get a straighter , truer look into [his]4011-his bright , grave eyes . Do [you]164-st. john see ? " And [Esther]148-esther does see , and thinking on [Robert Brandon]147-robert , is uneasily joyful . Ere the arrival of [the looked - for bazaar]4012-the looked - for bazaar , [Miss Craven]164-st. john 's cure is complete . On the day preceding the one appointed for that philanthropic festivity , [she]0-i has been walking in the late evening about [the moon - coloured garden]4013-the moon - coloured garden , free from any remaining lameness , leaning on [St. John]164-st. john 's arm . [She]0-i does not need the slight stay , but it pleases [him]4011-his to give and [her]0-i to receive it . It does not please [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington , however , watching [them]4014-them from [an upper chamber]4015-an upper chamber — watching [Esther]148-esther dabble [her]148-esther small hands in the opal water in the great bronze water - lily leaf that makes the basin of the fountain — watching [St. John]164-st. john , rapt and absorbed in [her]148-esther pretty foolish chatter . And yet [their]4014-them talk , if [she]0-i could but hear it , holds nothing obnoxiously fond or flirtatious ; it might be proclaimed by [the bellman]4016-the bellman in [the streets]4017-the streets . "[164-st. john] How nice it is to be no longer [a devil upon two sticks]1368-a devil upon two sticks ! " [the young girl]3585-the young girl is saying , joyfully ; and [the man]3894-the man makes answer , "[1369-you] [You]1369-you will be up to another gallop across [the park]3880-the park to - morrow ? " "[1369-you] Never , never ! " [she]0-i cries , bringing together emphatically [her]0-i two gleaming , wet hands . "[1369-you] [You]1371-you have witnessed [my]0-i first and last equestrian feat ; with [my]0-i own free - will [I]0-i will mount never a horse again , unless it is the rocking- horse at the end of [the north gallery]1372-the north gallery : it is frisky , yet safe ; gallops and plunges , yet stands still : that is the horse for [me]0-i . " [He]3894-the man laughs , and then [they]4020-they are silent . A star falls , hurling itself mysteriously down the sky , and into the dark ; two bats glide past , dusky , noiseless . [Bats]313-bats always seem to [me]3426-people like the ghosts of dead birds , that haunt [the green gardens]4021-the green gardens and copses [they]313-bats used to love . [St. John]164-st. john speaks presently . "[3426-people] One forms mistaken estimates of [people]3426-people 's characters ; [I]0-i should not have imagined [you]1369-you [a coward]1374-a coward . " "[0-i] But [I]0-i am one , physically and morally , " [she]0-i answers , sighing . As [the ladies]1347-the ladies retire to bed , [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington enters [[Esther]148-esther 's room]4023-esther 's room — a familiarity which somewhat surprises [that virgin]4024-that virgin , as it is the first time that it has been accorded to [her]4024-that virgin . "[0-i] [I]0-i have come to congratulate [you]1369-you ! " [Constance]256-constance says , civilly ; "[0-i] [you]1369-you have made a wonderful recovery . " "[1369-you] Yes , wonderful ! "[164-st. john] [St. John]164-st. john is very useful as a walking - stick , is n't [he]1375-he ? " ( playfully . ) "[1375-he] [He]1375-he thought it would tire [me]0-i less , " replies [the other]1100-the other , flushing ; "[1375-he] [he]1375-he has been most kind ! " "[1375-he] [He]1375-he always is , " answers [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington , quickly : "[1375-he] it is [his]1375-he nature ; [old beggarwomen]1376-old beggarwomen , dogs , cats , [dirty children in the gutter]1377-dirty children in the gutter — it is all one to [him]1375-he . " "[1375-he] Really ! " "[1375-he] That universal geniality amounts almost to a weakness , though an amiable one ; it has often been the cause of citing hopes that , of course , [he]1375-he had neither the wish nor the power to gratify . " "[1375-he] What ! in [old beggarwomen]1376-old beggarwomen , dogs , cats , and [dirty children in the gutter]1377-dirty children in the gutter ? " says [Esther]148-esther , smiling merrily , yet with scorn . "[1375-he] If [I]0-i did not take an interest in [you]1369-you , " continued [Constance]256-constance , leaning in a graceful artistic pose against the mantelpiece , "[0-i] [I]0-i should , of course , not take the trouble to mention the subject ; but , as [I]0-i do , [I]0-i thought it the kindest thing [I]0-i could do to [you]1369-you to set [you]1369-you on [your]1369-you guard against attentions to which [you]1369-you , who do not know [him]1375-he , might , without vanity , attribute some importance , but which [I]0-i , who know [him]1375-he so thoroughly , know to mean absolutely nothing , beyond a sort of general bonhomie towards [the whole of [the human race]1381-the human race]1380-the whole of the human race . " "[0-i] [I]0-i am deeply grateful , " answers [the young girl]3585-the young girl , with sarcastic emphasis ; "[0-i] but in [[my]0-i part of [the world]672-the world]1382-my part of the world , [girls]1384-girls are not in the habit of cherishing vague hopes because [a man]3402-a man has the civility to offer [them]1384-girls [his]3402-a man arm when [they]1384-girls are disabled by an accident from walking by [themselves]1384-girls . " "[1369-you] Well , forewarned is forearmed , [you]1369-you know " ( nodding and smiling ) ; "[1369-you] and from some careless , slighting remarks that [St. John]164-st. john let fall the other day , [I]0-i thought [I]0-i should not be acting the part of [a friend]1386-a friend by [you]1369-you if [I]0-i did not warn [you]1369-you against a snare into which [I]0-i have seen [others older]1387-others older , and knowing more of [the world]672-the world than [you]1369-you do , fall . Good night ! " "[759-a person] Stay ! " cries [Esther]148-esther , springing up , and catching hold of [[her]148-esther companion]3572-her companion 's gauzy dress in detention . "[759-a person] It is unfair to tell [a person]759-a person half , and not the whole . What were the slighting remarks that [Mr. Gerard]247-mr. gerard made à propos of [me]0-i ? " "[247-mr. gerard] Really , [I]0-i — [I]0-i do n't remember exactly , " replies [Constance]256-constance , with reluctance , half - feigned , half - real ; "[0-i] [I]0-i did not pay much attention at the time ; it was an admission that slipped out without [my]0-i intending it . " "[0-i] But now that it has slipped out , " cries [the other]1100-the other , authoritatively , "[1369-you] [you]1369-you must explain it fully , please . " "[1369-you] Well , really — please do n't look so tragic , it can be of so very little consequence to [you]1369-you what [he]247-mr. gerard said or did not say about [you]1369-you — " "[247-mr. gerard] Infinitesimally little ! but still [I]0-i mean to hear it . " "[0-i] Well " ( with rather an awkward laugh ) , "[0-i] the situation is hardly worth such [Mrs. Siddons]314-mrs. siddons ' airs : it was only that , when [I]0-i was remonstrating with [him]247-mr. gerard the other day on [his]247-mr. gerard manner to [you]1369-you , [he]247-mr. gerard said , in [his]247-mr. gerard off - hand , abrupt way , something to the effect that when [he]247-mr. gerard threw [you]1369-you over — never for a moment denying that sooner or later [he]247-mr. gerard would do so — [you]1369-you would get over it soon , or something of that description . [I]0-i can not recall the exact phrase . Good night . " But beautiful [Esther]148-esther , standing there stricken , credulous , with eager , angry eyes , forgets to make the answering greeting . THE Bazaar day has arrived ; so likewise have [[Constance]256-constance 's chosen friends]4029-constance 's chosen friends , [the Misses De Grey]315-the misses de grey ; so likewise has [[their]4029-constance 's chosen friends brother]4030-their brother , commonly called [Dick De Grey]316-dick de grey , for no other reason that [we]4031-we wot of but that at [his]4030-their brother baptism [he]4030-their brother received the name of [Charles]145-king charles . [The large open carriage which had so impressed [Esther]148-esther]4032-the large open carriage which had so impressed esther on [her]148-esther first arrival at [[Brainton]43-brainton station]4033-brainton station , and [St. John]164-st. john 's smart T.-cart , with [his]4030-their brother big , black horse , at whose head , or rather at some distance below whose nose , [a cockaded infant]4034-a cockaded infant stands trim and tidy , are at the door . "[317-adeline] How are [we]1390-we to divide ? " says [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington , coming out under [the portico]4035-the portico and unfurling [her]258-miss blessington white Honiton parasol . "[317-adeline] How many of [us]1390-we are there ? [Adeline]317-adeline , [Georgina]318-miss de grey , [Miss Craven]164-st. john , and [myself]0-i , four , and [[you]1391-he two gentlemen]1392-you two gentlemen six . [St. John]164-st. john , will [you]1391-he drive [Miss De Grey]318-miss de grey ? " "[1391-he] [I]0-i should be delighted , " [he]1391-he answers , slowly and tardily , not looking up from the gardenia which [he]1391-he is fastening on [his]1391-he coat ; "[1391-he] but [I]0-i believe [I]0-i am under an old engagement to drive [Miss Craven]164-st. john . [You]1391-he have never been in [a T.-cart]1393-a t.-cart , have [you]1391-he ? " ( looking at [her]1391-he imploringly , to back [him]1391-he up in the ready lie to which , for love of [her]1391-he , [he]1391-he has just given vent . ) "[1391-he] Never ! " [she]0-i answers , smiling coldly . "[1391-he] And now that [I]0-i see to what a height [one]559-one has to climb , and in what close proximity one must be to that huge quadruped 's heels , [I]0-i am in no hurry to make the experiment . [I]0-i release [you]0-i from [your]0-i engagement , [Mr. Gerard]247-mr. gerard , if it ever existed ; if it is all the same to [everybody]3709-everybody , [I]0-i prefer the — [I]0-i never can recollect the names of [carriages]1396-carriages — barouche , sociable , landau , which is it ? " [He]1391-he stares at [her]1391-he for an instant in blank astonishment ; then , turning away quickly to hide the mortification which [he]1391-he knows to be legible on [his]1391-he face , without a word or a groan helps [the oldest , plainest , languidest of [the Misses De Grey]315-the misses de grey]4036-the oldest , plainest , languidest of the misses de grey into [the T.-cart]55-the t.-cart and drives off with [her]1391-he . And [Esther]148-esther steps into the sociable , and tries to feel triumphant and dignified , contemplating , for a dozen miles , [Miss Georgina De Grey]318-miss de grey 's gold - dusted hair and featureless face , and submitting meekly to having the modest proportions of [her]0-i own toilette covered up and smothered in the abundance and volume of [her]0-i vis - à - vis ' laces and frillings . "[1397-his] Since [he]1397-his means to throw [me]0-i over , it is as well to be beforehand with [him]1397-his , " [she]0-i says to [herself]0-i , [her]0-i eyes fixed pensively on the revolving black and yellow wheel ; "[1397-his] in such cases it is always best to take the initiative . It would have been very pleasant , so high up out of the dust ; but what have [I]0-i to do with [aristocratic vehicles]1398-aristocratic vehicles ? A gig , a wheelbarrow , a pig - tub — such are the only conveyances [I]0-i am likely to have experience of in after - life ; why then inoculate [myself]0-i with a taste for luxuries that are for [my]0-i betters ? " And meanwhile [St. John]164-st. john holds dreary converse with [himself]164-st. john , while a river of sound , on which the words Nilsson , Romeo e Giulietta , Schneider , drums , [Holland House]56-holland house , garden party float , pours into [his]1397-his ear from the direction of [[his]1397-his companion]1252-his companion . "[1399-she] [She]1399-she is honest , at all events ; does not relish [my]0-i society , and does not affect to do so ; tolerated [me]0-i only as long as [I]0-i was useful , like a dog , in fetching and carrying . Why am [I]0-i so unpopular with [women]547-women ? Is it what [I]0-i do , what [I]0-i say , or what [I]0-i am , that makes [me]0-i so ? Is it anything mendable or unmendable ? " Precisely seventeen minutes past two of the clock , [the [Melford]48-melford town - hall]4038-the melford town - hall clock , and [visitors]4039-visitors are beginning to arrive pretty thickly ; three or four barouches , seven or eight waggonettes , and nine or ten [pony - carriages]4040-pony - carriages , are trotting and walking and crawling up [the steep Melford street]4041-the steep melford street . Climbing the side of [a house]4042-a house is [child]3639-child 's play to the ascent of [that most perpendicular of [high streets]4045-high streets]4044-that most perpendicular of high streets . [[The doctor]4046-the doctor 's house]4047-the doctor 's house , red , and with redder berries thick about [its]4047-the doctor 's house plate - glass windows , stands on [your]4048-your right as [you]4048-your go up [the town]4049-the town . [[Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington 's stall]4067-miss blessington 's stall is next - door neighbour to [poor Mrs. Tomkins]4068-poor mrs. tomkins ' , [[the Felton curate]4069-the felton curate 's fat , childridden wife]4070-the felton curate 's fat , childridden wife — as , in [some foreign city]4071-some foreign city , [they]4052-their tell [us]4072-us that [you]4073-you may see [marble palaces]4074-marble palaces and mud hovels cheek by jowl ; for , as is a mud hovel to [a marble palace]4075-a marble palace , so is poor [Mrs. Tomkins]4076-mrs. tomkins in the [Melford]48-melford table of valuation to [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington . [They]4091-they are not particularly fond of [one another]922-one another ; but no more was [Alexander Selkirk]326-alexander selkirk , [I]1401-lads dare say , of [[his]326-alexander selkirk next - door neighbour]4093-his next - door neighbour , when [he]326-alexander selkirk lived in [town]4083-town , if [he]326-alexander selkirk ever did . [She]324-priscilla is not thinking a bit of how [she]324-priscilla is looking ; [her]324-priscilla whole soul is intent on doing a good stroke of business , and none can escape [her]324-priscilla . [Sir Thomas Gerard]238-sir thomas has just entered [the hall]658-the hall . " At the door there is a little confusion — [carriages]1396-carriages driving up , [carriages]1396-carriages driving away ; [a small crowd]4151-a small crowd gathered to see [the smart ladies]4152-the smart ladies ; [two policemen]4153-two policemen . [St. John]164-st. john offers [Esther]148-esther [his]247-mr. gerard arm , and [she]148-esther , having no decent excuse for declining , takes it . As [they]4155-they walk along , [he]247-mr. gerard speaks to [her]148-esther hurriedly and not without temper . "[0-i] If [you]1426-you have no special ground of quarrel against [me]0-i — and [Heaven]182-heaven knows why [you]1426-you should have — but feel only that weariness to which [most women]3640-most women seem , in [my]0-i society , to be more or less subject , be unselfish , and let [me]0-i drive [you]1426-you [home]701-home . [I]0-i will not speak , neither need [you]1426-you , if [you]1426-you will have it so ; there are many things more unsociable than absolute silence . " "[1426-you] Why can not [you]0-i be satisfied with this morning 's arrangements ? " [she]148-esther asks , demurring ; the recollection of [his]1426-you reported insult rankling in [her]148-esther mind . [He]1426-you shrugs [his]1426-you shoulders expressively . "[0-i] If [you]1426-you had had three fourths of , ' Le Follet ' and half the Morning Post poured into [your]1426-you reluctant ears , as [I]0-i have , [you]1426-you would not have asked that question . " "[1426-you] If [you]0-i have heard half [the Morning Post]1429-the morning post , is it not a thousand pities that [you]0-i should not hear the other half ? " [she]148-esther inquires , drily . [They]4156-they have reached the T.-cart , the big black horse , [the baby - tiger]4157-the baby - tiger ; in the low , red sun the new harness shines brightly . "[0-i] [I]0-i almost wish [you]1426-you could sprain [your]1426-you other ankle , " [Gerard]247-mr. gerard says , recovering [his]247-mr. gerard good humour . "[1426-you] As long as [you]1426-you were lame , [you]1426-you were much more amiable . " Ten minutes more and [the Melford steep street]4158-the melford steep street and [railway bridge]4159-railway bridge are left behind [them]4156-they , [they]4156-they are trotting with smooth briskness between the nutty , briary hedgerows . At first the silence which [Gerard]247-mr. gerard had guaranteed threatens to remain unbroken ; it is infringed at last by [Esther]148-esther , out of whose heart the fair late breeze , the happy yellow stillness , and latly the proximity to and solitude with [the beloved one]4160-the beloved one , are smoothing all angry creases . ( "[1426-you] If [he]1430-he did speak lightly of [me]0-i , " [she]0-i thinks , sorrowfully , "[1430-he] [we]1431-we shall not have the chance of many more drives together ; whether [he]1430-he think ill or well , highly or meanly , of [me]0-i , let [me]0-i be happy with [him]1430-he while [I]0-i may ! " ) "[0-i] What a pleasant vehicle this would be to make a driving tour in ! " "[0-i] A tour of [all the cathedral towns throughout [England]13-england]1432-all the cathedral towns throughout england , as [the Heir of [Redclyffe]58-redclyffe]1433-the heir of redclyffe proposed spending [his]1433-the heir of redclyffe honeymoon in making ! " [She]0-i laughs . "[0-i] [I]0-i remember long ago the Saturday Review saying of [some [she]1435-she - novelist 's men]1434-some she - novelist 's men , that [they]1434-some she - novelist 's men were like [old governesses in trousers]1436-old governesses in trousers : it was not a bad simile , was it ? " Silence falls on [them]4161-them again ; broken this time by [Gerard]247-mr. gerard , who , turning abruptly towards [[his]247-mr. gerard companion]1252-his companion , says , "[1436-old governesses in trousers] [You]0-i are not bored by [my]0-i society , [Miss Craven]164-st. john ? Unless [you]0-i are cast in a mould different from the rest of [humanity]1327-humanity , [you]0-i must be bored by [the society of [the Misses De Grey]315-the misses de grey]1438-the society of the misses de grey . Why , then , were [you]0-i so resolute this morning in rejecting the one and accepting the other ? This is the problem that has been puzzling [me]0-i for the last half mile . " [She]0-i hangs [her]0-i head like [a scolded school - child]4163-a scolded school - child . "[0-i] What was [your]0-i motive ? " "[0-i] A prudential one , partly , " [she]0-i answers , rallying [her]0-i spirits . "[0-i] [I]0-i knew that in after life [I]0-i should have small experience of T.-carts and [such rich man]1439-such rich man 's luxuries , so [I]0-i thought it wiser not to run the risk of contracting a taste for [them]1440-them . " "[0-i] How do [you]0-i know what the experience of [your]0-i after life may be ? " "[0-i] [One]559-one may argue from the known to the unknown ; [I]0-i can give a pretty shrewd guess . " "[0-i] And was that [your]0-i sole motive ? " "[0-i] What does it matter to [you]0-i whether it was or not ? " "[0-i] Nothing ; except that , to a philosophical mind like [mine]0-i , [woman]3638-woman and [her]3638-woman caprices are an interesting psychological study . Did [you]0-i ever hear of an essay of [Addison]334-addison 's entitled ' Dissection of [a Coquette 's Heart]1443-a coquette 's heart ? ' " "[0-i] [I]0-i am not [a coquette]1444-a coquette , " [she]0-i cries , indignantly , answering the indirect accusation directly . "[0-i] [I]0-i did not say [you]0-i were . [I]0-i hope [you]0-i are not — [I]0-i hope to [God]435-god [you]0-i are not ! " [he]595-men answers , with more vehemence than the occasion seems to demand . "[0-i] And yet , " [she]0-i says , feeling oppressed by the solemnity of [his]595-men manner and trying to speak lightly , "[0-i] [I]0-i have heard it said that [no woman can be thoroughly attractive who is not something of a flirt]1445-no woman can be thoroughly attractive who is not something of a flirt . " "[0-i] [I]0-i had rather that [she]3638-woman should be thoroughly unattractive then , " [he]595-men answers , shortly and grimly . " "[0-i] Really ? " "[0-i] Really . " "[0-i] Seriously ? " "[0-i] Seriously . Confess that , after that admission , [your]0-i opinion of [me]0-i is considerably lowered . " No answer but a smile .
