" [she]148-esther could not have made the communication in a more tragic whisper : then , not waiting for any advice as to [her]148-esther conduct , snatching up [her]148-esther bouquet , [she]148-esther flies as if shot from a crossbow , out of the window and into [the garden]846-the garden . Was not it [Lord Chesterfield]341-lord chesterfield who said that [the guests at a dinner party]4193-the guests at a dinner party should never be less than [the Graces]4194-the graces or more than [the Muses]4195-the muses ? [Kant]342-kant preferred the Grace number , and had daily [two friends]1363-two friends , never more , to dine with [him]342-kant . [The guests at the Felton banquet]4197-the guests at the felton banquet greatly exceed the Chesterfieldian limits . [Those who have come only to dinner]4198-those who have come only to dinner have been bemoaning [themselves]4198-those who have come only to dinner heavily , as [they]4198-those who have come only to dinner came along , on the hardship of being forced away from [garden]4199-garden and croquet - ground , and obliged to drive three , four , five miles bare - necked and bare - backed — and [a woman nowadays in full dress]4200-a woman nowadays in full dress is verily and indeed bare - necked and bare - backed — through the mellow crimson evening . To even these grumblers , however , destiny now appears kinder — now , [I]748-the devil say , that the too candid daylight is shut out , that the amber champagne—"With[748-the devil] beaded bubbles winking at the brim — " is creaming gently in every glass , and the entrées are making [their]4201-their savoury rounds . [Esther]148-esther has fallen to the lot of [one of [the stray men of whom [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington spoke]4203-the stray men of whom miss blessington spoke — [a man who , when bidden to dinner]4204-a man who , when bidden to dinner , complies with the letter of [his]4204-a man who , when bidden to dinner invitation , and dines chiefly and firstly ; looks upon [the lady whom [he]4204-a man who , when bidden to dinner escorts to the social board]4205-the lady whom he escorts to the social board as a mere adjunct — [an agreeable or disagreeable one]4206-an agreeable or disagreeable one , as the case may be , but as merely an adjunct , as the flowers in the vases , or the silver Cupids that uphold the fruit baskets]4202-one of the stray men of whom miss blessington spoke — a man who , when bidden to dinner , complies with the letter of his invitation , and dines chiefly and firstly ; looks upon the lady whom he escorts to the social board as a mere adjunct — an agreeable or disagreeable one , as the case may be , but as merely an adjunct , as the flowers in the vases , or the silver cupids that uphold the fruit baskets . In the intervals of the courses [he]4204-a man who , when bidden to dinner has no objection to being amused : it is too much exertion to be very amusing [himself]4204-a man who , when bidden to dinner , but [he]4204-a man who , when bidden to dinner is not unwilling to smile and . lend an indulgent ear to [[his]4204-a man who , when bidden to dinner companion]1252-his companion 's prattle , so as that prattle does not infringe upon the succulent programme that [he]4204-a man who , when bidden to dinner has , by diligent study of the menu , laid out for [himself]4204-a man who , when bidden to dinner . Baffled on [her]148-esther left hand , [Miss Craven]164-st. john turns to [her]148-esther right , to be baffled there also . Not that [this right - hand neighbour]4208-this right - hand neighbour labours under any excessive gourmandise — [he]4204-a man who , when bidden to dinner is willing , on the contrary , that [the unknown , black - eyed innocent and the turtle cutlet]4209-the unknown , black - eyed innocent and the turtle cutlet should share and share alike in [his]4204-a man who , when bidden to dinner regards ; but ere a quarter of an hour [their]4209-the unknown , black - eyed innocent and the turtle cutlet conversation has come to a shipwreck . In it [he]4204-a man who , when bidden to dinner takes too much for granted : as , for example , that [she]148-esther has been to [London]16-london this season ; that [she]148-esther has seen [Faed]343-faed 's last picture ; that [she]148-esther has been at [Lady]4210-lady — 's ball ; that , by having seen both , [she]148-esther is in a position to judge of the comparative merits of [Mademoiselle Nilsson]339-nilsson 's and [Madame Carvalho]344-madame carvalho 's rendering of "[748-the devil] [Marguerite]292-marguerite . " Tired at length of saying , "[748-the devil] [I]0-i was not there , " "[0-i] [I]0-i have not seen it , " "[292-marguerite] [I]0-i never heard of [her]292-marguerite , " [she]148-esther relapses into a mortified silence ; thinking , what [an impostor]4211-an impostor must [I]0-i be to have thrust [myself]0-i in among all [these fine people]4212-these fine people — [I]0-i , who can not even catch [their]4212-these fine people jargon for five minutes ! Foiled in [her]148-esther own little conversational ventures , [she]148-esther tries to listen to [other people]3531-other people 's . In vain : if , above the general hum , [she]148-esther catches the beginning of one sentence , it is immediately joined on to the end of another . As well , listening to the sultry buzz of a swarm of bees , might one try to distinguish each separate voice . But the dumb show , at least , is left [her]148-esther : the waggling heads , the moving jaws — poor jaws , that have to talk and eat both at once ! To put a history to each of these heads — to pick out [characters]4214-characters by watching the delicate shades of difference with which [each person]4215-each person sits ; says , "[0-i] No , thank [you]1495-you ; " laughs — this is not unamusing . Yes , to study the faces , and find similitudes for [them]4212-these fine people : one nut - cracker ; several flowers ; one plum - pudding ; one horse , one vulture , one door - knocker . [She]148-esther is puzzled to find a resemblance for all ; for [Belinda Denzil]323-belinda denzil , for instance , who , virginally clad in white muslin , that seems to mock [her]323-belinda denzil thirty celibate years , is apparently forcing [the suave yet weary]4216-the suave yet weary [De Grey]318-miss de grey into an up - hill , one - sided flirtation . [No man]873-no man has hired [Belinda]323-belinda denzil , and it is , with [her]323-belinda denzil , the eleventh hour . What fowl , or fish , or quadruped , or article of furniture is [she]323-belinda denzil most like ? Before [Esther]148-esther can decide this point quite to [her]148-esther mind , the signal of retirement is given , and [each maid]4218-each maid and [wife]4219-wife rises obedient and vanishes . It is the general complaint in [the Felton neighbourhood]4220-the felton neighbourhood that at [that house]4221-that house [the men]3783-the men sit unfashionably , wearisomely long over [their]3783-the men wine . [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas belongs to [that excellent school that in [their]4223-that excellent school that in their hearts hearts]4223-that excellent school that in their hearts regret the good old days , when [a man]3402-a man never rejoined [the ladies]1347-the ladies without seeing double [their]4223-that excellent school that in their hearts real number . Half an hour , three - quarters of an hour , an hour and a quarter have passed . [Several girls]4226-several girls are beginning to yawn behind [their]4226-several girls fans ; [the Misses De Grey]315-the misses de grey are driving heavily through a long duet , with never a squire to turn over the leaves ( in the wrong place ) for [them]4226-several girls . The door opens , and a fat , bald head appears ; the most uninteresting always come first , but , like [Noah]308-noah 's dove , [he]3402-a man is the harbinger of better things . Five minutes more , and [the room]3629-the room is as full of broadcloth as of silk and satin . [The younger men]4228-the younger men are still hovering about uncertainly , unfixed as yet in [their]4228-the younger men minds as to which elaborate fair one [they]4228-the younger men shall come to final anchor by . [The epicure]4229-the epicure , now that there is nothing to eat , casts [his]4229-the epicure eyes round in search of [the finest woman]4230-the finest woman and the comfortablest chair to be found in [the great gilded room]4231-the great gilded room . Both requisites [he]4229-the epicure finds united in [[Esther]148-esther 's neighbourhood]4232-esther 's neighbourhood . Accordingly [he]4229-the epicure is moving towards [her]148-esther , when [his]4229-the epicure attention is happily arrested by a remark that [he]4229-the epicure overhears as to the best method of dressing [beccaficos]4233-beccaficos . Instantly [Miss Craven]164-st. john 's white , silky shoulders and red - pouted lips go out of [his]4229-the epicure head . White shoulders and red lips are good things in their way , but what are they to beccaficos [Esther]148-esther draws a long breath of relief . What an escape ! In a minute more suspense is ended , and the low armchair beside [her]148-esther is occupied by [the person for whom it was intended]4234-the person for whom it was intended — for whom , indeed , [she]148-esther has been slyly keeping it half - covered by [her]148-esther dress . "[1495-you] Well ! and how are [you]1496-you getting on ? " says [Gerard]238-sir thomas , asking a silly question for want of a wiser one occurring to [him]238-sir thomas , and looking rather affectionate . [St. John]164-st. john is not in the very least degree elevated ; but it is useless to deny that [the best and fondest of men]4235-the best and fondest of men are still fonder after dinner than before : it must be a very , very deep love that can not be a little deepened by champagne . "[1496-you] Better than [I]0-i thought [I]0-i should be a few seconds ago , when [that odious gourmand]1497-that odious gourmand seemed to be steering this way , " [she]0-i answers , not taking any great trouble to hide [her]0-i pleasure in [[his]1497-that odious gourmand neighbourhood]4236-his neighbourhood . "[1497-that odious gourmand] [Poor devil]1498-poor devil ! [he]1497-that odious gourmand must not come to [you]1496-you for a character , [I]0-i see . " "[0-i] Well , [you]0-i know , they are very good things , " answers [Gerard]238-sir thomas , chiefly to tease [her]0-i , but partly also because [he]238-sir thomas really thinks so . "[0-i] Do n't look so disgusted , " [he]238-sir thomas continues , laughing . "[256-constance] [THE world]672-the world 's life is shorter by a fortnight than it was on that last day [I]0-i told [you]1536-you of , and during that fortnight the ordinary amount of things have happened . [The usual number of [people]3426-people]1537-the usual number of people have had [their]1537-the usual number of people bodies knocked to atoms and [their]1537-the usual number of people souls into eternity by [express trains]1539-express trains ; the usual number of [men]595-men and [maids]1541-maids have come together in the Times column in holy matrimony ; and the usual number of [unwelcome babies]1542-unwelcome babies have been consigned to [the canals]1543-the canals . [A great many players]1544-a great many players have laid down [their]1544-a great many players cards , risen up , and gone away from the game of life ; but whether [winners]1545-winners or [losers]1546-losers , [they]1544-a great many players tell [us]1547-us not , neither shall [we]1547-us know awhile ; and [other players]1548-other players have taken [their]1548-other players places , and have sat down with the zest of ignorance . " Nature takes no notice of [those that are coming or going]4249-those that are coming or going . "[1549-she] [She]1549-she is briskly occupied at [[her]1549-she old business]1550-her old business — the business that seems to [us]1547-us so purposeless , progressless , bootless — the making only to unmake ; the beautifying only to make hideous ; the magnifying only to debase . Oh life ! life ! [Oh clueless labyrinth]1551-oh clueless labyrinth ! Oh answerless riddle ! September is waning mellowly into death , like [a holy man to whom an easy passage has been vouchsafed]1552-a holy man to whom an easy passage has been vouchsafed ; [the land]3431-the land has been noisy with guns , and many partridges have been turned into small bundles of ruffled features — little round , brown corpses . [Bob Brandon]190-bob walks stoutly up [the furzy hill]1554-the furzy hill sides and along [the stony levels]1555-the stony levels after the shy , scarce birds ; [he]190-bob is out and about all day , but [you]1556-you do not hear [him]190-bob whistling or humming so often as [you]1556-you used to do . " [He]190-bob goeth heavily , as [one that mourneth]4250-one that mourneth . "[190-bob] The fortnight is past , and yet another week , and still [Esther]148-esther holds no speech of returning ; [her]148-esther letters have waxed fewer , shorter , colder . Since that first one , mention of [Gerard]247-mr. gerard 's name is there in them none . [Bob]190-bob is not of a suspicious nature , but [he]190-bob can add two and two together . [He]190-bob has been doing that little dreary sum all the last ten days , till [his]190-bob head aches . But though [he]190-bob can do this sum [himself]190-bob , [he]190-bob will pot suffer [any one else]777-any one else to do it — at least in [his]190-bob presence . One day at dinner , when [Bessy]202-bessy was beginning a little sour adaptation of the text , " The lust of the flesh , the lust of the eye , "[190-bob] & c. , to [Esther]148-esther , [he]190-bob interrupted [her]148-esther with downright outspoken anger and rebuke ; and , though [he]190-bob apologised to [her]148-esther afterwards , and begged [her]148-esther pardon for having spoken rudely to [her]148-esther , yet [she]148-esther felt that that theme must not be dealt with again . [He]190-bob had promised to love [her]148-esther always in all loyalty , and whether [she]148-esther were loyal or disloyal to [him]190-bob made no difference . [He]190-bob will let [no man]873-no man , [woman]3638-woman , or [child]3639-child speak evil of [her]148-esther in [his]190-bob hearing : " ..... love is not loveThat alters when it alteration finds , Or bends with the remover to remove . "[190-bob] [Jack Craven]146-jack , too , is beginning to wonder a little when [Esther]148-esther is going to return to [the old farmhouse]1561-the old farmhouse — beginning to feel rather lonely as [he]146-jack sits by [himself]146-jack on the window - ledge of an evening , smoking [his]146-jack pipe , with [no one]891-no one to take it out of [his]146-jack mouth now , and thinking on [his]146-jack unpaid for [steam ploughs]1563-steam ploughs and [sterile mountain - fields]1564-sterile mountain - fields , with [no one]891-no one to speak comfortably to [him]146-jack , or console [him]146-jack with sweet illogical logic . " All is not gold that glitters . "[348-care] [Care]348-care gets up behind [the man]3894-the man , however fine a horse [he]3894-the man may be riding . [Care]348-care is sitting en croupe behind [Miss Craven]164-st. john , and [she]164-st. john can not unseat [him]3894-the man . It strikes [her]164-st. john sometimes with a shock of fear that [she]164-st. john is succeeding too well ; that the admiration and liking and love [she]164-st. john had hankered so greedily after , had striven unfairly for , had made wicked lightnings from [her]164-st. john eyes to obtain , was ready to be poured out lavishly , eagerly , honestly at [her]164-st. john feet , and [she]164-st. john dare not put out a finger to take them up . [She]164-st. john had been walking miles and miles of nights , up and down [[her]164-st. john bedroom]1282-her bedroom , from door to window , from window to door , when [all the rest of [the house]687-the house]1568-all the rest of the house are abed and asleep . " What shall [I]164-st. john do?—what shall [I]164-st. john do ? "[164-st. john] [she]164-st. john cries out to [her]164-st. john own heart , while [her]164-st. john hands clasp one another hotly , and the candles , so tall at dressing time , burn short and low . " Oh ! if [I]559-one had [some one]686-some one to advise [me!—not]559-one that [I]559-one would take [their]686-some one advice , if it were to give up [St. John]164-st. john ! Give [him]4252-him up ! How can [I]559-one give up what [I]559-one have not got ? Oh Bob , [Bob]190-bob , if [you]190-bob only knew how [I]559-one hate you!—Only less than [I]559-one hate [myself]559-one ! Oh ! why was not [my]559-one tongue cut out before that unlucky day when [I]559-one said [I]559-one would try to like [you]190-bob ? Try , indeed ! If there is need for trying , [one]559-one may know how the trial will end . Shall [I]559-one tell [St. John]164-st. john ? What ! volunteer an unasked confession ? Warn [him]4252-him off [[Robert]147-robert 's territory]4254-robert 's territory when [he]4252-him is not thinking of trespassing ? And if [I]559-one were to tell [him]4252-him — oh Heaven ! [I]559-one had sooner put [my]559-one hand into a lion 's mouth — what would [he]4252-him think of [me]559-one ? [He]4252-him , with [his]4252-him fastidious , strict ideas of what [a woman]553-a woman should be and do and look ? Shall [I]559-one write and ask [Bob]190-bob to let [me]559-one off ? It would not break [his]190-bob heart ; [he]190-bob is too good ; only [bad people]4256-bad people ever break [their]4256-bad people hearts , as [I]559-one shall do some day , [I]559-one dare say . Oh ! [poor Bob]190-bob , how badly [I]559-one am treating [you]190-bob ! [Poor Bob]190-bob ! and [his]190-bob yellow roses that [St. John]164-st. john made such fun of ! How [I]559-one wish that the thoughts of [your]190-bob long legs and [[your]190-bob little sour Puritan sisters]4257-your little sour puritan sisters did not make [me]559-one feel so sick ! Oh ! if [you]190-bob would but be good enough to jilt [me]559-one ! What shall [I]559-one do?—what shall [I]559-one do ? Wait , wait , go on waiting for what will never come , probably , and when [I]559-one have degraded [myself]559-one by waiting till hope is quite dead , go back whence [I]559-one came , and jig - jog through life alongside of [Bob]190-bob in a poke bonnet like [[his]190-bob mamma]4258-his mamma 's . Ah [Jack]146-jack , [Jack]146-jack ! why did [I]559-one ever leave [you]146-jack ? How [I]559-one wish that [all Bobs]4259-all bobs and [St. Johns]349-st. johns and other worries were at [the bottom of [the Red Sea]64-the red sea]4260-the bottom of the red sea , and [you]146-jack and [[I]559-one king and queen of [some desert island]4262-some desert island]4261-i king and queen of some desert island , where there was nothing nearer humanity than monkeys and macaws , and where there was no rent nor [workmen]4263-workmen 's wages nor [lovers]4065-lovers to torment [us]4265-us ! "[559-one] [One]559-one must go to bed at some time or other , however puzzled and pondering [one]559-one may be ; and in furtherance of this end , [Esther]148-esther , having reached this turn in [her]148-esther reflections , begins to undress . In so doing [she]148-esther misses a locket containing [Jack]146-jack 's picture , which [she]148-esther always wears round [her]148-esther neck . [She]148-esther must have dropped it [downstairs]1293-downstairs , where perhaps [some housemaid]1573-some housemaid 's clumsy foot may tread upon it , and mar [the dear , ugly young face within]1574-the dear , ugly young face within . [She]148-esther must go and look for it , though the clock is striking one . [She]148-esther takes up [her]148-esther candle , and runs lightly [downstairs]1293-downstairs . The gas is out . Great shadows from behind come up alongside , and then stretch ahead of [her]148-esther ; the statues glimmer ghostly chill from their dark pedestals . Is it [burglars]1577-burglars , or are the flowers giving a ball , as in [Andersen]350-andersen 's fair , fanciful tale ? [She]148-esther creeps gently up , and peeps in . " Do n't go ; stay and talk a minute . THE weekly clearance of mundane books has been made at [Plas Berwyn]38-plas berwyn ; the skimp drab gowns , and the ill - made frock coat , whose flaps lap over [one another so painfully behind]1598-one another so painfully behind , have been endured by [the Misses Brandon]205-the misses brandon and [[their]205-the misses brandon brother]4030-their brother respectively . At [church]3708-church has been all [the Brandon household]1601-the brandon household : [son]1602-son and [daughters]1603-daughters , [man - servant]1604-man - servant and [maid - servant]1605-maid - servant , ox and sheep , camel and ass . [I]0-i need hardly say that the last quartette have been introduced merely for the sake of euphony , and to give a fuller rhythm to the close of the sentence . [The Misses Brandon]205-the misses brandon always stand as stiff as pokers during the creed , with [their]205-the misses brandon backs to the altar . It amuses [them]205-the misses brandon , and it does not do [anybody else]1045-anybody else any harm , so why should not [they]205-the misses brandon , [poor women]1607-poor women ? [Bob]190-bob truckles to [the Scarlet Woman]1608-the scarlet woman ; [he]190-bob bows , and turns [his]190-bob honest , serious face to the east . The service is in Welsh , of which [he]190-bob does not understand a word . [He]190-bob can pick [his]190-bob way pretty well through the prayers , however , by the help of a Welsh and English prayer book . There are several landmarks that [he]190-bob knows , whose friendly faces beam upon [him]190-bob now and again when [he]190-bob is beginning to flounder hopelessly among uncouth words of seven consonants and a vowel . These are [his]190-bob chief finger - posts : " Gogoniant ir [Tad]353-tad , ac ir [Mab]354-mab , ac ir Yspryd Glan ; "[148-esther] that is , " Glory be to [the Father]4289-the father , and to [the Son]4290-the son , and to [the Holy Ghost]4291-the holy ghost . "[148-esther] " Gwared ni , [Arglywd daionus]355-arglywd daionus ! "[146-jack] " [Good Lord]356-good lord , deliver [us]4292-us ! "[148-esther] " Na Ladratta ! "[148-esther] " [Thou]4293-thou shalt not steal ! "[146-jack] [Jack Craven]146-jack has been to [church]3708-church too , and has , as [he]146-jack always does , been reading the inscriptions on the coffin - plates , nailed up , Welsh fashion , against the dilapidated , whitewashed walls , in lieu of monumental tablets . [Esther]148-esther has also been to [church]3708-church ; has been in state in [a great , close carriage]1611-a great , close carriage , in company with [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas , [Miladi]278-miladi , and [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington . [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas has been storming the whole way about a gap [he]238-sir thomas detected in a hedge that [they]1612-they passed , through which some cattle have broken , so that [they]1612-they all arrive at [the church]1613-the church door in that calmly devout state of quietude which is the fittest frame of mind for the reception of Divine truth . [The Gerard pew in [Felton church]66-felton church]1614-the gerard pew in felton church is as large as [a moderate - sized room]1615-a moderate - sized room , and is furnished with arm - chairs and a fireplace . In winter , [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas spends fully half the service time in poking the fire noisily and raking out the ashes . There is no fire now , and [he]238-sir thomas misses it . A high red curtain runs round [the sacred enclosure]1616-the sacred enclosure , and through it [[the farmers]1617-the farmers ' wives]1618-the farmers ' wives and [daughters]1603-daughters strain [their]1612-they eyes to catch a glimpse of [Miladi]278-miladi 's marabout feathers , and [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington 's big , golden chignon , and little green aerophane bonnet . [St. John]164-st. john generally pulls the brass rings of [his]1620-his bit of curtain aside along the brass rods , to make a peep - hole for [himself]1620-his over [the congregation]1621-the congregation . The shape and size of the pew do away with the necessity for any wearisome conformity of attitude among [the inmates]1622-the inmates . During the prayers , [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas stands bolt upright , with one bent knee resting on [his]238-sir thomas chair ; [his]238-sir thomas bristling grey head , shaggy brows , and fierce spectacles looming above the red curtain , to the admiration and terror of the row of [little charity girls beneath]1623-little charity girls beneath . [Constance]256-constance kneels forward on a hassock , with a large , ivory prayer book , gold - crossed , red - edged , in one hand , and a turquoise and gold - topped double scent - bottle and cobweb cambric handkerchief in the other . [She]256-constance confesses in confidence to [her]256-constance pale lavender gloves that [shehas]256-constance done that which [she]256-constance ought not to have done , and has left undone that which [she]256-constance ought to have done ; making graceful little salaams and undulations of head and body every two minutes . [Miladi]278-miladi confesses that [she]278-miladi has gone to sleep . [St. John]164-st. john makes no pretence of kneeling at all : [he]1620-his leans , elbow on knee and head on hand , and looks broken - hearted , as [men]595-men have a way of doing in [church]3708-church . In the afternoon , [[no one]891-no one at [Felton]44-felton]1627-no one at felton thinks of attending Divine service . It is a fiat of [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas 's that [no carriage]1628-no carriage , horses , or [servants]1158-servants are to be taken out more than once a day , and the two miles ' walk is an insuperable impediment to [Lady Gerard]239-lady gerard , and hardly less so to [Constance]256-constance . After luncheon [the three ladies]1630-the three ladies are sitting in [the garden]846-the garden , with the prospect of four unbroken hours of [each other]909-each other 's companionship before [them]1630-the three ladies . Masses of calceolarias , geraniums , lobelias , are flaring and flaunting around them — masses in which [the perverted eye of modern horticulture]1633-the perverted eye of modern horticulture sees its ideal of beauty . Nature , in [her]1634-her gardening , never plants great , gaudy squares and ovals and rounds of red and blue and yellow , without many shades of tenderest grey and green to soften and relieve them . Across the grass [St. John]164-st. john comes lounging ; [his]1620-his Sunday frock coat sitting creaseless to [his]1620-his spare , sinewy figure . [Esther]148-esther hates the sight of that coat : it reminds [her]148-esther so painfully , by its very unlikeness , of the singular garment that forms the head and crown of [[her]148-esther betrothed]1635-her betrothed 's scant wardrobe . " Do [you]164-st. john know , [I]258-miss blessington have half a mind to go to [Radley church]68-radley this afternoon . Will [any one]523-any one come with me?—will [you]164-st. john , [Conny]256-constance ? "[258-miss blessington] turning , mindful of last night , with a conciliatory smile to [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington . " How far is it ? "[258-miss blessington] [she]258-miss blessington asks , indolently , divided between [her]258-miss blessington hatred of walking and [her]258-miss blessington desire to frustrate the téte - à- téte [she]258-miss blessington sees impending between [St. John]164-st. john and [Esther]148-esther . " Three or four miles ; four , [I]258-miss blessington suppose . "[258-miss blessington] [She]258-miss blessington lifts [her]258-miss blessington large blue eyes languidly , " Four miles there , and four miles back ! Are [you]164-st. john mad , [St. John]164-st. john ? What do [you]164-st. john suppose one is made of ? "[258-miss blessington] Will [you]148-esther take pity on [me]0-i then , [Miss Craven]164-st. john ? " turning eagerly to [Esther]148-esther . [She]148-esther tilts [her]148-esther hat low down over [her]148-esther little , straight , Greek nose , looks up at [him]1636-a man who delights in solitude with shy coquetry under the brim , but answers not . "[164-st. john] [A man who delights in solitude]1636-a man who delights in solitude must be either a wild beast or [a god]1637-a god , do n't [you]148-esther know ? [I]0-i have no pretence to be either : [I]0-i hate [[my]0-i own society]1638-my own society cordially . Come " ( with a persuasive ring in [his]1636-a man who delights in solitude pleasant voice ) ; "[1637-a god] [you]148-esther had much better . " "[148-esther] Do n't be so absurd , [St. John]164-st. john ! " cries [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington , pettishly . "[164-st. john] [Miss Craven]164-st. john would far rather be left in peace . " "[148-esther] Would [you]148-esther ? " ( appealing to [her]239-lady gerard . ) "[148-esther] No — o ; that is — [I]0-i mean — [I]0-i think [I]0-i should like the walk , if [I]0-i may . May [I]0-i , [Lady Gerard]239-lady gerard ? do [you]148-esther mind ? " ( turning sweet red cheeks and quick eyes towards [[her]0-i hostess]4295-her hostess . ) "[0-i] [I]0-i , [[my]0-i dear]804-my dear ! Why should [I]0-i mind ? " responds [Miladi]278-miladi , leaning back and fanning [herself]278-miladi with a large fan ( [I]148-esther believe that [fat women]4296-fat women often suffer a foretaste of the torments of [the damned]4297-the damned in the matter of heat)—"so[148-esther] as [you]148-esther do n't ask [me]0-i to go with [you]148-esther ( with a fat smile ) . And , [St. John]164-st. john , be sure that [you]148-esther are back in time for dinner , there 's [a good boy]1640-a good boy ! [You]148-esther know what a fuss [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas is always in on Sunday evening ? " "[238-sir thomas] [I]0-i know that [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas is digging [[his]238-sir thomas grave]1641-his grave with [his]238-sir thomas teeth as fast as [he]238-sir thomas can , " answers [St. John]164-st. john , disrespectfully . "[238-sir thomas] Shall not [we]1642-we be rather late for [church]3708-church if [we]1642-we have four miles to go ? " asks [Esther]148-esther , as [she]148-esther steps out briskly beside [[her]148-esther companion]3572-her companion , while heart and conscience keep up a quarrelsome dialogue within [her]148-esther . "[238-sir thomas] It is not four miles ; it is only three . " "[148-esther] [You]148-esther told [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington four ? " "[148-esther] So [I]0-i did ; but [I]0-i drew for the extra mile upon the rich stores of [my]0-i imagination . " "[0-i] Why did [you]148-esther ? " [she]258-miss blessington asks , turning a wondering rosy face set in the frame of a minute white bonnet towards [him]3572-her companion . "[148-esther] Did [you]258-miss blessington ever hear of the invitations that [the Chinese]1644-the chinese give [one another]922-one another ? " [he]3572-her companion asks , laughing , and switching off a fern - head with a baby umbrella — "[148-esther] which , however pressing they may be , are always expected by [the giver]1646-the giver to be declined . [My]0-i invitation to [Conny]256-constance was a Chinese one : [I]0-i was not quite sure that [she]256-constance would understand it as such , and [I]0-i was so afraid that [she]256-constance would yield to [my]0-i importunities , that [I]0-i had to embroider a little in the matter of distance ; do [you]1647-you see ? " There has been rain in the morning ; now the clouds have rent themselves asunder , and broken up into great glistering rocks , peaks , and spires , such as no fuller on [earth]911-earth could white : "[1647-you] [Blue isles of heaven]1648-blue isles of heaven laugh between . " The breeze comes more freshly over the wet grasses and flowers , and blows in little fickle puffs against [St. John]164-st. john 's bronzed cheeks and [Esther]148-esther 's carnation ones . [The girl]682-the girl 's heart is pulsing with a keen , sharp joy ; all the keener , as [the heaven]4301-the heaven 's blue is deeper for the clouds that hover about it . "[0-i] [I]0-i shall have [him]1649-him all to [myself]0-i for three hours , " [she]0-i is saying inwardly ; "[1649-him] [he]1649-him will speak to [no one]891-no one but [me]0-i ; [he]1649-him will hear [no one else]1651-no one else 's voice ( [she]256-constance forgets [the parson]1652-the parson and [the clerk]1653-the clerk ) . Surely [Bob]190-bob may spare [me]0-i these three hours , and just a few more , out of the great long life during which [I]0-i shall tramp - tramp at [his]1649-him side ! "[190-bob] " No , thanks ; it is not heavy "[190-bob] ( retaining it , mindful of a certain inscription in the fly - leaf ) . " ' [Esther]148-esther Craven from [Robert Brandon]147-robert . ' Who is [Robert Brandon]147-robert when [he]147-robert is at [home]701-home ? "[190-bob] ( speaking rather shortly . ) [Esther]148-esther 's heart leaps into [her]148-esther mouth . Shall [she]148-esther tell [him]1649-him now , this minute , without giving [herself]148-esther time for second thoughts , which are not by any means always best ? Shall [she]148-esther lift off the weight of compunction , anxiety , shame , that has been pressing upon [her]148-esther for the last fortnight?—let it fall down , as the dead albatross fell from the Ancient Mariner 's neck—"Like lead into [the sea]601-the sea ? "[148-esther] The subject has introduced itself naturally , easily , without any of the dragging in by the head and shoulders of the officiously - volunteered confessions that [she]148-esther had salved [her]148-esther conscience by deprecating . Shall [she]148-esther , with strong , brave hand ; push away all hope of [the fine house]1654-the fine house and [the broad lands]1655-the broad lands , of [the carriages]1054-the carriages and horses , the roses and pine - apples , the down pillars and fragrances of life ? Shall [she]148-esther courageously , nobly , and yet in mere bare duty , turn away from [the fairy prince]1153-the fairy prince and return to [her]148-esther hovel and scullionship ? Shall [she]148-esther , or shall [she]148-esther not ? " Who is [Robert Brandon]147-robert "[164-st. john] repeats [St. John]164-st. john , rather crossly . In the second that follows [Esther]148-esther 's life destiny is settled . [She]148-esther refuses the good and chooses the evil . ( " [He]147-robert is [the man [I]148-esther am engaged to]4305-the man i am engaged to , "[148-esther] that is what [she]148-esther ought to have said . ) " [He]147-robert is in the — th foot . "[148-esther] This is what [she]148-esther does say , blushing till the tears come into [her]148-esther eyes , turning away [her]148-esther head , and feeling stabbed through and through with shame . " [An ally of [yours]164-st. john]4306-an ally of yours ? "[148-esther] ( quickly . ) " [I]148-esther have known [him]147-robert all [my]148-esther life , "[148-esther] [she]148-esther answers , evasively . " [He]147-robert would be none the worse for a few writing lessons . " [He]147-robert must have had a great deal of change out of sixpence , [I]1659-her poor lover should think . "[1659-her poor lover] " If [you]1659-her poor lover have nothing better to do than abuse [my]148-esther property , "[148-esther] cries [Esther]148-esther , impulsively , snatching it out of [his]1659-her poor lover hand , " [you]1659-her poor lover may give it [me]148-esther back , "[148-esther] looking half disposed to whimper . " [I]164-st. john apologise , "[164-st. john] responds [St. John]164-st. john , gravely . " [I]164-st. john did not mean to offend [you]148-esther ; [I]164-st. john give [you]148-esther carte blanche to insult [mine]164-st. john "[164-st. john] ( holding out a very minute Russia leather one ) . "[164-st. john] " No ; why ? "[164-st. john] " Because [I]164-st. john never heard of [any one being given a prayer book except as a wedding present]4309-any one being given a prayer book except as a wedding present , or by [[their]4309-any one being given a prayer book except as a wedding present godfathers]4310-their godfathers and [godmothers]4311-godmothers at [their]4309-any one being given a prayer book except as a wedding present baptism . "[164-st. john] " [Robert]357-robert is not old enough to be [[my]180-essie godfather]4312-my godfather , "[180-essie] says [Essie]180-essie , overcoming by a great effort the repugnance to pronouncing the fateful name : " [he]357-robert is quite young ; a great deal younger than [you]148-esther , "[180-essie] [she]180-essie ends , rather spitefully . " [He]357-robert might easily be that , "[164-st. john] replies [St. John]164-st. john , coldly . " Once , not so very many years ago , in whatever company [I]164-st. john was , [I]164-st. john always was [the youngest present]4313-the youngest present ; now , on the contrary , in whatever company [I]164-st. john am , [I]164-st. john always feel [the eldest present]4314-the eldest present . [I]164-st. john do n't suppose [I]164-st. john always am , but [I]164-st. john always feel as if [I]164-st. john were . "[164-st. john] " [I]148-esther believe [old people]3729-old people have the best of it , after all , "[148-esther] says [Esther]148-esther , recovering a little of [her]148-esther equanimity : " [they]3729-old people have certainly fewer troubles than [young ones]4316-young ones . [I]148-esther should say that [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas was decidedly a happier man than [you]148-esther are . "[148-esther] " [A man]3402-a man 's happiness is proportioned to the simplicity of [his]3402-a man tastes , [I]164-st. john suppose , "[164-st. john] answers [St. John]164-st. john , sardonically . " [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas 's happiness lies in a nutshell : [he]238-sir thomas has two ruling passions — eating and bullying ; [he]238-sir thomas has [a very fair cook]4318-a very fair cook to satisfy [the one]3424-the one , and [[my]164-st. john mother]3406-my mother always at hand for the gratification of the other . "[164-st. john] " [We]4321-we have all [our]4321-we ruling passions , "[148-esther] rejoins [Esther]148-esther , with a light laugh , " only very often [we]4321-we will not own them . [Mine]164-st. john is burnt almonds ; what is [yours]164-st. john ? "[148-esther] " Going to [church]3708-church , "[1661-he] [he]1661-he replies , in the same tone ; " as [you]148-esther may perceive by the strenuous efforts [I]1661-he have made to get [there]594-there this afternoon . "[1661-he] [[Radley]68-radley church]1662-radley church stands on a knoll . [[Radley]68-radley [parishioners]1664-parishioners]1663-radley parishioners have to go upwards to be buried — a happy omen , it is to be boped , for the destination of [their]1664-parishioners souls . [The church]1613-the church has [a little grey tower]1666-a little grey tower , pretty , old , and squat , and a peal of bells — these are [its]1613-the church claim to distinction — a merry peal , as [people]3426-people say ; but to [me]0-i it seems that in all the gamut of sad sounds there is nothing sadder , sorrowfuller , than bells chiming out sweetly and solemnly across the summer air . Rung in by the grave music of [their]1668-their invitation , [St. John]164-st. john and [Esther]148-esther enter . [Verger]1669-verger or pew - opener is there none , so [they]1668-their slip into the first of the open sittings that presents itself . [The clergyman]1670-the clergyman is young and energetic : [he]1670-the clergyman has rooted up the tall , worm - eaten , oak pews — disfiguring compromises between cattle - pen and witness - box — has clothed several " Dear little soulsIn nice white stoles , — "[1670-the clergyman] and is trying to teach [himself]1670-the clergyman intoning . [He]1670-the clergyman produces at present only prolonged whining groans , but it is a step in the right direction . Rest is good after exertion , and so [Essie]180-essie thinks . The south wind has been playing tricks with the dusk riches of [her]180-essie hair . [Nature]162-nature has been laying on [her]180-essie bistre under the great liquid eyes , and emptying a whole potful of [her]180-essie rouge on the rose velvet round of [her]180-essie cheeks . [She]180-essie is not in apple - pie order at all , and yet " [She]180-essie was most beautiful to see , Like [a lady from a far countree]4324-a lady from a far countree . "[180-essie] If [Esther]148-esther were to murder [any one]523-any one , and [her]148-esther guilt were to be brought [home]701-home to [her]148-esther as plainly as the eye of day shines in the sky at noon , [judge]1673-judge and [jury]1674-jury would combine to acquit [her]148-esther . " Blessed be [God]435-god , who has made [beautiful women]4325-beautiful women ! "[1675-the bedouin] says [the Bedouin]1675-the bedouin , and [Gerard]238-sir thomas echoes the benediction , as [he]238-sir thomas stands with [his]238-sir thomas big lavender thumb on one side of the hymn book , and [her]180-essie small , lavender thumb on the other , while [the " dear little souls "]4326-the " dear little souls "[4326-the " dear little souls "] are singing sweetly and quickly : " There [God]435-god for ever sitteth , [Himself]435-god of all the Crown;The Lamb , the Light that shineth , And goeth never down . "[4326-the " dear little souls "] Grand words , that make [one]559-one feel almost good and almost happy merely to say them ! There is only one hymn - book in the pew , and [St. John]164-st. john is glad of it . There is something pleasant in the sense of union and partnership , though it be only a three minutes ' partnership in a dog's - eared psalter . " Is not there some different way of going [home]701-home ? "[180-essie] asks [Essie]180-essie , as [they]1677-their stand side by side , after service , in [the high churchyard]1678-the high churchyard , looking down on the straggling damson trees , the grey smoke spiring northwards under the south wind 's faint blowing , the dark - blue green of [the turnip fields]1679-the turnip fields . " [I]1652-the parson hate going back the same way one came ; it shows such a want of invention ! "[1652-the parson] " There is another way , "[164-st. john] answers [St. John]164-st. john , scooping out a little plump green moss from a chink in the wall with the point of [his]238-sir thomas umbrella , while [the parson]1652-the parson and [[the parson]1652-the parson 's sister]1682-the parson 's sister , on [their]1677-their homeward way , turn [their]1677-their heads to look at [them]1683-them — [the parson at [Esther]148-esther]1684-the parson at esther , [[the parson]1652-the parson 's sister]1682-the parson 's sister at [St. John]164-st. john — [Jack]146-jack at [Jill]358-jill , and [Jill]358-jill at [Jack]146-jack as is the way of [the world]672-the world ; " but it is a good deal longer and a great deal muddier than the one [we]4328-we came by . "[358-jill] " [I]180-essie like mud , "[180-essie] says [Essie]180-essie , gaily , stooping and picking a daisy from [a little child]1688-a little child 's grave at [her]180-essie feet ; " it is [my]180-essie native element ; at [home]701-home [we]4328-we are up to [our]4328-we knees in mud in winter , and over [our]4328-we ankles in summer . "[180-essie] So [they]1689-they chose the longer and the muddier way . It is its length that is its recommendation to [them]1689-they both , [I]0-i think . Down [the village street]1690-the village street , past [the Loggerheads]359-the loggerheads and [the Forge]1691-the forge , and along [a long country lane]1692-a long country lane , paved unevenly with round stones after a way [[our]1693-our forefathers]722-our forefathers in [some of [the northern counties]1696-the northern counties]1695-some of the northern counties had of paving , in imperfect prophetic vision of [MacAdam]70-macadam . To - day no broad waggon - wheel groans , nor hoofed foot clatters along ; only [a few cottagers]1697-a few cottagers and [smart - bonneted servant girls]1698-smart - bonneted servant girls trudge along to [the Primirive Wesleyan Methodist Chapel]1699-the primirive wesleyan methodist chapel , built [A.D. 1789]1700-a.d. 1789 , that stands in simple , dissenting ugliness at the hill - foot , while over [its]1699-the primirive wesleyan methodist chapel newly - painted , gingerbread - coloured door stands this modest announcement : " This is [the Gate of Heaven]4330-the gate of heaven . "[164-st. john] " It strikes [me]164-st. john , "[164-st. john] says [St. John]164-st. john , rousing [himself]164-st. john out of a reverie which has lasted a quarter of an hour—"it strikes [me]164-st. john as one of the few instances in which [one]559-one 's experience tallies with what one reads in novels , the awkward knack [people]3426-people have of interrupting one at the wrong moment . "[164-st. john] " How do [you]1701-his mean "[180-essie] asks [Essie]180-essie , coming out of a reverie , too . " [I]1701-his never , "[1701-his] pursues [he]1701-his , taking off [his]1701-his hat , and passing [his]1701-his hand over the broad red mark it has made on [his]1701-his forehead—"I never read aloud to [any one in [my]148-esther life]4333-any one in my life — [I]148-esther was rather fond of reading poetry at one period of [my]148-esther history , [I]148-esther leave [you]4334-you to guess which — not that [she]4335-she cared about it — [she]4335-she did not know [Milton]360-milton from [Tommy Moore]361-tommy moore ; but [I]148-esther never read to [her]4335-she in the course of [my]148-esther life without [the footman coming in to put coals on at the most affecting passages]4336-the footman coming in to put coals on at the most affecting passages — [Arthur]362-arthur 's parting from [Guinivere]363-guinivere , say , or [Medora]364-medora 's death — and clattering down the tongs and shovel , making [the devil]748-the devil 's own row . "[148-esther] [Esther]148-esther laughs . " These reflections are à propos of — what ? "[148-esther] " Of [Conny]256-constance 's most ill - timed entry last night , "[1702-i] [he]1702-i answers , with energy . " [I]1702-i do n't suppose [she]256-constance makes such a midnight raid once in five years , and [she]256-constance certainly could not have found [you]148-esther and [me]1702-i téte - à - téte at two in the morning more than once in fifty years . Why could not [she]256-constance leave [us]4338-us in peace that once ? [We]4338-us did not grudge [her]256-constance any amount of pleasant dreams ; why need [she]256-constance grudge [us]4338-us [our]4338-us pleasant wakefulness ? "[1702-i] " Do [you]1702-i think [she]256-constance came on purpose , then ? "[180-essie] asks [Essie]180-essie , [her]180-essie eyes opening as round in alarmed surprise as [a baby]1062-a baby 's when [a grown - up person]1704-a grown - up person makes ugly faces at it . [He]1702-i shrugs [his]1702-i shoulders slightly . " Can not say , [I]1702-i 'm sure . [Conny]256-constance is not much in the habit of burning the midnight oil in the pursuit of knowledge generally . If it was accident , [she]256-constance came in at a wonderfully à propos , or rather mal à propos , moment . Tell [me]1702-i , "[1702-i] [he]1702-i says , crossing over to [her]180-essie side of [the road]3569-the road , and fixing frankly - asking eyes upon [her]180-essie ; " [I]1702-i may be mistaken — it is a misfortune to which [I]1702-i am often incident — but [I]1702-i could not help thinking that , just as that unlucky candle appeared round the corner last night , [you]180-essie were going to tell [me]1702-i something — something about [yourself]180-essie ? [I]1702-i thought [I]1702-i saw it in [your]180-essie face . [I]1702-i think [I]1702-i deserved some little reward for raking up for [your]180-essie behoof the ashes of that old fire that [I]1702-i burnt [my]1702-i fingers at so badly once . "[1702-i] [Esther]148-esther still remains silent , but turns [her]148-esther long neck from one side to the other with a restless , uneasy motion . " Are lamplight and the small hours indispensable accessories "[1702-i] [he]1702-i asks , with gentle pleading in look and words—"or could not [you]148-esther tell [me]1702-i as well now ? "[1702-i] " Tell [you]1702-i what "[148-esther] [she]148-esther says , turning round sharp upon [him]1702-i , and snapping , as a little cross dog snaps at the heels of [the passer - by]1706-the passer - by — " must [I]148-esther invent something ? "[148-esther] " Are [you]148-esther sure that it is necessary to invent ? "[1702-i] [he]1702-i asks , scanning the fair , troubled face with searching gaze . [She]148-esther pulls a bunch of nuts out of the hedge from among their rough - ribbed green leaves , and begins to pick them out of their sheath . " What am [I]148-esther to tell [you]1702-i ? "[148-esther] [she]148-esther says , petulantly , a suspicion that [he]1702-i may have heard a rumour of [her]148-esther engagement crossing [her]148-esther mind : " that [I]148-esther live in [an old farm - house]4339-an old farm - house with [[my]148-esther brother]4340-my brother [Jack]146-jack , and that [we]4341-we are very hard up — [you]1702-i know already ; that ' [Sudrydachi]365-sudrydachi ' is Welsh for ' How do [you]1702-i do ' and that [our]4341-we asparagus has answered very badly this year ? "[148-esther] " Of course , [I]1702-i can not force [your]148-esther confidence , "[1702-i] [he]1702-i answers , rather coldly . " Why do [you]1702-i insist upon [my]148-esther having something to confide ? What reason have [you]1702-i for supposing that [I]148-esther have ? "[148-esther] [she]148-esther cries , with increased irritation . " None whatever , but what [you]1702-i [yourself]1702-i have given [me]148-esther ! "[148-esther] " [I]1702-i ! "[1702-i] " Yes , [you]148-esther ; not [your]148-esther words , but [your]148-esther face now and then . Do n't think [me]1702-i impertinent . [You]148-esther know what unhappy reason [I]1702-i have had to be suspicious . But tell [me]1702-i "[1702-i] ( trying [his]1702-i best to get a look round the corner into the averted , perturbed face of [his]1702-i companion)—"tell [me]148-esther whether there is not something between [you]148-esther and — and — that fellow that gave [you]148-esther the prayer - book ? "[148-esther] [Esther]148-esther 's heart gives one great bounding throb ; the thin muslin of [her]148-esther dress but poorly conceals its hard , quick pulsings . One more chance for [her]148-esther ! Fate generally gives [us]1707-us two or three chances before it allows [us]1707-us to consign [ourselves]1707-us irrecoverably to the dogs . One more choice between loyalty and disloyalty — a plain question , to be answered plainly , unequivocally — Yes or No ; [Robert]357-robert or [St. John]164-st. john . [The man whose conversation bores [her]148-esther , whose proximity and whose gaze leave [her]148-esther colder than snow on [an alp 's high top]1709-an alp 's high top an hour before sunrise , and with whom [she]148-esther has promised to live till death do them part]1708-the man whose conversation bores her , whose proximity and whose gaze leave her colder than snow on an alp 's high top an hour before sunrise , and with whom she has promised to live till death do them part ; or [the man , no whit better or handsomer , whose coming , felt , though unseen , makes [her]148-esther whole frame]1710-the man , no whit better or handsomer , whose coming , felt , though unseen , makes her whole frame vibrate , as a harp 's strings vibrate under [the player]1711-the player 's hands — beneath whose eyes [hers]148-esther sink down bashful , yet passionate — [the man whom , after this week , [she]148-esther must see never again until death do [them]1713-them unite]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite . [Woman]3638-woman - like , [she]148-esther tries to avoid the alternative . " What is that to [you]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite ? "[148-esther] [she]148-esther retorts , abruptly , endeavouring to be playful , and succeeding only in being rude . " Nothing whatever , "[1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite] [he]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite replies , flushing angrily ; and then [they]1715-they walk on for some distance in silence . " Are [you]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite angry ? "[148-esther] asks [Esther]148-esther , presently , with a smile , half saucy , half frightened . " [I]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite ? not in the least , "[1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite] [he]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite replies , with an air of ostentatious indifference , but with a complexion undoubtedly florider than nature made [his]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite . " [You]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite look excessively cross , and have not uttered a word for the last half mile , "[148-esther] [she]148-esther says , pouting out [her]148-esther full red under - lip , and then looking ( a little alarmed at [her]148-esther own audacity ) to see in what spirit [he]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite takes [her]148-esther impertinence . " When [I]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite do not get civil answers to civil questions , [I]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite think it best to hold [my]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite tongue , "[1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite] [he]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite says , stalking along with [his]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite head up , and hitting viciously with [his]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite umbrella at the tall , yellow mulleins in the hedge . " [People]3426-people 's ideas differ as to what are civil questions , "[180-essie] says [Essie]180-essie , trying to stalk too , and to elevate nose and chin in emulation of [his]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite . " Suppose that [I]180-essie had asked [you]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite how many times [you]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite had been refused , would [you]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite have answered [me]180-essie ? "[180-essie] " Undoubtedly [I]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite should , "[1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite] [he]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite replies , gravely . " How many times have [you]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite ? " Questions should be answered in the order of priority in which they are asked , "[1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite] [he]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite replies , with a smile of amusement at [her]180-essie simplicity , but with a good deal of dissatisfied doubt underlying the smile . " Answer [my]148-esther question , and [I]148-esther 'll answer [yours]148-esther . [His]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite anxiety overcomes [his]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite hurt pride . " Is there not something between [you]148-esther and [him]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite ? " No "[148-esther] is a plain downright lie , at which conscience demurs , and " Yes "[148-esther] a cannon - ball that will knock [her]180-essie away from [St. John]164-st. john 's side out into [the drear , great world]1716-the drear , great world for ever . " For [God]435-god 's sake answer [me]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite ! "[1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite] [he]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite says again , in great agitation at a dumbness that seems to [him]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite ominous . Hearing the sharp pain and angry fear in [his]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite voice , [she]148-esther hesitates no longer . Lie or no lie , [she]148-esther takes the plunge . " Nothing ! "[148-esther] [she]148-esther says , faintly , turning first milk - white , then red as a rose in [her]148-esther burning prime . " Why do [you]148-esther turn away [your]148-esther face ? Are [you]148-esther quite certain ? "[1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite] [he]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite asks , quickly , only half convinced by [her]148-esther weak negation . "[1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite] [he]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite asks , with jealous impatience . " [I]148-esther wo n't stand being catechised in this way , "[148-esther] [she]148-esther cries , blazing out angrily , and stopping short , while sparks of fire , half quenched in tears of vexation , dart from the splendid night of [her]148-esther eyes . " [I]148-esther have answered a question which [you]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite ought never to have asked ; [you]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite must be [a person of very little observation]4343-a person of very little observation , "[148-esther] [she]148-esther continues , sharply , " not to have discovered during the three weeks that [I]148-esther have been with [you]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite that [I]148-esther blush at everything and nothing ; [I]148-esther should be as likely as not to blush when [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas 's name was mentioned , or — or — "[148-esther] " Or [mine]164-st. john , "[164-st. john] suggests [St. John]164-st. john , ironically ; " put it as strongly as [you]164-st. john can . "[164-st. john] " Or [yours]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite , if [you]1712-the man whom , after this week , she must see never again until death do them unite like , "[148-esther] [she]148-esther answers , hardily , but crimsoning painfully meanwhile in confirmation of [her]148-esther words . At a little distance farther on , [their]1717-their path forsakes [the road]3569-the road and leads across a line of [grass fields]1719-grass fields . [St. John]164-st. john crosses [the first stile]1720-the first stile , and waits politely on the other side to help [Esther]148-esther over . " No , no ! "[148-esther] [she]148-esther cries , petulantly , withdrawing [her]148-esther foot from the first rung—"I hate being helped over stills . Go on , please . "[1721-i] [He]1721-i obeys , and walks on . [Her]148-esther dignity does not allow [her]148-esther to hurry [her]148-esther pace to overtake [him]1721-i , nor does [his]1721-i permit [him]1721-i to slacken [his]1721-i steps till [she]148-esther come up with [him]1721-i ; and [they]1717-their walk on in single file , goose - fashion , through [two fields]1722-two fields and a half . Dividing and watering [the third field]1723-the third field , as the four ancient rivers divided and watered [the rose gardens and asphodel fields of Paradise]1724-the rose gardens and asphodel fields of paradise , [a little beck , with many turns and bends and doublings back upon itself , strays babbling , like a silver ribbon twisted among [the meadow]3756-the meadow 's green hair]1725-a little beck , with many turns and bends and doublings back upon itself , strays babbling , like a silver ribbon twisted among the meadow 's green hair . It is not like the Welsh brooks , fretful and brawling , making little waterfalls and whirlpools and eddies over and about every water - worn stone ; smoothly it flows on , as a holy , eventless life flows towards [the broad sea]1727-the broad sea whose tides wash [the shores of Time]1728-the shores of time . In dry weather it is slow - paced enough , and crystal clear ; now the late heavy rains have quickened its current , and rolled [it]1729-it along , turbid and muddy . Even though swollen , however , it is still but a narrow thread , and [St. John]164-st. john clears it at a jump . " Shall [I]1721-i go on still ? "[1721-i] [he]1721-i asks , with a malicious smile from the other side , addressing [Esther]148-esther , who stands looking down rather ruefully at the quick , brown water at [her]148-esther feet . " [I]148-esther believe [you]1721-i knew of this , and brought [me]148-esther [here]3398-here on purpose to make a fool of [me]148-esther , "[148-esther] [she]148-esther cries , reproachfully . " [I]1721-i did nothing of the kind , "[1721-i] [he]1721-i answers , quietly . " Last time [I]1721-i was [here]3398-here there was a plank thrown across ; but [you]148-esther see [the stream]4346-the stream has been higher than it is now "[1721-i] ( pointing to the drenched grass and little deposit of sticks and leaves on [the bank]1730-the bank ) , " and has probably carried it away . "[1721-i] " How am [I]148-esther to get over ? "[148-esther] [she]148-esther asks , hopelessly , with a look of childish distress on [her]148-esther face . " [I]1721-i 'll carry [you]148-esther , "[1721-i] [he]1721-i answers , springing back to [her]148-esther side ; " [the brook]854-the brook is shallower farther down ; [I]1721-i can lift [you]148-esther over with the greatest ease imaginable . "[1721-i] " That [you]1721-i sha n't ! "[148-esther] answers [Esther]148-esther , civilly turning [her]148-esther back upon [him]1721-i . " May [I]1721-i ask why ? "[1721-i] [he]1721-i asks , coolly . " After the number of times [I]1721-i have carried [you]148-esther up and down stairs at [Felton]44-felton , [you]148-esther can hardly be afraid of [my]1721-i letting [you]148-esther fall ? "[1721-i] " The very fact of [my]148-esther having already had so many obligations to [you]1721-i makes [me]148-esther resolved not to add to [their]4348-their number , "[148-esther] [she]148-esther replies , stiffly , with an effort to look dignified , which [her]148-esther laughing , débonnaire , seductive style of beauty tenders peculiarly unsuccessful . " If [you]148-esther can suggest any better plan , [I]1721-i shall be delighted to assist [you]148-esther in carrying it out , "[1721-i] rejoins [he]1721-i , smothering a smile . " [I]148-esther 'll jump ! "[148-esther] [she]148-esther says , desperately , eyeing meanwhile [the hurrying stream]1731-the hurrying stream and space between bank and bank with calculating look . " [You]148-esther can not , "[1721-i] [he]1721-i cries , hastily ; " [you]148-esther 'll get a ducking as sure as [I]1721-i stand here . Do n't be so silly ! "[1721-i] The word " silly "[148-esther] acts as a whip and spur to [Essie]180-essie 's flagging courage . [She]148-esther retreats a few yards from the edge , in order to get a little run to give [her]148-esther a better spring . " As headstrong as an allegory on [the banks of [the Nile]71-the nile]4349-the banks of the nile ! "[238-sir thomas] remarks [Gerard]238-sir thomas , resignedly , quoting [Mrs. Malaprop]366-mrs. malaprop and folding [his]1721-i arms . Neither the preparatory run , nor the tremendous bound [she]148-esther takes , avail to save [Miss Craven]164-st. john from the fate which [her]148-esther obstinacy and the comparative shortness of [her]148-esther legs render unavoidable . [She]148-esther jumps short , and falls forward on [the wet bank]1732-the wet bank ; [her]148-esther lavender kid gloves digging convulsively into it , and [her]148-esther legs disporting themselves fish - like in [the brook]854-the brook . [He]1721-i is at [her]148-esther side in an instant , raises gently and lifts [her]148-esther on to the grass , unmindful of the pollution caused to [his]1721-i coat by the muddy contact . " What [a fool]4286-a fool [I]148-esther was ! "[148-esther] [she]148-esther cries , passionately , sinking down among a grove of huge burdock leaves , smothered in shame and angry blushes . [St. John]164-st. john thinks it rude to disagree with [her]148-esther , so holds [his]1721-i peace . " Why do n't [you]1721-i laugh at [me]148-esther ? why do n't [you]1721-i jeer [me]148-esther ? "[148-esther] [she]148-esther continues , vehemently ; " why do n't [you]1721-i tell [me]148-esther [you]1721-i are very glad of it , and that [I]148-esther richly deserve it , as [I]148-esther see [you]1721-i are longing to do ? Anything would be better than standing there like a stock or a stone ! "[148-esther] " It is not of much consequence how [I]1721-i stand or how [I]1721-i look , "[1721-i] [he]1721-i replies , coldly . " It would be more to the purpose to know how [you]148-esther are to get [home]701-home ! "[1721-i] " [I]148-esther will walk as [I]148-esther am , "[148-esther] [she]148-esther cries impulsively , springing to [her]148-esther feet ; " it will be a fit penance for [my]148-esther idiocy , and [you]1721-i shall go on ahead . [I]148-esther do n't want [you]1721-i to be disgraced by being seen in company with such an object . "[148-esther] " That is very probable , is n't it ? "[1721-i] [he]1721-i answers , laughing good - humouredly . " No , [I]1721-i have a better proposition than that , [I]1721-i think . It has just occurred to [me]1721-i that [an old servant of ours]4352-an old servant of ours lives at no great distance from here , [[her]4352-an old servant of ours cottage]4353-her cottage is not more than three or four fields off . If [you]1721-i can manage to get [there]594-there [she]4352-an old servant of ours would dry [your]1721-i clothes for [you]1721-i in a minute . "[1721-i] Rendered docile by [her]148-esther late disaster , feeling very small , and hanging [her]148-esther head , [Esther]148-esther acquiesces . [Her]148-esther gown , from which every particle of starch or stiffness has fled , clings to [her]148-esther limbs and defines their form ; the water drips down from [her]148-esther in a thousand little spouts and rivulets ; bang , bang , go [her]148-esther soaked petticoats against [her]148-esther ankles at every step [she]148-esther takes . " [You]1734-you have had almost enough of taking [me]148-esther out to walk , [I]148-esther expect , "[148-esther] [she]148-esther remarks presently , rather grimly . " [You]1734-you have had almost enough of jumping brooks , [I]1734-you expect , "[1734-you] [he]1734-you retorts , drily ; and then [they]1735-they walk on in silence till [they]1735-they reach [a little whitewashed cottage]1736-a little whitewashed cottage , with [its]1736-a little whitewashed cottage slip of [potato ground]1737-potato ground and plot of pinks and marigolds and larkspurs — [an oasis of tilled ground among [the wilderness of pasturage]1739-the wilderness of pasturage]1738-an oasis of tilled ground among the wilderness of pasturage . [St. John]164-st. john knocks at the half - open door and puts [his]1734-you head in . " Are [you]148-esther at [home]701-home , [Mrs. Brown]367-mrs. brown ? How are [you]148-esther ? "[1734-you] says [he]1734-you , in that frank , friendly voice that goes far to make [the Felton]44-felton tenants wish that [Sir St. John]368-sir st. john reigned in [[Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas 's stead]1740-sir thomas 's stead . " Quite well , thank [you]164-st. john , [Mr. St. John]369-st. john ; [I]1741-the person hope [I]1741-the person see [you]164-st. john the same , "[1741-the person] replies [the person]1741-the person addressed , coming to the door with [a jolly red face and a voluminous widow]1742-a jolly red face and a voluminous widow 's cap that contradict [one another]922-one another ; " it 's a long time since [we]4356-we 've seen [you]164-st. john come [our]4356-we way . "[1741-the person] " So it is , [Mrs. Brown]367-mrs. brown ; but , [you]164-st. john see , [I]1741-the person have been after the partridges . "[1741-the person] " And [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas , [I]1741-the person hope [he]238-sir thomas keeps pretty well , [Mr. St. John]369-st. john ? "[1741-the person] " Yes , thanks . "[1741-the person] Do [you]1744-you see , [Mrs. Brown]367-mrs. brown , that [this young lady]1745-this young lady has met with an accident : [she]1745-this young lady has tumbled into [the brook]854-the brook .
