" "[1744-you] Eh dear , [Miss]1747-miss , [you]1744-you are in a mess ! " ! "[367-mrs. brown] ejaculates [Mrs. Brown]367-mrs. brown , walking round [Esther]148-esther , and surveying [her]148-esther curiously , as [she]148-esther stands close behind [Gerard]238-sir thomas , dripping still , with a hang - dog air and chattering teeth . " Why , [you]1744-you have not a dry stitch upon [you]1744-you ; [you]1744-you are one mask of mud ! Would [you]1744-you please to step in ? "[367-mrs. brown] [Mrs. Brown]367-mrs. brown and [Essie]180-essie retire into [an inner chamber]1748-an inner chamber for the purpose of removing the wet clothes and replacing them temporarily with some of the contents of [Mrs. Brown]367-mrs. brown 's wardrobe . [St. John]369-st. john remains in [the outer room]1749-the outer room , looks at the clock , behind whose dial - plate a round china - moon - face peeps out ; takes up the mugs on the dresser : " For [a Good Boy]1640-a good boy , "[369-st. john] " A Keepsake from [Melford]48-melford , "[369-st. john] " A Present from [Manchester]72-manchester , "[369-st. john] hiding amongst numberless gilt flourishes ; chivies the tabby cat ; counts the flitches of bacon hanging from the rafters ; walks to the door , and watches the bees crawling in and out of the low door of [[their]1750-their straw houses]1751-their straw houses , and the maroon velvet nasturtiums trailing along the borders , and lifting [their]1750-their round leaves and dark faces up to the knees of the standard rose . As [he]369-st. john so stands , whistling softly and musing , [some one]686-some one joins [him]369-st. john in the doorway . [He]369-st. john turns and beholds [Esther]148-esther , bashful , shame - faced , metamorphosed . To [Mrs. Brown]367-mrs. brown 's surprise , [she]148-esther has declined the magnanimous offer of [her]148-esther best black silk . There is nothing coquettish or picturesque , as [she]148-esther is aware , about an ill - made dress that tries to follow the fashion and fails — destined , too , for [a woman treble [her]148-esther size]1753-a woman treble her size . [She]148-esther has chosen in preference , a short , dark , linsey petticoat and lilac cotton bedgown , which , by its looseness , can adapt itself to the round slenderness of [her]148-esther tall , lissom figure . [Her]148-esther bonnet was not included in the ruin of [her]148-esther other garments , but [she]148-esther has taken it off , as destructive to the harmony of [her]148-esther costume . [St. John]369-st. john surveys [her]148-esther for some moments : looks upward from petticoat to bedgown , and downward from bedgown to petticoat , but observes a discreet silence . " Does it become [me]148-esther ? "[148-esther] [she]148-esther asks at last , with shy vanity . " Why do not [you]369-st. john say something ? "[148-esther] " [I]369-st. john have been so unlucky in two or three of [my]369-st. john remarks lately , "[369-st. john] replies [he]369-st. john , with a concluding glance at the round , bare arms that emerge whitely from the short cotton sleeves , " that [I]369-st. john have become chary of making any more . "[369-st. john] " [You]369-st. john need not be afraid of offending [me]148-esther by telling [me]148-esther that it is unbecoming , "[148-esther] [she]148-esther says , gravely — " quite the contrary . [I]148-esther "[148-esther] — [she]148-esther continues rather discontentedly — " think that it suits [me]148-esther too well , as if it were a dress that [I]148-esther ought to have been born to . Upon [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington now such a costume would look utterly incongruous . "[148-esther] [St. John]369-st. john bursts out laughing . " [A goddess in a bed - gown]4358-a goddess in a bed - gown ! Diana of [the Ephesians]4359-the ephesians in a linsey petticoat ! Perish the thought ! "[369-st. john] [Esther]148-esther looks mortified , and turns away . The cleansing of [Miss Craven]164-st. john 's garments is a lengthy operation . [Mrs. Brown]367-mrs. brown retreats into [[her]367-mrs. brown back [kitchen]1755-kitchen]1754-her back kitchen , draws forward a washtub , kneels down beside it , turns up [her]367-mrs. brown sleeves , and with much splashing of hot water and lathering of soap , rubs and scrubs , rings out , dries , and irons the luckless gown and petticoat . It is latish and duskish by the time that [St. John]164-st. john and [[his]369-st. john companion]1252-his companion set out on [their]1757-they homeward way . Two or three starflowers have already stolen out , and are blossoming , infinitely distant , in the meadows of the sky . They are not loquacious : it is [the little shallow rivulet]1758-the little shallow rivulet that brawls ; [the great deep river]1759-the great deep river runs still . Silently [they]1757-they walk along ; [her]1252-his companion little feet trip softly through the rustling grass beside [him]369-st. john : the evening wind blows [her]1252-his companion light garments against [him]369-st. john . [He]369-st. john has taken [her]1252-his companion little gloveless hand as [he]369-st. john helps [her]1252-his companion over a stile ( adversity has made [her]1252-his companion abject , and [she]1252-his companion no longer spurns [his]369-st. john assistance ) , and now retains it , half absently . Bare palm to bare palm , [they]1757-they saunter through [the rich , dim land]1760-the rich , dim land . It is dusk , but not so dusk but that [they]1757-they can see [their]1757-they dark eyes flashing into one another : sharp , stinging pleasure shoots along [their]1757-they young , full veins . The vocabularies of pain and of delight are so meagre , that each has to borrow from the other to express [its]1761-its own highest height and deepest depth . As [they]1757-they pass along [a lane , whose high grass banks and overgrown hawthorn hedges]1762-a lane , whose high grass banks and overgrown hawthorn hedges make the coming night already come , [Esther]148-esther 's foot stumbles over a stone . The next moment [she]148-esther is in [his]369-st. john arms , and [he]369-st. john is kissing [her]148-esther repeatedly . " [Esther]148-esther , will [you]148-esther marry [me]369-st. john ? "[369-st. john] [he]369-st. john asks , in a passionate whisper , forgetting to make any graceful periphrasis to explain [his]369-st. john meaning , using the plain words as they rise in [his]369-st. john heart . No answer . Emotions as complicated as intense check the passage of [her]148-esther voice . Even here , on this highest pinnacle of bliss — pinnacle so high that [she]148-esther had hardly dared hope ever to climb there — the thought of [Bob]190-bob and [his]190-bob despair flashes before [her]148-esther : [her]148-esther own remarks about the senselessness of kissing — about its being a custom suited only to [savages]1763-savages , and [her]148-esther own great aversion to it — recur to [her]148-esther with a stab of remorse . " [You]148-esther wo n't ? "[164-st. john] cries [St. John]164-st. john , mistaking the cause of [her]148-esther silence , in a voice in which extreme surprise and profound alarm and pain are mixed in equal quantities . Still no answer . " If [you]148-esther have been making a fool of [me]369-st. john all this time , [you]148-esther might , at least , have the civility to tell [me]369-st. john so , "[369-st. john] [he]369-st. john says , in a voice so sternly cold that remorse , coyness , and all other feelings merge into womanish fear . " Do n't blame [me]148-esther before [I]148-esther deserve it , "[148-esther] [she]148-esther says , with a faint smile . " [I]148-esther will mar — "[148-esther] [She]148-esther finishes [her]148-esther sentence on [his]369-st. john breast . Perfect happiness never lasts more than two seconds in [this world]549-this world ; at the end of that time [St. John]164-st. john 's doubts return . [He]369-st. john puts [her]148-esther a little way from [him]369-st. john , that [she]148-esther may be [a freer agent]1765-a freer agent . " [Esther]148-esther , "[369-st. john] [he]369-st. john says , " [I]369-st. john half believe that [you]148-esther said ' yes ' out of sheer fright ; [you]148-esther thought [I]369-st. john was going to upbraid [you]148-esther ; and [I]369-st. john am aware "[369-st. john] ( with a half smile ) " that there are few things [you]148-esther would not do or leave undone to avoid a scolding ; [you]148-esther did not say it readily , as if [you]148-esther were glad of it . [I]369-st. john know that [you]148-esther have only known [me]369-st. john three weeks , that [I]369-st. john am not particularly likeable , especially by [women]547-women , and that [I]369-st. john always show to the worst possible advantage at [home]701-home . All [I]369-st. john beg of [you]148-esther is , tell [me]369-st. john the truth : Do [you]148-esther like [me]369-st. john , or do [you]148-esther not ? "[369-st. john] " [I]1766-i do like [you]1766-i . "[1766-i] " Like is such a comprehensive word , "[1766-i] [he]1766-i says , with a slight , impatient contracting of [his]1766-i straight brows . " [You]1766-i like [Mrs. Brown]367-mrs. brown , [I]1766-i suppose , for washing [your]1766-i clothes ? "[1766-i] " [I]1766-i like [you]1766-i better than [Mrs. Brown]367-mrs. brown . "[1766-i] " [I]1766-i did not doubt that , "[1766-i] [he]1766-i answers , laughing ; " probably [you]148-esther like [me]1766-i better than [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas , than [[my]1766-i mother]3406-my mother , than [Constance]256-constance , perhaps ; but such liking as that [I]1766-i would not stoop to pick off the ground . [I]1766-i must be first or nowhere . Am [I]1766-i first ? "[1766-i] " No , [you]1766-i are not , "[1766-i] [she]1766-i answers firmly . [His]1766-i countenance falls , as [Cain]230-cain 's did . " [I]1766-i am not ! "[1766-i] [he]1766-i repeats , in a constrained voice . " Who is then , may [I]1766-i ask ? "[1766-i] " [Jack]146-jack , [[my]1766-i brother]4340-my brother — [he]4340-my brother is , and always will be ! "[1766-i] " Bah ! "[238-sir thomas] cries [Gerard]238-sir thomas , laughing , and looking immensely relieved . " How [you]1766-i frightened [me]238-sir thomas ! "[1766-i] " Before — what 's [his]4340-my brother name?—the fellow that writes such a remarkably good hand — before [Brandon]190-bob ? " It is wearisome to hear [a person always harping on one string]4365-a person always harping on one string , "[1767-me] [she]1767-me answers coldly . " Believe [me]1767-me or not , as [you]1768-i choose ; but please spare [me]1767-me the trouble of these repeated and useless asseverations . "[1767-me] " [I]1768-i beg [your]1767-me pardon ! " [I]1768-i will never dig [him]4340-my brother up as long as [I]1768-i live . Peace to [his]4340-my brother ashes ! Oh darling ! "[1768-i] [he]1768-i continues , [his]1768-i voice changing to an emphatic , eager , impassioned key—"I have been so little used to having things go as [I]1768-i wish , that [I]1768-i can hardly believe it is [I]1768-i that am standing here . [So few people]4366-so few people are ! Not a soul in [the wide world]4367-the wide world , [I]1768-i do believe , except [[my]1768-i old mother]4368-my old mother . [The girl that [I]1768-i told [you]148-esther about last night]4369-the girl that i told you about last night lay in [my]1768-i arms , and let [me]1768-i kiss [her]4369-the girl that i told you about last night as [you]148-esther are doing ; [she]4369-the girl that i told you about last night kissed [me]1768-i back again , as [you]148-esther do not do ; [I]1768-i looked into [her]4369-the girl that i told you about last night eyes , and they seemed true as truth itself , and all the while [she]4369-the girl that i told you about last night was lying to [me]1768-i : [my]1768-i very touch must have been hateful to [her]4369-the girl that i told you about last night , as it is to [you]148-esther , perhaps ? "[1768-i] " [You]1769-i are always referring to that — [that person]1417-that person , "[148-esther] says [Esther]148-esther , lifting great jealous eyes , and a mouth like a ripe cleft cherry , through the misty twilight towards [him]1769-i . " [I]148-esther perceive that [I]148-esther am only a pis aller after all . "[1769-i] [He]1769-i may afford to be magnanimous . " Come , "[553-a woman] [she]553-a woman says , with a slight shiver , " let [us]4374-we go [home]701-home . "[164-st. john] " Does [he]238-sir thomas always say the same ? "[148-esther] asks [Esther]148-esther , smiling . " Always . "[148-esther] " [I]1774-he may very probably d — n [the servants]4284-the servants , and be upset for a whole evening if there are lumps in the melted butter ; [I]1774-he may very probably insist on [your]148-esther playing backgammon with [me]1774-he every evening , and insist , likewise , on [your]148-esther being invariably beaten . "[1773-they] [They]1773-they both laugh ; but in [Esther]148-esther 's laugh there is a ring of bitterness , which [she]148-esther [herself]148-esther hears , and wonders that [he]1774-he does not . As [they]1773-they near [the house]687-the house , [they]1773-they see thin slits of crimson light through the dining - room shutters . " Who knows ? to - morrow [we]1773-they may be dead ; to - day [we]1773-they are as [gods]4385-gods , knowing good and evil . " There can be but one explanation of that , "[1774-he] [he]1774-he says , angrily . " If [you]1774-he only knew — , "[148-esther] begins [Esther]148-esther , with an uncertain half - inclination to confess , though late . " If [you]148-esther are going to tell [me]1774-he anything disagreeable , "[1774-he] [he]1774-he says , quickly putting [his]1774-he hand before [her]148-esther mouth , " stop ! Tell [me]1774-he to - morrow , or the day after , but not now — not now ! ' "[1774-he] [She]148-esther is silent . " And yet , perhaps , it would be better if [I]148-esther knew the end of [your]1774-he sentence ; if [I]148-esther only knew — what?—how little [you]1774-he care about [me]148-esther ? "[148-esther] " [You]1776-his are mistaken , "[148-esther] [she]148-esther answers , roused into vehemence . " [I]148-esther love [you]1776-his so well , that [I]148-esther have grown hateful to [myself]148-esther ! "[148-esther] and having spoken thus oracularly , [she]148-esther raises [herself]148-esther on tip - toe , lifts two shy burning lips to [his]1776-his , and kisses [him]1776-his voluntarily . Then , amazed at [her]148-esther own audacity , clothed with shame as with a garment , [she]148-esther tears [herself]148-esther out of [his]1776-his arms , as in delightful surprise [he]1776-his catches [her]148-esther to [his]1776-his heart , and flies with frenzied haste into [the house]687-the house . THE sweetness of September is that of the last few days spent with [a friend that goeth on a very long journey]1778-a friend that goeth on a very long journey ; and [we]1779-our know not whether , when [he]1778-a friend that goeth on a very long journey returneth , [we]1779-our shall go to meet [him]1778-a friend that goeth on a very long journey with outstretched arms , or shall smile up at [him]1778-a friend that goeth on a very long journey only through the eyes of the daisies that flower upon [our]1779-our straight green graves . " [Our]1779-our sweetest songs are those that tell of saddest thought , "[1779-our] and [our]1779-our sweetest seasons are , to [my]0-i thinking , those in which the ecstasies of possession are mixed with the soft pain of expected parting . A September sun — such a one as warmly kissed the quiet faces of [[our]1779-our young dead heroes]1780-our young dead heroes , as [they]1780-our young dead heroes lay thick together on [[Alma]372-alma 's hill]1781-alma 's hill - side — is shining down with even mildness upon the just and the unjust , upon [Constance Blessington]256-constance 's grass - green gown as [she]256-constance sits at breakfast , and on the hair crown of yellow gold with which [Providence]132-providence has seen fit to circle [her]256-constance dull fair brows . " [I]256-constance think that [you]148-esther must have regretted being in such a hurry to run away from [the garden]846-the garden and [us]1779-our , "[256-constance] [she]256-constance is saying , with a gentle smile of lady - like malice , to [Esther]148-esther , à propos of [her]256-constance yesterday 's misadventure . " Sitting in the shade eating nectarines is certainly pleasanter occupation than grovelling on [your]148-esther hands and knees on [a mud - bank]4388-a mud - bank , "[148-esther] replies [Esther]148-esther , demurely . " [St. John]164-st. john is so terribly energetic ! "[258-miss blessington] says [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington , rather lackadaisically ; " [he]670-the young man would have walked [me]258-miss blessington off the face of [the earth]708-the earth long ago if [I]258-miss blessington had let [him]670-the young man . "[258-miss blessington] Remembering the Chinese invitation , [Esther]148-esther can not repress an involuntary smile . " What about [St. John]164-st. john ? "[670-the young man] says [the young man]670-the young man , entering ; having caught [his]670-the young man own name , with that wonderful acuteness of hearing with which every one is endowed when [themselves]1783-themselves are in question . " Much better have stuck to [[your]148-esther parish church]4390-your parish church , "[238-sir thomas] says [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas , brandishing a large red and yellow bandanna , which is part of the old English costume , " than gone scrambling heigh - go - mad over hedges and ditches after new - fangled Puseyite mummeries ! "[238-sir thomas] [Gerard]238-sir thomas and [[his]238-sir thomas betrothed]3581-his betrothed exchange a glance of intelligence . [Gerard]238-sir thomas is looking slightly sentimental ; [his]238-sir thomas head is a little on one side ; but on [his]238-sir thomas discovering that [he]238-sir thomas is an object of attention to [Constance]256-constance , it returns rather suddenly to the perpendicular . [Esther]148-esther 's eyes are brillianter than their wo nt ; [her]148-esther cheeks are flushed with a deeper hue than the crimson lips of a foreign shell , but it is not the flush of a newly - departed sleep . [The angel of slumber]1785-the angel of slumber has passed by the portals of [her]148-esther brain , as [the destroying angel]1786-the destroying angel passed by the blood - painted lintels of [Israel]74-israel . Thoughts sweeter than virgin honey , thoughts bitterer than gall , have kept [her]148-esther wakeful . Ere [she]148-esther went to bed , [she]148-esther spent three hours in writing letters of dismissal to [Brandon]190-bob , and at the end left [him]190-bob undismissed . " [I]148-esther can not write it to [him]190-bob ! "[148-esther] [she]148-esther cries , sitting up in bed in the dark , and flinging out blind arms into the black nothingness around [her]148-esther ; " anything written sounds so harsh , so abrupt , so hard . [I]148-esther must tell [him]190-bob [myself]148-esther very gradually and gently , and tell [him]190-bob how sorry [I]148-esther am , and beg [him]190-bob to forgive [me]148-esther , and cry — go down on [my]148-esther knees , perhaps . No ; [I]148-esther should look such [a fool]4286-a fool if [I]148-esther did that ! After all , [no one]891-no one cries long over spilt milk — least of all any one so sensible and utterly unimaginative as poor dear [Bob]190-bob . "[148-esther] And with that , thinking in a disparaging , hold - cheap way of [him]190-bob and [his]190-bob love , [she]148-esther turns the pillow over to try and find a cooler place on the under side for [her]148-esther burning face to rest on . " Two dissyllabic names now passing many mouths by three dissyllabic names are here expressed , "[258-miss blessington] reads [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington , with distinct gravity , after breakfast that morning , out of an acrostic book that lies on the work - table before [her]148-esther , while [Esther]148-esther sits opposite with pencil and paper , ready to write down the products of the joint wisdom of [their]1787-their two minds . But the top of the pencil is being bitten by [the young scribe]1788-the young scribe 's short white teeth , and [her]148-esther eyes are straying away absently — away through the open window and out to the sunshiny sward , where two of [St. John]164-st. john 's dogs , forbidden by [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas on pain of death , to set paw within [the house]687-the house , are rolling over one another , making abortive bites at [each other]909-each other 's hind legs , and waggishly , with much growling and mumbling , taking each other 's heads into [their]1787-their mouths . " That is the whole , "[256-constance] continues [Constance]256-constance . " These are the proofs ; [a woman]553-a woman , [a wise man]4394-a wise man , [a king]4395-a king , [a poet]4396-a poet , [a beauty]4397-a beauty ! "[256-constance] Silence . " [A woman]553-a woman ! [Esther]148-esther makes no suggestion . " [A woman]553-a woman ! "[258-miss blessington] repeats [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington , raising [her]258-miss blessington voice a little . A — what did [you]258-miss blessington say ? "[148-esther] " [A woman]553-a woman ! "[258-miss blessington] repeats [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington , for the third and last time . " [A woman]553-a woman ! "[258-miss blessington] echoes [Esther]148-esther , vacantly ; " that is rather vague , is it not ? "[148-esther] " Let [us]4403-us try the next , then , "[256-constance] says [Constance]256-constance , obligingly : " [A wise man]4394-a wise man . "[256-constance] " [Solomon]154-solomon ! "[148-esther] answers [Esther]148-esther , glibly . " [I]256-constance said a dissyllable name , "[256-constance] remarks [Constance]256-constance , with gentle asperity . The door opens , and [St. John]164-st. john enters . " Tell [us]4403-us [a wise man]4394-a wise man 's name ? "[164-st. john] " Who was [a wise man]4394-a wise man ? "[1791-we] cry [they]1791-we both in a breath . " [Solomon]154-solomon ! "[164-st. john] replies [St. John]164-st. john , brilliantly . " So [I]148-esther said , "[148-esther] says [Esther]148-esther , smiling ; " but , unluckily , it must be [a two - syllabled wise man]4407-a two - syllabled wise man . " "[3402-a man] [[Your]3402-a man future wife]1804-your future wife ! " [she]0-i repeats , with a dreamy , mournful smile . "[3402-a man] Am [I]0-i that ? [I]0-i think not . " There is a pause — a little brief pause — in which [that shyest , fleetest - winged of [earth]911-earth 's visitants]4432-that shyest , fleetest - winged of earth 's visitants — Happiness — folds [her]0-i pinions and settles down for a little minute on two beating , trembling human hearts . [I]0-i am half divided between that and toothache , only [I]0-i suppose that the latter necessitates the simulating of acute bodily torture , and subjects [one]559-one to unlimited offers of boiled figs , hopbags , laudanum , and the Lord knows what . " [Gerard]238-sir thomas had found [[his]238-sir thomas betrothed]3581-his betrothed stubborner than [he]238-sir thomas had expected as to [her]148-esther expressed resolution of departure . Looking at the childish roundness of [her]148-esther soft face , at the dewy meekness of [her]148-esther heavenly eyes , [he]238-sir thomas had fancied [her]148-esther malleable by [his]238-sir thomas hand , as clay by [the potter]4440-the potter 's ; and so , in most things , [she]148-esther would have been . In most things , it was to [her]148-esther easier to yield than to resist — less trouble — and , besides , it pleased [people]3426-people ; but in the one prime passion of [her]148-esther life , [her]148-esther love for [[her]148-esther brother]644-her brother , [you]4443-you might as well try to move [the Tower of [London]16-london]4444-the tower of london with [your]4443-you finger and thumb as to stir [her]148-esther . The sole concession [he]644-her brother could win from [her]148-esther was that of one day , the day of the ball . "[1817-we] [We]1817-we may imagine the clock put on thirty years , and [ourselves]1817-we already in possession , " [he]644-her brother says , laughing—"only[1817-we] minus the gout and wrinkles and spectacles [we]1817-we shall also have come into possession of by then . " "[3426-people] What the devil do [people]3426-people mean , " says [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas , entering [the morning - room]1576-the morning - room that evening after dinner , with [his]238-sir thomas hair brushed up into - a stiff cockatoo , and tugging away at a huge pair of white kid gloves , off which [he]238-sir thomas has already succeeded in bursting both buttons , "[3426-people] dragging [a man]3402-a man away from [[his]3402-a man own fireside]1820-his own fireside to see [a lot of fools]1821-a lot of fools cutting capers , and flourishing [their]1821-a lot of fools heels in each other 's faces ? " From [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas 's description one would imagine that [the Cancan]4447-the cancan was habitually danced at the balls [he]238-sir thomas frequents . The door opens , and [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington makes [her]258-miss blessington appearance ; looking , not vain or conscious , but calmly defiant of [any one]523-any one to make a better — a triumph of lace and tulle and flowers , and milk - white flesh , and grand , cold curves and contours . "[3426-people] Oh , how beautiful ! " cries [Essie]180-essie , clasping [her]180-essie little hands , with the unaffected admiration of [one handsome woman]4449-one handsome woman for [another]4450-another . "[3426-people] [I]0-i know it is rude to make personal remarks ; but is not [she]1822-she , [Lady Gerard]239-lady gerard ? " "[239-lady gerard] It is a pretty dress , " replies [miladi]278-miladi , whose unwieldy bulk not even the cunningest of Parisian couturières has been able to fashion into anything nearer than an approximation to any shape at all ; "[239-lady gerard] but [I]0-i never think that [Elise]300-elise 's taste is as good as [Jane Clarke]240-jane 's used to be . " [Constance]256-constance has walked to a pier - glass , and is examining with anxiety a bite that a gnat has been savage enough to inflict on [her]256-constance face , a little under the lower lip , and which has been disturbing [her]256-constance wonted composed serenity ever since 3 P.M. , when the catastrophe took place . "[240-jane] Does it show much ? " [she]256-constance asks , turning with a concerned , serious look to [Esther]148-esther . "[240-jane] Oh no ! hardly at all . " "[0-i] [I]0-i think [I]0-i will put a little bit of sticking - plaster on it , " [she]0-i continues , gravely . "[0-i] It will only look like a patch ; and patches are always so becoming . " "[0-i] Let [me]0-i go and get [you]0-i a bit ! " cries [Essie]180-essie , good - naturedly , running off . When [she]0-i returns [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas is saying , fussily : "[0-i] Now , why is not [that boy]1823-that boy dressed ? Always the same ! Always late ! Never in time for anything ! " "[1823-that boy] [He]1823-that boy is not coming , [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas ; [he]1823-that boy has got a headache , and is gone to lie down — at least [he]1823-that boy said so , " replies [Constance]256-constance , coldly , but casting a scrutinising glance at [Esther]148-esther ( who is deftly , with a small pair of scissors , cutting out a little circle of sticking - plaister ) as [she]256-constance speaks . "[1823-that boy] Stuff and nonsense ! " cries "[1823-that boy] [that boy]1823-that boy 's " papa , angrily—"a[3952-miladi] pack of lies ! A fine [Miss Molly]387-mary [you]387-mary have made of [[your]387-mary son]825-your son , [miladi]3952-miladi ! [He]1823-that boy 'll be afraid of going out shooting next year for fear of getting [his]1823-that boy feet wet ! " "[1823-that boy] Is that about the right size " inquires [Esther]148-esther , timidly , raising a pair of guilty pink cheeks , and exhibiting the result of [her]148-esther labours on the point of the scissors . "[1827-good god] [Good God]1827-good god ! [miladi]3952-miladi , do take that plaguy long tail of yours up ! How the devil can [I]0-i help treading on it ? " These are the last sweet words of [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas , as [he]238-sir thomas follows [wife]4219-wife and [ward]4452-ward into [the carriage]3788-the carriage . [They]4454-they are gone , and [Essie]180-essie sits down in [the large empty room]4455-the large empty room to await the resurrection of [[her]180-essie lover]683-her lover . The sort of shy half - fear which always assails [her]180-essie at [his]1823-that boy expected approach comes over [her]180-essie more strongly than ever . A distant door bangs faintly somewhere about [the house]687-the house ; then another nearer . "[1823-that boy] [He]1823-that boy is coming ! " [she]180-essie says to [herself]180-essie , and the quick blood rushes tingling to [her]180-essie fingers ' ends . It is a hot night , and the tall French windows stand unshuttered and open . Some impulse of timid coquetry urges [her]180-essie to flee from before [him]1823-that boy : [she]180-essie is ashamed that [he]1823-that boy should see the plain letters of joy written on [her]180-essie face at [his]1823-that boy coming : [she]180-essie would fain have yet a few moments of the happiness of expectancy , to [whose delights those of reality are but seldom comparable]4458-whose delights those of reality are but seldom comparable . From [the terrace]1152-the terrace a flight of stone steps leads down , with many a twist , to [the mere]4460-the mere . In a minute [Essie]180-essie has run lightly down , and is standing by [the water]4461-the water 's edge . [The dahlias]4462-the dahlias are nodding [their]4462-the dahlias round drowsy heads , and [the sentinel hollyhocks]4463-the sentinel hollyhocks stand up stiff and pompous with [their]4463-the sentinel hollyhocks clustered flower - spikes — [rulers]4464-rulers and [law - givers]4465-law - givers among [the flower - people]4466-the flower - people ; the little ripples are biting with playful tooth the low sedge - banks , and the tall bulrush forest , whence [the coot]4467-the coot and [the waterhen families]4468-the waterhen families sailed out into life in the warm spring weather . To and fro rock the heavy , lazy , water - lily leaves , whose bloom - time is past two months ago . Through [[her]180-essie garden]3454-her garden , the sky , the high moon walks stately , holding [her]180-essie silver lamp , in whose light all things shine deliciously . [Essie]180-essie stands entranced . It seems to [her]180-essie like [the intermediate residence of [some happy soul]4471-some happy soul , freed from [the world]672-the world 's toil and moil]4470-the intermediate residence of some happy soul , freed from the world 's toil and moil , shrived from sin , emancipated from life , where it should dwell in tempered bliss till that last day when heaven 's brighter glories , stronger raptures , should burst upon and clothe it for aye . [She]180-essie strolls along [the narrow gravel path]4473-the narrow gravel path , bathing [her]180-essie hands with childish delight in the moonbeams , and then stoops and picks up two or three little stones that the night 's sweet alchemy has gifted with a bright short glory not [their]4466-the flower - people own . So stooping , [she]180-essie hears [a man]3402-a man 's quick firm foot running down [the garden steps]4475-the garden steps . [She]180-essie raises [herself]180-essie , and goes to meet [him]3402-a man with "[1823-that boy] a moonlight - coloured smile " on [her]180-essie face . "[1823-that boy] Are n't [they]1829-they lovely ? " [she]180-essie asks , holding up [her]180-essie pebbly treasures for [him]3402-a man to look at . Not speaking , [he]3402-a man takes the little pink palm , stones and all , into [his]3402-a man hand , and looks into [her]180-essie face ; and then , as if yielding to a temptation that [he]3402-a man hates , that [he]3402-a man would fain resist , and to which , being over - strong , [he]3402-a man must yet succumb , [he]3402-a man snatches [her]180-essie to [his]3402-a man breast , and kisses [her]180-essie fiercely — eyelids , lips , and neck — with a violence [he]3402-a man is [himself]3402-a man hardly conscious of . "[1823-that boy] Stop ! " [she]180-essie cries , surprised , half - shocked , pushing [him]3402-a man away from [her]180-essie . "[1830-you] What do [you]1830-you mean ? [You]1830-you frighten [me]0-i ! " [He]3402-a man recollects [himself]3402-a man instantly , and releases [her]180-essie . "[1830-you] It is alarming being kissed , especially when [you]1830-you are not used to it , " [he]3402-a man answers , with a sneer . [She]180-essie looks up at [him]3402-a man in blank astonishment . Has [he]3402-a man gone mad ? Is it the moonlight that has given [him]3402-a man that white wrathy look ? "[1830-you] Something has happened ! " [she]180-essie says , quickly . "[1830-you] What is it ? tell [me]0-i ! " "[1830-you] Oh ! nothing — a mere bagatelle ! " [he]3402-a man replies , with a little bitter laugh . "[1830-you] It is only that [I]0-i have been hearing a pleasant piece of news . " "[0-i] What is it ? " "[0-i] Only that [an acquaintance of mine]1831-an acquaintance of mine is going to be married ! " "[1831-an acquaintance of mine] Is it [an acquaintance of mine]1831-an acquaintance of mine too ? " "[1831-an acquaintance of mine] About the most intimate [you]1830-you have , [I]0-i should say : [yourself]1830-you , in fact ! " "[0-i] Is that news ? " [she]180-essie asks , trying to smile . "[0-i] [I]0-i am going to be married , am not [I]0-i , to [you]1830-you ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i am not aware that [my]0-i name is — [Brandon]190-bob , " [he]3402-a man answers , coldly , while [his]3402-a man sorrowful , fierce eyes go through [her]180-essie heart like poisoned arrows . [She]180-essie turns [her]180-essie head aside and groans . A great vague darkness blots out the broad moon , and the stars ' thick cohorts ; the bright water beside [her]180-essie grows black as hell 's sluggish rivers . [He]3402-a man had not known how much [he]3402-a man had been buoyed up by hope till that mute gesture of hers bid [him]3402-a man despair . "[190-bob] It 's true , then ? " [he]3402-a man asks in a voice of sharp rage and anguish , catching hold of the white wonder of [her]180-essie arm , on which [his]3402-a man fingers , unwittingly cruel , leave crimson prints . "[190-bob] Is what true ? " [she]180-essie asks , faintly , trying for yet a little longer to stave off Fate , to push away [Nemesis]199-nemesis , with [her]180-essie weak woman - fingers . "[190-bob] That [you]1830-you are — [God]435-god ! am [I]0-i choking?—engaged to [Brandon]190-bob ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i was once , " [she]180-essie falters under [her]180-essie breath . "[0-i] How long ago ? " "[0-i] When first [I]0-i came [here]3398-here . " "[0-i] And since then [you]0-i have written to break it off ? " [he]3402-a man asks , while a tone of joyful hope vibrates in [his]3402-a man deep voice . "[0-i] No , [I]0-i have not , " [she]180-essie answers , in a frightened whisper . [St. John]164-st. john 's face gathers blackness . "[0-i] [I]0-i am to understand , then , " [he]3402-a man resumes , in a constrained voice , out of which [the man]3894-the man 's strong will keeps the pent passion from bursting forth , "[0-i] that [you]0-i belonged to [him]190-bob at the time when [I]0-i kept [you]0-i out of bed one night to listen to an interesting chapter in [my]0-i own autobiography ? " "[0-i] Yes . " "[0-i] And when , in reply to [my]0-i inquiries , [you]0-i denied having any connection beyond common acquaintance with — with [him]190-bob ? " "[0-i] Yes . " "[0-i] And when [you]0-i were good enough to overlook all trifling obstacles , and to consent to marry [me]0-i ? " "[0-i] Yes . " The little catechism ended , the last cobweb of doubt torn away , [they]4477-they stand dumb . [Esther]148-esther 's guilty head sinks down on [her]148-esther breast as a flower 's head sinks overladen with rain . Suddenly [she]148-esther looks up and stretches out [her]148-esther arms . "[0-i] Speak to [me]0-i ! " [she]148-esther says , huskily . "[0-i] Curse [me]0-i ! strike [me]0-i ! call [me]0-i some bad name — only speak ! " "[0-i] [I]0-i wish to God [you]0-i were [a man]3402-a man ! " [he]3402-a man answers , in a hard , low voice ; while [his]3402-a man straight brows draw together into one dark line across [his]3402-a man face , and [his]3402-a man lips look white and thin under [his]3402-a man moustache . "[0-i] That [you]0-i might kill [me]0-i ! " [she]0-i says , incoherent with excitement . "[0-i] Well , kill [me]0-i now ! If revenge is so pleasant to [you]0-i , [I]0-i give [you]0-i leave ! " "[0-i] Let [us]1835-us have no heroics , please , " says [he]3402-a man , contemptuously ; "[0-i] [you]0-i do n't appear to be aware that it is not the fashion for [English gentlemen]1579-english gentlemen to murder [women who make fools of [them]1579-english gentlemen]1837-women who make fools of them . It may be a sensible practice , but it is at present confined to the tiers état . " Having spoken , [he]3402-a man makes a slight movement to depart . "[0-i] Are [you]0-i going to give [me]0-i up ? " [she]0-i cries , smiting [her]0-i hands together , and forgetting in [her]0-i great dismay to reflect whether the remonstrance accorded well with [her]0-i dignity or not . "[0-i] [I]0-i have no claim upon [you]0-i , " [he]3402-a man answers , icily . "[0-i] What do [you]0-i mean ? " [she]0-i cries , passionately . "[0-i] [You]0-i are unjust . There could be nothing too bad for [him]1838-him to say of [me]0-i , but what injury have [I]0-i done [you]0-i ? [You]0-i ought to thank [me]0-i and praise [me]0-i for having been wicked and dishonourable and double - dealing for [your]0-i sake . " "[0-i] For [my]0-i sake ! " [he]3402-a man repeats , with a sardonic smile . "[0-i] [I]0-i am hardly so conceited as to take it personally . " "[0-i] What do [you]0-i mean ? " [she]0-i asks , quickly . "[0-i] If [I]0-i did not do it for [your]0-i sake , for whose did [I]0-i ? " [He]3402-a man is silent . "[0-i] Do [you]0-i mean , " [she]0-i inquires , slowly , [her]0-i cheeks paling to the whiteness of snowdrops blowing , "[0-i] that [you]0-i think [I]0-i gave [him]1839-him up because [I]0-i wanted to be [a grand lady]1840-a grand lady — because [I]0-i wanted to have all these fine things " ( looking round at [the flowering gardens]4478-the flowering gardens , at [the broad lake]4479-the broad lake , at [the stately house]4480-the stately house shimmering in the moonshine ) "[0-i] belonging to [me]0-i ? " "[0-i] If such is [your]0-i opinion of [me]0-i , " [she]0-i says , turning away indignantly , "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't wonder at [your]0-i being in such a hurry to be rid of [me]0-i ! " [He]3402-a man looks askance at [her]0-i out of the corners of [his]3402-a man eyes . [She]0-i has hidden [her]0-i face in [her]0-i hands , but by the panting breast and heaved white shoulder [he]3402-a man sees that [she]0-i is weeping — that a storm of sobs is shaking [her]0-i childish frame . "[0-i] [I]0-i am in a hurry to be rid of [you]0-i ! " [he]3402-a man says , harshly , steeling [himself]3402-a man against [her]0-i . "[0-i] From [a woman who could throw [a man]3402-a man over with the deliberate , cold - blooded artlessness [you]0-i have done]1844-a woman who could throw a man over with the deliberate , cold - blooded artlessness you have done , one may well sing ' Te Deum ' for beirg rescued in time . " [She]0-i flings up [her]0-i little head proudly , and the dusk splendour of [her]0-i eyes blazes through great tears . "[0-i] Listen to [me]0-i ! " [she]0-i says , laying hold of [his]3402-a man arm with one small burning hand . "[0-i] [I]0-i am [a bad girl]1846-a bad girl , [I]0-i know , but [I]0-i am not [the calculating , mercenary wretch [you]0-i take [me]0-i for]1847-the calculating , mercenary wretch you take me for . [I]0-i tell [you]0-i honestly that the first day [I]0-i came [here]3398-here — [I]0-i had never been staying at [a great house]1849-a great house before — [I]0-i thought it must be pleasant to live in [large rooms]1850-large rooms , and have gilt and ormolu and fine pictures about one , and to have [carriages]1396-carriages and horses and [servants]1158-servants , and not to be obliged to think twice before one spent sixpence ; and [I]0-i thought , too " ( [her]0-i long neck droops , and [she]0-i blushes painfully as [she]0-i makes the confession ) , "[0-i] what a pity it was that [I]0-i was already engaged , for that otherwise , as [I]0-i was pretty , [you]0-i might have taken a fancy to [me]0-i — " [She]0-i stops , choked with maiden shame . Upon [his]4481-his averted face an enduring flush , like a hectic autumn leaf 's , burns red and angry . "[0-i] But as soon as [I]0-i saw [you]0-i , almost , " [she]0-i continues , commanding [her]0-i tears with great difficulty—"as[0-i] soon as [you]0-i spoke to [me]0-i , all such thoughts went out of [my]0-i head . [I]0-i do n't know why [they]1853-they did , " [she]0-i says , simply . "[0-i] [You]0-i were not particularly pleasant or civil ; [I]0-i did not think [you]0-i good - looking , and [you]0-i gave [me]0-i the idea of being ill - tempered ; but " ( with a sigh ) "[559-one] [one]559-one can not reason about those sort of things . [I]0-i began to think so much about what [you]0-i were , that [I]0-i forgot to remember what [you]0-i had . " [He]4482-he makes no comment upon [her]0-i confession . "[0-i] Do [you]0-i believe [me]0-i ? " [she]0-i asks , eagerly , [her]0-i little fingers tightening their clasp upon [his]4482-he coat - sleeve . Still [he]4482-he is dumb . "[0-i] Do [you]0-i ? " [she]0-i repeats , excitedly , the quick breath passing to and fro pantingly across the threshold of [her]0-i crimson lips . "[0-i] Why do [you]0-i insist on making [me]0-i uncivil ? " [he]4482-he says , with a sarcastic smile . "[0-i] [I]0-i do not believe [you]0-i . [I]0-i dare say [you]0-i fancy [you]0-i are telling truth ; but if [another man]3623-another man were to come on the scene with a few thousands a - year more , and a higher position in the social scale , [you]0-i would enact the same part over again . [Women]547-women must be true to [their]547-women instincts . [Those who are bent on rising]1857-those who are bent on rising must kick down the ladder by which [they]1857-those who are bent on rising have climbed : it is an irreversible law . " "[0-i] [You]0-i are mistaken , " [she]0-i says , eagerly . "[0-i] [I]0-i have no desire to climb ; if [I]0-i came here with any silly , childish idea that [rich people]1858-rich people were happier than [poor ones]1859-poor ones , [I]0-i have been quite disillusioned . [Bob]190-bob " ( how oddly the little unromantic name comes in among [her]0-i heroics ! ) — "[190-bob] [Bob]190-bob is [a happier man than [you]0-i are , though [he]190-bob is only [a lieutenant in [a foot regiment]1862-a foot regiment]1861-a lieutenant in a foot regiment , and has next to nothing to live upon]1860-a happier man than you are , though he is only a lieutenant in a foot regiment , and has next to nothing to live upon . " "[0-i] [I]0-i have no doubt that [Bob]190-bob " ( with a little sneering emphasis on the monosyllable ) "[190-bob] is in all respects [a very superior person to [me]0-i]1863-a very superior person to me , " says [St. John]164-st. john , with a bitter pale smile , like a gleam of wrathful sunlight on a day of east wind and clouds and driving sleet . "[190-bob] [I]0-i quite agree with [you]0-i , " [she]0-i answers eagerly , [her]0-i great eyes flashing angry , like unwonted meteors that blaze fitful in the winter sky , "[0-i] and [I]0-i wish to Heaven [I]0-i had never left [him]190-bob ! " Over [Gerard]238-sir thomas 's features a spasm , contracting and puckering them , passes ugly and painful ; [his]238-sir thomas hands clench themselves in the mightiness of [his]238-sir thomas effort to govern [his]238-sir thomas smitten soul . "[0-i] That is easily remedied , " [he]238-sir thomas answers , after a little pause , in a clear cold voice . "[0-i] Why should not [you]0-i go back to [him]190-bob as [you]0-i came ? " [she]0-i cries , scornfully , voice trembling and lip quivering with passion . "[0-i] [You]0-i are like [the woman in the Judgment of [Solomon]154-solomon]1864-the woman in the judgment of solomon , who said , ' Let it be neither [mine]1864-the woman in the judgment of solomon nor thine , but divide it ! ' [You]0-i love [me]0-i ! [You]0-i never did ! [[My]0-i God]1865-my god , [I]0-i wish it had ! " Through the proud calmness of [his]4483-he voice penetrates a tone of bitter , unwilling tenderness . " [she]0-i repeats , in [her]0-i sweet , vibrating voice . "[0-i] Because [I]0-i have not the faith that removes mountains , " [he]4483-he answers , harshly ; "[0-i] because a thing must be probable , or at least possible , before [I]0-i can give credit to it ; because [I]0-i am unable to understand how , for [a man whom [you]0-i confess to having thought ill - looking , ill - tempered , and ill - mannered , [you]0-i could , out of pure disinterested love , throw over one to whom [you]0-i must , at least , have pretended to be sincerely attached]1867-a man whom you confess to having thought ill - looking , ill - tempered , and ill - mannered , you could , out of pure disinterested love , throw over one to whom you must , at least , have pretended to be sincerely attached . " If [I]1868-he were to marry [you]180-essie now , "[1868-he] [he]1868-he says , resolutely , " [my]1868-he life would be one long suspicion : [I]1868-he should love [you]180-essie madly , and should disbelieve in [you]180-essie . " Because a faith once broken can never be mended , "[1868-he] [he]1868-he answers , sternly—"it may be patched up , but a patched faith will not do to go through life with ; because [a woman who has deceived [a man]3402-a man once for one object]4486-a woman who has deceived a man once for one object may deceive [him]3402-a man a second time for another . "[1868-he] [She]180-essie withdraws [her]180-essie rejected hand , and falls to weeping sorelier than ever , but very mutely . " What madness induced [you]180-essie to tell [me]1868-he so many lies ? "[1868-he] [he]1868-he cries , passionately , with mournful severity . " Were [you]180-essie bent on putting a gulf , that could never be bridged through all eternity , between [us]4489-us ? Did not [you]180-essie know that that is the one sin [I]1868-he could never forget or forgive ? "[1868-he] " What had [I]180-essie done to [her]256-constance ? " "[182-heaven] What had [I]0-i done to [her]180-essie , " [she]0-i says , in a sort of wonder , "[0-i] that [she]180-essie should do [me]0-i such a mischief ? " Looking at [her]0-i as [she]0-i stands with upturned eyes , like [some sweet prayerful saint]4491-some sweet prayerful saint or penitent [Magdalen]389-magdalen , drawn by a cunning hand that has been resolved three centuries back into elemental dust — dust that has stopped a bunghole perhaps , like [Alexander's]390-alexander's — [Gerard]238-sir thomas 's resolution breaks a little ; not [his]238-sir thomas resolution of parting from [her]0-i — that remains firm as ever — but [his]238-sir thomas power of so parting with nonchalant coldness : "[180-essie] [Child]391-child ! " [he]238-sir thomas cries , a little roughly , and yet with a half - groan , placing a hand heavily on each of [her]0-i shoulders—"Child[180-essie] ! why are [you]391-child so pretty ? If it was [your]391-child nature to be deceitful and underhand , why could not [you]391-child be ugly too ? [Your]391-child beauty is the one thing about [you]391-child that [I]0-i believe in , and it drives [me]0-i distracted ! " "[0-i] And yet , " [she]0-i answers , with a melancholy smile , "[0-i] [you]0-i told [me]0-i just now , very calmly , to go back to — to [him]1873-his : [you]0-i seemed to contemplate with great equanimity the prospect of seeing [me]0-i and [my]0-i distracting beauty " ( with a bitter emphasis ) "[0-i] in [another man]3623-another man 's possession . " "[0-i] [You]391-child are mistaken , " [he]1873-his answers , with quick violence . "[391-child] By [God]435-god 's help , [I]0-i 'll never see [you]391-child again after to - night . " Hearing that heavy sentence , [her]0-i knees tremble beneath [her]0-i a little ; a momentary dimness comes over [her]0-i eyes ; voice , breath , and heart seem to suspend their functions . No word of protest , of lamentation , of entreaty , crosses [her]0-i whitened lips . "[0-i] What right have [I]0-i to be with [you]391-child ? " [he]1873-his asks , indignantly—"I[0-i] , who can not see [you]391-child without coveting [you]391-child ? What right have [I]0-i to steal [[another man]3623-another man 's wife]1876-another man 's wife , any more than [his]3623-another man horse or [his]3623-another man money ? " "[0-i] Let [me]0-i go , then , " [she]0-i answers , with a low , moaning sigh—"since[0-i] it must be so . [You]391-child know what is right better than [I]0-i do . Good - bye ! " "[391-child] Good - bye ! " [he]1873-his answers , very shortly , and turns away [his]1873-his head sharply , that only [the lake]4492-the lake and the stars may see the distortion that the passion of that parting is working on [his]1873-his face . "[391-child] Say [you]391-child forgive [me]0-i before [I]0-i go ! " says the tender , tremulous voice , that might unman [a hero]4493-a hero — might unsaint [an anchorite]4494-an anchorite — as [she]0-i lingers yet a little minute beside [him]1873-his . " [she]0-i says , sobbingly , the words coming a little wildly through a tempest of tears . "[0-i] [I]0-i can not go unless [you]0-i do ; if [I]0-i went now , [I]0-i should remember [you]0-i all [my]0-i life as [you]0-i are to - day ; to - day would blot out all the happy hours [we]1878-we have been together ! " For all answer [he]1873-his turns away from [her]0-i , and buries [his]1873-his face in [his]1873-his hands . "[0-i] Look at [me]0-i kindly once again ! " [she]0-i says , calmness growing out of [her]0-i strong emotion , putting up [her]0-i two small hands and trying to draw [his]1873-his away from before [his]1873-his hidden face . "[0-i] [I]0-i may be very wicked ; [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i am — as [you]0-i say so — mean , underhand , deceitful ; but yet , for the sake of what is gone , look at [me]0-i kindly once again : that wo n't hurt [you]0-i , as it is for the very last time ! " Still [Gerard]238-sir thomas remains speechless — not from obstinacy , but because [he]238-sir thomas can not command [his]238-sir thomas voice : and [his]238-sir thomas pride revolts from speaking shakily , quaveringly , like [an hysterical woman]4495-an hysterical woman or [paralytic old man]4496-paralytic old man . "[0-i] If [I]0-i were [a thief]1879-a thief , or [a murderer]1880-a murderer ! " [he]238-sir thomas answers , with fierce vehemence , looking at [her]0-i once again as [she]0-i had asked [him]238-sir thomas — looking at [her]0-i with wrathful , reluctant passion , but not kindly . "[164-st. john] [St. John]164-st. john , " [she]0-i says , earnestly , "[164-st. john] do n't [you]164-st. john know that [people]3426-people always attend to dying requests , however foolish and unreasonable [they]3426-people may be ? This of [mine]0-i is a dying request , for after to - night [I]0-i shall be dead to [you]164-st. john . Say , ' [Essie]180-essie , [I]0-i forgive [you]164-st. john . ' " "[180-essie] What is it to [you]180-essie whether [I]0-i forgive [you]180-essie or not ? " [he]190-bob inquires , sullenly , with a certain savage pulling and biting of [his]190-bob moustache . " [he]4497-his says again , abruptly , putting out [his]4497-his hand ; feeling that the strain is too great for [him]4497-his , and that if it last much longer [he]4497-his , being but human , will break under it . "[0-i] [I]0-i can no more say ' good - bye , ' " [she]0-i says , desperately , in a passionate whisper , "[0-i] than [you]164-st. john can say ' [I]0-i forgive [you]164-st. john . Oh , [[my]0-i darling]1890-my darling ! give [me]0-i one more trial ! " [Her]0-i arms cling about [his]4497-his brown throat close as the bindweed clings about the hedges in sultry August ; [her]0-i white warm breast heaves and pants against [his]4497-his , as the sea heaves and pants against [the shore]4498-the shore 's tawny sides ; [her]0-i eyes , impassioned as only dark eyes can be — alluring , despairing — flame into [his]4497-his eyes , and down through [his]4497-his eyes into [his]4497-his heart . "[1891-such a woman] Is not it better to be tricked by [such a woman]1891-such a woman , " [Passion]394-passion whispers , "[1891-such a woman] than to spend long eons of unswerving fidelity with [one less maddeningly fair]1892-one less maddeningly fair ? Were not such moments of ecstasy very cheaply purchased , even by years of suspicion and deceit ? "[1900-tha — anks] Well , then , since [you]0-i wish it , so it must be , " [she]180-essie answers , with meek despair ; and catching suddenly [his]4501-he hand before [he]4501-he has time to prevent [her]180-essie , [she]180-essie kisses it very humbly and sorrowfully . AND so that act of the play is finished : [all the actors]4503-all the actors have strutted and fumed and fretted through [their]4503-all the actors little parts , and now the curtain has fallen . " Meanwhile [Esther]148-esther lies stretched upon the counterpane , while a gloomy pageant of all that [she]148-esther has lost passes before [her]148-esther eyes . Now , lo ! both have fallen into the water . There are a few circles , a few rising bubbles ; then all is over — gone , sunk to the bottom , to come up again never more . "[1902-your] Go back to [[your]1902-your pigstye]1903-your pigstye ! " cries [Fate]272-fate to [Esther]148-esther . [Her]399-hope heart stops pulsing for a second , then sets off galloping at the rate of a hundred and twenty a minute . Going without making any sign ! [She]399-hope leans further out of the window , and rests [her]399-hope white arms , that look whiter than any lilies in the moonlight , on the sill . [He]3402-a man is so close beneath [her]399-hope , if [the servants]4284-the servants were not there , [she]399-hope might call to [him]3402-a man ; as it is , [he]3402-a man will never know that [she]399-hope has watched [his]3402-a man departure . [He]3402-a man gives a slight start , but , instantly recovering [himself]3402-a man , walks steadily to [the cart]4530-the cart and gets in . The horse is a little fidgety at starting . "[0-i] Wo - o - o ! Gently , [old lass]1909-old lass ! " This is the affecting form that [St. John]164-st. john 's last words take . [She]399-hope cranes [her]399-hope neck out of the window ; [she]399-hope leans out [her]399-hope lithe body , reckless of the danger of losing [her]399-hope balance and tumbling on [the hard gravel drive below]4537-the hard gravel drive below , in [her]399-hope eagerness to catch the last glimpse of the lessening , dwindling bulk ; then , forgetting to shut the window , careless of any cold or stock of rheumatism that [she]399-hope might be laying up for [herself]399-hope , [she]399-hope returns to [her]399-hope former position , flings [herself]399-hope again prone on [her]399-hope bed , again buries [her]399-hope face in the pillow ; but this time no beguiling hope sits and whispers pleasant falsities to [her]399-hope . [Hope]399-hope got up upon [the dog - cart]4538-the dog - cart , and drove away with [Gerard]238-sir thomas . The night wanes ; morning dreams , that [they]4539-they say come true , invade [many sleepers]4540-many sleepers ' brains . At [Lord]4541-lord — 's ball [people]3426-people are still dancing with the fury produced by champagne and supper ; but [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas , [Miladi]278-miladi , and [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington , are at [home]701-home again , and in bed . [Constance]256-constance is not one of [those hard dancers who think that one after supper- galop]4544-those hard dancers who think that one after supper- galop is worth ten ante - cœnal ones . Not for [all the entrancing valses [Strauss]401-strauss ever composed]4545-all the entrancing valses strauss ever composed would [she]399-hope run the risk of damaging the freshness of [her]399-hope toilette , nor the still more serious risk of exchanging the marble coolness of [her]399-hope cheeks for the unsightly flush of heat or the ugly pallor of exhaustion . Dawn is just beginning stealthily to unlatch the eastern gate ; [her]399-hope torch , new - lit , makes but a puny opponent for the night 's one great and myriad lesser lamps . [Esther]148-esther has fallen into an uneasy doze , [her]148-esther damp brow and loosened hair resting on [her]148-esther bare , outflung arm . Suddenly a knock at [her]148-esther door makes [her]148-esther start up in a vague , confused horror . Is it [St. John]164-st. john come back ? Is it [some one]686-some one come to murder [her]148-esther ? A thousand impossibilities flash across [her]148-esther bewildered brain . Without waiting for permission , [the person who knocked]4547-the person who knocked enters ; not [St. John]164-st. john , nor [a murderer]1880-a murderer — only [a dishevelled housemaid]4549-a dishevelled housemaid , who has evidently just thrown a gown over [her]4549-a dishevelled housemaid night attire , and endeavoured abortively to gather up the straggling hair out of [her]4549-a dishevelled housemaid sleepy eyes under a muslin cap put on awry . "[0-i] A tallygraph for [you]1910-you , [miss]1911-miss ! " says [she]148-esther , coming forward , holding in one hand a blue envelope , and in the other a tall , solemn tallow candle , as sleepy as [herself]148-esther . A telegraphic message ! Oh hateful telegraph ! Cruellest of modern inventions ! Oh hastener of evil tidings , that , without [you]1910-you , come all too speedily ! Oh [maker of sick hearts and blanched cheeks and arrested pulses]4550-maker of sick hearts and blanched cheeks and arrested pulses ! [Esther]148-esther snatches it , while a sudden , awful cold grasps [her]148-esther heart , and reads by the wavering , feeble light these words , in [a scrawly clerk]4551-a scrawly clerk 's hand : "[147-robert] [Robert Brandon]147-robert to [Esther Craven]148-esther . Come [home]701-home instantly ; [Jack]146-jack is very ill . " With how few pen - strokes can a death - warrant be written ! Then consciousness returns , brought back by a huge , tearing , killing agony ; then even the agony yields to one intense , consuming longing — one all - dominating purpose - the longing to slay time and space ; to be with [him]238-sir thomas now , this instant ; to be beside [Jack]146-jack dying , not [Jack]146-jack dead . " [she]0-i says , hoarsely—"I[435-god] know [he]238-sir thomas is ; [I]0-i must go to [him]238-sir thomas this minute ; for [God]435-god 's sake help [me]0-i to get to [the station]1067-the station ! " "[435-god] Indeed , ' m , [I]0-i 'm sorry to see [you]1915-ma'am in such trouble , that [I]0-i am ! " answers [[her]0-i companion]3572-her companion , moved to compassion by the terrible , haggard misery of the young , round face , that [she]0-i , in company with [[her]0-i fellow - servants]4559-her fellow - servants , had often admired in its happy , dewy rosiness at prayers on Sunday evenings ; "[435-god] but , [you]1915-ma'am see , [all the men]1919-all the men are in bed , and [Simpson]280-simpson ' ud cut off [his]280-simpson own ' ead afore [he]280-simpson 'd venture to take out [the carriage]3788-the carriage without [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas 's orders . " The tall , yellow candle flares between [them]1919-all the men : lights up the tortured beauty of [the one woman]4560-the one woman , the placid stolidity of the other . [Esther]148-esther groans , and smites [her]148-esther hands together . "[238-sir thomas] Is there [no vehicle [I]0-i can have]1921-no vehicle i can have ? " [she]0-i asks in impatient agony—"no[238-sir thomas] cart?—no anything ? [I]0-i 'd give all [I]0-i have in [the world]672-the world to any one who would take [me]0-i . Oh God ! how many minutes [I]0-i am wasting . " [The housemaid]647-the housemaid puts down [her]647-the housemaid flat candlestick on the table , and rubs [her]647-the housemaid forehead with [her]647-the housemaid rough fore - finger to aid [her]647-the housemaid thinking powers . "[0-i] There 's the dog - cart that [the under - servants]1923-the under - servants goes to [church]3708-church in , " [she]0-i says , presently , with an uncertain suggestion : "[0-i] if [we]1925-we could knock [the men]3783-the men up , [you]1927-you might have it , perhaps . " "[1927-you] Knock [them]3783-the men up this instant , then ! " cries [Esther]148-esther , with passionate urgency — "[1927-you] now , this minute ! Go , for [God]435-god 's sake ! " So saying , [she]148-esther almost pushes [the woman]3893-the woman out of [the room]3629-the room , and [herself]148-esther follows [her]148-esther . Through [long passages]4564-long passages and [corridors]4565-corridors , full of emptiness and darkness — darkness utter and complete , save where through [the gallery]4566-the gallery 's high - stained east window the chilly . chilly dawn comes peeping , with a grey glimmer , about the black frames , never closing eyes , and stiff , prim simpers of [the family portraits]4567-the family portraits — down to [the lower regions]4568-the lower regions , where [the huge kitchen - grate]4569-the huge kitchen - grate yawns , black as [Erebus]65-erebus — up steep back - stairs along [other passages]4570-other passages . In one of [these passages]4571-these passages [Esther]148-esther stands , [her]148-esther frame trembling and teeth chattering with cold and nervous excitement , while [[her]148-esther companion]3572-her companion raps with broad , hard knuckles on a door , and loudly calls on [Simpson]280-simpson to awake . [But hard workers]4573-but hard workers are [hard sleepers]4574-hard sleepers , and it is some time before [the coachman]4575-the coachman can be induced to leave [the country of slumber]4576-the country of slumber . When at length [he]4575-the coachman is aroused , and has come out to [them]4573-but hard workers , in all the yawning sulkiness of disturbed sleep , it is a still longer time before [he]4575-the coachman can be induced to admit the possibility of any vehicle whatever being put at [Esther]148-esther 's disposal . with so righteous a fear of [his]4575-the coachman wrath has [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas succeeded in inspiring [[his]4575-the coachman subordinates]4577-his subordinates . It is not without the aid of all [her]148-esther remaining money , with the exception of what is needed for the purchase of [her]148-esther railway ticket — not without the aid of all that is left of [poor [Jack]146-jack 's hardly - spared five - pound note]4578-poor jack 's hardly - spared five - pound note — that [she]148-esther is able at length to induce [him]146-jack to consent to the getting ready of the dog - cart "[1923-the under - servants] in which [the under - servants]1923-the under - servants goes to [church]3708-church . " Fully three - quarters of an hour more elapse before [one of [the helpers]4580-the helpers]4579-one of the helpers can be knocked up , can dress [himself]4579-one of the helpers , can harness the oldest and screwiest horse in [the stables]699-the stables , and put [him]4579-one of the helpers , with many a muttered grumble , into the cart . [Wretched Esther]148-esther follows [the man]3894-the man and [[his]3894-the man lanthorn]4583-his lanthorn to [the stable - yard]3877-the stable - yard , with the vain idea that [her]148-esther presence may hurry [his]3894-the man movements . During most of the three - quarters of an hour [she]148-esther walks quickly up and down over the hard , round stones with which [the yard]4585-the yard is paved , or stands watching , with greedy eyes , every step in the harnessing process ; while [her]148-esther hands clench themselves , as [his]3894-the man are clenched who is dead by some very cruel , violent death , and a pain like a red - hot , two - bladed knife keeps running through [her]148-esther heart . Before the horse is well between the shafts , [she]148-esther has climbed into [the cart]4530-the cart and taken [her]148-esther seat . "[1923-the under - servants] The luggage is not in yet , ' m , " suggests [the groom]3655-the groom , respectfully . "[1923-the under - servants] Oh ! never mind the luggage , " cries [Esther]148-esther , feverishly ; "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't want it ! [I]0-i do n't want anything ! [I]0-i 'm ready ! Get in , please , and set off this minute ! " Dawn is breaking , slowly , coldly , greyly , without any of the rose - coloured splendours that mostly gild the day 's childhood , as the glorious delusions of youth gild [our]4588-our morning , There has not been a positive , actual frost in the night — not frost enough to congeal [the wayside pools]4589-the wayside pools or to kill [the dahlias]4462-the dahlias — but the air has , for all that , a frosty crispness , as of the first breath of coming winter . The trees and hedgerow holly - bushes loom gigantic , formless , treble and quadruple their real size , folded round and round in a mantle of mist ; [the meadows]4591-the meadows are like lakes of mist ; sheets of vapour steaming damply up to the shapeless , colourless , low - stooping heavens . [Esther]148-esther has forgotten to take any wrap : through the poor protection of [her]148-esther thin cotton dress and jacket the mist creeps slowly , searchingly , making [her]148-esther limbs shake and shudder ; but [she]148-esther [herself]148-esther is unconscious of it — [she]148-esther could not have told [you]4592-you afterwards whether [she]148-esther had been warm or cold . At [the turnpike gate]4593-the turnpike gate [a sleepy old man]4594-a sleepy old man comes hobbling out ( [men at toll - gates]4595-men at toll - gates are mostly one - legged ) , in [his]4594-a sleepy old man hand a candle , to which the white morning is beginning to give a very sickly , yellow look : it seems to [Esther]148-esther that [he]4594-a sleepy old man will never have done fumbling in [his]4594-a sleepy old man breeches - pocket for the sixpence of change that eludes [his]4594-a sleepy old man search . "[1930-you] Why do [you]1930-you stop ? Can not [you]1930-you go a little quicker ? " asks [Esther]148-esther , hoarsely , [her]148-esther teeth chattering with cold and misery , as [the groom]3655-the groom allows [his]3655-the groom horse to walk up a long , gentle incline . "[1931-sir tummas allus] [Sir Tummas allus]1931-sir tummas allus gives pertikler herders as [we]1932-we should walk the ' orses up this ' ill , " replies [the man]3894-the man ; "[1933-you] [you]1933-you see , ' m , it 's collar - work pretty nigh all the way from [[our]1932-we place]1934-our place to [Brainton]43-brainton . " "[1933-you] But it is such [a little hill]1935-a little hill , and [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas need never know , " pleads [Esther]148-esther , imploringly . "[238-sir thomas] [I]0-i have not got any money now , but if [you]1930-you 'll take [me]0-i quicker — a good deal quicker — [I]0-i will send [you]1930-you five shillings — ten shillings — by post , when [I]0-i get [home]701-home . " "[0-i] Much obliged to [you]1933-you , [ma'am]1915-ma'am , " answers [the man]3894-the man , touching [his]3894-the man hat , and giving another instance of the influence of filthy lucre by whipping up [his]3894-the man horse . "[0-i] When is [the next train]1938-the next train to [Berwyn]79-berwyn ? " cries [Esther]148-esther , almost before [they]4599-they had pulled up at [the station]1067-the station , to [a porter , who stands waiting to receive any arriving passengers]4601-a porter , who stands waiting to receive any arriving passengers . "[1915-ma'am] 7.20 , " replies [the man]3894-the man , briefly . "[1915-ma'am] And what time is it now ? " "[1915-ma'am] 6.15 . " "[1915-ma'am] Is not there one before 7.20 ? " "[1915-ma'am] None ; [you]1933-you are just too late for the 6.10 one ; it has been gone about five minutes . " Unmindful of the presence of [the careless , indifferent onlookers]4603-the careless , indifferent onlookers , [Esther]148-esther clasps [her]148-esther cold hands together and groans . In a great despair , as in a great bodily agony , [we]4599-they do not much mind who sees or hears [us]4599-they . "[1915-ma'am] Too late ! " [she]148-esther says , with a heavy , tearless sob — "[1915-ma'am] five minutes too late ! Oh God , it is hard ! " "[1911-miss] Any luggage , [Miss]1911-miss ? " asks [the porter]4604-the porter , in [his]4604-the porter civil , matter - of - fact voice . The common - place question brings [her]148-esther back to life . "[1911-miss] No , none , " [she]148-esther answers , collecting [herself]148-esther ; and so saying walks into [the station]1067-the station , and , taking refuge in [the waiting - room]4606-the waiting - room , sinks down upon a green Utrecht velvet chair . Owing to the earliness of the hour , [other occupant of [the room]3629-the room]4607-other occupant of the room is there none ; neither is there any fire ( a fire always looks in good spirits ; it never has the blues ) . Alongside of [the empty fire - place]4609-the empty fire - place stands a stiff , green Utrecht velvet sofa , and round the bare table more green Utrecht velvet chairs . Opposite to [Esther]148-esther , against the wall , hangs a roll of texts . Involuntarily [her]148-esther haggard eyes lift themselves to [them]4610-them , and light upon this one — which , under the slightly inappropriate title of "[1911-miss] Encouragements to Repentance , " heads the list : "[1911-miss] Woe to [me]0-i , for [I]0-i am undone ! " [She]148-esther shudders , "[1911-miss] Is it an omen ? " turns away [her]148-esther head quickly , and tries to look out of window , but the wire - blind hinders [her]148-esther gaze . Once again , "[1911-miss] Woe is [me]0-i , for [I]0-i am undone ! " standing out clear and black in large type from the white paper , greets [her]148-esther eyes . [She]148-esther can bear it no longer , but rising hastily , runs out , and begins to walk swiftly up and down [the platform]1071-the platform . [Brainton]43-brainton is [a large station]4612-a large station — [a junction of many lines]4613-a junction of many lines . Engines are snorting and puffing about ; boilers letting off steam , with a noise calculated to break the drum of any ear ; tarpaulin - covered waggons standing shunted on side lines . [A train]4614-a train has just come in , and is disgorging [its]4614-a train human load ; [a man with a hammer]4615-a man with a hammer is walking along by the side of it , stooping and tapping the wheels ; [porters]4616-porters are driving [luggage - piled trucks]4617-luggage - piled trucks before [them]4616-porters , and shouting out , "[1940-your] By [your]1940-your leave ! " to [any unwary traveller who may cross the relentless path of [their]4618-any unwary traveller who may cross the relentless path of their juggernaut Juggernaut]4618-any unwary traveller who may cross the relentless path of their juggernaut : [other parties]4619-other parties are enduring and answering , with angelic patience and bonhomie , the agitated and incoherent questions of [unprotected females]4620-unprotected females in waterproof cloaks and turn - down hats . [Everybody]404-everybody and everything is rampantly alive ; even to [his]4621-his handiwork , [man]3613-man seems to have imparted some of [his]4621-his own intense vitality ; to the engines [he]4621-his has given motion and voice — motion and voice ten thousandfold stronger than [his]4621-his own . In [her]4623-her hurried walks , [Esther]148-esther suddenly comes face to face with [a fair - haired youth]4624-a fair - haired youth , who , followed by [a porter carrying a gun - case]4625-a porter carrying a gun - case , is walking lightly along with [his]4624-a fair - haired youth hands in [his]4624-a fair - haired youth pockets , whistling for very lightheartedness , "[0-i] [I]0-i paddle [[my]0-i own canoe]3390-my own canoe . " [Jack]146-jack 's tune ! What business has [he]146-jack to whistle it ? [All fair - haired youths]4626-all fair - haired youths , with nothing very prominent in any of [their]4626-all fair - haired youths features , are more or less alike ; and this amount of resemblance [the unknown]4627-the unknown bears to [[her]148-esther boy]4628-her boy . Long after [he]146-jack has passed [her]148-esther , amid the shrieking of the engines , the shouts of the porters—"Take[1911-miss] [your]1942-your seats for [Wolverhampton]80-wolverhampton , [Birmingham]81-birmingham ! " "[1911-miss] All here for [Chester]82-chester , [Warrington]83-warrington , and [Manchester?"—the]84-manchester?"—the well - known tune echos faintly back to [her]148-esther ears . An overpowering , blinding , deafening rush of feeling comes over [her]148-esther ; [she]148-esther sits down hastily on a bench that is near at hand , in close proximity to [an Irish labourer]4629-an irish labourer , with a blue - spotted bundle , and , careless of the contaminating contact , buries [her]148-esther head in [her]148-esther hands , and rocks to and fro in a paroxysm of despair . It is one of those incontrovertible facts that [we]4630-we all know to be true , and that [we]4630-we all feel to be false , that every hour is of the same length ; that in an hour of [Elysium]85-elysium there are sixty whole minutes , and that in an hour of [Hades]86-hades there are only sixty . In [Esther]148-esther 's hour of waiting there are , however , seventy - five minutes , as [the train]1069-the train is a quarter of an hour late . "[1911-miss] Is it [a fast train]1943-a fast train ? " [she]148-esther asks eagerly of [the bearded guard , who , with the politeness inborn in [guards]4633-guards]4632-the bearded guard , who , with the politeness inborn in guards , opens the carriage - door for [her]148-esther . "[1911-miss] No , [miss]1911-miss , " [he]4632-the bearded guard , who , with the politeness inborn in guards answers , with [suavity—"slow[1911-miss] train]4634-suavity—"slow train , [miss]1911-miss ; stops at [every station]1946-every station ; 6.10 was [the fast train]1947-the fast train , [miss]1911-miss ! " Off at last , sliding slowly at first past platform , [officials]4635-officials , [trucks]4636-trucks , [book - stalls]4637-book - stalls , [dowdy women]4638-dowdy women and [dusty men]4639-dusty men ; then the wind comes beating with a strong rush against [Esther]148-esther 's cheeks , blowing back [her]148-esther hair , as [they]4640-they fly through the air at the rate of fifty miles an hour . The transit from [Brainton]43-brainton to [Berwyn]79-berwyn occupies three hours , and during the greater part of that time [Miss Craven]164-st. john maintains almost exactly the same attitude ; with [her]164-st. john greedy eyes devouring [every field]4641-every field and tree and homestead as [they]4640-they run past — [each village]4642-each village spire and bridge a finger - post to tell [her]164-st. john that [she]164-st. john is so much nearer [[her]164-st. john boy]4628-her boy . [She]164-st. john does not cry at all , or groan . Even had [she]164-st. john wished to do so , conventionality — that makes [us]4644-us laugh when [we]4644-us would fain weep , makes [us]4644-us weep when [we]4644-us would fain laugh — would have forbidden [her]164-st. john , for [she]164-st. john is not alone in [the carriage]3788-the carriage . [Two other travellers]4646-two other travellers share it with [her]164-st. john — [two extremely cheerful young men , to whom it is a matter of supreme indifference how many hedges and meadows are before]4647-two extremely cheerful young men , to whom it is a matter of supreme indifference how many hedges and meadows are before , how many behind [them]4646-two other travellers . [They]4646-two other travellers are not exactly [gentlemen]4648-gentlemen : and indeed it is a matter of almost as curious inquiry as what becomes of all the pins that are made and lost , in what part of [the train]1069-the train , if it be not in [[the guard]4650-the guard 's van]4651-the guard 's van , [gentlemen]4648-gentlemen and [ladies]1534-ladies travel , as assuredly [they]4646-two other travellers are but seldom to be met with in [first - class carriages]4654-first - class carriages . [The two youths]4655-the two youths have made [themselves]4655-the two youths and [their]4655-the two youths hat - boxes , rugs , & c. , luxuriously comfortable , and seem rather disposed to be funny — to "[1911-miss] show off , " as [children]3772-children say , for the benefit of [the lovely girl , who looks so disconsolate and dishevelled , who seems so unflatteringly unaware of [their]4655-the two youths presence]4657-the lovely girl , who looks so disconsolate and dishevelled , who seems so unflatteringly unaware of their presence . [They]4655-the two youths eat sandwiches and drink sherry ; [they]4655-the two youths are provided with a large stock of all the morning papers , and by - and - by [the eldest]4658-the eldest and boldest of [them]4655-the two youths proffers Punch , Fun , and half - a - dozen other dreary comicalities to [Esther]148-esther . [She]148-esther looks at [him]4648-gentlemen for a second with [her]148-esther large wistful eyes as [she]148-esther declines the offered civility , and then resumes [her]148-esther watch . Having obtained that one short glance , [he]4648-gentlemen ceases from [his]4648-gentlemen witticisms , half - conscious of being in the company of a great sorrow — as [we]4659-we involuntarily hush [our]4659-we voices and speak softly in the presence of [[our]4659-we great master]4660-our great master and [owner]4661-owner — Death . Perhaps , [cowardly slaves]4662-cowardly slaves as [we]4659-we are , [we]4659-we fear lest , if [we]4659-we should speak loudly , [he]4648-gentlemen might be reminded of [our]4659-we existence — might lay [his]4648-gentlemen heavy hand on [our]4659-we shoulders also . Another hour of waiting at [Berwyn]79-berwyn — another hour before there is [any train]4663-any train for [the branch line that leads to [Glan - yr - Afon]24-glan - yr - afon]4664-the branch line that leads to glan - yr - afon — [any train]4663-any train , at least , that stops at so insignificant [a station]598-a station . Another hour of tramping in forlorn , impotent impatience up and down [the platform]1071-the platform , hustled by [a hurrying crowd]4668-a hurrying crowd , who know nothing , and care , if possible , less , about [her]4669-her and [her]4669-her grief . Well , if [every one in [England]13-england]4670-every one in england wept for [every one else]4671-every one else 's sorrows , the noise of tears and sobbings would drown the whirring of [all the mills in [Leeds]87-leeds and [Manchester]72-manchester]4672-all the mills in leeds and manchester — the booming of all the cannon at [Shoeburyness]88-shoeburyness . It is half an hour past noon , when , almost before [the train]1069-the train has stopped at [the little wayside station]4674-the little wayside station , [Esther]148-esther springs out .
