For Heaven 's sake , talk in that strain to [no one but [me]2142-i]4889-no one but me ! [Any one that knew [you]2141-you less well than [I]2142-i do]4890-any one that knew you less well than i do might misunderstand [you]2141-you . "[2142-i] [She]2141-you looks up at [him]2142-i , half - frightened . " [One]559-one does say dreadful things without intending it , "[2141-you] [she]2141-you says , apologetically ; " but [I]2141-you only meant to express , as forcibly as possible , how little consequence it was what happened to [me]2141-you . "[2141-you] " For [God]435-god 's sake , word it differently then ! "[2142-i] [he]2142-i says , almost sternly ; " or , better still , do n't say it or think it at all ! It is morbid , and it is not true . If it is of no consequence to [any one else]777-any one else what becomes of [you]2141-you , it is of intense , unspeakable consequence to [me]2142-i : how many times must [I]2142-i tell [you]2141-you that before [you]2141-you mean to believe it ? "[2142-i] " To [you]2142-i ! in [Bermuda]33-bermuda ? "[2141-you] [she]2141-you says , with a little doubting sigh . " Yes , to [me]2142-i , in [Bermuda]33-bermuda , "[2142-i] [he]2142-i answers , firmly . " Perhaps [you]2141-you think that it was only because [I]2142-i looked upon [you]2141-you as [my]2142-i own , [[my]2142-i property]4893-my property , that [I]2142-i took so great an interest in [you]2141-you : it was not as [mine]2142-i , it was as [yourself]2141-you , that [I]2142-i cared about [you]2141-you . [You]2141-you are [yourself]2141-you still , though [you]2141-you are not nor ever will be [mine]2142-i . "[2142-i] Then , like [Guinevere]422-guinevere 's , " [his]2142-i voice brake suddenly . "[2142-i] " Then , as a stream , that spouting from a cliffFails in mid - air , but gathering at the base , Remakes itself and flashes down [the vale]4894-the vale , Went on in passionate utterance . "[2143-i] " [Essie]180-essie ! [they]4895-they say that [women]547-women are more capable of self - sacrifice than [men]595-men . Prove it to [me]2143-i now ! Sacrifice this pride of [yours]2141-you ; consent to the one thing that would make [me]2143-i leave [England]13-england with almost a light , instead of such a heavy heart ! "[2143-i] [She]2143-i is silent for a minute or two , halting between two opinions ; hesitating , struggling with [herself]2143-i : then [she]2143-i speaks , rapidly , but not easily — " [I]2143-i can not , [Bob]190-bob — [I]2143-i can not ! Ask [me]2143-i anything , not quite so hard , and [I]2143-i 'll do it ! Just think how young [I]2143-i am , seventeen last birthday , [I]2143-i have probably forty or fifty more years to live ; do [you]190-bob wish [me]2143-i to promise to be [a pensioner]4898-a pensioner for half a century on [[your]190-bob mother]3422-your mother 's charity ? "[2143-i] [He]2144-he does not answer . " Do n't be angry with [me]2143-i for having a little self - respect ! "[2143-i] [she]2143-i cries , passionately , snatching [his]2144-he hand . " [I]2143-i will go and stay with [[your]190-bob people]4900-your people till [I]2143-i have found something to do , if [they]4900-your people will have [me]2143-i . [I]2143-i will get [[your]190-bob mother]3422-your mother to help [me]2143-i in looking for work ; [I]2143-i will take [her]3422-your mother advice in everything , do whatever [she]3422-your mother tells [me]2143-i ; [I]2143-i will do anything — anything in life to please [you]190-bob , except — "[2143-i] " Except the one thing [I]2144-he wish , "[2144-he] [he]2144-he answers , sadly and coldly . " If [you]2144-he speak in that tone [I]2145-i shall have to promise [you]2144-he anything , "[2145-i] [she]2145-i says , despairingly ; " but it will only be perjury , for [I]2145-i shall infallibly break [my]2145-i promise again . Why should not [I]2145-i work ? "[2145-i] [she]2145-i goes on , in a sort of indignation at [his]2144-he silence . " Am [I]2145-i [a cripple]4902-a cripple , or [an idiot]4903-an idiot ? "[2145-i] " As [you]2145-i will , "[2144-he] [he]2144-he answers , deeply wounded . [you]2145-i are wrong — [you]2145-i are wrong ! "[2144-he] IT is Sunday evening . [Miss Craven]164-st. john has been to [church]3708-church for the first time since [her]164-st. john bereavement , as [people]3426-people call it . [She]164-st. john has displayed [her]164-st. john crape in all its crisp funeral newness before the eyes of [the Plas Berwyn congregation]2148-the plas berwyn congregation . Also , [she]164-st. john has been made the subject of conversation , over [their]2149-their early dinner , between [the imbecile rector]2150-the imbecile rector and [[his]2150-the imbecile rector vinegar - faced , bob - curled wife]2151-his vinegar - faced , bob - curled wife ; the latter remarking how unfortunately unbecoming black was to poor [Miss Craven]164-st. john — really impossible to tell where [her]164-st. john bonnet ended and [her]164-st. john hair began ; and how lucky it was for [her]164-st. john that [people]3426-people did not wear mourning for as long a time as [they]3426-people used — three months being ample nowadays , ample for [a brother]3525-a brother ! [Esther]148-esther has sat in [[their]2149-their pew]2154-their pew for the first time alone : [she]148-esther has looked at [Jack]146-jack 's prayer - book , at [his]146-jack vacant corner under the dusty cobwebbed window , with eyes dryly stoic ; [she]148-esther has walked firmly after service down [the church - path]2155-the church - path , past [a grassless hillock]2156-a grassless hillock , where [he]146-jack who was [[her]148-esther brother]644-her brother lies , dumbly submitting to the one terrific , changeless law of decay — the law that not one of [us]2158-us can face , as applying to [ourselves]2158-us , without [our]2158-us brains reeling at the horror of it . Oh ! thrifty , harsh Nature ! that , without a pang of relenting , unmixes again those cunningest compounds that [we]2158-us call [our]2158-us bodies — making the freed elements that formed them pass into new forms of life — makes [us]2158-us , who erewhile walked upright , god- like , fronting the sun , communing with the high stars — makes [us]2158-us , [I]0-i say , creep many - legged in the beetle , crawl blind in the worm ! It is evening now , and [Esther]148-esther sits , in [her]148-esther red armchair , beside the drawing - room fire , alone again . The wind comes banging every minute against the shuttered French window , as one that boisterously asks to be let in ; the ivy leaves are dashed against the pane , as one that sighingly begs for admittance . Every now and then [the young girl]3585-the young girl looks round timidly over [her]3585-the young girl shoulder , in the chill expectation of seeing a death - pale spirit - face gazing at [her]3585-the young girl from some corner of [the room]3629-the room ; every now and then [she]3585-the young girl starts nervously , as a hot cinder drops from the grate , or as the small feet of some restless mouse make a hurry - skurrying noise behind the wainscot . As often as [she]3585-the young girl can frame the smallest excuse , [she]3585-the young girl rings the bell , in order to gather a little courage from the live human face , the live human voice , of [the servant that answers it]2161-the servant that answers it . Around [Plas Berwyn]38-plas berwyn also the wind thunders — against [Plas Berwyn]38-plas berwyn windows also the ivy - leaves fling themselves plaintively ; but there the resemblance ends . The steady light from the lamp outblazes the uncertain , fitful fire - gleams : at [Plas Berwyn]38-plas berwyn there are no ghost - faces of the lately dead to haunt [the inmates of [that cheerful room]2163-that cheerful room]2162-the inmates of that cheerful room . [They]2164-they are all sitting round the table on straight - backed chairs — no lolling in armchairs , no stealing of furtive naps on the Sabbath — sitting rather primly , rather Puritanically , reading severely good books . To [Bob]190-bob 's palate , the Hedley Vicarsian type of literature is as distasteful as to [any other young man of sound head and good digestion]2165-any other young man of sound head and good digestion , but [he]190-bob succumbs to it meekly , to please [[his]190-bob mother]3479-his mother ; if Sunday came twice a week , [I]0-i think [he]190-bob would be constrained to rebel . From [the kitchen]1014-the kitchen , [the servants]4284-the servants ' voices sound faintly audible above the howling wind , singing psalms . [The family]3846-the family are divided between prose and poetry . [Miss Brandon]202-bessy is reading a sermon ; [[her]202-bessy sister]4078-her sister a hymn . Here it is : — [THE FIRM BANK]423-the firm bank . * A charming mixture of the jocose and familiar , is n't it ? " [Mother]162-nature , "[190-bob] says [Bob]190-bob , rather abruptly , looking up from a civil - spoken , pleasant little work , entitled " [[Thou]4912-thou Fool]4913-thou fool ! " [I]190-bob 'm perfectly well : why should [I]190-bob shirk work any more than [any other fellow]4914-any other fellow ? "[190-bob] Foiled in this direction , [she]3509-the old lady varies [her]3509-the old lady point of attack a little : " Can [you]190-bob look [me]3509-the old lady in the face , and tell [me]3509-the old lady that since [your]190-bob engagement [she]3509-the old lady has behaved to [you]190-bob as [a modest , honourable woman]4965-a modest , honourable woman should behave to [the man [she]3509-the old lady has promised to marry]4966-the man she has promised to marry ? "[3509-the old lady] ? " [He]190-bob casts [his]190-bob eyes down troubled , and begins to fidget with a dilapidated little Chelsea Cupid on the mantelshelf , too truthful to say "[3509-the old lady] Yes , " too generous to say "[3509-the old lady] No . " "[3509-the old lady] [She]3509-the old lady is ready to fulfil [her]3509-the old lady promise , " [he]190-bob answers , evasively . "[3509-the old lady] [She]3509-the old lady is willing to marry [me]0-i whenever [I]0-i like , as [I]0-i told [you]3509-the old lady before — to - morrow ! to - night ! this instant , if [I]0-i wish ! " "[3509-the old lady] For a [home]701-home , of course ; [one]559-one can understand that , in [her]3509-the old lady situation , " says [[his]190-bob mother]3479-his mother , in a tone of slighting pity . [Bob]190-bob perceives , and is stung by it . "[3509-the old lady] No , not for [a home]2203-a home ! " [he]190-bob answers , indignantly . "[3509-the old lady] [Poor soul]4817-poor soul ! [she]3509-the old lady may have that without paying such a heavy toll for it . " "[3509-the old lady] To what motive , then , do [you]0-i ascribe [her]3509-the old lady willingness ? " "[3509-the old lady] [She]3509-the old lady told [me]0-i that [she]3509-the old lady liked [me]0-i better than any one else in [the world]672-the world , " [he]190-bob answers , with the reluctance of [one who is making a statement that [he]190-bob believes will not be credited by [the auditor to whom it is addressed]4969-the auditor to whom it is addressed]4968-one who is making a statement that he believes will not be credited by the auditor to whom it is addressed . "[3509-the old lady] [[My]0-i poor simple boy]2206-my poor simple boy [I]0-i and [you]0-i believed [her]3509-the old lady ? " ( with a sort of compassionate scorn ) . [He]190-bob hesitates . "[3509-the old lady] [I]0-i believe that [she]3509-the old lady meant what [she]3509-the old lady said at the moment , " [he]190-bob replies , doubtfully . "[3509-the old lady] If there was such perfect harmony of opinion between [you]0-i , why was the engagement broken , may [I]0-i ask ? " [she]0-i inquires , a little sharply . No answer , except quickened breathing , and a frown slightly contracting [his]190-bob climate - bronzed forehead . "[3509-the old lady] Was it — oh , [[my]0-i dear boy]4915-my dear boy ! if it was so , [no one]891-no one can respect [your]0-i scruples more than [I]0-i do — was it because [you]0-i were not quite sure that [she]3509-the old lady was [one of [the Lord 's people]2210-the lord 's people]2209-one of the lord 's people ? " "[0-i] Oh , dear , no , " answers [the young man]670-the young man , quickly , with scarcely repressed impatience in [his]670-the young man tone—"nothing[0-i] of the kind . God forbid [my]0-i being so presumptuously uncharitable ! How am [I]0-i to know who is , or who is not ? All [I]0-i know is that if [she]3509-the old lady is not , neither am [I]0-i ; and [I]0-i trust , [mother]826-mother , that [you]826-mother will find , by - and - bye , that [they]2212-they are not quite such a scanty nation as [you]826-mother seem to imagine . " "[2213-a higher authority than i am] [A higher authority than [I]0-i am]2213-a higher authority than i am has expressly designated [them]2212-they ' [a little flock]2214-a little flock , ' " says [the old woman]3507-the old woman , sententiously , pursing up [her]3507-the old woman mouth ; "[2213-a higher authority than i am] but far be it from [me]0-i to wish to judge , whatever [you]826-mother may imply . But [I]0-i am still waiting to hear what [your]826-mother motive was for breaking [your]826-mother engagement , a motive which [you]826-mother seem to have such an unaccountable difficulty in telling [me]0-i . " [He]826-mother looks down , for an instant or two , biting [his]826-mother lips , then speaks petulantly : "[826-mother] Why should [I]0-i tell [you]826-mother , [mother?—why]2215-mother?—why should [I]0-i tell [any one]523-any one ? [A man]3402-a man 's motives are [his]3402-a man own concern , whatever [his]3402-a man actions may be ; if [mine]0-i are strong enough to satisfy [myself]0-i and [her]2218-her , surely that is enough . " "[2215-mother?—why] Oh , of course , " answers [[his]826-mother mother]3479-his mother , rather nettled at what [she]3479-his mother considers a want of confidence ; "[2215-mother?—why] only that , unless [I]0-i am put in possession of the circumstances of the case , [I]0-i really do n't see how [I]0-i can be expected to give advice — " "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't want advice , " interrupts [the young man]670-the young man , eagerly . "[0-i] [I]0-i want a much better thing — assistance . " "[0-i] Assistance in what ? " "[0-i] Why , in hindering [that poor girl]2219-that poor girl , " [he]826-mother says , with warmth , "[0-i] from being thrown upon [the world]672-the world penniless , helpless , and without [a friend]1386-a friend , as [she]2219-that poor girl will be after the sale at [Glan - yr - Afon]24-glan - yr - afon . " "[2219-that poor girl] Not without [a friend]1386-a friend , as long as [you]0-i are alive , [Bob]190-bob ; [one]559-one can answer for that ! " rejoins [[his]826-mother mother]3479-his mother , rather tartly . "[0-i] [I]0-i count for nothing , " says [Bob]190-bob , quietly . "[0-i] [A man]3402-a man 's friendship can be of no service to [a woman]553-a woman , unless [he]3402-a man is in some authorised position of relationship or connection with [her]553-a woman ; otherwise [he]3402-a man does [her]553-a woman more harm than good . What [she]553-a woman needs , and what [I]0-i hoped [she]553-a woman would have found in [you]0-i , [mother]826-mother , is [a woman - friend]2227-a woman - friend . " "[2227-a woman - friend] If , " replies [[his]3402-a man mother]3479-his mother , drawing [herself]3479-his mother up and looking very stiff—"If[0-i] [she]553-a woman is , as [you]0-i say , too proud to avail [herself]553-a woman of [the home that [I]0-i am]2228-the home that i am , for [your]0-i sake , willing to offer [her]553-a woman , [she]553-a woman is likely to be too proud to consent to be befriended in any other way . " [Brandon]201-mrs. brandon looks at [her]162-nature for a moment with something akin to indignant scorn in [his]3402-a man face , dutiful son as [he]3402-a man usually is ; then , repenting , throws [himself]3402-a man on [his]3402-a man knees beside [her]162-nature , and clasping [his]3402-a man arms about [her]162-nature withered neck , says , entreatingly : "[162-nature] [Mother]162-nature , why are [you]162-nature so hard upon [her?—what]2229-her?—what has [she]553-a woman done to [you]162-nature ? Just think , how would [you]162-nature have liked [Jane]240-jane or [Bessy]202-bessy , when [they]2230-they were [her]553-a woman age , to have been driven out into [the world]672-the world to make [their]2230-they own way , without [a single soul]2232-a single soul to say a kind word to [them]2230-they , or give [them]2230-they a helping hand ; and , " [he]190-bob continues , musingly , "[553-a woman] [they]2230-they never could have been exposed to the temptations [she]553-a woman will be — [they]2230-they never were beautiful , like [her]553-a woman ! " [He]190-bob had never spoken truer words in all [his]190-bob life , but the truth is not always the best to be spoken . "[190-bob] At all events , " says [the old lady]3509-the old lady , with emphasis , freeing [herself]3509-the old lady from [his]190-bob arms , and getting rather red in the face face—"At[190-bob] all events , [Bob]190-bob , however disparagingly [you]190-bob may speak of them , [they]2230-they were and are [good , modest , pious girls]2233-good , modest , pious girls , that would not trifle with [an honest man]2234-an honest man 's affection for [their]2230-they own amusement , as [handsomer ones]2235-handsomer ones have done before now . " "[0-i] [I]0-i never heard of [any honest man]2236-any honest man having given [them]2230-they the chance , " retorts [Bob]190-bob , sarcastically , quitting [his]190-bob caressing posture , with a revulsion of feeling as sudden as it was complete . "[2236-any honest man] [The servants]4284-the servants are assembled , " says [the youngest , best , modestest , piousest of [the girls]906-the girls]4977-the youngest , best , modestest , piousest of the girls , opening the door , and putting in [her]4977-the youngest , best , modestest , piousest of the girls little drab face . "[4284-the servants] Must [I]0-i tell [them]4284-the servants to go back to [the kitchen]1014-the kitchen for a quarter of an hour , or has [Bob]190-bob nearly finished [his]190-bob private communication ? " "[190-bob] Quite ! " replies [Bob]190-bob , emphatically . [He]190-bob is standing leaning against the chimneypiece , [his]190-bob colour heightened , and a sorely angered look on [his]190-bob open simple face . "[2239-you] [You]2239-you need not wait for [me]0-i , [mother]826-mother , " [he]190-bob continues , seeing [[his]190-bob parent]2176-his parent look inquiringly towards [him]190-bob , as [she]826-mother moves with the slowness of age and portliness to the door ; "[826-mother] [I]0-i shall not come to prayers to - night . When [one]559-one prays , [one]559-one ought to be in charity with all [the world]672-the world , ought not one ? And [I]0-i am not . " THE rough winds and the spiteful rains have wellnigh stripped all [their]4980-their red - and - yellow clothing off the trees : upon the oaks alone some leaves still hang persistent , though withered and crackly . The apples and pears are all gathered and stored for the winter ; even the dark - blue Orleans plums , that require the crisping frost to ripen them , are eaten and gone . The sale at [Glan - yr - Afon]24-glan - yr - afon is over ; it is enrolled among that countless array of unrecallable events , great and little , that is past . [The new tenant]4981-the new tenant , [an ordinary Welsh farmer , with an overfull quiver of sprouting Welshmen]4982-an ordinary welsh farmer , with an overfull quiver of sprouting welshmen and [Welshwomen]4983-welshwomen , has entered into possession . [No one]891-no one has taken the trouble to "[0-i] redd up " [the garden]846-the garden for the winter ; flowers do not help to pay the rent — they give back nothing but [their]4980-their beauty and perfume ; and so , over [Esther]148-esther 's trim flower - beds , sheep - dogs gallop , and [children , boisterous with health and spirits]4986-children , boisterous with health and spirits , run races . The rustic seat under the old cherry- tree — the seat that [Jack]146-jack fashioned in the summer evenings — has been broken up for firewood ; and in [Jack]146-jack 's chair in [the dining - room]688-the dining - room , [the father of [the family]3846-the family]4988-the father of the family reposes [his]4988-the father of the family plethoric bulk of an evening , when [he]4988-the father of the family does not happen to be getting drunk at the "[0-i] Punch Bowl , " and snores euphoniously . And [Bob]190-bob , pursued by blessings , prayers , lamentations , and strong wishes for [his]190-bob safe back - coming , is gone — gone away in a smoky steamer , over [the mist - mantled grey sea]4990-the mist - mantled grey sea . Not a few of the tears that fell for [him]190-bob came from [Esther]148-esther 's eyes — not love - tears , shed privily , secretly , dashed away with hasty care at the sound of any approaching footsteps , but poured out openly , publicly , in the presence of [[his]190-bob mother]3479-his mother and [sisters]3770-sisters — mingled with [theirs]3770-sisters , indeed , as of no different quality . Not more openly , not more publicly , had [she]148-esther wept for [old Luath]186-old luath , when , on the day before the sale , the old dog , who had ailed and moped ever since [[his]190-bob master]718-his master 's ( to [him]718-his master ) unaccountable disappearance , crawled weakly to [her]148-esther feet , and , looking up dimly wistful into [her]148-esther face for the last time , died licking [her]148-esther tender hand . On the day before [his]190-bob departure , [Brandon]201-mrs. brandon came to say "[0-i] Good - bye " to [her]148-esther . "[0-i] [I]0-i have told [mother]826-mother nothing , " [he]190-bob says , with some embarrassment , in allusion to [their]4994-their late engagement — "[826-mother] nothing , except that [I]0-i was sure that [I]0-i could not make [you]826-mother happy . [I]0-i have given [her]826-mother no reason , [Esther]148-esther — give [her]826-mother none either ! [She]826-mother will not ask [you]826-mother point - blank , and it is always easy to evade indirect questions ; there are some things that it is of no use being confidential about . " "[0-i] [I]0-i see , " [she]0-i answers , with a faint smile . "[0-i] [I]0-i understand , neatly as [you]826-mother have gilded the pill , [you]826-mother are afraid that [she]826-mother would turn [me]0-i out - of - doors if [she]826-mother knew what [a treacherous , black - hearted wretch]2245-a treacherous , black - hearted wretch [I]0-i have been ; that [I]0-i should have to take refuge even sooner than [I]0-i must otherwise do in [the workhouse]2246-the workhouse , to which [I]0-i always look forward as [my]0-i final destination . " Then , bidding [God]435-god bless [her]0-i , [he]826-mother wrings [her]0-i hand , strongly , and so takes [his]826-mother last farewell of [her]0-i , nor ever sees [her]0-i fair face and great gentle stag eyes again . And now [he]826-mother is gone — gone with a difficult smile on [his]826-mother face , and very little money in [his]826-mother pocket . [He]826-mother never has much , but [he]826-mother has less than usual now ; having spent [his]826-mother few last sovereigns on the erecting a plain white cross at the head of [[Jack]146-jack 's low grave]4995-jack 's low grave , that , when [this generation]4996-this generation has passed , [his]826-mother place of sleeping may not be quite undistinguished from that of [[his]826-mother neighbour]541-his neighbour dust . [He]826-mother has gone , with [his]826-mother heart 's strongest longing balked , [his]826-mother prime hope death - smitten ; but yet not despairing — not cursing [his]826-mother day , nor arraigning [High God]435-god , saying , "[826-mother] Why do [I]0-i , undeserving , thus suffer ? " [He]826-mother carries away with [him]826-mother no heavy seething load of revenge , [no man]873-no man - slaying ardour of hatred against [the woman that has wronged [him]826-mother]4999-the woman that has wronged him , and [the man for whose sake [she]4999-the woman that has wronged him did it]5000-the man for whose sake she did it . Life is full , interesting , complex — not all on one string , whatever [morbid women and moody rhymers]5001-morbid women and moody rhymers may say ; not all sexual love — all of it , that is , that is not devoted to drinking , as [Anacreon]426-anacreon , [Catullus]427-catullus , and [Moore]361-tommy moore have dulcetly told [us]5002-us . And therefore , though poor , disappointed , and heart - wrung , [Brandon]201-mrs. brandon is not all unhappy . [He]826-mother has been greatly sinned against , and has forgiven , thus exercising the function that raises [us]5002-us nearest to a level with [the Godhead]5003-the godhead . And meanwhile [Esther]148-esther , left behind in [wintry Wales]1-wales , takes [his]826-mother emptied place at [triste Plas Berwyn]38-plas berwyn . Despite all [her]148-esther resolves , despite [her]148-esther high talk that a morsel of [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon 's bread would choke [her]148-esther — that it would be better to starve than to be under any obligation to [the family of [the man [she]148-esther has betrayed]5005-the man she has betrayed]5004-the family of the man she has betrayed — [she]148-esther is now eating that suffocating bread , now lying under those annihilating obligations . Want makes [us]5002-us swallow [our]5002-us dignity — makes [us]5002-us do many mean things . [One]559-one must live ; [one]559-one must keep in that breath that perhaps is only spent in sighs : and [Mr. James Greenwood]428-james has made [us]5002-us all out of love with [the workhouse]2246-the workhouse . So [she]148-esther sits down three times a day at [[Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon 's table]5009-mrs. brandon 's table , [the unwillingest guest that ever sat at any board]5010-the unwillingest guest that ever sat at any board , and eats the bread of charity , and the roast mutton and apple - tart of charity , when the conclusion of [the long Puritan grace]5011-the long puritan grace gives [her]148-esther permission to do so . There is plenty of time for thinking at [Plas Berwyn]38-plas berwyn , for in that still household talk is not rife . When [people]3426-people never leave [[their]3426-people own little one [earth - nook]5014-earth - nook]5013-their own little one earth - nook , rarely see [any one beyond [[their]3426-people immediate family circle]5016-their immediate family circle]5015-any one beyond their immediate family circle , and rarelier still read any reviews , papers , books , that treat of any subject but one , [they]3426-people have not much to talk about . There are few minds original enough , copious enough , to suffice to [them-]5017-them- selves — to be able to do without supplies derived from external objects . [Our]5002-us thoughts are generally [our]5002-us own , merely by right of immediate possession ; mostly they are the thoughts of [others]4701-others , more or less digested , more or less amalgamated with thought - matter of [our]5002-us own . [They]5017-them- are not unkind to [her]148-esther , these chill [faded women]5019-faded women . Not loving [her]148-esther — for , as [Bessy]202-bessy appositely quoted , "[826-mother] Can two walk together except [they]2247-their be agreed " — and [Esther]148-esther and [they]2247-their are most surely in nothing agreed ; mistrusting [her]148-esther , though not knowing , of having dealt falsely by [[their]2247-their brother]4030-their brother ; sincerely , though bigotedly , looking upon [her]148-esther society as unprofitable — nay , almost contaminating ; as being one of the unregenerate many — one standing in the cold , outside [[their]2247-their little clique of [elect , safe souls]5022-elect , safe souls]5021-their little clique of elect , safe souls : despite all this , [they]2247-their are yet willing to give [her]148-esther food and shelter , to give [them]2247-their [her]148-esther for an indefinite number of years , to make [her]148-esther a part of [their]2247-their own dry sapless lives . But [she]148-esther is not willing — oh , most unwilling ! Let [me]826-mother not be mistaken , however : it is not with the dryness and saplessness of the offered life that [she]148-esther quarrels . Life must henceforth be to [her]148-esther , everywhere , dry and sapless ; the duller it is , the less it contrasts with [her]148-esther own thoughts . It must be lived somewhere : it can be lived pleasurably nowhere . Then , why not unpleasurably , greyly , negatively , at [Plas Berwyn]38-plas berwyn ? Why not , supposing that [she]148-esther had been able to pay for [her]148-esther own cups of tea and slices of mutton , for [her]148-esther own iron bedstead and deal washhand - stand ? But , supposing that [she]148-esther was not able ; supposing that [she]148-esther was so destitute as to be glad , even while weeping over [his]5023-his poor rough body , that [her]148-esther old dog had died because [she]148-esther was too poor to be able to keep [him]5023-his ; supposing that this life entailed upon [her]148-esther the bitter pain of being daily , hourly grateful to people for whose society [she]148-esther had a strong repugnance , and upon whom , in the person of [one of [their]2247-their nearest and dearest]5024-one of their nearest and dearest , [she]148-esther had inflicted a mortal injury ? It is hard to live with people whose every idea runs counter to [your]5025-you own — whose whole tone of thought and conversation is diametrically opposed to what [you]5025-you have been used to all [your]5025-you life — and yet not be able to contradict , to argue with , or differ from [them]2247-their , because [you]5025-you are eating of [their]2247-their bread and drinking of [their]2247-their cup . The mere fact of feeling that [you]5025-you are too deeply indebted to [people]3426-people to be able , without flagrant ingratitude , to quarrel , makes [you]5025-you desire ardently to fall out with [them]2247-their . "[826-mother] How much better to be [a professed beggar]2248-a professed beggar at once ! " thinks [Esther]148-esther , with a sort of grim humour . "[2248-a professed beggar] How much better to whine and shuffle along [the streets]4017-the streets at [people]3426-people 's elbows , swearing that [you]2251-you have [a husband dying of consumption]2252-a husband dying of consumption , and [six children all under three years of age]2253-six children all under three years of age starving at [home]701-home ! " It is only the very basest and the very noblest natures that can accept great favours and not be crushed by [them]2247-their . [Esther]148-esther 's is neither . To [her]148-esther it is only the thought that [her]148-esther state of dependence is temporary that makes it supportable . [She]148-esther has lost no time in appealing to [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon for [her]201-mrs. brandon aid in the search for work — work , that vague word , that conveys to [her]148-esther no distinct idea , that stands to [her]148-esther in the place of something to be done by [her]148-esther , in return for which [she]148-esther may be able to obtain food and drink , without saying "[2251-you] Thank [you]2251-you " to [any one for [them]3426-people]5027-any one for them . On the afternoon of the day of [Bob]190-bob 's departure [Esther]148-esther has been sitting for an hour or more , in listless sadness , on the fender - stool before the fire , [her]148-esther eyes staring vacantly at the battered Michaelmas daisies aqd discoloured chrysanthemums in the wintry , darkening garden outside . [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon 's steel knitting - pins click gently , as [she]148-esther knits round and round , round and round , in the monotonous eternity of a long - ribbed knickerbocker stocking . The fire - gleams flicker dully red on the sombre , large - patterned flock - paper , which makes [the room]3629-the room look twice as small and twice as dark as it need otherwise do . [Esther]148-esther is roused from [her]148-esther reverie by the entrance of [the servant with the moderator lamp]5029-the servant with the moderator lamp . "[201-mrs. brandon] [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon ! " [she]148-esther says , addressing [[her]148-esther hostess]4295-her hostess . "[201-mrs. brandon] Yes , [[my]0-i dear]804-my dear ! " The "[201-mrs. brandon] [[my]0-i dear]804-my dear " is a concession to [Bob]190-bob 's memory . "[190-bob] [Bob]190-bob told [me]0-i , " says [the young girl]3585-the young girl , with some diffidence , "[804-my dear] that [you]804-my dear were good enough to say that [you]804-my dear would help [me]0-i in looking for — for — something to do ! " [The old lady]3509-the old lady looks scrutinizingly at [her]3585-the young girl over the tops of [her]3509-the old lady spectacles . "[0-i] [[My]0-i dear son]4948-my dear son expressed such great , such surprising anxiety , considering that [your]804-my dear connection with [him]4948-my dear son is at an end , about [your]804-my dear future , that [I]0-i did promise . " "[0-i] And [you]804-my dear will ? " asks [the other]1100-the other , timidly . "[804-my dear] [I]0-i always keep [my]0-i promises , [Esther]148-esther , [I]0-i hope " ( with a slight expressive accent on the [I]0-i and [my]0-i ) . "[0-i] When will [you]804-my dear begin?—soon?—at once ? to - morrow ? " cries [the girl]682-the girl , eagerly . [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon hesitates : "[0-i] [I]0-i must first know for what sort of employment [you]804-my dear wish — for what sort [you]804-my dear are best suited ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i am suited for nothing , " [she]0-i answers , despondently ; "[0-i] but that must not deter [me]0-i . If [nobody]3405-nobody did any work but what [they]3405-nobody were fitted for , [three quarters of [the world]672-the world]2259-three quarters of the world would be idle . " "[804-my dear] Would [you]804-my dear be inclined to take a situation as [governess]2261-governess , if one could be found for [you]804-my dear in [a respectable pious family]2262-a respectable pious family ? " [She]0-i shakes [her]0-i head . "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't know enough , and [I]0-i have no accomplishments . [I]0-i can read a few pages of ' Racine ' or ' Télémaque ' without applying very often to the dictionary ; modern French , with its colloquialisms and slang , baffles [me]0-i ; and [I]0-i can play a few ' Etudes ' and ' Morceaux de Salon ' in a slipshod , boarding - school fashion ; but these extensive requirements would hardly be enough . " [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon pauses in consideration . "[559-one] There are so few occupations open to [ladies]1534-ladies , " [she]201-mrs. brandon remarks , with an emphasis on the word . "[559-one] Most professions are closed up by [our]2264-our sex , and all trades by [our]2264-our birth and breeding . " "[559-one] When [one]559-one is [a pauper]2266-a pauper , [one]559-one must endeavour to forget that [one]559-one ever was [a lady]1109-a lady , " answers [Esther]148-esther , rather grimly ; "[559-one] [my]0-i gentility would not stand in the way of [my]0-i being [a shoeblack]2270-a shoeblack , if [women]547-women ever were shoeblacks , and if [they]547-women paid one tolerably for it . " "[547-women] Would [you]0-i like to try dressmaking ? " inquires [[her]148-esther companion]3572-her companion , rather doubtfully . [Esther]148-esther gives an involuntary gasp . It is not a pleasant sensation when the consciousness that [one]559-one is about to descend from the station that [one has been born and has grown up in]5037-one has been born and has grown up in is first brought stingingly [home]701-home to [one]559-one . [Happiness]429-happiness , [they]547-women say , is to be found equally in all ranks , but [no one]891-no one ever yet started the idea that it was sweet to go down . Quick as lightning there flashed before [her]148-esther mind the recollection of a slighting remark made by [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington , [à propos of [two very second - rate young ladies]5042-two very second - rate young ladies , who had come to call at [Felton]44-felton one day during [her]258-miss blessington visit [there]594-there]5041-à propos of two very second - rate young ladies , who had come to call at felton one day during her visit there , that "[2272-they] [they]2272-they looked like [little milliners]2273-little milliners ! " Was [she]258-miss blessington going to be [a "[2273-little milliners] little milliner]5044-a " little milliner ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i 'm afraid [I]0-i do n't sew well enough , " [she]148-esther answers , gently , wondering meanwhile that the idea has never before struck [her]148-esther what [a singularly inefficient , incapable member of society]5045-a singularly inefficient , incapable member of society [she]148-esther is . "[0-i] [I]0-i can not cut out : [I]0-i can make a bonnet , and [I]0-i can mend stockings in a boggling , amateur kind of way , and that is all ! " Recollecting whose stockings it was that [she]148-esther had been used to mend in the boggling way [she]148-esther speaks of , a knife passes through [her]148-esther quivering heart . "[0-i] The same objection would apply to [your]0-i attempting [[a lady's - maid]2274-a lady's - maid 's place]2275-a lady's - maid 's place , [I]0-i suppose ? " "[0-i] Yes , of course " ( bending down [her]148-esther long white neck in a despondent attitude ) ; "[0-i] but " ( with regathered animation in eye and tone)—"but[0-i] that objection would not apply to any other branch of domestic service — [a housemaid]2276-a housemaid , for instance ; it can not require much native genius , or a very long apprenticeship , to know how to empty baths , and make beds , and clean grates : [I]0-i ought to be able to learn how in a week . " [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon 's eyes travel involuntarily to the small , idle , white hands that lie on [Esther]148-esther 's lap — the blue - veined , patrician hands that [she]148-esther is so calmly destining to spend [their]2274-a lady's - maid existence in trundling mops and scouring [floors]5046-floors . "[0-i] [[My]0-i dear child]2277-my dear child , " [she]0-i says , with compelled compassion in [her]0-i voice , "[0-i] [you]2277-my dear child talk very lightly of these things ; but [you]2277-my dear child can have no conception , till [you]2277-my dear child make the experiment , of what the trial would be of being thrown on terms of equality among [a class of persons so immensely [[your]2277-my dear child inferiors]2279-your inferiors in education and refinement]2278-a class of persons so immensely your inferiors in education and refinement . " "[0-i] [I]0-i believe it is a well - authenticated fact , " answer [Esther]148-esther , firmly , "[0-i] that in [some town in [one of the midland counties]2281-one of the midland counties]2280-some town in one of the midland counties [[a baronet]2282-a baronet 's wife]2283-a baronet 's wife is , or was , earning [her]2283-a baronet 's wife living by going out charing . What right have [I]0-i to be more squeamish than [she]2283-a baronet 's wife ? " "[2283-a baronet 's wife] It is unchristian , " pursues [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon — unconvinced by [Esther]148-esther 's anecdote , which indeed [she]201-mrs. brandon treats as apocryphal — "[2283-a baronet 's wife] to call [any one common or unclean]2284-any one common or unclean , and [God]435-god forbid that [I]0-i should ever do so ! But imagine [a lady]1109-a lady , born and bred like [yourself]2277-my dear child , exposed to the coarse witticisms of [the footman]2286-the footman and the intimate friendship of [the cook]645-the cook ! " [Esther]148-esther 's little face seems to catch some of the deep fire - glow — [her]148-esther breast heaves up and down in angry , quick pants . "[201-mrs. brandon] [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon , do [you]201-mrs. brandon suppose that [they]2288-they would be so impertinent — ? " [she]148-esther begins , fiercely ; then breaks off , ashamed . "[201-mrs. brandon] [I]0-i forgot ; it would be no impertinence then ! Well ! " ( with a long low sigh ) "[0-i] [I]0-i am tough : [I]0-i have borne worse things ! This is but a little thing , after all ; [I]0-i can bear this ! " "[0-i] [I]0-i think , [Esther]148-esther , that if , as [I]0-i fear , [you]148-esther are leaning on [your]148-esther own strength , and not on an Unseen Arm , [you]148-esther are overrating [your]148-esther powers of endurance . " "[148-esther] Perhaps ; [I]0-i can but try . " "[148-esther] Impossible ! " answers [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon , with cool , common sense . "[148-esther] Who would hire [you]148-esther ? Ridiculous!—childish ! No , [Esther]148-esther ; [we]2289-we must try and find something more eligible for [you]148-esther , if [you]148-esther are still foolishly bent on declining the happy , and respectable , and ( [I]0-i humbly hope [I]0-i may say ) pious [home]701-home that [I]0-i am so willing — that [we]2289-we are all so willing — to offer [you]148-esther . " "[148-esther] Oh yes ! yes ! yes ! " cries [the child]5047-the child , passionately . "[148-esther] [I]0-i am bent on it ! It is less degrading even to be exposed , as [you]148-esther say , to the witticisms of [the footman]2286-the footman and the friendship of [the cook]645-the cook , than to live upon people on whom [you]148-esther have no claim beyond that of having been already most ungrateful to [them]2293-them — than to impose on [their]2293-them generosity , to sponge upon [them]2293-them ! " "[148-esther] As [you]148-esther will , [Esther]148-esther , " answers [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon , loving [her]148-esther too little , and respecting [her]148-esther independence of spirit too much , to reason further with [her]148-esther . There is a pause — a pause broken presently by [Esther]148-esther , who speaks diffidently : "[148-esther] [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon , do n't [you]201-mrs. brandon think that if [I]0-i could get into [one of [those large shops in [London]16-london]2295-those large shops in london]2294-one of those large shops in london , or [one of [our great towns]2297-our great towns]2296-one of our great towns , [I]0-i could try on cloaks , and measure yards of ribbon , without requiring any great amount of knowledge of any kind , theoretical or practical ? " [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon looks doubtful . "[201-mrs. brandon] It is not so easy as [you]148-esther may imagine , [[my]0-i dear]804-my dear , to obtain admission into [one of [those shops]2300-those shops]2299-one of those shops : [a friend of mine]2301-a friend of mine made great efforts to get a situation for [a protégé of [hers]2301-a friend of mine at [Marshal & Snelgrove 's]93-marshal & snelgrove 's]2302-a protégé of hers at marshal & snelgrove 's , or [Lewis & Allenby]430-lewis & allenby 's , and after waiting a long time , was obliged to give it up as hopeless . " "[2301-a friend of mine] Perhaps [she]2301-a friend of mine was not tall ? " suggests [Esther]148-esther , rather timidly . "[2301-a friend of mine] [I]0-i really never inquired . " "[2301-a friend of mine] [They]2303-they like [them]2303-they tall ! " says [the girl]682-the girl , involuntarily drawing up [her]0-i slight élancé figure ; "[2303-they] and [I]0-i 'm tall , am [I]0-i not ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i should imagine that that qualification alone would hardly suffice , " answers [the old lady]3509-the old lady , drily ; "[0-i] and indeed , " [she]0-i continues , pursing up [her]0-i mouth rather primly , "[0-i] even if it would , [I]0-i should hardly think a situation in [a shop]2304-a shop , or [other place of public resort]2305-other place of public resort , desirable for [a girl so young]2306-a girl so young , and of so — so — so peculiar an appearance as [you]2307-you . " "[0-i] [I]0-i did not say odd - looking , [[my]0-i dear]804-my dear , " returns [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon , sharply ; "[0-i] please do n't put words into [my]0-i mouth . " "[0-i] If [people]3426-people came to buy cloaks , [they]3426-people would surely be thinking of how [they]3426-people were looking , not how [I]0-i looked , " says [Esther]148-esther , not yet quite recovered from [her]0-i annoyed astonishment ; "[3426-people] [my]0-i appearance , beyond the mere fact of [my]0-i being tall , could not be of much consequence one way or another . " [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon takes off and lays down [her]201-mrs. brandon spectacles the better to point the rebuke [she]201-mrs. brandon is about to administer . " [Esther]148-esther flings up [her]148-esther head with an angry gesture . "[0-i] [I]0-i really do n't see what temptations [a person]759-a person even as unsteady and irreligious as [I]0-i am , " [she]0-i says , contemptuously , "[759-a person] could be exposed to in [a haberdasher 's shop]2316-a haberdasher 's shop . Temptation , in [a woman]553-a woman 's mouth , always implies something about [men]595-men ; and in [a place specially devoted to [woman]3638-woman 's dress]2319-a place specially devoted to woman 's dress , [one]559-one would be less likely to see [them]595-men than in [any other spot on [the face of the earth]2323-the face of the earth]2322-any other spot on the face of the earth . " "[148-esther] If [you]148-esther are so much better informed on the subject than [a person of treble]2324-a person of treble [your]148-esther years and experience , " says [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon , resuming [her]201-mrs. brandon spectacles , and beginning to knit faster than ever , "[148-esther] [I]0-i have , of course , no more to say . " An apposite retort rises prompt and saucy to [Esther]148-esther 's lips , clamouring for egress through those sweet red gates ; but the recollection of [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon 's weak tea and legs of mutton , and the obligations thereto hanging , drives it back again . [She]201-mrs. brandon leans [her]201-mrs. brandon elbow on [her]201-mrs. brandon knee , and elevates [her]201-mrs. brandon straight dark brows . "[0-i] The question is , " [she]201-mrs. brandon says , gravely , "[148-esther] can [you]148-esther suggest anything better ? When [one]559-one has no money , and none of the acquirements that command money , [one]559-one must take what [one]559-one can get , and be thankful . " But [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon is silent , counting [her]201-mrs. brandon stitches , buried in calculations as to whether [her]201-mrs. brandon stocking - leg has attained the length and breadth suited to the dimensions of one of [[her]201-mrs. brandon son]3724-her son 's large limbs . The wind shakes the shutter as if , in its lonely coldness outside , it coveted the fire and lamp - light . The old grey cat sits on the fender - stool beside [Esther]148-esther , yawning prodigiously every now and then ; [her]201-mrs. brandon round fore - paws gathered trimly under [her]201-mrs. brandon , and the sleepy benignity of [her]201-mrs. brandon face half - contradicting the fierce stiffness of [her]201-mrs. brandon whiskers , and the tigerish upward curve of [her]201-mrs. brandon lips . "[559-one] What is done in haste is always ill - done , [[my]0-i dear]804-my dear ! " says [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon , presently , having satisfactorily calculated that five more rows will conduct [her]201-mrs. brandon to [Bob]190-bob 's large heel — giving utterance to [her]201-mrs. brandon little trite saw with a certain air of complacency . Original remarks come forth doubtfully , questioningly , feeling their way : it is only a well aired platitude that can strut and swagger forwards in the certainty of a good reception . "[2328-we] [We]2328-we will think over the subject seriously and prayerfully : [we]2328-we will take it with [us]2328-we to [the Throne of Grace]2329-the throne of grace , and make it the subject of special intercession of worship this evening . " "[804-my dear] Oh no , no ! please not!—please not ! " cries [Esther]148-esther , the lilies in [her]148-esther fair cheek turning quickly to deepest , angriest carnations . "[804-my dear] [I]0-i should not like it : [I]0-i could not come to prayers if [you]804-my dear did . Why can not [we]2328-we talk it over now , this instant ? There 's no time like the present . " "[0-i] [I]0-i see no hurry , [Esther]148-esther , " answers [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon , coldly . "[148-esther] But there is a hurry!—every hurry ! " exclaims [the girl]682-the girl , passionately , throwing [herself]682-the girl on the floor beside [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon , too much in earnest to be chilled by the frosty cold of [her]682-the girl manner ; [her]682-the girl whole soul thrown , in bright entreaty , into the great clear pupils of [her]682-the girl superb , up - looking eyes . "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't think [I]0-i ever knew what the words meant till now . [I]0-i do n't believe [I]0-i ever could have been in a real hurry in [my]0-i life before ! Put [yourself]804-my dear in [my]0-i position , [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon , " [she]0-i says , laying [her]0-i little eager hand on [[her]0-i companion]3572-her companion 's rusty - black - coburg knee ; "[201-mrs. brandon] imagine how [you]804-my dear would like to be wholly dependent , not only for luxuries and comforts — one might well do without [them]2330-them — but for bare bread and water , on people that are neither kith nor kin to [you]804-my dear , and that have taken [you]804-my dear in out of Christian charity , and , because [they]2331-they think it right — not in the least because [they]2331-they love [you]804-my dear ! " "[148-esther] If [I]0-i were exposed to such a trial , [Esther]148-esther , " replied [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon , deliberately rubbing [her]0-i spectacles gently with [her]0-i pocket - handkerchief , "[148-esther] [I]0-i hope that [I]0-i should bear it meekly ; that [I]0-i should kiss the rod , knowing that it was an Allwise Hand that brandished it , and that [I]0-i was so chastened in order to lower the pride of a too carnal heart . " "[435-god] Then God forbid that [my]0-i carnal heart may ever be so lowered ! " cries [the other]1100-the other , springing impetuously to [her]0-i feet , and drawing up [her]0-i head haughtily . "[435-god] Why , " [she]0-i continues , beginning to walk up and down [the little room]3745-the little room with agitated steps and fingers hotly interlaced—"why[435-god] did [God]435-god implant such an instinct as self - respect in [us]2332-our , if supinely submitting to what destroys all self - respect is a passport to heaven ? Who would bow beneath any rod if [they]2331-they could get from under it ? It is a metaphor that always reminds [me]0-i of [a naughty child]2333-a naughty child , or [a broken - spirited cur]2334-a broken - spirited cur . " [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon deposits [her]201-mrs. brandon knitting on the table ; rises slowly — [old people]3729-old people 's joints , like wooden dolls , decline to bend on short notice ( it is a pity , is it not , that [our]2332-our machinery is not calculated to remain in a state of efficiency , even through [our]2332-our paltry seventy years?)—dismounts from the footstool , on which [her]201-mrs. brandon feet have been perched , walks to the door , there stands , and , shaking [her]201-mrs. brandon stiff , grey curls , speaks with trembling severity : "[148-esther] [Esther]148-esther , until [you]148-esther can discuss this subject with less irreverent violence , [I]0-i must beg to decline any further conversation upon it . [She]164-st. john had begged earnestly for the expunging of [the "[201-mrs. brandon] pious family]5057-the " pious family . " "[201-mrs. brandon] It is not true , [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon , " [she]0-i says , with vexed tears in [her]0-i eyes ; "[201-mrs. brandon] it is nothing to [me]0-i whether [they]2341-they are pious or not — the salary is far the greatest object . " "[201-mrs. brandon] If it is , [[my]0-i dear]804-my dear , it ought not to be , " answers promptly [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon , who , having paid for the insertion of the advertisement , thinks that [she]201-mrs. brandon has a right to word it as [she]201-mrs. brandon wishes . And now it has gone forth through the length and breadth of [the civilized world]5058-the civilized world , from [the Arctic]94-the arctic to [the Antarctic Poles]95-the antarctic poles — has found its way into clubs and [cafés]5059-cafés , [hotels]5060-hotels and [private houses]5061-private houses , numerous as [the sea - sand grains]5062-the sea - sand grains , in the overgrown advertisement sheet of the Times . To [not one in ten thousand of [that journal 's millions of readers]5064-that journal 's millions of readers]5063-not one in ten thousand of that journal 's millions of readers is it more interesting than any other announcement in the long columns of — "[2343-a cook] Wanted , [a cook]2343-a cook , " "[2343-a cook] Wanted , [a cook]2343-a cook . " "[2345-a good plain cook] Wanted , [a good plain cook]2345-a good plain cook . " "[2346-a footman] Wanted , [a footman]2346-a footman . " "[2346-a footman] Wanted , [a footman]2346-a footman . " A companionship , then , is what has been decided upon as the vocation to which [Esther]148-esther is best suited : it requires neither French nor German , neither astronomy nor the use of the globes : it demands only a patience out - Jobing Job , a meekness out - Mosesing [Moses]431-moses , a capacity for eating dirt greater than that of [any parvenu struggling into society]5065-any parvenu struggling into society , health and spirits more aggressively strong than [a schoolboy]5066-a schoolboy 's , and a pliability greater than [an osier]5067-an osier 's . These qualities being supposed to be more quickly acquirable than music , drawing , and languages , [Esther]148-esther has decided upon entering on [the office that will call for the exercise of [them]5069-them all]5068-the office that will call for the exercise of them all . Besides the printed advertisement above quoted , [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon has been advertising largely in private , by means of many long - winded epistles ; has been seeking far and wide among [the circle of [her]201-mrs. brandon acquaintance]5070-the circle of her acquaintance for [some grey maid]5071-some grey maid , [wife]4219-wife , or [widow]5073-widow , in the tending of whose haggard , peevish age [Esther]148-esther may waste [her]148-esther sweet , ripe youth , unassailed by [wicked men]5074-wicked men , in safe , respectable misery . And meanwhile [Esther]148-esther waits — waits through the fog - shrouded , sun - forgotten November days , through the eternal black November nights,—waits , straying lonely along the steaming tree - caverned wood - paths — the solemn charnels of the dead summer nations of leaves and flowers . [Preachers]5075-preachers are fond of drawing a parallel between [us]5076-us and those forest leaves ; telling [us]5076-us that , as in the autumn they fall , rot , are dissolved , and mingle together , stamped down and shapeless , in brown confusion , and yet in the spring come forth again , fresh as ever ; so shall [we]5076-us — who , in [our]5076-us autumn , die , rot , and are not — come forth again in [our]5076-us distant spring , in lordly beauty and gladness . So speaking , whether thinkingly or unthinkingly , [they]5075-preachers equivocate — [they]5075-preachers lie ! It is not the same leaves that reappear ; others like [them]5075-preachers burst from their sappy buds , and burgeon in .the "[2346-a footman] green - haired woods ; " but not [they]5075-preachers — not [they]5075-preachers ! [They]5075-preachers stir not , nor is there any movement among the sodden earth- mass that was [them]5075-preachers . If the parallel be complete , [others like [us]5076-us]5077-others like us — others as good , as fair , as [we]5076-us ! but yet not [we]5076-us — other than [us]5076-us , shall break forth in lusty youth , in [their]5075-preachers strong May - time ; but [we]5076-us shall rot on ! "[2346-a footman] Oh touching , patient earth , That weepest in [thy]2348-thy glee;Whom [God]435-god created very good , And very mournful [we]2349-we ! " how much longer can [you]5078-your bear the weight of all [[your]5078-your dead children]5079-your dead children , that lie so heavy on [your]5078-your mother breast ! One morning , on joining [the Brandon family]3713-the brandon family before prayers , [Esther]148-esther finds [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon reading aloud a letter ; but on [Esther]148-esther 's entrance [she]0-i desists . Hearing [her]0-i voice stop , [the young girl]3585-the young girl comes forward eagerly . "[435-god] Is it about [me]0-i ? " [she]0-i asks , panting , forgetting [her]0-i morning salutations . "[148-esther] Yes , [Esther]148-esther , " replies [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon , laconically , continuing to read , but this time to [herself]201-mrs. brandon . [Esther]148-esther walks to the window , drums on the rain - beaten pane , returns to the table ; takes up the bread - knife , and begins to chip bits of crust off the loaf ; sits down , gets up again ; then , unable to contain [herself]148-esther any longer , cries out , hastily , "[148-esther] Will it do?—will it do ? " "[148-esther] If [you]148-esther will give [me]0-i time , [[my]0-i dear]804-my dear , to finish this letter in peace , [I]0-i shall have a better chance of being able to tell [you]148-esther , " answers [the old lady]3509-the old lady , drily . [Esther]148-esther sits down again , snubbed ; and then the door opens , and [the three middle - aged , quakerish maid - servants]5083-the three middle - aged , quakerish maid - servants make [their]5083-the three middle - aged , quakerish maid - servants sober entry , each with bible and hymnal in [her]148-esther hand ; and the long exposition , the eight - versed hymn , and extempore prayer set in . To [Esther]148-esther 's ears , all the words of exposition , hymn , and prayer seem to be , "[0-i] Will it do ? — will it do ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i have received a letter , " begins [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon , slowly addressing [Esther]148-esther , when the "[0-i] exercise " is ended , "[0-i] from [a valued Christian friend of [mine]0-i]2351-a valued christian friend of mine , who has lately met with [a lady]1109-a lady and [gentleman considerably advanced in life , who are on the look - out for a — " "[1109-a lady] Companion]2353-gentleman considerably advanced in life , who are on the look - out for a — " " companion ? " interrupted [Esther]148-esther , breathlessly . " [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon seats [herself]201-mrs. brandon at the table , and begins to pour out the tea out of a huge , deep - bodied family tea - pot . [Miss Bessy]202-bessy divides the small curling rashers of fat bacon into four exactly equal portions . At [Plas Berwyn]38-plas berwyn it is generally a case of "[432-cynegan] [Cynegan]432-cynegan 's Feast ; or enough and no waste . " That is to say , at the first onslaught everything vanishes ; and if [any one , with fruitless gluttony]5094-any one , with fruitless gluttony , craves a second help , [he]5094-any one , with fruitless gluttony must console [himself]5094-any one , with fruitless gluttony with the idea that [many medical men]5095-many medical men agree in the opinion that , in order to preserve [ourselves]5096-ourselves in perfect health , [we]5096-ourselves should always rise from table feeling hungry . " "[0-i] Perhaps so , " answers [the young girl]3585-the young girl , calmly ; but to [her]3585-the young girl own heart [she]3585-the young girl says that [she]3585-the young girl defies any earthly furnace to burn hotlier than the one [she]3585-the young girl has already passed through . IN another week letters have passed , references been asked and given ; [Esther]148-esther proved unimpeachably respectable ; the amount of [her]148-esther salary agreed upon ; the day of [her]148-esther journey into — shire fixed , and all preliminaries settled previous to [her]148-esther undertaking the agreeable , free , and independent office of companion to [John Blessington]433-john blessington , Esq . , of [Blessington Court]97-blessington court , in [the county of —]5098-the county of — , aged eighty - nine , and to [Harriet Blessington]434-harriet blessington [[his]433-john blessington wife]542-his wife , aged eighty . [Miss Craven]164-st. john has but one good - bye to say , and on the afternoon of the day before [her]164-st. john departure [she]164-st. john stands in [the churchyard]5100-the churchyard ready to say it . It is only to a grave . [Huge cloud headlands]5101-huge cloud headlands , great leaden capes and promontories , mournful and heavy with unwept snow - tears , heap and pile themselves up behind [the dim mirk hills]5102-the dim mirk hills ; it snowed last night , but the snow has nearly all melted ; only enough remains to make [the old dirty church - tower]5103-the old dirty church - tower , from which great patches of whitewash have fallen , look dirtier than ever . Upon the broken headstones , all awry and askew with age and negligence , the lichens flourish dankly . Wet nettles and faded bents overlie , overcross [each cold hillock]5104-each cold hillock . [No one]891-no one cares to weed in [the garden of the dead]5106-the garden of the dead . [Each hillock]5107-each hillock is the last chapter in some forgotten history . Oh ! why must all stories that are told truly end amongst the worms ? Why must death be always at the end of life ? Oh ! if [we]5108-we could but get it over , like some cruelest operation , in the middle or early part of [our]5108-we little day ; so that [we]5108-we might have some half a life , some quarter or twentieth part even of one , to live merrily in , to breathe and laugh and be gay in , without , in [our]5108-we cheerfullest moments , experiencing the chilly fear of feeling [the black - cloaked skeleton - headed phantom]5109-the black - cloaked skeleton - headed phantom lay [his]5109-the black - cloaked skeleton - headed phantom bony finger on [us]5108-we , saying , "[0-i] [Thou]2389-thou art [mine]2389-thou ! " Upon the grey flat tombstone near the church - gate [the great grave yew]5110-the great grave yew has been dropping [her]5110-the great grave yew scarlet berries , one by one — berries that shine , like little lights , amid the night of [her]5110-the great grave yew changeless foliage : there they lie like a forgotten rosary , that [some holy man]5111-some holy man , having prayed amongst [the unpraying dead]5112-the unpraying dead , going , has left behind [him]5111-some holy man . Evening is closing in fast ; the air is raw and chill ; [no one that can avoid it]5113-no one that can avoid it is outside [[a house]4042-a house 's sheltering walls]5115-a house 's sheltering walls : there is [no one]891-no one to disturb [Esther]148-esther 's meeting with [[her]148-esther brother]644-her brother . What cares [she]148-esther for the cold , or for the six feet of miry earth that part them . [She]148-esther flings [herself]148-esther upon the sodden mound ; stretching [herself]148-esther all along upon it , as [the prophet]5118-the prophet stretched [himself]5118-the prophet on [the young dead child]5119-the young dead child — hand to hand , heart to heart , mouth to mouth . [She]148-esther lays [her]148-esther lips upon the soaked soil , and whispers moaningly , "[146-jack] Good - bye , [Jack]146-jack — good - bye ! Oh ! why wo n't [they]2390-they let [you]2391-you answer [me]0-i ? Why have [they]2390-they buried [you]2391-you so deep that [you]2391-you can not hear [me]0-i ? " [Lord God]435-god ! of what stuff can [Mary]387-mary and [Martha]134-pat have been made , to have overlived the awful ecstasy of seeing [their]2390-they dead come forth in warm supple life out of the four - days - holding grave ! [Their]2390-they hearts must have been made of tougher fibre than [ours]5120-ours , or , in the agony of that terrible rapture , soul and body must have sundered suddenly , and [they]2390-they fallen down into the arms of [that tomb]5121-that tomb whence [[their]2390-they brother]4030-their brother had just issued in [his]4030-their brother ghastly cerements , in dazed , astonished gladness ! As [Esther]148-esther lifts [her]148-esther streaming eyes , [they]2390-they fall upon the inscription on the cross at the grave - head : "[2392-lord] [Lord]2392-lord , have mercy upon [me]0-i . [a sinner]2393-a sinner ! " [She]148-esther casts [her]148-esther arms about the base of the holy symbol ; [she]148-esther presses [her]148-esther panting breast against the stone . "[2394-lord] [Lord]2394-lord , have mercy upon [me]0-i , [a sinner]2393-a sinner ! " [she]148-esther cries too ; and surely [the live sinner]5123-the live sinner needs mercy as much as [the dead one]5124-the dead one ? And as [she]148-esther so lies prostrate , with [her]148-esther forehead leant against the white damp marble , a hideous doubt flashes into [her]148-esther heart — sits there , like a little bitter serpent , gnawing it : "[2394-lord] What if there be [no Lord]2396-no lord ! What if [I]0-i am praying and weeping to and calling upon nothing ! " . . . . . . . Let [me]2397-me not go mad!Sweet Heaven , forgive weak thoughts ! If there should beNo [God]435-god , no heaven , [no earth in [the void world]5126-the void world]5125-no earth in the void world — [The wide , grave , lampless , deep , unpeopled world]5127-the wide , grave , lampless , deep , unpeopled world . "[2397-me] [They]2397-me tell [us]2398-us — don't they?—in [our]2398-us childhood , that wickedness makes [people]3426-people unhappy : [I]0-i think the converse is full as often true — that unhappiness makes [people]3426-people wicked . A little icy wind creeps coldly amongst the strong nettles and weak sapless bents , blowing them all one way — creeps , too , through [Esther]148-esther 's mourning weeds , and makes a numbness about [her]148-esther shivering breast . For a moment an angry defiant despair masters [her]148-esther . " What if [this great distant being , who , without any foregone sin of [ours]2398-us , has laid upon [us]2398-us the punishment of life — in the hollow of whose hand [we]2398-us lie!—what if [He]5128-this great distant being , who , without any foregone sin of ours , has laid upon us the punishment of life — in the hollow of whose hand we lie!—what if he be laughing at us all this while be laughing at [us]2398-us all this while]5128-this great distant being , who , without any foregone sin of ours , has laid upon us the punishment of life — in the hollow of whose hand we lie!—what if he be laughing at us all this while ! "[148-esther] So thinking , against [her]148-esther will [she]148-esther involuntarily clasps closer the cross in [her]148-esther straining arms — involuntarily moans a second time , " [Lord]5129-lord , have mercy upon [me]148-esther , [a sinner]2393-a sinner ! "[148-esther] No — no ! it can not be so ! it is one of those things that are too horrible to be believed ! There is no justice here ! none ! but it exists somewhere ! How else could [we]2401-us ever have conceived the idea of it ? It is , then , in [some other world]2402-some other world : [we]2401-us shall find it on the other side of [these drenched , nettly charnels]2403-these drenched , nettly charnels — on the other side of corruption 's disgrace and abasement : " . . . . . . . . If this be all , And other life await [us]2401-us not , for oneI say , ' tis [a poor cheat]5131-a poor cheat , [a stupid bungle]5132-a stupid bungle , A wretched failure 1 [I]148-esther , for one , protestAgainst it — and [I]148-esther hurl it back with scorn ! "[148-esther] Despair never stays long with [any one]523-any one , unless it is specially invited . Struck with sudden horror at the daring blasphemy of [her]148-esther thoughts , [wretched Esther]148-esther , with clasped hands and a flood of penitential tears , sinks upon [her]148-esther trembling knees . God grant that the thoughts that come to [us]2401-us , [we]2401-us know not whence , that stab [us]2401-us in the dark , that [we]2401-us welcome not , neither cherish at all — yea , rather , drive [them]2405-them away rudely , hatingly — may not be counted to [us]2401-us for crimes in [His]2406-him great Day of Reckoning , any more than the sudden - smiting disease that makes [the strong man]2407-the strong man flag in [his]2406-him noonday is counted to [him]2406-him ! With a sudden revulsion of feeling , with a paroxysm of devotion , powerfuller than [the former one of doubt]2408-the former one of doubt had been , [the desolate child]2409-the desolate child , ' prone on the grave of [her]2409-the desolate child one treasure , lifts quivering lips and emptied arms to [Him]2406-him who " . . . . .
