" If [you]148-esther have never been used to take it before , [I]148-esther should think two or three drops would be hample , ' m ; [I]148-esther hope , ' m "[148-esther] ( with a little anxiety in [her]148-esther florid plebeian face ) , " as [you]148-esther 'll be careful not to take a hoverdose , or [you]148-esther might chance never to wake up again : [I]148-esther knew [a young person]726-a young person as took it by mistake for ' black dose'—it was the fault of [the chemist 's young man]5317-the chemist 's young man — and in an hour [she]726-a young person was [a corpse]5318-a corpse ; [they]5319-they said as [she]726-a young person had took enough to kill [ten men]5320-ten men . "[148-esther] " It is no wonder that [she]726-a young person was a corpse , then , "[164-st. john] [Miss Craven]164-st. john answers , with a slight smile . " [I]164-st. john should not think "[164-st. john] ( scrutinising the little bottle inquisitively ) , " that there was enough here to kill [one woman]2108-one woman , let alone [ten men]5320-ten men . Yes , [I]148-esther 'll be careful ; thanks , very much . Good night ! "[148-esther] ( with [her]148-esther pretty courteous smile ) . [The housemaid]647-the housemaid being gone , [Esther]148-esther bolts the door — a weakly defensive measure against [one class of assailants]2597-one class of assailants , [the crape - masked burglars]2598-the crape - masked burglars ; though , as [she]148-esther is aware , utterly impotent against [the other and worse class]2599-the other and worse class — [the intangible , unkeep - outable revenants]2600-the intangible , unkeep - outable revenants ; the rustlers along [the passage]5265-the passage , the rattlers of the lock . [She]148-esther then seats [herself]148-esther at the dressing - table , flings down [her]148-esther arms among [her]148-esther brushes and combs , and sinks [her]148-esther head upon them , in closest proximity to the candles , whose little spires of flame the wind , thrusting its thin body in between window and frame , drives right against the tumbled plenty of [her]148-esther hair . In this attitude [she]148-esther remains a long time ; forgetting even to search under the bed , up the chimney , behind the screen , or in the huge japanned chest , upon which a disconnected but interesting landscape of cocks , pagodas , and junks picks itself out , in tarnished yellow , from the dull black ground . It is impossible for the most comprehensive mind or body to contain any two distinct , even though not necessarily opposite feelings , in their fullest force , at the same time . If one is famished with hunger , [one]559-one can not be consumed by thirst ; if [one]559-one is consumed by thirst , [one]559-one can not be famished with hunger . If [one]559-one is in despair at being forgotten by [[one]559-one 's lover]2607-one 's lover , [one]559-one is indifferent as to the onset of any number of ghosts and [murderers]2609-murderers ; if [one]559-one is paralyzed by fear of ghosts and [murderers]2609-murderers , [one]559-one is tolerably indifferent as to [[one]559-one 's lover]2607-one 's lover 's lapse of memory . For the first time since [his]2615-his death , [Jack]146-jack is not the leading thought in [Esther]148-esther 's mind . [Poor dead]2616-poor dead ! How can [they]2617-they be so unreasonable as to expect to be [anyone]2618-anyone 's leading thought ? Even [we]2619-i noisy , voiceful , visible living are obliged to keep crying out , " [I]2619-i am here — remember [me]2619-i , "[2619-i] in order not to sink into oblivion amongst [[our]2619-i neighbours]2620-our neighbours and [kinsfolk]105-kinsfolk . " Wilt [thou]5323-thou remember [me]2619-i when [I]2619-i am gone , Further each day from [thy]5323-thou vision withdrawn — [Thou]5323-thou in the sunset , and [I]2619-i in the dawn ? "[2619-i] Pretty , tender , touching lines ; but [I]0-i think that the answer to them , if given truly , would hardly content [the asker]2621-the asker : " [I]164-st. john will remember [thee]5323-thou for a very little while ; even till [I]164-st. john see [some one younger and prettier than [thou]5323-thou wert]5324-some one younger and prettier than thou wert , and then [I]164-st. john will forget [thee]5323-thou ! "[164-st. john] [Miss Craven]164-st. john starts up , after awhile , and begins to walk up and down , over the creaky , up - and - downy boards , and to speak vehemently and out loud to the rats , who , numerous and cheerful as usual , are scrabbling , pattering , squeaking under the floor , behind the wainscot , in [the japan - chest]2622-the japan - chest . " At all events , "[164-st. john] [she]164-st. john says , with a sort of savage satisfaction , " there is one comfort : [he]2619-i 'll be miserable — [he'll]2619-i curse the day when [he]2619-i ties [himself]2619-i to that lump of blancmange . [Blancmange]456-blancmange ! white meat ! that exactly expresses [her]164-st. john ; [she]164-st. john looks as if [she]164-st. john would be good to eat — soft , luscious , ripe . Unfortunately , [a man]3402-a man does not contemplate eating [[his]3402-a man wife]542-his wife ! "[164-st. john] But even this little angry gleam of comfort has but a short life . Soon , too soon , it occurs to [her]164-st. john that [men]595-men do not look at [a woman with [women]547-women 's eyes]2624-a woman with women 's eyes . [Men]595-men , being three parts animal [themselves]595-men , condone any offence to [a woman]553-a woman [the animal part of whom is perfect and beautiful]2628-the animal part of whom is perfect and beautiful . How else is it that beauty — mere blank beauty , although destitute of any accessory charms — can always command its price in the market , and that price a high one ? In marrying [Constance]256-constance , [St. John]164-st. john will have no disappointments to undergo , no discoveries to make . [He]2629-he has known [her]256-constance all [her]256-constance life ; has seen [her]256-constance change from [a handsome stupid child]2630-a handsome stupid child into [a handsomer stupider girl]2631-a handsomer stupider girl , and bloom , lastly , into [a handsomest , stupidest woman]2632-a handsomest , stupidest woman . [Constance]256-constance has no antecedents ; [she]256-constance is [a woman without a history]2633-a woman without a history . That also is in [her]256-constance favour . [A man]3402-a man likes to write [his]3402-a man name on a sheet of white paper better than on one upon which [many other men]2635-many other men have written [theirs]2635-many other men . Perfectly virtuous , perfectly healthy , perfectly beautiful , young , rich , not ill - tempered , not fast , not shrew - tongued — surely [she]256-constance is a prize worth [any man]2636-any man 's drawing . If , in addition to [her]256-constance long list of qualifications , [she]256-constance possessed also [Desdemona]457-desdemona 's heart and [Imogen]458-imogen 's mind , it would be too hard upon the rest of [womankind]2637-womankind : " Why should [one woman]2108-one woman have all goodly things ? "[256-constance] Want of sympathy with [the companion]2638-the companion of [her]256-constance life makes [a woman]553-a woman embittered , reckless — sends [her]256-constance often trespassing on [[her]256-constance neighbours]2640-her neighbours ' preserves , in the endeavour to find there that congeniality of spirit which is not to be met with in [her]256-constance own . Want of sympathy with [the companion of [his]3402-a man life]2641-the companion of his life sends [[a man]3402-a man oftener to [[his]3402-a man club]2644-his club]2643-a man oftener to his club ; makes [him]3402-a man much pleasanter to [other women]3773-other women when [he]3402-a man goes into society ; makes [him]3402-a man sulky and sleepy when [he]3402-a man dines at [home]701-home — that is all . Doubtless [St. John]164-st. john will be indifferent to [[his]3402-a man bride]2647-his bride at first ; [he]3402-a man will dislocate [his]3402-a man jaw with yawning during [their]2648-they wedding - tour , but [she]2647-his bride will bear [him]3402-a man children ; " selon les [us]5328-us et coutumes Anglaises , elle aura beaucoup d'enfants ; "[3402-a man] [he]3402-a man will like [her]2647-his bride for that . Year by year [they]2648-they will come here to [Blessington]256-constance , probably . Year by year [she]2647-his bride ( [Esther]148-esther ) will see the blossom of a fuller contentment on [his]3402-a man wide brow , the quiet of a deeper rest in [his]3402-a man restless eyes . And [she]2647-his bride [herself]2647-his bride will be here always , for [one]559-one can not throw away [one]559-one 's daily bread . Year by year [they]2648-they will find [her]2647-his bride with ever thinner hair , sharper shoulders , drabber cheeks ; and [he]3402-a man , looking upon [her]2647-his bride with the forgiveness of complete indifference , will say to [himself]3402-a man , " [She]2647-his bride is bad , and [she]2647-his bride is ugly ; [I]3402-a man was well rid of [her]2647-his bride ! "[3402-a man] Than to be so forgiven , how much rather would [she]2647-his bride have been struck down dead by [his]3402-a man hand , lifted in righteous anger and vengeance , on that moonlit September night , beside the glassy rush - brimmed mere at [Felton]44-felton ! A sudden rage at [her]2647-his bride own fatuity fills [her]2647-his bride , when [she]2647-his bride looks back on that idiotic hope that had upsprung in [her]2647-his bride mind , that [his]3402-a man object in coming to [Blessington]256-constance was to pardon [her]2647-his bride , and take [her]2647-his bride back to [himself]3402-a man . Do [men]595-men ever pardon a sin against [themselves]595-men ? " ..... Worse than despair , Worse than the bitterness of death , is hope . It is the only ill which can find placeUpon the giddy , sharp , and narrow hourTottering beneath [us]5329-us . Plead with the swift frost , That it should spare the eldest flower of spring ; Plead with awakening earthquake , o'er whose couchEven now [a city]5330-a city stands , strong , fair and free , Now stench and blackness yawns like death . Oh ! pleadWith famine and wind - walking pestilence , Blind lightning , or [the deep sea]5331-the deep sea ; not with [man]3613-man — [Cruel , cold formal man]5333-cruel , cold formal man - righteous in words , In deeds a [Cain]230-cain . "[2647-his bride] [She]2647-his bride sits down before [her]2647-his bride looking - glass , and stares desperately , with inner eyes , at the blank ruin of [her]2647-his bride life ; with outer eyes at the ruin mirrored in [her]2647-his bride sunken , altered face , that the old looking - glass , blurred with rust stains , makes look more sunken and altered still . Involuntarily [she]2647-his bride lifts [her]2647-his bride thumb and forefinger , and lays them in the hollows of [her]2647-his bride cheek , as if seeking for the red carnations that used to flower so fairly there . [She]2647-his bride has noticed before the decay of [her]2647-his bride beauty — noticed it with apathy , as who should say , " Everything else is gone , why should not this go too ? "[2647-his bride] But now [she]2647-his bride observes it with a sick pang , as at the parting with [a friend]1386-a friend ; [she]2647-his bride would give ten years of [her]2647-his bride life to reach it back again . " It was only for [my]2647-his bride beauty [he]2653-one shipwrecked , floating about on a plank among the weltering waves of some great plunging , grey - green sea liked [me]2647-his bride , "[2647-his bride] [she]2647-his bride says , still speaking aloud ; " it was only for [my]2647-his bride beauty that [anybody]740-anybody could like [me]2647-his bride ; there is nothing else to like in [me]2647-his bride . [I]2647-his bride never was clever , or said witty things , or sang , or played : [I]2647-his bride was only pretty . Now that that is gone , everything is gone ! "[2647-his bride] As [one shipwrecked , floating about on a plank among the weltering waves of some great plunging , grey - green sea]2653-one shipwrecked , floating about on a plank among the weltering waves of some great plunging , grey - green sea , strains [his]2653-one shipwrecked , floating about on a plank among the weltering waves of some great plunging , grey - green sea eyes along the horizon to see some sail - speck , some misty palm - island , that looks as though it were hung midway in air ; so [she]2647-his bride strains [her]2647-his bride mental eyes to catch sight of [some friendly ship that may take [her]2647-his bride off from]2654-some friendly ship that may take her off from [this rock of [her]2647-his bride despair]2655-this rock of her despair . [This world]549-this world is full , of pairs , but some oversight has left a good many odd ones also ; [Esther]148-esther is an odd one . [[Her]148-esther road]2657-her road has come to a blank wall , and there stopped . Is there no ladder that can overclimb this wall?—no gap in all the thickness of [its]2658-its brick - and - mortar?—no outlet ? [She]148-esther rises and stands by the fire ; [her]148-esther eyes down - dropped on the blue - and - white Dutch tiles — on the hobs , and queer brass - inlaid dogs : involuntarily [she]148-esther raises them , and [they]2659-they rest upon the little laudanum - bottle on the chimneypiece . Quick as lightning , an answer to [her]148-esther thought - question seems flashed across [her]148-esther mind . There is a ladder that can over - climb any wall ; there is a gap that can give egress through [the stoutest masonries]2660-the stoutest masonries ; there is an outlet from [the deepest dungeon]2661-the deepest dungeon ; and this ladder , this gap , this outlet , [men call Death]2662-men call death . Over the sea of [her]148-esther memory [the housemaid]647-the housemaid 's words float back : " [I]647-the housemaid hope [you]2665-you 'll be careful not to take an overdose , ' m , or [you]2665-you might chance never to wake again ! "[647-the housemaid] [They]2664-they had been spoken in careful warning ; to [her]148-esther they seemed words of persuasive promise . Never to wake again ! Never to say again in the evening , " Would God it were morning ! "[647-the housemaid] and in the morning , " Would [God]435-god it were evening ! "[647-the housemaid] To [Esther]148-esther , the great sting of death had always laid in [his]2665-you pain — in [his]2665-you gasping breath , twitched features , writhen unfleshed limbs ; but this death that comes in sleep can be no bitterer than a mother that lifts [[her]2666-her little slumbering child]2667-her little slumbering child out of [his]2667-her little slumbering child small bed ( [he]2667-her little slumbering child not knowing ) , and bears [him]2667-her little slumbering child away softly . The idea of self - slaughter , when first suggested , has always something terrific , especially to [us]2668-we , who from [our]2668-we birth have been taught to look upon it as a crime hardly second to murder ; to [us]2668-we , to whom [Cato]459-cato 's great heroism and [Lucretia]460-lucretia 's chaste martyrdom seem as sins . Some vague idea that suicide is forbidden in the Scriptures runs through [Esther]148-esther 's mind . [She]148-esther sits down at the table , and , drawing a Bible towards [her]148-esther , searches long among the partial , temporary , and local prohibitions and commands of the Books of the Law , and still longer among the universal , all - applying prohibitions and commands of Gospel and Epistle . Whether it be that [she]148-esther search ill , or that there is nought therein written on the subject [she]148-esther seeks , [she]148-esther knows not ; only [she]148-esther finds nothing ; and , closing the book , [she]148-esther leans [her]148-esther pale cheek on [her]148-esther closed white hand . [Her]148-esther brain feels strangely calm , and [she]148-esther even forgets the darkness of the night , musing on a deeper darkness . What is this death , that [we]2668-we write in such great black letters ? After all , what is it that [we]2668-we know about [him]2667-her little slumbering child , for or against ? Is it fair to condemn [him]2667-her little slumbering child unheard , unknown ? Why should [we]2668-we give [him]2667-her little slumbering child any embodiment?—why should [we]2668-we personify [him]2667-her little slumbering child at all ? [He]2667-her little slumbering child is but an ending : what is there in the end of anything more terrifying than in its beginning , or its middle ? Death is but the end of life , as birth is its beginning , and as some unnoticed moment in its course is its middle . Why are the waters in which [we]2668-we set [our]2668-we feet at the last more coldly awful than those out of which [we]2668-we stepped at the first ? Both — both , are they not [portions of [the great sea of Eternity]2670-the great sea of eternity that floweth ever round [[Time]106-time 's little island]2671-time 's little island]2669-portions of the great sea of eternity that floweth ever round time 's little island ? A clock is wound up for a certain number of hours ; when that number of hours has elapsed , it stops . [Our]2668-we more complicated machinery is wound up to go for a certain number of years , months , days ; when that number of years , months , and days is elapsed , [we]2668-we stop — that is all . What is this life , about the taking or keeping of which [we]2668-we make such a clamour , as if it were some great , costly , goodly thing ? " It is but a watch or a visionBetween a sleep and a sleep . "[2672-they] It is cowardly , disloyal , say [they]2672-they , for [a soldier]886-a soldier to desert the post at which [he]886-a soldier has been set . Ay , but [the galley - slave]2674-the galley - slave , chained to an oar , if [he]2674-the galley - slave can but break [his]2674-the galley - slave chain and be gone , may flee away , and [none]1161-none blame [him]2674-the galley - slave . [A prisoner that is not on parole]2676-a prisoner that is not on parole , what shall hinder [him]2674-the galley - slave from escaping ? If [he]2674-the galley - slave can but burst [his]2674-the galley - slave bars , and draw [his]2674-the galley - slave strong bolts , may [he]2674-the galley - slave not out and away into the free air ? If , before [our]2668-we birth , in that unknown pre - existence of [ours]2668-we at which backward - reaching memory catches not , [we]2668-we , standing looking into life , had said , " Oh , [Master]5335-master , give [me]2668-we of this life ! [I]2668-we know not what it is , but [I]2668-we would fain taste it ; and if [Thou]5336-thou givest it to [me]2668-we , [I]2668-we swear to [Thee]5336-thou to keep and guard it carefully , as long as [I]2668-we may—. "[2668-we] But have [we]2668-we ever so asked for it ? Has it not been thrust upon [us]2668-we , undesiring , unconsulted , as a gift that is neither of beauty nor of price ? Who can chide [us]2668-we , if , laying it down meekly at the everlasting feet , [we]2668-we say , " Oh , [Great Builder]5337-great builder ! take back [that house in which , [a reluctant tenant]5339-a reluctant tenant , [Thou]5336-thou hast placed [me]2668-we]5338-that house in which , a reluctant tenant , thou hast placed me . Resume [Thy]5336-thou gift ; it is a burden too heavy for [me]2668-we ! Lay it , [I]2668-we pray [Thee]5336-thou , on shoulders that mayhap may bear it stoutlier ! "[2668-we] [She]2677-her lifts the bottle , having uncorked it , to [her]2677-her lips and tastes . It has a deathly , sickly flavour , not enticing . Hesitating , [she]2677-her holds it in [her]2677-her hand , half - frightened , half - allured ; while [her]2677-her heart beats loud and hard . " It is the key to all [my]2677-her doubts , "[2677-her] [she]2677-her says within [herself]2677-her , looking steadfastly at it ; " it is the answer to all [my]2677-her questions . If [I]2677-her do but drink this little draught , [I]2677-her shall have all knowledge ; [I]2677-her shall never wonder again ! [I]2677-her shall know where [Jack]146-jack is ; [I]2677-her shall be with [him]146-jack ! But shall [I]2677-her ? "[2677-her] Ay , that 's the rub ! Even in [this small world]2678-this small world , to be alive at the same time with [another person]3540-another person is not necessarily , or even probably , to be with [him]3540-another person . [Wide continents]2680-wide continents , [high mountains]2681-high mountains , [deep rivers]2682-deep rivers often sever those that are closest of kin ; and in [the world of the dead , which , being so much more populous]2683-the world of the dead , which , being so much more populous , must be so much the greater , is it not likely that [still wider continents]2684-still wider continents , [higher mountains]2685-higher mountains , [deeper rivers]2686-deeper rivers , may part two that would fain be together ? What if , before [her]2677-her time , [she]2677-her incur the abasement of death , the dishonour of corruption , and yet attain not the object for whose sake [she]2677-her is willing desperately to lay [her]2677-her comely head in the dust ? [She]2677-her changes [her]2677-her attitude , puts down the bottle , and again stoops [her]2677-her small flower - face on [her]2677-her bent fingers — [her]2677-her thoughts varying their channel a little : " If [I]2677-her go , [I]2677-her shall leave no gap behind [me]2677-her , any more than a teacupful of water taken out of a great pool leaves a gap behind . If it is disgraceful to go willingly out of [the world]672-the world , instead of being dragged unwillingly out of it , [my]2677-her disgrace is [my]2677-her own . [I]2677-her involve [no one else]1651-no one else in it ; there is [no one of]5342-no one of [my]2677-her name left to be ashamed of [me]2677-her . [I]2677-her leave no work undone in [the world]672-the world . Hundreds of [others]4701-others can carry air - cushions , and read to [a deaf old man]5345-a deaf old man far more patiently than [I]2677-her have done . [My]2677-her fifty pounds a year will go to put daily bread into [some other poor woman]5346-some other poor woman 's mouth , to whom it may perhaps taste sweeter than it has done to [me]2677-her . "[2677-her] [Her]2677-her head sinks forward again on [her]2677-her outstretched arms . .... " It is awful to go out into the dark all by [oneself]5347-oneself , "[2677-her] [she]2677-her thinks , with a pang of intense self - pity , as [she]2677-her feels the warm , gentle life throbbing in [her]2677-her round , tender limbs : " and [I]2677-her , that hate the dark so — , is it very wicked of [me]2677-her to think of this thing ? [People]3426-people will say so , but [I]2677-her will not hear [them]3426-people . Where shall [I]2677-her be to - morrow at even ? "[2677-her] " [You]148-esther will be at [Blessington]256-constance , and feeling a good deal ashamed of [your]148-esther absurd paroxysm of cowardly despair , "[2677-her] answers plain common sense , who , in the shape of an untold multitude of rats , begins rushing and gnawing , hundred- toothed , scampering hundred - footed behind the walls . [Esther]148-esther lifts [her]2677-her foolish prone head , and listens . " Skurry — skurry ! "[148-esther] go the rats ; " Crack ! "[148-esther] go the beams ; " Thud ! "[148-esther] goes some unexplained bulk , in [the dining - room underneath]2687-the dining - room underneath ! As the tide , at flood , creeps up and over [the sands]2688-the sands , so [the child]5047-the child 's old fear creeps up and over [her]2677-her new mad scheme of suicide . " Rustle — rustle ! "[148-esther] come the ghostly dresses along [the China gallery]2690-the china gallery ; " Click , rattle — rattle , click ! "[148-esther] goes the door - lock . Down goes the laudanum bottle on the table , and [Esther]148-esther , springing to [her]148-esther feet , begins to unfasten , with fingers rendered nervous by extreme haste , [her]148-esther dress and the belt round [her]148-esther slim waist . " Crack — crack — crack ! "[148-esther] goes something close to the bed - head ; " Bang ! "[148-esther] goes a distant door . There is no wind ; what or who can have executed that bang The fire , which has been burning hollow for some time , collapses , and falls in suddenly with a clear , loud noise . In one leap [Miss Craven]164-st. john is in bed and beneath the sheltering bed - clothes . All very well pensively to contemplate , in half - earnest , the conveying [oneself]2691-oneself out of a world that has been [a most harsh step - mother]2692-a most harsh step - mother to one , but by no means well to have one 's graceful farewells to existence broken in upon by [a nation]2693-a nation tailed and whiskered — by the spirits of [old reprobates in flowered dressing - gowns]2694-old reprobates in flowered dressing - gowns , and of [ladies]1534-ladies , who nightly carry [their]1534-ladies patched and powdered heads like parcels under [their]1534-ladies arms . JOHN]461-st . john has arrived ; [he]461-st . john has jumped down from [the dog - cart]4538-the dog - cart that brought [him]461-st . john from [the station]1067-the station , wrapped up in a huge greatcoat lined with otter - skin , that makes [him]461-st . john look like " [three single gentlemen rolled into one . "]5349-three single gentlemen rolled into one . "[461-st . john] [His]461-st . john nose , always rather a salient point in [his]461-st . john face , is reddened by the east winds , and [his]461-st . john eyelids purple with want of sleep , as [he]461-st . john has been travelling night and day — not from any violent hurry to reach [his]461-st . john destination , but because [boats]2699-boats and [mail - trains]2700-mail - trains suited — from [the South of [Ireland]3-ireland]2701-the south of ireland , where for the last ten days [he]461-st . john has been daily shooting [the wily woodcock]2702-the wily woodcock , and nightly putting into practice the excellent resolution expressed in the song of " not going [home]701-home till morning , "[461-st . john] with [some rather fast bachelor - friends]2703-some rather fast bachelor - friends , who , like [himself]461-st . john , are as yet destitute of [household angels]2704-household angels , to bring heaven to [their]2703-some rather fast bachelor - friends hearths , to take away [their]2703-some rather fast bachelor - friends cues , blow out [their]2703-some rather fast bachelor - friends cigars , and reduce the number of [their]2703-some rather fast bachelor - friends brandies and sodas . Neither a good - looking nor [a good - tempered young man]2705-a good - tempered young man does [he]461-st . john look as [he]461-st . john makes [his]461-st . john descent . The first [he]461-st . john can not help — the second [he]461-st . john can . [His]461-st . john ill - humour is owing partly to a violent headache ; partly to the information , just imparted to [him]461-st . john by [the butler]1089-the butler , that " [the family]3846-the family dines at six o'clock now reg'lar — no difference made whatever company there may be — on account of [the old squire]5153-the old squire 's ' ealth . "[1089-the butler] Perhaps , had [St. John]164-st. john known that [a woman]553-a woman was watching [his]461-st . john arrival , [he]461-st . john might have endeavoured to smooth [his]461-st . john features into an expression of greater amiability . Had [he]461-st . john known that [that woman]2708-that woman was [Esther Craven]148-esther , the look of bored annoyance would certainly have given way to a stronger one , whether of pleasure or pain . Crouched on one of the paintless window - seats in [the China gallery]2690-the china gallery , [she]2708-that woman watches [his]461-st . john coming , as [she]2708-that woman had watched [his]461-st . john going ; only that now [she]2708-that woman makes no smallest effort to attract [his]461-st . john attention — cowers away rather in the dark , while [he]461-st . john stands , unconscious and grumbling , in the patch of red light that comes through the open hall - door . [He]461-st . john has been [here]3398-here half an hour now — half an hour spent in [the hot airtight saloon]2711-the hot airtight saloon , where the giant fire draws a strong woolly smell from [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington 's winter dress , as [she]2708-that woman sits right into the fire — a practice not permitted by [the autocrat of [Felton]44-felton , and consequently largely indulged in by [[his]461-st . john subjects]2713-his subjects when away from [his]461-st . john master - eye]2712-the autocrat of felton , and consequently largely indulged in by his subjects when away from his master - eye . [The old squire]5153-the old squire has requested [St. John]164-st. john to come round to [his]461-st . john other side — to draw [his]461-st . john chair closer to [his]461-st . john — to speak more distinctly . [The old lady]3509-the old lady has explained to [him]461-st . john the exact manner in which the draught comes through the middle window , and catches [her]2708-that woman just at the back of the neck , so that when [she]2708-that woman wakes in the morning it is so stiff that [she]2708-that woman can hardly turn it a quarter of an inch one way or another . [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington has expressed one fear that [he]461-st . john had had a cold journey down , and another that [he]461-st . john had not been able to get a foot - warmer at [Shoreditch]107-shoreditch ; there were always so shamefully few [there]594-there , particularly [these afternoon trains]2717-these afternoon trains , that [all the business - men]2718-all the business - men came down from [[their]2718-all the business - men offices]2719-their offices by . [Constance]256-constance had certainly never spoken a truer word , than in saying that [she]256-constance and [[her]256-constance lover]683-her lover were not fond of public demonstrations ; the question that [[their]2721-their acquaintance]2722-their acquaintance asked [each other]909-each other was , whether [they]2721-their were any fonder of private ones . As the clock strikes half - past five , [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington rises and floats away lightly , and without noise , to dress . "[164-st. john] " Exactly , "[3509-the old lady] answers [the old lady]3509-the old lady , innocently . " And [she]256-constance is a satisfactory beast of burden , [I]258-miss blessington hope ? "[258-miss blessington] says [Gerard]258-miss blessington , yawning till the tears come into [his]2735-his eyes ; " fetches and carries well ? "[258-miss blessington] " [She]256-constance seems a nice , quiet , ladylike person enough , "[437-mrs. blessington] replies [Mrs. Blessington]437-mrs. blessington , leaning back placidly in [her]437-mrs. blessington chair , with [her]437-mrs. blessington hands , in black kid half - gloves , lying folded in [her]437-mrs. blessington lap—"only , unfortunately , over - sensitive : [those sort of people]5357-those sort of people always are . Why , it was only yesterday that [she]256-constance rushed from [this room]1342-this room with such violence that [she]256-constance nearly shook [Constance]256-constance and [me]258-miss blessington out of [our]5359-our chairs , because [I]258-miss blessington made some slight observation about [a brother of [hers]256-constance]5360-a brother of hers who died lately , and to whom , it seems , [she]256-constance was much attached . [I]258-miss blessington 'm sure [I]258-miss blessington had no intention of hurting [her]256-constance feelings , [poor girl]5361-poor girl ! "[258-miss blessington] " [Girl]463-girl ! "[164-st. john] repeats [St. John]164-st. john , laughing ; " that means a gushing thing of fifty , [I]164-st. john suppose ? "[164-st. john] " More like fifteen . [By - the - by]5362-by - the - by , [she]256-constance said something the other day about having known [you]670-the young man . "[258-miss blessington] " Known [me]670-the young man ! "[670-the young man] cries [the young man]670-the young man , opening [his]670-the young man quick grey eyes . " Well , ' more know [Tom Fool]464-tom fool than [Tom Fool]464-tom fool knows . ' [I]670-the young man never knew any one in [my]670-the young man life that had a ' companion'—of this sort , [I]670-the young man mean . What may [[my]670-the young man unknown friend]5363-my unknown friend 's name be ? "[670-the young man] But at this juncture , before the name of [[his]670-the young man unknown friend]2737-his unknown friend can be confided to [him]670-the young man , [the old squire]5153-the old squire , waking up , urgently requests to be told what [they]2739-they are talking about , which information is communicated , in a succession of long dull roars , into [his]670-the young man good ear . [St. John]164-st. john takes advantage of the diversion to leave [the room]3629-the room , and , running [upstairs]3979-upstairs , knocks at [Constance]256-constance 's door . " [Constance]256-constance ! "[164-st. john] " Who 's [there]594-there ? "[164-st. john] ( Voice rather muffled — from under an avalanche of hair apparently ) . " [I.]164-st. john Can [you]256-constance come out and speak to [me]164-st. john for a minute , if [you]256-constance are not in [too great deshabille]5365-too great deshabille ? "[164-st. john] " Certainly . "[164-st. john] Ordinarily , [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington is a prude ; but to appear for an instant before [[her]258-miss blessington betrothed]1635-her betrothed in light - blue cashmere lined with blue satin , and [her]258-miss blessington hair in golden rain about [her]258-miss blessington shoulders , is , [she]258-miss blessington thinks , for once permissible . Has [he]5153-the old squire come to make some demonstration of affection?—to give [her]258-miss blessington some warmer greeting than the nonchalant handshake with which [they]2743-they met ? Or has [he]5153-the old squire , has [he]5153-the old squire — oh sweeter , warmer thought!—brought [her]258-miss blessington a present from [Ireland]3-ireland ? Visions of Irish poplin , Irish lace , bog - oak and gold , cunningly fashioned together into bracelet or necklace , float before [her]258-miss blessington mind 's eye . In a moment , with a little affected coyness on [her]258-miss blessington face , [she]258-miss blessington stands before [him]5153-the old squire ; stands before [him]5153-the old squire — and [he]5153-the old squire does not even see [her]258-miss blessington ! [He]5153-the old squire has opened one of the rusty casements in [the passage]5265-the passage , and thrust [his]5153-the old squire head out , feeling the keen eastern blast blow against [his]5153-the old squire throbbing brow with a sense of relief . [He]5153-the old squire has evidently no gift in [his]5153-the old squire hand , nor does [he]5153-the old squire seem to be assailed by any very over - powering temptation to embrace [her]258-miss blessington , blue and gold and white miracle though [she]258-miss blessington be . Hearing [her]258-miss blessington [he]5153-the old squire turns , and the expression of [his]5153-the old squire countenance is glum . " [I]5153-the old squire say , does this sort of thing happen every day ? "[5153-the old squire] " What sort of thing ? "[5153-the old squire] ( with a little pique at the errand on which [she]258-miss blessington has been called away from among [her]258-miss blessington cosmetics ) . " This feeding , [I]5153-the old squire can not call it dining , like [savages]1763-savages , at mid - day ? "[5153-the old squire] " It is a fancy of [[my]256-constance uncle]5170-my uncle , "[256-constance] replies [Constance]256-constance , with the door - handle still in [her]256-constance hand ; " [he]5170-my uncle imagines that , if [he]5170-my uncle dined later , [he]5170-my uncle should not have time to digest [his]5170-my uncle food before going to bed . "[256-constance] [St. John]164-st. john utters an impatient exclamation . " In [Heaven]182-heaven 's name let [him]5170-my uncle digest in bed , then ; or , if not , let [him]5170-my uncle dine by [himself]5170-my uncle ! [I]164-st. john 'm sure [no one]891-no one would object to that arrangement . [Poor old boy]5369-poor old boy ! [he]5170-my uncle ca n't help it ; but it does take away [one]559-one 's appetite to see [a very old man]2478-a very old man mumbling [his]5170-my uncle food , like a toothless old dog over a bone . "[164-st. john] " [I]256-constance suppose [he]5170-my uncle may dine at what hour [he]5170-my uncle chooses in [[his]5170-my uncle own house]5372-his own house ? "[256-constance] says [Constance]256-constance , coldly . " Of course [he]5170-my uncle may . [He]5170-my uncle may go back to the manners and customs of [the ancient British]5373-the ancient british , "[258-miss blessington] rejoins [Gerard]258-miss blessington , impatiently ; " [he]5170-my uncle may get up in the middle of the night and paint [himself]5170-my uncle in blue - and - white stripes , instead of wearing coat and waistcoat , if [he]5170-my uncle chooses — only [he]5170-my uncle can hardly expect [civilized beings]5374-civilized beings to join [him]5170-my uncle . "[258-miss blessington] " [I]256-constance always think it right , on principle , to humour [old people]3729-old people 's whims , "[256-constance] answers [Constance]256-constance , taking the high moral tone that [she]256-constance has adopted more than once since [their]2745-their engagement in any discussion with [[her]256-constance lover]683-her lover , a tone symptomatic of what the postnuptial line of attack is likely to be . " A very excellent sentiment , [[my]164-st. john dear]804-my dear , "[164-st. john] says [St. John]164-st. john , a little mockingly , " worthy of being copied by [little boys]5377-little boys and [girls]1384-girls after [they]5379-they have mastered straight strokes and pot - hooks ; but to - night [I]164-st. john must request [the aged]2532-the aged to humour [my]164-st. john whim , and [my]164-st. john whim is to absent [myself]164-st. john from this symposium . [I]164-st. john have got a splitting headache , and am altogether pretty nearly dead - beat . [I]164-st. john have hardly a leg to stand upon : if [you]5381-you wo n't take it as a personal insult , [I]164-st. john have a good mind to turn in at once . [I]164-st. john have not been in bed , for any time worth speaking of , for the last ten days . "[164-st. john] " Indeed ! "[256-constance] replies [Constance]256-constance , freezing up , and looking as though tortures should not wring from [her]256-constance any question as to what had been the vicious pursuits that had detained [[her]256-constance lover]683-her lover from balmy slumbers . " [You]164-st. john will please [yourself]164-st. john of course . "[164-st. john] " If [every one]869-every one pleased [themselves]869-every one , and [no one else]1651-no one else , this would be [a much more passable world to live in]5384-a much more passable world to live in , "[164-st. john] retorts [St. John]164-st. john , with a little misanthropy ; " for then [each person]4215-each person would get [their]869-every one fair share of attention neither more nor less , which is what [they]869-every one do not now . "[164-st. john] But the last half of [his]683-her lover sentence is addressed to [himself]683-her lover , as [[his]683-her lover madonna]2748-his madonna has retired again within [[her]2748-his madonna shrine]2749-her shrine . Meanwhile , for the first time since [[her]2748-his madonna brother]644-her brother 's death , [the " companion"—the[2751-the " companion"—the nice , quiet , young ladylike person , whose only fault is being over - sensitive] nice , quiet , young ladylike person , whose only fault is being over - sensitive]2751-the " companion"—the nice , quiet , young ladylike person , whose only fault is being over - sensitive — is , like [Constance]256-constance , making a toilette . Since [Jack]146-jack 's death [she]2748-his madonna has daily put on [her]2748-his madonna clothes , as a necessary preliminary to the day 's work ; but it has been a task full of weariness — devoid of pleasure . To - night , like [Constance]256-constance , [she]2748-his madonna makes a toilette , and like [Constance]256-constance , it is for the benefit of [the young man who does not know gingham from " gaze [de Chambéry]465-de chambéry]5386-the young man who does not know gingham from " gaze de chambéry . "[2748-his madonna] It is not , however , with any faintest hope that [her]2748-his madonna Sunday frock , any more than [her]2748-his madonna work - a - day one , will bring back [[her]2748-his madonna lost lover]2752-her lost lover to [her]2748-his madonna side , that [she]2748-his madonna puts [the former]1843-the former on . The very strength of [her]2748-his madonna faith in [his]2752-her lost lover honour hinders the possibility of [his]2752-her lost lover turning away from [the woman [he]2752-her lost lover has promised to marry]2754-the woman he has promised to marry to [any other woman]2755-any other woman from entering [her]2748-his madonna head . Only , seeing , as plainly as if it were another 's and not [her]2748-his madonna own , the ruin of the face that meets [her]2748-his madonna , daily and nightly , in the dim oval of the old glass in [its]2756-its tarnished frame , [she]2748-his madonna wishes that that ruin might be revealed slowly , and by degrees ( not all at once ) , to [him]2752-her lost lover that had once thought [her]2748-his madonna so fair . For this one night , [she]2748-his madonna would fain look like [her]2748-his madonna old self — would [fain]2757-fain be pretty plump [Esther Craven]148-esther , whose face , dimpled and débonnaire , [men]595-men used to turn round in [the street]4154-the street to look after — instead of [the thin depressed " companion]5387-the thin depressed " companion , "[5387-the thin depressed " companion] whom if [men looked at at all]2760-men looked at at all , it was only to pity [her]2748-his madonna sunken white cheeks and sombre mourning weeds . [Her]2748-his madonna Sunday frock is a lugubrious combination of cheap black silk and crape , against which [her]2748-his madonna artistic eye has been revolting ever since [she]2748-his madonna heard of [St. John]164-st. john 's coming . A little white tucker will not make [her]2748-his madonna any the less mindful of [Jack]146-jack . And so [she]2748-his madonna has been devoting most of the short winter daylight to the inserting of [such a tucker]2761-such a tucker , and to cutting the funereal body square . The alterations have been effected , now the Sunday frock is on : if it had been costliest velvet or satin , instead of papery silk at two - and - sixpence [a yard]2762-a yard , its black could not have contrasted better with the milkwhite of the long lily . throat and swelling bust . [Esther]148-esther has lost flesh a good deal lately ; but , being small - boned and thoroughly well - made , no unsightly hollows show as yet , like salt - cellars , beneath [her]2748-his madonna collar - bones — not yet are elbows or shoulders sharp . Brilliancy of colouring is gone ; but the head , arched like the Clyte 's , is still left , and great plenty of night dark hair to clothe it . Instead of the unnatural protuberance of a chignon , [she]2748-his madonna has arranged this hair in the thick plain twists with which in the old time [[Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington 's betrothed]2763-miss blessington 's betrothed used — .... " to playNot knowing — , "[2748-his madonna] and , so playing , spoke in loving commendation of [them]2763-miss blessington 's betrothed . In like twists [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington [herself]258-miss blessington often disposes [her]258-miss blessington locks — twists purchased by [her]258-miss blessington for a considerable price from [M. Isidore]466-m. isidore , golden hair being hard to match , and consequently expensive . It is five minutes to six . The toilette is finished , and [Esther]148-esther stands before the glass considering it ; but with none of the triumphant self - content with which [a fine woman]2764-a fine woman usually regards the victory that art and nature , fighting side by side , have achieved on the battle - field of [her]2748-his madonna face . Colour had been [Esther]148-esther 's strong point , and colour has gone from [her]148-esther ; as it goes from a violet sent in a letter , or from a poppy dried between the leaves of a love - song . A raging desire for rouge , raddle , plate - powder — anything to bring back that flower - flush that used to need no persuasion to stay with [her]2748-his madonna — enters [her]2748-his madonna mind . But neither rouge nor raddle is near , and for plate - powder [she]2748-his madonna would have to apply to [the butler]1089-the butler — an effort for which not even [her]2748-his madonna great wish to appear once more red - cheeked before [[her]2748-his madonna ex - lover]2766-her ex - lover can nerve [her]2748-his madonna . Suddenly , [her]2748-his madonna eyes fall on a spray of scarlet geranium , that , plucked this morning in [the conservatory]4436-the conservatory , [she]2748-his madonna has worn all day in the breast of [her]2748-his madonna dress . A recollection comes to [her]2748-his madonna of having , when [a child]3412-a child , crushed one of those dazzling flowers against the face of [another child]2769-another child , and of having laughed with pleasure at the scarlet stain . [She]2748-his madonna snatches up eagerly some of the petals , and rubs them on [her]2748-his madonna cheeks ; the hue produced , though too scarlet for nature , is vivid and beautifying . [She]2748-his madonna sets to work on the other cheek . [Esther]148-esther is not [a very cunning artiste]2770-a very cunning artiste ; [she]148-esther has no idea of softening off edges with cotton - wool — of working deftly from cheekbone downwards . [She]148-esther is only possessed by a great longing to get back , for this one night , something of [her]148-esther old brilliancy . And in this [she]148-esther partially succeeds . The result of [her]148-esther labours is , indeed , a too hectic bloom ; but the bright colour seems to fill up somewhat the hollowed cheeks — seems to bring back a little of the old childish débonnaire grace . [Her]148-esther labour ended , [she]148-esther runs [downstairs]1293-downstairs quickly — not giving [herself]148-esther time for remorse at the meretricious nature of [her]148-esther charms , and listens , trembling all over , at the saloon - door before entering . There is no sound except the rolling grunts with which , unheard by [himself]2772-himself , [the old gentleman]5182-the old gentleman accompanies every respiration . [A footman]2346-a footman crosses [the hall]658-the hall ; [the " companion]5388-the " companion "[148-esther] must not be caught eavesdropping ; [she]148-esther turns the door - handle and goes in . [The old squire]5153-the old squire , with coat - tails under [his]5153-the old squire arms , standing on tottery old legs before the fire ; [the old lady]3509-the old lady , in [her]3509-the old lady evening - cap , sunk in armchair and Shetland shawls ; [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington , with blue bands binding close [her]258-miss blessington waved golden hair , and an expression of face less bland than usual , on the ottoman . [No one else]1651-no one else . " How smart [you]5182-the old gentleman are , [[my]3509-the old lady dear]804-my dear ! "[3509-the old lady] [the old lady]3509-the old lady says , not . unkindly , [her]3509-the old lady faded eyes straying slowly over the square- cut bodice , white tucker , and cabled hair . " Is that in honour of [Mr. Gerard]247-mr. gerard ? "[3509-the old lady] " It is rather thrown away if it is , "[247-mr. gerard] says [[Mr. Gerard]247-mr. gerard 's future owner]2780-mr. gerard 's future owner , with some temper : " [St. John]164-st. john has chosen to make [an invalid]1285-an invalid of [himself]164-st. john tonight , and has gone to bed . "[247-mr. gerard] No need now for the geranium dye — a great hot blush burns through it — burns throat and brow and neck ; [she]148-esther has made [herself]148-esther up in vain . " Gone to bed ! "[437-mrs. blessington] " [He]247-mr. gerard is quite able to take care of [himself]247-mr. gerard , [I]256-constance assure [you]256-constance — thanks , [aunt]1203-aunt , "[256-constance] replies [Constance]256-constance , not without a vexed ring in [her]256-constance low flute voice . " If [we]5393-we served [him]247-mr. gerard right , [we]5393-we should accept [him]247-mr. gerard as [the invalid]1283-the invalid [he]247-mr. gerard pretends [himself]247-mr. gerard , and allow [him]247-mr. gerard nothing but a little water - gruel or arrowroot . "[256-constance] " It seems so unnatural , [a young man]2580-a young man going to bed without [his]247-mr. gerard dinner ; [I]3509-the old lady 'm sure , [dear]951-dear , [I]3509-the old lady hope it is nothing serious , "[3509-the old lady] cries [the old lady]3509-the old lady , with that righteous horror of death and sickness which , by some strange contrariety , [one]559-one finds so often amongst [the aged]2532-the aged , so seldom amongst [the young]2784-the young . " Nothing more serious than the natural results of ten days ' Irish hospitality , "[256-constance] replies [Constance]256-constance , with a laugh , which , though low and highbred , is not mirthful ; " [men]595-men are so fond of [one another]922-one another 's society when [they]595-men get together , that [they]595-men never can take it in moderation . [I]256-constance dislike bachelor parties particularly . "[256-constance] " [He]247-mr. gerard is making the most of [his]247-mr. gerard time , [[my]3509-the old lady dear]804-my dear — [he]247-mr. gerard knows it is short , "[3509-the old lady] suggests [the old lady]3509-the old lady , smiling and nodding , and looking wise . " Quite right , too!—quite right ! [Sensible fellow]5400-sensible fellow — knows when [he]247-mr. gerard is well off ! So did [I]2786-the squire when [I]2786-the squire was [his]247-mr. gerard age — eh , [Mrs. Blessington]437-mrs. blessington ? "[2786-the squire] chimes in [the squire]2786-the squire , who , for a wonder , has caught the drift of the talk ; chuckling to [himself]2786-the squire at the recollection — perfectly clear , though [he]2786-the squire forgets what happened yesterday — of the pleasant immoralities that have the weight of over half a century lying upon them . " Dinner ! "[1089-the butler] announces [the butler]1089-the butler , coming close up to [[his]1089-the butler master]718-his master , and bawling unnecessarily loud . " [You]804-my dear 'll have to be content with [the old squire]5153-the old squire again , [Conny]256-constance , [[my]2484-the old man dear]804-my dear , "[2484-the old man] says [the old man]2484-the old man , putting out [his]2484-the old man feeble arm ; " [you]804-my dear 'll find [the old fellows]5403-the old fellows are best , after all . "[2484-the old man] " [I]256-constance quite agree with [you]2484-the old man , [uncle]5144-uncle — [I]256-constance think [they]5403-the old fellows are , "[256-constance] replies [Constance]256-constance , gravely ; and so , [the old man]2484-the old man supported on [one young girl]2791-one young girl 's arm , and [the old woman]3507-the old woman on another 's , [the procession]2793-the procession toddles solemnly , at a snail 's pace , into [the carefully - warmed and shaded dining - room]2794-the carefully - warmed and shaded dining - room . " What a brilliant colour [you]2484-the old man have to - night , [Miss Craven]164-st. john ! "[256-constance] says [Constance]256-constance that evening ; endeavouring vainly to get a strong light thrown upon [Esther]148-esther 's countenance — the one small lamp , with its deep green shade , effectually baffling [her]148-esther . " [I]148-esther went out in the wind , and it caught [my]148-esther face , "[148-esther] answers [Esther]148-esther , hurriedly : involuntarily raising [her]148-esther hands to [her]148-esther cheeks and then snatching them away again , in the fear that the scarlet dye , staining them , may betray [her]148-esther secret . " But there was no wind to - day , and [I]148-esther did not think that [you]2484-the old man had been outside the doors ? "[148-esther] " Yes , [I]148-esther was ; [I]148-esther went for a run in [the park]3880-the park just before dressing - time . "[148-esther] " It must have been quite dark . "[148-esther] " It is never quite dark out - of - doors ; total darkness is a human invention , [I]256-constance think ; there is always a sort of owl light . "[256-constance] [Constance]256-constance shrugs [her]256-constance shoulders : " Chacun à [son goût]5406-son goût , [I]256-constance prefer leaving it to the owls . "[256-constance] " It stifles [me]258-miss blessington staying indoors all day ; [I]258-miss blessington have never been used to it . "[258-miss blessington] [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington unbuttons [her]258-miss blessington great eyes a little : " Really ? "[258-miss blessington] " Yes , really . "[258-miss blessington] " But there was no wind , surely ? "[256-constance] persists [Constance]256-constance . " Not a breath ! "[1100-the other] replies [the other]1100-the other , absently , forgetting [her]1100-the other former excuse for [her]1100-the other brilliant face . " There never is any wind worth calling a wind in [these low countries]5407-these low countries ; the winds keep to [the mountains]4682-the mountains , and very wise of them too . "[1100-the other] " But [you]1100-the other said it was the wind that had caught [your]1100-the other face ? "[256-constance] says [Constance]256-constance , raising [herself]256-constance from [her]256-constance lounging attitude with more animation than is customary to [her]256-constance . [Esther]148-esther starts . " Oh ! so [I]148-esther did — [I]148-esther forgot ; [I]148-esther meant the air , of course . "[148-esther] [Constance]256-constance looks slightly sceptical , but is too well - bred to pursue [her]256-constance inquiries further ; merely saying , languidly , as [she]256-constance rearranges the cushions upon which [her]256-constance stately shoulders rest posed , " Glycerine - cream is the best thing in [the world]672-the world for a chapped face . "[256-constance] " Is it ? "[180-essie] answers [Essie]180-essie , guiltily conscious that a little cold water is the only glycerine - cream needed to effect the cure of [her]180-essie chapped face . " Have [you]180-essie seen [St. John]164-st. john since [he]2796-him came ? "[256-constance] asks [Constance]256-constance , presently ; the links that connect [his]2796-him name with [her]256-constance artificially - reddened countenance being painfully evident to [Miss Craven]164-st. john . " No — yes — no , not to speak to . "[164-st. john] " [You]180-essie were out when [he]2796-him came , [I]256-constance suppose , were n't [you]180-essie ? "[256-constance] " No , [I]164-st. john was [upstairs]3979-upstairs , "[164-st. john] " [I]164-st. john have not told [him]2796-him [you]180-essie are [here]3398-here ; it will be a surprise to [him]2796-him to meet [an old acquaintance]5412-an old acquaintance . "[164-st. john] [Esther]148-esther gives an involuntary start of dismay . " Why did not [you]180-essie tell [him]2796-him ? "[148-esther] [she]148-esther asks , hurriedly . " [I]148-esther ! Oh , [I]148-esther do n't know ; [I]148-esther have the worst memory in [the world]672-the world . [I]148-esther have intended to tell [him]2796-him in every letter , but [I]148-esther have always forgotten . "[148-esther] " Will [he]2796-him stay [here]3398-here long ? "[2798-the young companion] " Do [you]2798-the young companion think so ? [I]148-esther do n't much believe in omens . May is certainly the best time for [Paris]108-paris . "[148-esther] " Perhaps not , "[256-constance] answers [Constance]256-constance , closing [her]256-constance eyes , and looking bored , whereupon [Esther]148-esther lapses into silence . [Every Jack]146-jack has [[his]146-jack Jill]2799-his jill ; but [[my]0-i Jill]2800-my jill is probably in [Siberia]109-siberia or [Hong Kong]110-hong kong , and [yours]2801-yours is close at hand ; so [I]0-i marry [yours]2801-yours , and [you]2801-yours , being in [Siberia]109-siberia or [Hong Kong]110-hong kong , marry [mine]0-i , and [we]2802-we both rue it to [our]2802-we dying day . NEXT morning [St. John]164-st. john wakes , recovered from [his]2803-his ill temper , [his]2803-his headache , and all the effects of [his]2803-his Irish saturnalia . Perhaps , had [he]2803-his known who it was that lay wakeful in a great ginger four - poster , two doors off , [his]2803-his slumbers would not have been so profound . The hounds meet twelve miles away , at [Shepherds Hatch]111-shepherds hatch . By nine o'clock [he]2803-his is in the saddle , and riding quietly along [the deep Essex lanes and wet fields]2804-the deep essex lanes and wet fields , with a soft , south wind blowing in [his]2803-his face , and the grass , crisped by the slightest possible frost , beneath the horse 's hoofs . [He]2803-his is lucky enough to come in for the run of the season ; has the satisfaction of seeing [many better men than [himself]2803-his]2805-many better men than himself floundering , hatless and well - watered , in [a brook]2806-a brook , or getting croppers over stiff hawthorn hedges ; over all which obstacles [his]2803-his grey , a new investment , of whose fencing powers [he]2803-his and [[his]2803-his groom]2807-his groom had been unjustly doubtful , carries [him]2803-his like a bird . As to whether [[his]2803-his ladylove]2808-his ladylove may relish this early preference of " bold [Reynolds]207-reynolds "[2808-his ladylove] to [herself]2808-his ladylove , any more than [she]2808-his ladylove relished [his]2803-his fatigue and headache last night , [he]2803-his troubles [himself]2803-his but little . [He]2803-his has no intention whatever of being [a hen - pecked husband]2809-a hen - pecked husband . When [he]2803-his proposed to [her]2808-his ladylove , [he]2803-his told [her]2808-his ladylove what [he]2803-his could give [her]2808-his ladylove , and what [he]2803-his could not — what [she]2808-his ladylove might expect , and what [she]2808-his ladylove might not : nor has this day 's desertion been any departure from [his]2803-his half of the bargain . Somewhere about five o'clock [he]2803-his is back again at [Blessington]256-constance , splashed from head to heel ; [his]2803-his tops , in which this morning [you]2810-you might have seen [your]2810-you face , all stained and discoloured ; with a dab of mud on each cheek , and a third on the bridge of [his]2803-his nose . [He]2803-his runs [upstairs]3979-upstairs lightly , whistling a tune , and has just reached the first landing , when , " Click - clack , "[553-a woman] [he]2803-his hears [a woman]553-a woman 's high - heeled shoes descending . It is [Esther]148-esther , who is walking listlessly down , with [her]148-esther eyes fixed on a great picture let into the wall — [a large , white woman]2813-a large , white woman , with [her]2813-a large , white woman clothes tumbling off , hurling [her]2813-a large , white woman substantial person upon a spear ; [a young man , with arms like a blacksmith]2814-a young man , with arms like a blacksmith 's , lying on the ground , making a profuse display of [his]2814-a young man , with arms like a blacksmith charms , and , though with no very perceptible wound , evidently in articulo mortis ; a fat Cupid blubbering hard by — the whole entitled " [Pyramus]467-pyramus and Thisbe . "[164-st. john] [St. John]164-st. john looks upward , to see who [the author of the " click - clacking "]5426-the author of the " click - clacking "[2803-his] may be . " Who [the devil]748-the devil is [this pretty girl]5428-this pretty girl ? "[2803-his] is [his]2803-his first thought . [His]2803-his second — a thought that makes [him]2803-his stagger back with the colour hurrying from [his]2803-his healthy cheek — a thought full of anger , astonishment , desire , and pain — a thought that involuntarily [he]2803-his speaks aloud , is " [Esther]148-esther . "[2803-his] At almost the same moment [she]148-esther has caught sight of [him]2803-his . In [her]148-esther case , there is no surprise ; but the pain is as great , if not greater . " Yes , it is [I]148-esther , "[148-esther] [she]148-esther answers , almost inaudibly , trembling all over . [His]2803-his first impulse seems to be to rush away from [her]148-esther , to pass quickly [upstairs]3979-upstairs ; [his]2803-his second takes [him]2803-his to [her]148-esther side . " In [Heaven]182-heaven 's name , what brings [you]148-esther here ? "[2803-his] [he]2803-his asks , in a voice almost as low as [her]148-esther own , from intense repressed emotion . No answer . [His]2803-his voice has carried [her]148-esther back , across [the gulf of]2816-the gulf of [Jack]146-jack 's death , of [her]148-esther own servitude and failing health , to that night when , in [the starry Felton fields]2817-the starry felton fields , [she]148-esther had stood by [his]2803-his side , [[his]2803-his beloved , promised wife]2818-his beloved , promised wife . [You]2803-his are here always , then ? "[2803-his] " Always . "[2803-his] A pause ! "[2833-i] ( putting [her]2833-i hand for a second over [her]2833-i eyes ) . " [I]2833-i am tired of being punished now . [We]5456-we shall see very little of [one another heneforth]5457-one another heneforth , but that little might as well be in civility as in inoivility — mightn't it ? "[2833-i] " [Civility!"—he]468-civility!"—he[2803-his] repeats , without much of that quality in [his]2803-his tone—"civility between [you]2803-his and [me]2834-i ! And what would that end in , pray ? It would be oversweet at first , and bitterer than wormwood afterwards , as [our]5456-we former civility was . No — no ! [we]5456-we will have no sophisms , no absurd Platonisms here ! [God]435-god forbid [my]2834-i thrusting [myself]2834-i into temptation again ! [We]5456-we will say ' good morning ' and ' good evening ' to [one another]922-one another , as [people]3426-people would remark it if [we]5456-we did not . But for the rest , let [us]5456-we hold [our]5456-we tongues and keep apart ; and as soon as [I]2834-i can do it , without exciting great question , [you]2803-his may rely upon [my]2834-i going ; and then [we]5456-we shall have done with [one another]922-one another for good , [I]2834-i pray [God]435-god ! " Well , good - bye for the present ; [I]3894-the man suppose [I]3894-the man must be going to adorn for this unearthly meal . "[3894-the man] [No one]891-no one ever accused the dinners en famille at [Felton]44-felton of being too lively ; but , that evening , [Gerard]247-mr. gerard decides that [they]2844-they yield the palm , in point of perfect : stagnation , to [Blessington]256-constance . "[891-no one] At [Blessington]256-constance , indeed [the servants]4284-the servants have things pretty much [their]4284-the servants own way ; and , accustomed to [[their]4284-the servants master]4535-their master 's total and [mistress]2852-mistress 's partial deafness , have got into a habit of conversing with [one another]922-one another in a tone of voice considerably above that usually considered seemly in civilised ménages . "[256-constance] THIS ancient distich proves true in the year [I]0-i am speaking of . Not later than Christmas does the moist mild weather last . With January the frost comes hurrying back ; hanging great icicles on the house - eaves , throwing [men]595-men out of work , and pressing with its iron finger the thin faint life out of [half - a - dozen old almsmen]2891-half - a - dozen old almsmen and [almswomen]2892-almswomen . The foxes have a little breathing - time — a little space in which to steal and eat three or four more fat capons and stubble - fed geese — before that evil day when [[their]595-men dappled foes]2893-their dappled foes shall tear [their]595-men poor little red bodies limb from limb . Hunting is stopped , and [men]595-men are hurrying up from [the shires]2895-the shires to [London]16-london . [St. James 's Street]115-st. james 's street and [its]115-st. james 's street hundred clubs are crowded . At [Blessington]256-constance [everybody]3709-everybody is pirouetting on the ice . [St. John]164-st. john , passionately fond of all out - of - door sports , spends the whole day on [the mere]4460-the mere . One afternoon [a large party]2898-a large party comes over from [[Lord Linley]474-lord linley 's place]2899-lord linley 's place , five miles away . Not in [all [Lord Linley]474-lord linley 's grounds]2900-all lord linley 's grounds is there such a stretch of smooth ice as [the Blessington pool]2901-the blessington pool affords ; and so [they]2902-their are all come to show [their]2902-their prowess on its hard flat face . [Esther]148-esther keeps well out of [their]2902-their way . From [her]148-esther post of obcervation — the deep window - seat in [the China gallery]2690-the china gallery — [she]148-esther has watched [their]2902-their arrival , heard [their]2902-their gay voices in [the hall]658-the hall , and then , unnoticed , unmissed , [she]148-esther has stolen out upon one of [her]148-esther long , dawdling , cold - giving strolls in [the park]3880-the park : over the frost - crisped grass , under the branchy trees , whose staglike crowns cut the pale sky — up [little knolls]2906-little knolls and down into dips where , in summer time , the fern stands neck high . At last [she]148-esther comes in sight of [the mere]4460-the mere ; and , impelled by curiosity , trusting in [her]148-esther own insignificance to escape notice , sits down on [a bank that slopes gently down towards the sheet of water]2908-a bank that slopes gently down towards the sheet of water , and looks upon the unwonted brilliance of the scene . Girls in velvet short costumes ; bright petticoats , furs , hats with humming birds on them , curls , fair chignons , glancing in the cheerful winter sun . Fashion in all its folly and extravagance , but picturesque withal ; it is as if [a company of Dresden shepherdesses]2909-a company of dresden shepherdesses had stepped off the mantelshelf , and come tripping , dainty - footed , over [the frozen water]2910-the frozen water . [Her]148-esther eyes follow [the shepherdess figures]2911-the shepherdess figures with eager interest — so seldom in [her]148-esther simple country - bred life has [she]148-esther been brought into contact with [any of [[Fashion]475-fashion 's bright daughters]2913-fashion 's bright daughters]2912-any of fashion 's bright daughters . [The men]3783-the men have less attraction for [her]148-esther . Under no most prosperous conjunction of circumstances could [she]148-esther ever have been [a man]3402-a man ; but under happier auspices [she]148-esther might have been one of these fluttering butterflies — a prettier butterfly than any there , [her]148-esther heart tells [her]148-esther . [Shylock]476-shylock 's words recur to [her]148-esther : " Am not [I]476-shylock ' fed with the same food , hurt with the same weapons , subject to the same diseases , healed by the same means , warmed and cooled by the same winter and summer ? ' Why , then , are [they]3783-the men frisking about in purple and fine linen upon the ice , with [half - a - dozen young patricians]5488-half - a - dozen young patricians ( in trousers of surprising tightness and coats of unequalled brevity ) in [[their]5488-half - a - dozen young patricians train]5489-their train , while [I]476-shylock am perched here upon the all - alone stone , among these stiff cold sedges , with only the Canada geese , with [their]3783-the men long necks craned out , screeching above [my]476-shylock head ? Five minutes later , [Miss Craven]164-st. john 's scruples — such as never having skated before , having no skates , & c.—being overruled by [[her]164-st. john new acquaintance]2942-her new acquaintance , [she]164-st. john is sitting on [the bank]1730-the bank ; and [he]2942-her new acquaintance , kneeling before [her]164-st. john , is fastening [some one else]3400-some one else 's unused skates on [her]164-st. john little feet . A great desire for pleasure has come over [her]164-st. john — a great longing for warmth and colour in [her]164-st. john grey life , that looks all the greyer now in the contrast to the brilliant reds and purples of these strange lives with which it is brought into sudden contact . A great delight in the wintry brightness fills [her]164-st. john — in the shifting , varying hues — in the bubbling laughter ; a great impulse to laugh too , the spirit of [youth]615-youth rising up in arms against the tyranny of grief . The low sun shoots down dazzling crimson rays on [the mere]4460-the mere 's dirty white face . The swans and Solan geese are exiled to a little corner , where the ice has been broken for [them]2947-they , and where [they]2947-they have to keep swimming round and round to prevent the invasion of [[their]2947-they little territory by the grasping frost]2948-their little territory by the grasping frost . Girls that can not skate being pushed about in chairs ; " Whirr ! whirr ! "[2947-they] [they]2947-they rush along the smooth surface at a headlong pace . [Men]595-men , with [their]595-men arms stretched out like the sails of a windmill , advancing cautiously — first one foot , then the other — just managing to keep on [their]595-men feet , and thinking [themselves]595-men extremely clever for so managing . [Other men]3420-other men and [women]547-women flying hand - in - hand , from [one end of the pool]2952-one end of the pool to the other , in long , smooth slides — as safe and secure as if running upon [their]595-men own feet on the grass . Others , cutting eights , and all manner of figures , whirling round upon one leg , and making [themselves]595-men altogether remarkable . [One poor gentleman with [his]2953-one poor gentleman with his skates in the air , and head starring the ice skates in the air , and head starring the ice]2953-one poor gentleman with his skates in the air , and head starring the ice ; [brother men]2954-brother men laughing and jeering ; [pretty girls]2955-pretty girls pitying — light laughter mixed with [their]2955-pretty girls condolences also . [Eight people dancing a quadrille , chaîne des dames]2956-eight people dancing a quadrille , chaîne des dames : in and out , in and out — right , left — go the moving figures , the cerise petticoats , the glancing feet . It is all so pretty and gay . When [one]559-one has spent the best part of three months in weeping , when one has the quick blood of seventeen in one 's veins , [one]559-one longs to get up and run , and dance , and jump about too . Meanwhile [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington , a little out of breath with [her]258-miss blessington exertions , is resting on a chair , in bright blue velvet and a more delicate pink - and - white porcelain face than any of [the other shepherdesses]2969-the other shepherdesses . Over [her]258-miss blessington [Gerard]258-miss blessington is leaning — frowning , sad , and heavy - hearted . [He]2981-he is thirty now , and — [the Gerards]244-the gerards are [a long - lived , tough race]2989-a long - lived , tough race — [he]2981-he may live till ninety . "[485-mr. shandy] Strive as [he]2981-he may against the conviction , the yoke that [he]2981-he has taken upon [himself]2981-he in careless apathy has already begun to gall [[his]2981-he withers]2992-his withers . And yet it was not ( as [you]2993-you may imagine ) pique that first made [[Gerard Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington 's lover]2994-gerard miss blessington 's lover . P. , [the Hall]658-the hall , and [the lake]4492-the lake , and [the wide fat lands]3001-the wide fat lands will go to [some distant needy cousins , with whom [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas is at dagger 's drawing]3002-some distant needy cousins , with whom sir thomas is at dagger 's drawing , and for whom [he]2981-he cherishes a hatred livelier even than that which [poachers]3003-poachers , [Irish beggars]3004-irish beggars , and vulpecides inspire in [his]2981-he gentle breast . The fact of [his]2981-he responsibilities has been chimed into [St. John]164-st. john 's ears till [he]2981-he is rather weary of it : [he]2981-he has been hearing it for the last five - and - twenty years — ever since indeed , that solemn day when , petticoats being cast aside , [he]2981-he was invested with the virile dignity of round jacket and breeches . " Why do n't [we]5539-we cut off the entail ? "[2981-he] [he]2981-he asks impatiently , one day , shortly after [Esther]148-esther 's visit — a visit which has naturally given [him]2981-he a greater distaste for the subject than [he]2981-he had ever before experienced . " [You]238-sir thomas and [I]2981-he together can do it , can not [we]5539-we , [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas , and leave [the property]5540-the property to [the Foundling]5541-the foundling , or [Hanwell]119-hanwell , or to [some hospital]5542-some hospital or [penitentiary]5543-penitentiary , where it would do a deal more good , [I]2981-he do n't doubt , than it ever has in [our]5539-we hands ? "[2981-he] But [he]2981-he does not mean it ; [his]2981-he pride in [the old house]3005-the old house and the old name is as great , though not as offensively shown , as [[his]2981-he father]1115-his father 's . " It 's all [your]2981-he cursed selfishness , "[2176-his parent] says [[his]2981-he parent]2176-his parent , strutting and fuming about , one morning , over the crimson and ash - coloured squares of the library carpet ; puffing out [his]2981-he feathers , as it were , and beginning to gobble - obble . " [You]2981-he prefer [your]2981-he lazy , lounging club life , [[your]2981-he French chef]5544-your french chef , and d — d sybarite habits , to everything else under heaven ; [you]2981-he do n't reflect that , when [a man]3402-a man has been given such advantages as [yours]2981-he , [he]3402-a man owes corresponding duties to [[his]3402-a man country]5546-his country and [[his]3402-a man estate]5547-his estate , and — and — and [[his]3402-a man father]1115-his father — "[238-sir thomas] concludes [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas , rather at a loss for a peroration . [St. John]164-st. john lifts [his]238-sir thomas eyebrows almost imperceptibly at the last clause . " If [you]2981-he like to look out for [a wife]884-a wife for [me]238-sir thomas , "[238-sir thomas] [he]238-sir thomas says , flinging [himself]238-sir thomas indolently into an arm - chair , and speaking half - seriously , half - derisively , " and will engage to undertake all the bore of the preliminaries — love - making , dancing attendance , [etc.—I]238-sir thomas have no objection to marrying , since the duty of continuing this illustrious race has been perverse enough to devolve on [me]238-sir thomas , who , God knows , am not ambitious of perpetuating [myself]238-sir thomas . "[238-sir thomas] " Love - making ! — pooh ! "[238-sir thomas] repeats [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas , contemptuously ; " [we]5550-we need have none of that rubbish ; respect and esteem are a deal the best basis to go upon ; that 's what [[your]2981-he mother]3422-your mother and [I]238-sir thomas began life with — "[238-sir thomas] " And have continued undiminished up to the present day , "[164-st. john] says [St. John]164-st. john , with a slight sneer . " Well "[164-st. john] ( yawning ) , " if [you]2981-he can find , amongst the wide range of [your]2981-he acquaintance , [any young lady who is willing io respect and esteem [me]164-st. john — which is not likely — or to respect and esteem [Felton]44-felton]5552-any young lady who is willing io respect and esteem me — which is not likely — or to respect and esteem felton — which is more probable , and , after all , comes to much the same in the end — [she]5552-any young lady who is willing io respect and esteem me — which is not likely — or to respect and esteem felton may have the felicity of being [[your]2981-he daughter - in - law]5553-your daughter - in - law , for all [I]164-st. john shall do to hinder it : anything for a quiet life . "[164-st. john] [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas turns [his]238-sir thomas bright little fierce eyes sharply upon [[his]238-sir thomas offspring]3008-his offspring , prepared , at a moment 's notice , to precipitate [himself]238-sir thomas into one of [his]238-sir thomas blustering , sputtering , God damning rages if [he]238-sir thomas detect the slightest sign of mirth or derision on [the young man]670-the young man 's face . But none such is to be found ; [his]238-sir thomas downcast eyes are fixed with lazy interest upon [his]238-sir thomas own substantial legs , stretched in black - and - crimson - ribbed stockings , straight before [him]238-sir thomas . The ire of [[his]238-sir thomas parent]2176-his parent 's gaze is mitigated . " If [you]164-st. john are in earnest , "[238-sir thomas] [he]238-sir thomas says , surlily , " and not making a jest of this , as [you]164-st. john mostly do of every serious subject , why — why — there 's no use in going far afield for what one has ready to [one]559-one 's hand . "[238-sir thomas] " Where ? " Where ? "[238-sir thomas] repeats [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas , rather irritated at [[his]238-sir thomas son]3015-his son 's obtuseness . " Why , here ! not five yards off ! in [this very house]5555-this very house ! "[238-sir thomas] Then , seeing [him]238-sir thomas still look puzzled : " God bless [my]238-sir thomas soul , [sir]3823-sir ! where are [your]238-sir thomas wits to - day ? How can [you]238-sir thomas do better than [Conny]256-constance ? [That bit of land of hers down at [Four Oaks]120-four oaks]5557-that bit of land of hers down at four oaks dovetails into ours as neatly as possible ; it seems as if it were intended by [Providence]132-providence , "[238-sir thomas] ends [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas , piously . " [I]238-sir thomas should as soon have thought of marrying [[my]238-sir thomas mother]3406-my mother . Why , [we]5559-we have been like [brother]5560-brother and [sister]3516-sister all [our]5559-we lives . "[238-sir thomas] " Fiddlesticks ! The idea is thoroughly new , certainly , but it does not altogether displease [him]3016-him . [He]3016-him is thinking of [her]3017-her approvingly , as [the one woman whom , above all others]3018-the one woman whom , above all others , it would be impossible for [him]3016-him to love . After all , it is not a wife for [him]3016-him that is required ; God knows , [he]3016-him has no desire for such an appendage ; it is [a mother for [the heir to [Felton]44-felton]3020-the heir to felton that is wanted]3019-a mother for the heir to felton that is wanted ; and for that purpose [she]3017-her will do as well as another — better than most , indeed , being statelier , fairer , of better growth . If [she]3017-her can transmit to [her]3017-her progeny [her]3017-her own straight features , instead of [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas 's bottle nose , or [St. John]164-st. john 's long nondescript one , so much the better for [them]3021-them . " Well ? "[238-sir thomas] says [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas , impatiently , strutting up and down , with [his]238-sir thomas hands under [his]238-sir thomas green - coat tails .
