" [She]3024-she is good to look at , and [she]3024-she does not pretend to care two straws about [me]238-sir thomas — both causes for special thankfulness , "[238-sir thomas] [he]238-sir thomas says to [himself]238-sir thomas , with a sort of sardonic philosophy , after [his]238-sir thomas decisive interview with [[his]238-sir thomas betrothed]3581-his betrothed . "[238-sir thomas] Meanwhile [Esther]148-esther 's little holiday is succeeded by [no others]3026-no others ; [it]3027-it remains [one green oasis , with well and palmtrees , among long stretches of shifting , blinding , desert sand]3028-one green oasis , with well and palmtrees , among long stretches of shifting , blinding , desert sand . [Mr. Linley]480-linley , indeed , has been to call , and has been rewarded for [his]480-linley attention by a three - quarters - of - an - hour téte - à - téte with [Mrs. Blessington]437-mrs. blessington . [Esther]148-esther is aware of [his]480-linley presence ; is visited , indeed , by a small and contemptible desire to go down and chat with [the young fellow]695-the young fellow ; feels a weak craving for the touch of a friendly hand , for the greeting of admiring eyes and courteous words . But , being dimly conscious that the small acquaintance [she]148-esther has already had with [him]480-linley has made [Gerard]238-sir thomas conceive an even worse opinion of [her]148-esther than [he]480-linley had before nourished , [she]148-esther restrains [herself]148-esther , in [her]148-esther great , desire to prove to [him]480-linley that [she]148-esther is not [the insatiable greedy coquette [he]480-linley falsely thinks [her]148-esther]3030-the insatiable greedy coquette he falsely thinks her ; and stays [upstairs]3979-upstairs in the cold , in [her]148-esther great bare barrack , curled up on the broad paintless window - seat , and vainly trying to read " [Pamela"—the]489-pamela"—the[148-esther] hairbreadth escapes from [RUIN]121-ruin ( in big letters ) , in the shape of [a handsome and generous master]3032-a handsome and generous master , of that most austerely virtuous and priggish of waiting - maids being one of the newest works of fiction in [the Blessington library]3033-the blessington library . And [St. John]164-st. john hears of [Linley]480-linley 's visit , and does not hear of [Esther]148-esther 's little self - abnegation ; and , too proud to ask any questions about the matter , pictures to [himself]164-st. john soft willades , challenging smiles , hand - pressures , under the purblind eyes of [the old lady]3509-the old lady , and , so picturing , eats [his]480-linley heart out with a dumb gnawing jealousy . One evening , in one of [her]148-esther late lonely saunters ( [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington never accompanies [her]148-esther on [her]148-esther walks ) , [Esther]148-esther has strayed outside [the park]3880-the park paling into [the road]3569-the road , lured by the splendour of a great holly - bush , all afire with thousand clustered berries , amid the dark glister of varnished leaves . Now , although having well understood ( as " [Johnny]146-jack and [[his]146-jack sister]619-his sister [Jane]240-jane , While walking down [a shady lane]5580-a shady lane , "[3037-themselves] unfortunately for [themselves]3037-themselves , did not ) that " Fruit in [lanes]5581-lanes is seldom good , "[148-esther] [Esther]148-esther has coveted those berries . Fond of bright colours as [a child]3412-a child or [a savage]3039-a savage , [she]148-esther has been wrestling obstinately with the stout tough stems , and has come off ultimately victor , with only one very considerable scratch , and several lesser ones on each bare hand . This spoil , robbed from niggard winter , will make [the old rat palace at [home]701-home]3040-the old rat palace at home so bravely , warmly gay . As [she]148-esther strolls slowly along , considering [her]148-esther treasures , the sound of a trotting horse on [the road]3569-the road behind [her]148-esther reaches [her]148-esther ears . [She]148-esther turns , and sees a glimmer of scarlet flashing through the misty light . Is it [St. John]164-st. john coming back from hunting ? If [St. John]164-st. john have [a figure light and spare as a jockey]3043-a figure light and spare as a jockey 's , have a large red moustache , and a small questioning retroussé face , this is [he]3044-he ; if [he]3044-he have not , this is not [he]3044-he . " How de - do , [Miss Craven]164-st. john ? "[480-linley] says [Linley]480-linley , throwing [himself]480-linley off [his]480-linley horse , and coming towards [her]148-esther with ready right ; hand heartily outstretched . " Could not imagine who [you]148-esther were . " [We]5593-we do hear a great deal about [them]5594-them ; but [I]148-esther do n't mind now ; [I]148-esther 'm used to it . " [They]5596-they are too old to care for [society]5598-society ; like [Barzillai the Gileadite]490-barzillai the gileadite , [they]5596-they can not hear any more ' the voice of [singing men]5599-singing men and [singing women]5600-singing women . " [Mr. Blessington]438-mr. blessington roars at [Mrs. Blessington]437-mrs. blessington , and [Mrs. Blessington]437-mrs. blessington roars at [Mr. Blessington]438-mr. blessington , and [I]1252-his companion roar at [them]5612-them both . "[0-i] " [We]5613-we are , none of [us]5613-we , much addicted to conversation , "[1252-his companion] [she]1252-his companion answers , grimly ; " but , en revanche , what [we]5613-we do say [we]5613-we say very loud . "[0-i] " What an exhausting process ! "[1252-his companion] [he]1252-his companion says , with a shrug ; " takes a great deal out of [you]3056-you , does n't it ? "[1252-his companion] " A good deal ; lately , [I]0-i have generally ended the day without any voice at all . [I]0-i do n't mind making short remarks at the top of [my]0-i voice , but shouting out six columns of the Times , as is daily [my]0-i pleasing task , is rather fatiguing . "[0-i] " How inhuman of [them]5620-them to allow [you]3056-you ! "[1252-his companion] [he]1252-his companion cries , indignantly , looking at [the slender , fragile figure]3055-the slender , fragile figure , at the childish face - so appealing , so touching in its utter paleness , now that [he]1252-his companion sees it without the temporary rose - flush of excitement . " Not at all , "[3056-you] [she]3056-you answers , simply ; " [they]5620-them pay [me]3056-you for it . "[3056-you] " It would require very high pay to indemnify any one for the sacrifice of the best years of [their]5620-them lives to [those two old fossils]5621-those two old fossils ; [I]670-the young man thought [I]670-the young man was entitled to something considerable for standing [the old woman]3507-the old woman for three - quarters of an hour the other day without uttering a groan , "[670-the young man] answers [the young man]670-the young man , more seriously than [he]670-the young man generally takes the trouble of saying anything . " [My]3056-you pay is fifty pounds a year , "[3056-you] [she]3056-you answers , frankly , " if [you]670-the young man call that high . "[3056-you] Fifty pounds ! It would not find [him]1252-his companion in cigars . [He]1252-his companion has thrown away five times that sum , before now , at [lansquenet]122-lansquenet at one sitting . Involuntarily [his]1252-his companion thoughts glance back over [his]1252-his companion own life — the luxurious sybarite life in which , hitherto , the heaviest misfortunes have been a too - prolonged frost , a disease among [the grouse]3058-the grouse , the coming in second at a steeplechase , or the pressure of a heavy helmet on [his]1252-his companion forehead when on duty on a hot summer afternoon . Involuntarily , [he]1252-his companion compares this life of [his]1252-his companion with the existence of [the slight frail child]3059-the slight frail child beside [him]1252-his companion : but the comparison is disagreeable , and so [he]1252-his companion stifles it , as [he]1252-his companion always stifles , on principle , every painful thought , as a sin against [his]1252-his companion religion of ease . " Fifty pounds!—what a pittance ! "[1252-his companion] [he]1252-his companion ejaculates . " Do [you]670-the young man think so ? "[3056-you] [she]3056-you answers , surprised . " [I]3056-you think it is a good deal . Considering that [they]5623-they find [me]3056-you in food and lodging , and that [I]3056-you do for [them]5623-they only what [any charity- school boy]5624-any charity- school boy could do nearly as well , it is surely enough . "[3056-you] [[Her]3056-you companion]3572-her companion differs widely in opinion from [her]3056-you , but " When ignorance is bliss'Tis folly to be wise ; "[1252-his companion] and reflecting that it is fortunate that [she]3056-you is satisfied , on whatever insufficient grounds [her]3056-you satisfaction rests , [he]1252-his companion drops the subject , and continues [his]1252-his companion catechism on a different head . " Have [you]3056-you no amusement of any kind — none ? "[1252-his companion] " Oh dear , yes ! [We]5625-we drive into [Shelford]102-shelford every day in [a close carriage]5626-a close carriage , with all the windows up . "[1252-his companion] " Terrific ! And what do [you]3056-you do when [you]3056-you get [there]594-there ? "[1252-his companion] " [We]5625-we come back again . "[1252-his companion] " And have [you]3056-you [no visitors]5628-no visitors ? Does [no one]891-no one ever come to call ? "[1252-his companion] " Yes ; [you]3056-you came the other day . "[1252-his companion] " And am [I]1252-his companion a solitary instance of would - be sociability ? "[1252-his companion] " Not quite . [Mr. Blessington]438-mr. blessington gets into a panic about [himself]438-mr. blessington , sometimes , and thinks that [he]438-mr. blessington is drawing near [his]438-mr. blessington latter end ; and [he]438-mr. blessington bids [us]5625-we all good - bye ; and [he]438-mr. blessington cries , and [we]5625-we cry , and then [Mr. Brand]166-mr. brandon , [the doctor]4046-the doctor , comes and reassures [us]5625-we . "[1252-his companion] " [I]1252-his companion had no idea that there was anything the matter with [the old gentleman]5182-the old gentleman . "[1252-his companion] " No more there is . [He]5182-the old gentleman has no more idea of dying really than [you]3056-you have ; less , probably . [You]3056-you may break [your]3056-you neck out hunting , and [he]5182-the old gentleman can not well break [his]5182-the old gentleman out of [his]5182-the old gentleman armchair . When [a person]759-a person has got into such a confirmed habit of living as [he]759-a person has , "[3061-she] [she]3061-she concludes , drily , " [they]759-a person find it extremely difficult to break [themselves]759-a person of it . "[3061-she] [He]3062-he smiles . " After all , "[3061-she] [she]3061-she continues , thoughtfully , " since it is wear - and - tear of mind , brain and heart - work , that drives [people]3426-people to [the churchyard]5100-the churchyard , [I]3061-she do n't see any reason why mere sleeping and eating machines should not go on for ever . "[3061-she] It would be impossible to imagine a more innocent dialogue than the foregoing , would not it ? But [the interlocutors]3063-the interlocutors have involuntarily fallen into a very gentle saunter , as [two people that , finding [each other]909-each other 's society]3064-two people that , finding each other 's society agreeable , are in no haste to part . With [his]3062-he horse 's bridle carelessly thrown over [his]3062-he arm , [a small muddy scarlet gentleman]3066-a small muddy scarlet gentleman strolls along with [his]3062-he face turned with interest towards [[his]3062-he companion]1252-his companion , who is chattering away to [him]3062-he freely and readily — not as having any particular partiality for [him]3062-he , but as being something young , friendly , compassionate . This is the picture — invested by twilight with an air of mystery that it would not have worn in daylight — that salutes the eyes of [a second and larger scarlet gentleman]3068-a second and larger scarlet gentleman , splashing home through the puddles on a tired horse . As [he]3062-he passes [them]3069-them , [Gerard]258-miss blessington ( for it is [he]3062-he ) pulls up [his]3062-he horse into a walk , for [he]3062-he would not have the incivility to cover [any woman]3070-any woman with dirt , even though [the woman in question]3071-the woman in question be [a vile greedy coquette , to whose insatiable vanity all men]3072-a vile greedy coquette , to whose insatiable vanity all men are meat . Then , raising [his]3062-he hat stiffly , [he]3062-he rides on without speaking . As [he]3062-he trots homeward through the dusk , the thought flashes into [his]3062-he writhing heart : " It was an assignation ! [She]3071-the woman in question arranged it with [him]3062-he on the day [he]3062-he came to call . [Damnable flirt]5635-damnable flirt ! Is not [she]3071-the woman in question satisfied with two ruined lives ? Is [she]3071-the woman in question fool enough to think that [Linley]480-linley will marry [her]3071-the woman in question ? [Meanwhile St. John]493-meanwhile st. john , having arrived at [Blessington]256-constance , and given up [his]493-meanwhile st. john horse to [a groom]5645-a groom , enters [the house]687-the house ; but the confinement of roof and walls is insupportable to [him]493-meanwhile st. john . So [he]493-meanwhile st. john goes out again , and , walking up [the avenue]1266-the avenue , stations [himself]493-meanwhile st. john at the gate . [Linley]480-linley rides by alone . [His]480-linley face is turned towards [the house]687-the house , in whose great black facade the lighted windows make oblong - shaped red glories ; [his]480-linley eyes are trying to fix upon [Esther]148-esther 's casement . " [He]480-linley retraces [his]480-linley steps down [the avenue]1266-the avenue , and , following [a back road that skirts [the kitchen - garden]5655-the kitchen - garden]5654-a back road that skirts the kitchen - garden , reaches another gate that leads into [the park]3880-the park , and there stands and waits again . The short - cut has proved rather a long one . [Part of [the park]3880-the park]5657-part of the park has been fenced off , to keep the deer and the Scotch cattle separate ; a gate which [she]3087-she had reckoned upon finding open , [she]3087-she discovers to be padlocked , and has to make a long circuit round to another gate . As [she]3087-she toils weary - footed through the wet grass , vague alarms assail [him]480-linley that watches for [her]3087-she . Can any evil have come to [her]3087-she in the darkness ? Most improbably in [that still , safe park]5659-that still , safe park . After a while , and when [his]480-linley reasonless fears are beginning to gather more strongly about [his]480-linley heart , [he]480-linley hears the sound as of [some one running pantingly]5660-some one running pantingly . [Esther]148-esther is not so good at running as [she]148-esther was in [the old Glan - yr - Afon days]5661-the old glan - yr - afon days . [She]148-esther has been flying along in hot haste , with a mixed fear of Scotch bulls and goblins in pursuit . As [she]3087-she approaches the gate , [Gerard]247-mr. gerard opens it for [her]3087-she . Seeing [it]5662-it swing open without any apparent cause , [she]3087-she gives a great nervous start ; then , discovering the motive cause of the phenomenon , drops into a walk . "[0-i] It is rather late , [Mr. Gerard]247-mr. gerard , [I]0-i 'm afraid , is n't it so ? " [she]3087-she asks , with some hesitation at this disobedience to [his]247-mr. gerard command of silence . And yet , surely , if [he]247-mr. gerard had meant not to speak to [her]3087-she , [he]247-mr. gerard would not have come thither . [Two speech - gifted human beings]5663-two speech - gifted human beings could hardly be expected to meet with less civility than two pigs , who would at least exchange a grunt . [He]247-mr. gerard looks at [his]247-mr. gerard watch again . "[247-mr. gerard] It is ten minutes to six , " [he]247-mr. gerard replies with punctilious politeness . "[247-mr. gerard] Is it really ?
