" The line of defence [she]3087-she has hit upon is unlucky . "[247-mr. gerard] Really ! " [he]247-mr. gerard answers , stiffly . "[247-mr. gerard] [I]0-i had not noticed how the light had gone , nor anything about the matter , " [she]3087-she continues , innocently , floundering at every word into deeper disgrace . "[0-i] [I]0-i daresay not , " [he]247-mr. gerard replies , freezingly . [She]3087-she had addressed [him]247-mr. gerard , penitent and humble , willing to take a scolding in all submissiveness , but the chill brevity of [his]247-mr. gerard answers turns [her]3087-she meekness to gall . "[0-i] When [one]559-one is in pleasant company , " [she]3087-she remarks , with a rather hysterical laugh , "[559-one] [one]559-one forgets the flight of time . " "[559-one] Undoubtedly , " replies [Gerard]247-mr. gerard , endeavouring to conceal [his]247-mr. gerard anger under an appearance of calmness , and unable to manage more than one word at a time . "[559-one] If [one]559-one has not taken a vow of perpetual silence , it is a great relief to have a little conversation with [a person who is neither deaf nor dumb]3092-a person who is neither deaf nor dumb , " [she]3087-she says , emboldened by exasperation . "[3092-a person who is neither deaf nor dumb] An immense relief , no doubt , " [he]247-mr. gerard answers , in deep displeasure . "[3092-a person who is neither deaf nor dumb] And yet , if [you]0-i will allow [me]0-i , " [he]247-mr. gerard continues , unable to resist the temptation to lecture [her—"who]3087-she[3092-a person who is neither deaf nor dumb] am so much older than [you]0-i , and can have no interest in the matter but [your]0-i own advantage — to give an opinion , [I]0-i should recommend [your]0-i choosing a fitter time of day for [your]0-i meetings , even with so desirable and congenial a companion as [Mr. Linley]480-linley " "[3094-choosers] [Beggars]3093-beggars must not be [choosers]3094-choosers , " [she]3087-she answers , sulkily . "[0-i] [You]0-i seem to forget how very small a portion of the day [I]0-i have at [my]0-i own disposal . " [He]247-mr. gerard draws [himself]247-mr. gerard up to [his]247-mr. gerard full height , and a stern expression makes [his]247-mr. gerard lip thin . "[0-i] [I]0-i was right , " [he]247-mr. gerard says internally ; "[0-i] it was no accident ! " Then aloud : "[0-i] [I]0-i apologise , [Miss Craven]164-st. john , for interfering in [your]0-i affairs , in which , [God]435-god knows , [I]0-i have small concern . [I]0-i only thought that , as [you]0-i are so young , [you]0-i might not be aware that nocturnal walks with [a man of [Linley]480-linley 's character]3095-a man of linley 's character are not advantageous to [any woman]3070-any woman 's reputation . " "[0-i] [I]0-i know nothing about [his]480-linley character , " retorts [she]0-i , defiantly ; "[0-i] [I]0-i daresay it is as good as [other people]3531-other people 's . All [I]0-i know is , that [he]480-linley is very kind and civil to [me]0-i , which is what [nobody else]893-nobody else is nowadays . " Then , to avoid the disgrace of seeming to court [his]480-linley compassion by tears , [she]0-i darts from [his]480-linley side , and rushes to [that harbour of refuge]5664-that harbour of refuge — [[her]0-i great , bare sleeping - chamber]5665-her great , bare sleeping - chamber . TIME goes by . Since [Joshua]494-joshua , [God]435-god - bidden , commanded sun and moon to stand still , who has been able to stop it ? [Gerard]247-mr. gerard still remains at [Blessington]437-mrs. blessington — remains , despite the six - o'clock dinners ; despite the inarticulate and inharmonious mumblings with which [old Blessington]437-mrs. blessington takes away the appetites of such as feast with [him]480-linley ; despite the utter failure of [his]480-linley endeavours to draw from the mind of [[his]480-linley betrothed]3581-his betrothed any ideas but such as [Le Follet]495-le follet and [Le Journal des Demoiselles]496-le journal des demoiselles had just put into it . Latterly [he]480-linley has abandoned the attempt , has taken to reading the Times , Field , anything in the evening , instead ; has even , in [his]480-linley despair — modern works of fiction being , as [I]480-linley have before observed , unknown at [Blessington]256-constance — waded through two chapters and a half of "[480-linley] Pamela , " which [Esther]148-esther had inadvertently left on the table . Sometimes , to [his]480-linley own surprise , [he]480-linley catches [himself]480-linley wishing that [his]480-linley wedding - day were over . "[480-linley] When [we]3099-we are married , [we]3099-we need never speak to [one another]922-one another , " [he]480-linley reflects . "[3099-we] Thank [God]435-god , [we]3099-we shall not be so poor as to be obliged to keep together from economy ; a dinner of herbs and hatred , or , worse still , indifference therewith , would be hard to digest ; [she]3101-her may go [her]3101-her way , and [I]0-i mine . [I]0-i will get up a great stock of beads , and looking - glasses , and red calico , and make an expedition to [Central Africa]124-central africa ; learn some euphonious African tongue , all made up of [Ms]3102-ms and [Ns]497-ns ; and carefully abstain from engaging in arguments upon the immortality of the soul with [intelligent natives]3103-intelligent natives . " Now and again [conscience]498-conscience 's voice thunders at [him]3104-his in the recesses of [his]3104-his soul : "[3104-his] [You]3104-his are paltering with temptation . Arise!—flee!—begone ! " But [he]3104-his , strong in the innocence of [his]3104-his acts and words , replies doughtily : "[3101-her] Temptation is there none for [me]0-i here . The occupations of [my]0-i life are such as they would be at [home]701-home ; [I]0-i am struggling to know and like better [her]3101-her with whom [my]0-i life is to be passed . As to [that other woman]3106-that other woman , [I]0-i see [her]3106-that other woman rarely , speak to [her]3106-that other woman never , look at [her]3106-that other woman as seldom as it is possible to [me]0-i . " And , in the meantime , [that other woman]3106-that other woman droops like an unwatered flower , day by day . When the mainspring of a watch is broken , must it not stop ? If hope , the mainspring of life , be broken , must not life stop — not all at once , as the watch does , but by gentle yet sure degrees ? A slow fire burns in [the child]5047-the child 's veins ; before [this man]5669-this man had come , [she]5047-the child had peace — a sad stagnant peace , indeed , but still peace . Now [she]5047-the child lives in a state of perpetual concealed excitement . True , [they]5670-they meet but rarely , speak to each other never ; but the same roof covers [them]5670-they both . From [her]5047-the child outlook in [the China Gallery]2690-the china gallery , [she]5047-the child can watch [his]5669-this man going forth in the morning , [his]5669-this man coming back at evening . At breakfast and dinner [he]5669-this man sits opposite to [her]5047-the child ; [she]5047-the child can study [his]5669-this man face , with stealthy care , lest [she]5047-the child may be observed , while [he]5669-this man drives heavily through slow trite talk with [her]5047-the child that fills the place in [his]5669-this man life that , for a golden day , from one sundown to another , was [Esther]148-esther 's . Sometimes [they]5670-they meet upon the stairs ; [her]5047-the child black dress lightly touches [him]5669-this man , as [they]5670-they pass [one another]922-one another dumbly . At night [she]5047-the child lies awake , waiting to catch the sound of [his]5669-this man footfall in [the gallery]4566-the gallery past [her]5047-the child door ; has to wait long hours often ; for [he]5669-this man , unknowing that [any one]523-any one takes note of [his]5669-this man vigils , sits in [the smoking - room]5675-the smoking - room far into the small hours , puffing out of [his]5669-this man well - coloured meerschaum great volumes of smoke — wishing , not seldom , [I]3106-that other woman think , that [he]5669-this man could puff away [Constance]256-constance , [[his]5669-this man beloved]3586-his beloved , into smoke volumes and thin air . Fed by no kindly words , nourished only upon neglect and cold looks , [Esther]148-esther 's love for [Gerard]247-mr. gerard yet strikes out great roots downwards — shoots forth strong branches upwards . A tree of far statelier growth it stands than in the days when the soft gales and gentle streams of answering love fanned and watered it . Who cares for what [they]5677-they can have ? Who cries for the moon ? It is the intermediate something — the something that lies just a handbreadth beyond the utmost stretch of [our]5678-our most painfully - strained arms , that [we]5678-our eat out [our]5678-our hearts in longing for . [Esther]148-esther never goes beyond [the park palings]5679-the park palings now , deterred by the fear of being waylaid by [Linley]480-linley . [She]148-esther need not have been alarmed . As long as [she]148-esther came naturally in [his]5669-this man way , [he]5669-this man was delighted to see [her]148-esther : as [we]5678-our stoop and pick gladly the fruit that drops off the tree at [our]5678-our feet . [He]5669-this man had even , on a day when the frost forbade hunting , and when [he]5669-this man had got tired of skating , taken the unwonted trouble of riding over to [Blessington]256-constance , to warm [himself]5669-this man at the fire of those great black eyes , that have still for [him]5669-this man the charm of novelty upon [them]5677-they ; but [women , many and fair]5680-women , many and fair , came too readily to [his]5669-this man hand to make [him]5669-this man very keen in the chase of [any one individual woman]5681-any one individual woman . In former generations [men]595-men used to be [the pursuers]5683-the pursuers , [women the pursued]5684-women the pursued . In this generation [we]5678-our , who have set right most things , have set right this also . Now , the hares pursue the harriers , the foxes the hounds , and the doves swoop upon the falcons . During these latter evenings [Mr. Blessington]438-mr. blessington has been very alert and wakeful — has insisted on being read to from tea to bed - time — a liberal hour . But , however hoarse and voiceless [the young reader]5685-the young reader may be , [Gerard]247-mr. gerard never now comes to the rescue , never interferes , though the frequent teasing cough of the "[3106-that other woman] damnable flirt " goes through [his]5669-this man heart like a sword . With steady certainty , through frost and thaw , rain and shine , through all the alternations of an English winter , [the young girl]3585-the young girl 's health declines . To all but [herself]3585-the young girl is this fact evident , and [she]3585-the young girl , unaccustomed to illness — never having seen the signs of premature decay in others — thinks it is but a little weariness , a little languor , a nothing . It will pass when [the swooned world]5687-the swooned world revives into spring and the buttercups come . Sunday is here again , the initial letter in the week 's alphabet : "[2038-the lord] The Sundays of [man]3613-man 's life , Threaded together on Time 's string , Make bracelets to adorn the wifeOf [the eternal glorious King]3108-the eternal glorious king . " Ah [me]2394-lord ! [the languid , yawning Sundays of most of [us]5678-our]5688-the languid , yawning sundays of most of us will make but sorry bracelets for [any one]523-any one , methinks . Sunday — the day on which [the Shelford shopboys]5690-the shelford shopboys and [shopgirls]5691-shopgirls walk about gloriously apparelled , arm - in - arm , [man]3613-man and [maid]5693-maid , filling [their]5688-the languid , yawning sundays of most of us lungs with country air,—day on which [the gentlefolks]5694-the gentlefolks , such as are [men of [them]5688-the languid , yawning sundays of most of us]5695-men of them , debarred from horse and hound and cue , smoke a cigar or two more than usual over the instructive pages of [Messieurs De Kock]499-messieurs de kock , [Sue]263-susanna , [Balzac]125-balzac , & c. ; while such as are [women , being for the most part piously disposed]5696-women , being for the most part piously disposed , hold [Goulburn]500-goulburn 's "[2394-lord] Thoughts on Personal Religion , " or [Hannay]501-hannay 's "[2394-lord] Last Day of [Our Lord]3109-our lord 's Passion , " open on [their]5688-the languid , yawning sundays of most of us velvet laps , and kill a reputation between each paragraph . On this especial Sunday [Esther]148-esther has risen , feeling feebler , more nerveless than usual . Something in the influence of the weather — soft , sodden , sunless — weighs upon [her]148-esther with untold oppression . [She]148-esther would fain not go to [church]3708-church , remain at [home]701-home , and lie on [her]148-esther bed ; but this can not be . Foremost in importance , in indispensability , among [her]148-esther duties are these Sunday ones . If the weather be tolerable , [Mr. Blessington]438-mr. blessington is always scrupulously punctual in attending Divine worship . Leaning on [[his]438-mr. blessington valet]5699-his valet 's arm , [he]438-mr. blessington totters up [the church]1613-the church , in [his]438-mr. blessington old tail - coat , tightly buttoned over [his]438-mr. blessington sunken chest , and , arrived at the [Blessington]438-mr. blessington pew , is deposited in a little nook thereof , partitioned ( in some quirk of [his]438-mr. blessington , while [he]438-mr. blessington could yet see ) from the rest . In thia nook there is room for [two people]4924-two people — to wit , for [Mr. Blessington]438-mr. blessington , and for [the happy person who is to guide [his]438-mr. blessington devotions]5702-the happy person who is to guide his devotions . And to conduct [Mr. Blessington]438-mr. blessington 's prayers and praises is , [I]3110-i assure [you]5703-you , no sinecure . Almost entirely deaf , almost entirely blind , [he]438-mr. blessington is yet resolute to take a part in the services by no means less prominent than [the clerk]1653-the clerk 's . It is , therefore , [[his]438-mr. blessington attendant]5705-his attendant 's duty to shout the responses in [his]438-mr. blessington ear , in order to give [him]438-mr. blessington some clue to the portion of the ritual which has been arrived at and to check [him]438-mr. blessington with elbowings and nudgings , when [his]438-mr. blessington aberrations from the right path become so flagrantly noticeable as to distract the attention of [the other worshippers]5706-the other worshippers . But too often , however , the attempts at repression on the part of [the acolyte]5707-the acolyte are so much labour lost . In the region of darkness and silence in which [his]438-mr. blessington infirmities have placed [him]438-mr. blessington , [the old man]2484-the old man frequently becomes impatient of the slow progress of the service as notified to [him]438-mr. blessington by the roars of [[his]438-mr. blessington companion]1252-his companion . Not seldom [he]438-mr. blessington proclaims , in a voice distinctly audible throughout [the building]5710-the building , the point at which , according to [his]438-mr. blessington reckoning , [priest]5711-priest and [people]3426-people should have arrived . "[3110-i] And with [thy]3110-i spirit , " cries [the squire]2786-the squire , with unction in [his]2786-the squire deep , tremulous bass , while [the sleek young rector]5714-the sleek young rector 's gentle "[3110-i] [The Lord]2038-the lord be with [you]3112-you " does not follow till five minutes later . In the Creed there is but one course to pursue : to start [him]438-mr. blessington , if possible , fair — happy , indeed , if [he]438-mr. blessington does not insist on turning to the altar somewhere towards the close of the second lesson or beginning of the Jubilate,—to start [him]438-mr. blessington fair , [I]2038-the lord say . and then in despair , give [him]438-mr. blessington [his]438-mr. blessington head . Fervently , loudly , rapidly , [he]438-mr. blessington announces [his]438-mr. blessington belief in the articles of the Christian faith , while [parson]5715-parson , [clerk]5716-clerk , and [congregation]5717-congregation toil after [him]438-mr. blessington in vain . Occasionally — especially at such portions of the service as refer to [our]5718-our need of forgiveness , [our]5718-our sinfulness , [our]5718-our mortality,—he breaks out into senile tears ; too deaf to hear [his]438-mr. blessington own penitent sobs , [he]438-mr. blessington has no idea of the loudness with which they reverberate through [the church]1613-the church . [Strangers]1198-strangers , hearing , perk [their]1198-strangers heads up above [their]1198-strangers pews , and then fling [them]1198-strangers down again on [their]1198-strangers pocket - handkerchiefs convulsed with inextinguishable laughter ; but the greater part of the assemblage are used to these spasms of grotesque devotion — it is only "[2038-the lord] t'oud squoire . " [Esther]148-esther always draws a long breath of relief when "[2038-the lord] [Lord]2394-lord , have mercy upon [us!Christ]3114-us!christ , have mercy upon us!Lord , have mercy upon [us]3115-us ! " has been safely tided over without any unusually noisy burst of lamentation . On the Sunday [I]2394-lord speak of "[2394-lord] t'oud squoire 's " prayers were more unruly than usual . Whether it was that [Esther]148-esther 's weakened voice was unable to guide [them]1198-strangers into the right channel , or to whatever other cause assignable , certain it is that [his]438-mr. blessington vagaries were more painfully evident — ludicrously to [the congregation]1621-the congregation , distressingly to [[his]438-mr. blessington family]5722-his family — than on any former Sunday within the memory of [man]3613-man . [Many heads]5724-many heads turn towards [the Blessington pew]5725-the blessington pew ; even [the rector]5726-the rector — meekest among [M.A.s]502-m.a.s — looks now and again with gentle reproach at [the old man]2484-the old man , who is , with such aggressive loudness , usurping [his]438-mr. blessington office of leading the devotions of [[his]438-mr. blessington flock]5728-his flock . [A proud woman]5729-a proud woman is [Esther Craven]148-esther when the Liturgy comes to a close . In the sermon there are , thank [God]435-god , no responses for [the congregation]1621-the congregation to make ; it is not even customary to cry , "[2394-lord] Hear , hear ! " "[2394-lord] Hallelujah ! " "[2394-lord] More power to [you]3116-you ! " at intervals . In the sermon , therefore , [the old gentleman]5182-the old gentleman composes [himself]5182-the old gentleman to sleep , and there is peace . [The Blessington pulpit]5732-the blessington pulpit is to - day occupied by [a stranger]2869-a stranger — [a Boanerges]5734-a boanerges , or [Son of Thunder]5735-son of thunder , in the shape of [a muscular , half - educated , fluent Irishman]5736-a muscular , half - educated , fluent irishman — [a divine who would fain flog [[his]5737-a divine who would fain flog his hearers to heaven , show them the way upwards by the light of hell 's flambeaux hearers]5738-his hearers to heaven , show [them]5738-his hearers the way upwards by the light of hell 's flambeaux]5737-a divine who would fain flog his hearers to heaven , show them the way upwards by the light of hell 's flambeaux — [one of that too numerous class who revel in disgusting descriptions , and similes drawn from [our]5740-our mortality]5739-one of that too numerous class who revel in disgusting descriptions , and similes drawn from our mortality . It is impossible to help listening to [him]5182-the old gentleman , and difficult to help being sick . [Esther]148-esther listens , trembling , while [he]5182-the old gentleman descants with minute relish on "[2394-lord] the worm that never dies . " The worm that never dies ! Surely , a terrible picture enough , in its simple bareness , without enlargement thereupon ! With imagination rendered more vivid , and reason weakened by sickness , [the unhappy girl]5741-the unhappy girl pictures that worm gnawing at [[her]5741-the unhappy girl brother]644-her brother 's heart — gnawing , crawling , torturing eternally . [She]5741-the unhappy girl covers [her]5741-the unhappy girl face with [her]5741-the unhappy girl hands ; it is too horrible ! A sort of sick feeling comes over [her]5741-the unhappy girl — a giddy faintness . If [she]5741-the unhappy girl can but reach the open air ! [She]5741-the unhappy girl rises unsteadily , opens the pew - door , and walks as in a mist down [the aisle]5743-the aisle , between the two rows of questioning faces , and so out . As [she]5741-the unhappy girl passes through [the church]1613-the church - door [she]5741-the unhappy girl staggers slightly , and catches at the wall for support . [Gerard]247-mr. gerard , watching [her]5741-the unhappy girl anxiously , sees [her]5741-the unhappy girl unsteady gait , and the involuntary gesture of reaching out for some stay for [her]5741-the unhappy girl tottering figure . Instantly , without giving thought to the light in which [[his]247-mr. gerard beloved]3586-his beloved may regard [his]247-mr. gerard proceeding , [he]247-mr. gerard , rising , quickly follows [the young girl]3585-the young girl . [She]5741-the unhappy girl has just managed to reach [a flat tombstone]5747-a flat tombstone , and there sits , with [her]5741-the unhappy girl face turned thirstily westwards , whence a small soft wind blows fitfully . "[2394-lord] [You]3117-you are ill , " [he]247-mr. gerard says , bending solicitously over [her]5741-the unhappy girl , and laying aside in that compassionate mment the armour of [his]247-mr. gerard coldness . [She]5741-the unhappy girl does not answer for awhile ; then , drawing a long breath , and trying to smile : "[3117-you] [The church]1613-the church was so close , " [she]5741-the unhappy girl says , sighingly ; "[2394-lord] and that smell of escaped gas always makes [me]0-i feel faint , and — and " ( with a shudder ) — "[3119-that dreadful man] [that dreadful man]3119-that dreadful man — with [his]3119-that dreadful man metaphors all taken from [the charnelhouse]3120-the charnelhouse ! " "[3119-that dreadful man] [I]0-i wish [he]3119-that dreadful man were there [himself]3119-that dreadful man , with all [my]0-i heart , " answers [Gerard]247-mr. gerard , devoutly ; "[3119-that dreadful man] [he]3119-that dreadful man might there frame metaphors to [his]3119-that dreadful man taste at [his]3119-that dreadful man leisure . " "[3119-that dreadful man] And it is so terrible to think that it is all true , is n't it ? " [she]0-i says , fixing [her]0-i great awestruck eyes upon [his]3119-that dreadful man face , as if trying to find comfort and reassurance there ; "[3119-that dreadful man] that the reality exceeds even [his]3119-that dreadful man revolting word - painting ; that [we]3121-we shall be loathsome , all of [us!—you]3122-us!—you and [I]0-i and [everybody]3709-everybody — young and old , beautiful and ugly ! How could [God]435-god be so cruel as to let [us]3121-we know it beforehand ? " "[435-god] Knowing it beforehand is better than knowing it at the time , which , at least , [we]3121-we are spared , " replies [St. John]164-st. john , composedly . "[435-god] But are [we]3121-we ? " [she]0-i cries , eagerly : "[435-god] that is the question ! Latterly [I]0-i have been beset by a fearful idea that death is but a long catalepsy . In a catalepsy , [you]3124-he know , [a person]759-a person seems utterly without consciousness or volition ; breath is suspended , and all the vital functions ; and yet [he]759-a person feels and sees and hears more acutely than when in strong health . Why may not death , too , be a catalepsy ? " "[3124-he] Absurd ! " [he]3124-he says . "[2039-my poor child] [[My]0-i poor child]2039-my poor child , it is thoughts like these , gone wild , that fill [madhouses]3127-madhouses . According to [your]3124-he theory , at what point of time does [your]3124-he catalepsy end ? When [we]3121-we are dissolved into minutest particles of dust does each atom still feel and suffer ? " "[0-i] [My]0-i theory , as [you]3124-he call it , will not hold water , [I]0-i know , " [she]0-i answers gravely , "[0-i] but it does not haunt [me]0-i any the less . There are times when [one]559-one can not reason — [one]559-one can only fear . " "[559-one] [You]2039-my poor child should not give way to these morbid fancies , " [he]3124-he says , chidingly ; "[3124-he] they are making [you]2039-my poor child ill . " "[3124-he] Am [I]0-i ill , do [you]3124-he think ? Do [I]0-i look ill ? " [she]0-i asks , with startled eagerness . The havoc worked in face and figure by the last few months is too directly under [his]3124-he eyes for [him]3124-he to answer anything but truthfully , "[0-i] Very ill . " "[3124-he] [You]3124-he do n't think [I]0-i 'm going to die ? " [she]0-i says , lowering [her]0-i voice , and laying [her]0-i hand on [his]3124-he arm , while [her]0-i great feverish eyes burn into [his]3124-he very soul . "[3124-he] [People]3426-people are not any the more likely to die for being thin and weak , are [they]3426-people ? Creaky doors hang the longest . " "[3426-people] Die!—God forbid ! " [he]3124-he replies , trying to speak lightly . "[3426-people] Let [us]3131-us banish death from [our]3131-us talk . [I]0-i suppose it is [this place of tombs]3132-this place of tombs that has made [him]3133-him take such a leading part in it . Come , [you]0-i are not at all fit to go back into [church]3708-church , and [I]0-i am not anxious to hear the tail - end of that wormy discourse . The smell of brimstone is quite strong enough in [my]0-i nostrils already . Let [us]3131-us go [home]701-home ! " So [they]3131-us return to [the house]687-the house , and [he]3124-he still shows no inclination to leave [her]0-i . [He]3124-he draws a chair for [her]0-i near an open window , and stands with [his]3124-he hand resting on the back . It is almost like the old times — the old times that [he]3124-he thinks of , "[3136-dead men of good days , ere the wrong side of death] As [dead men of good days , Ere the wrong side of death]3136-dead men of good days , ere the wrong side of death was [theirs]3136-dead men of good days , ere the wrong side of death , when [GodWas friends]3137-godwas friends with [them]3136-dead men of good days , ere the wrong side of death . " Something in the recollection of those days makes soft [his]3124-he voice , which is not wo nt to be soft . "[3137-godwas friends] [You]0-i are not fit for this life , " [he]3124-he says , stooping down [his]3124-he face towards [her]0-i small wan one . "[0-i] It requires [a tough seasoned woman]3138-a tough seasoned woman , in middle life . Tell [me]0-i why [you]0-i have undertaken it ? Why are [you]0-i not — not married ? " [She]0-i turns away , crimsoning painfully . "[0-i] Because [no one]891-no one has asked [me]0-i , [I]0-i suppose , " [she]0-i answers , trying to speak banteringly . "[891-no one] But [you]0-i were engaged when — when [we]3140-we parted ? " "[0-i] Yes . " "[0-i] And [you]0-i are not now ? " With ungovernable , unaccountable impatience , [he]3141-he awaits the slow brief answer . "[0-i] No . " "[0-i] Had [he]3141-he then — h'm ! h'm!—discovered anything ? " [Gerard]247-mr. gerard asks , finding some difficulty in framing the question politely . [She]0-i fires up quickly . "[3141-he] Discovered anything ! " [she]0-i repeats , indignantly . "[0-i] Do [you]0-i think it is impossible for [me]0-i to be honest even once in [my]0-i life ? [I]0-i told [him]3141-he [myself]0-i . " "[0-i] [You]0-i broke it off , then ? " "[0-i] No , [I]0-i did n't . " "[3141-he] [He]3141-he did ? " "[3141-he] Yes . " "[3401-poor fellow] [Poor fellow]3401-poor fellow ! [he]3141-he had good cause to be angry , " says [St. John]164-st. john ; the old bitterness surging back upon [him]3141-he , as [he]3141-he reflects on the cowardly duplicity that had made waste two honest lives . "[3141-he] But [he]3141-he was not angry , " [she]0-i cries , eagerly : "[3141-he] [he]3141-he was grieved — oh , so grieved ! Shall [I]0-i ever forgive [myself]0-i when [I]0-i think of how [he]3141-he looked when [I]0-i told [him]3141-he ? " ( [her]0-i eyes gazing out abstractedly at the "[0-i] Rape of [the Sabines]445-the sabines , " as [her]0-i thoughts fly back to [that quarried nook on [the bleak autumnal hillside]5750-the bleak autumnal hillside , where [she]0-i had broken [a brave man]5751-a brave man 's heart]5749-that quarried nook on the bleak autumnal hillside , where she had broken a brave man 's heart ) . "[0-i] But [he]3141-he was not angry . Oh , no ! [he]3141-he never thought of [himself]3141-he ! [he]3141-he thought only about [me]0-i ! Ah ! that was love ! " "[3141-he] [He]3141-he would not marry [you]0-i , however ? " says [St. John]164-st. john , exasperated at these laudations , which [he]3143-he imagines levelled as reproaches against [himself]3143-he . "[3141-he] No , " [she]0-i answered quietly , "[3141-he] [you]3143-he are right ; [he]3141-he would not marry [me]0-i , though [I]0-i begged [him]3141-he . But that was for [my]0-i sake , too — not [his]3141-he own ; [he]3141-he told [me]0-i that [he]3141-he could not make [me]0-i happy , for that [I]0-i did not love [him]3141-he . [He]3141-he was wrong , though . [I]0-i did love [him]3141-he — [I]0-i love [him]3141-he now . If [I]0-i did not love the one friend [I]0-i have in all [this great empty world]3144-this great empty world , what should [I]0-i be made of ? " [she]0-i concludes , while the tears come into [her]0-i eyes . "[0-i] [You]0-i have a great capacity for loving , " says [St. John]164-st. john , who , though not usually [an ungenerous fellow]5752-an ungenerous fellow , is maddened by the expressions of affection , the tears and regretful looks bestowed upon [[his]3141-he rival]5753-his rival . "[0-i] [I]0-i envy , though [I]0-i despair of emulating [you]0-i . " "[595-men] [Men]595-men have but one way of loving , " [she]0-i answers , gently ; "[547-women] [women]547-women have several . [I]0-i love [him]3141-he as [the one completely unselfish being [I]0-i ever met]3147-the one completely unselfish being i ever met . [I]0-i agree with [you]0-i , that the way of loving [you]0-i mean comes but once in a lifetime . " At [her]0-i words , and the fidelity to [himself]3141-he which [they]3148-us so innocently imply , a fierce bright joy upleaps in [his]3141-he heart — a joy that clamours for utterance in violent fond words , in the wild closeness of forbidden embraces ; but honour , that strong gaoler that keeps [so many under lock and key]5754-so many under lock and key , keeps [him]3141-he too . [He]3141-he only holds out [his]3141-he hand to [her]0-i . "[148-esther] [Esther]148-esther , let [us]3148-us be [friends]915-friends . [I]0-i am tired of this silence and estrangement ; let there be peace between [us]3148-us ! " "[0-i] [I]0-i have always wished for it , " [she]0-i answers meekly , laying [her]0-i little trembling hand in [his]3141-he — "[0-i] [you]0-i know [I]0-i have ; but let [us]3148-us be at peace apart , and not together ; that will be better . How long , " [she]0-i asks , impulsively , lifting quivering red lips and dew - soft eyes to [his]3141-he — "[0-i] how long — how much longer — do [you]0-i mean to stay [here]3398-here ? " "[0-i] Why do [you]0-i ask ? " [he]3141-he says , in a troubled voice , hurt pride and hot passion struggling together . "[0-i] Surely in [this great wide house]3151-this great wide house there is room for [you]0-i and [me]0-i ; [I]0-i am not much in [your]0-i way , surely ? " "[0-i] [You]0-i are , " [she]0-i answers , feverishly—"you[0-i] are in [my]0-i way ; [you]0-i would be , in [the widest house that ever was built]3152-the widest house that ever was built . Every day [I]0-i long more and more to be a great way off from [you]0-i . [I]0-i think [I]0-i could breathe better if [I]0-i were . " [He]5755-he does not answer : leaning still over [her]0-i in a dumb agonised yearning , that — with the chains of another still dragging about [him]5755-he — may not be outspoken . "[0-i] That day [we]3153-we met upon the stairs , " [she]0-i continues , eyes and cheeks aflame and lustrous with the consuming fire within [her]0-i , "[0-i] [you]0-i promised [me]0-i [you]0-i would avail [yourself]0-i of the first opportunity to leave [this place]5442-this place ; a month or more is gone since then . Surely [the most exacting mistress]3155-the most exacting mistress could spare [you]0-i for awhile now ? Why have [you]0-i broken [your]0-i word , then ? Why are [you]0-i here ? " [He]5755-he is silent for a few moments , questioning [his]5755-he own soul — questioning that conscience whose monitions [he]5755-he has hitherto so stoutly resisted . Then [he]5755-he speaks , a flush of shame making red [his]5755-he bronzed cheek : "[0-i] Because [I]0-i have been dishonest to [myself]0-i and to [you]3156-you . [This place]5442-this place has had an attraction for [me]0-i which [I]0-i see now it would not have had had [she]3155-the most exacting mistress only been [here]3398-here . [I]0-i linger about it as [a man]3402-a man lingers about [the churchyard where [his]3402-a man one hope lies buried]3160-the churchyard where his one hope lies buried . " "[3402-a man] Do n't linger any longer , then , " [she]3156-you cries , passionately , taking [his]5755-he hand between both [hers]3156-you ; "[3402-a man] do n't be dishonest any more ! Tell [yourself]3156-you the truth , if [you]3156-you tell [no one else]1651-no one else , and go at once , before it is too late ; for if [you]3156-you wo n't , [I]0-i must ! " [She]3156-you is weeping freely as [she]3156-you speaks ; [her]3156-you tears drop hot and slow , one after another , upon [his]5755-he hand . [He]5755-he flings [himself]5755-he on [his]5755-he knees beside [her]3156-you , [his]5755-he mastery over [himself]5755-he reeling in the strong rush of long - pent passion . "[3156-you] [You]3156-you tell [me]0-i to go , " [he]5755-he says , in a voice choked and altered with emotion , "[3156-you] and in the very act of telling [me]0-i [you]3156-you cry . Which am [I]0-i to believe , [your]3156-you words or [your]3156-you tears ? " "[0-i] [My]0-i words , " [she]3156-you answers , trying to speak collectedly , and by gaining calmness [herself]3156-you to bring it back to [him]5755-he . "[0-i] [I]0-i have been dishonourable once — [you]0-i know it ; do n't let [me]0-i have the remorse of thinking that [I]0-i made [an honourable man]3162-an honourable man palter with temptation — made [him]3162-an honourable man sully [his]3162-an honourable man honour for [me]0-i . If [I]0-i am the inducement that keeps [you]0-i here , go ; for [my]0-i sake , go ! [I]0-i say it a hundred times ; promise [me]0-i [you]0-i will go — soon , this week . Let [me]0-i hear [you]0-i swear it ; [you]0-i will not break [your]0-i oath , [I]0-i know ! " [He]3162-an honourable man is silent ; hesitating to take that step of irrevocable banishment — banishment from [the woman that [he]3162-an honourable man cast away in righteous wrath , and in whose frail life [his]3162-an honourable man own now seems to be bound up]5756-the woman that he cast away in righteous wrath , and in whose frail life his own now seems to be bound up . "[0-i] Swear ! " [she]0-i says again , earnestly , with a resolute look in [her]0-i soft face . "[0-i] [I]0-i beg it of [you]0-i as a favour ; for if [you]0-i wo n't , though [my]0-i only chance of daily bread lies here , [I]0-i must go to - night . " The determination in [her]0-i voice recalls [him]3162-an honourable man to [his]3162-an honourable man senses . "[0-i] [I]0-i will not drive [you]0-i to such extremities , " [he]3162-an honourable man says , coldly . "[0-i] Give [me]0-i only till to - morrow morning — twenty - four hours can not make much difference to [you]0-i , and [a man going to be hanged]3163-a man going to be hanged likes to have a little respite — give [me]0-i till to- morrow , and [I]0-i will swear whatever [you]0-i wish . " "[0-i] That is right , " [she]0-i answers , trying to smile through [her]0-i tears . "[0-i] Some day [you]0-i will thank [me]0-i ; [you]0-i will say , ' [She]0-i was [a bad girl]1846-a bad girl , but [she]0-i did [me]0-i one good turn ! ' " [The people]1500-the people are flocking out of [church]3708-church ; [the squire]2786-the squire , in a low pony - chaise , driven by [a groom as old and toothless as [himself]2786-the squire]5760-a groom as old and toothless as himself , and drawn by a pony ( considering the comparative ages of horses and [men]595-men ) also nearly as old , is bowling gently up [the drive]5762-the drive . "[0-i] [I]0-i must go , " [Esther]148-esther says , rising hastily ; "[0-i] [Mrs. Blessington]437-mrs. blessington hates red eyes as [she]437-mrs. blessington hates a black dress , and for the same reason ! " AT [Blessington]437-mrs. blessington [no one]891-no one goes to [church]3708-church twice . It is the bounden duty of [every Christian man]5765-every christian man , [woman]3638-woman , and [child]3639-child to go to [church]3708-church in the morning ; it is the duty of only [the clergyman]1670-the clergyman , [the school - children]5770-the school - children , and [the organist]5771-the organist to go to [church]3708-church in the afternoon . [The old people]5196-the old people sleep side by side in the blaze of the saloon - fire ; being , both of [them]5196-the old people , happily deaf , [they]5196-the old people are undisturbed by [each other]909-each other 's grunts and snores . Since the beginning of [St. John]164-st. john 's visit , [the north drawing - room]5775-the north drawing - room has been made over to [him]5776-his and [[his]5776-his betrothed]3581-his betrothed to be affectionate in , so that [they]5196-the old people may enjoy , uninterrupted , those fits of affection to which [all engaged people]5778-all engaged people are supposed , and sometimes unjustly supposed , to be liable . Whether [they]5196-the old people have reached the requisite pitch of warmth on the afternoon [I]437-mrs. blessington speak of is , to say the least , doubtful ; but , all the same , in [the north drawing - room]5775-the north drawing - room [they]5196-the old people are . [Constance]256-constance leans back in an armchair , rather listless . [She]256-constance is fond of work , and it is not right to work on Sunday : [her]256-constance feet repose on a foot - stool before [her]256-constance — [her]256-constance eyes are fixed upon [them]5196-the old people : [she]256-constance is thinking profoundly whether steel buckles a size smaller than the ones [she]256-constance is at present wearing would not be more becoming to the feet . [St. John]164-st. john sits by the table ; [his]5776-his left hand supports [his]5776-his head ; [his]5776-his right scribbles idly , on a bit of paper , horses taking impossible fences , prize pigs , [ballet - girls]5780-ballet - girls , [little skeleton men squaring up at one another]5781-little skeleton men squaring up at one another . [He]5776-his , too , is thinking — but not of shoe - buckles . [He]5776-his has got something to say to [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington — something unpleasant , unpolite ; and [he]5776-his can not , for the life of [him]5776-his , imagine how to begin to say it . [Chance]503-chance favours [him]5776-his . [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington , happening to look up , catches [[her]258-miss blessington lover]683-her lover 's eyes fixed , with an expression [she]258-miss blessington had never before seen in them — not on [herself]258-miss blessington , as [she]258-miss blessington , for the first second imagines , but ( as a second glance informs [her]258-miss blessington ) on some object outside the window . [Her]258-miss blessington gaze follows [his]5776-his , and lights upon "[437-mrs. blessington] [nobody very particular]3165-nobody very particular — only poor [Miss Craven]164-st. john ! " who , with head rather bent , is trudging by towards [the garden]846-the garden . "[164-st. john] How ill [that girl]1422-that girl looks ! " [she]0-i says , pettishly . "[164-st. john] [I]0-i really believe [those sort of people]5357-those sort of people take a pleasure in looking as sickly and woebegone as possible , in order to put one out of spirits . " The opening [he]5776-his has been looking for has come . "[256-constance] [Constance]256-constance , " [he]5776-his says , bending [his]5776-his head , and speaking in a low voice , "[256-constance] what fatuity induced [you]256-constance not to send [me]0-i word when [you]256-constance found that [that girl]1422-that girl was [here]3398-here ? " "[0-i] [You]0-i forbad [me]0-i ever to mention [her]1422-that girl name to [you]0-i , " [she]0-i answers , coldly ; "[0-i] and , to tell [you]0-i the truth , [I]0-i thought it was a good thing that [you]0-i should see [her]1422-that girl . If [you]0-i had not met again , [you]0-i might have carried a sentimental recollection of [her]1422-that girl throughout life , which [you]0-i can hardly do now that [you]0-i have seen with [your]0-i own eyes how completely [she]1422-that girl has lost [her]1422-that girl beauty . " [St. John]164-st. john lifts [his]5784-his head , and stares at [her]0-i in blank astonishment . "[1422-that girl] Lost [its]1422-that girl beauty!"—that "[0-i] Lost [her]1422-that girl beauty ! " [he]5784-his repeats , in a sort of stupefaction . "[0-i] Well , " [she]0-i replies , languidly , "[0-i] why do [you]0-i repeat [my]0-i words ? [You]0-i know [I]0-i never admired [her]1422-that girl much . [I]0-i never can admire [those black women]3170-those black women , but that is a matter of taste , of course . It is not matter of taste , however — it is matter of fact , that whatever good looks [she]1422-that girl once had are gone — gone . " [Gerard]258-miss blessington smiles contemptuously . "[0-i] [I]0-i do believe that [[you]3171-you [women]547-women]1344-you women lose the sight of [your]3171-you eyes when [you]3171-you look at [one another]922-one another . " "[0-i] What do [you]0-i mean ? " [she]0-i asks , with some animation . "[0-i] Is it possible that [you]0-i do n't agree with [me]0-i as to [her]1422-that girl being quite passée ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i think [her]1422-that girl , as [I]0-i always thought [her]1422-that girl , " [he]5785-he answers , steadily , "[1422-that girl] [the loveliest woman [I]0-i ever beheld]3175-the loveliest woman i ever beheld ; a little additional thinness or paleness does not affect [her]1422-that girl much . [Hers]1422-that girl is not mere skin beauty : as [you]0-i say , tastes differ , and [I]0-i like [those black women]3170-those black women . " "[0-i] That is a civil speech to make to [me]0-i ! " [she]0-i answers , reddening — an insult to [her]0-i appearance or [her]0-i clothes being the one weapon that has power to pierce the scales of [her]0-i armour of proof . [St. John]164-st. john smiles again . "[0-i] When [we]3177-we engaged to marry [one another]922-one another , did [we]3177-we also engage to think [each other]909-each other [the handsomest specimens of the human animal Providence ever framed]3180-the handsomest specimens of the human animal providence ever framed ? " "[0-i] It is , at least , not usual for [a man]3402-a man to express an open preference for [another woman]3182-another woman to [the girl to whom [he]3402-a man is engaged]3183-the girl to whom he is engaged . " "[0-i] It is no question of preference , " [he]3402-a man answers , quietly . "[0-i] [I]0-i had no thought of drawing any comparison between [you]0-i and [Miss Craven]164-st. john at the moment ; [I]0-i was not thinking of [you]0-i . " "[0-i] [You]0-i said [she]164-st. john was [the loveliest girl [you]0-i had ever seen]3184-the loveliest girl you had ever seen ! " objects [Constance]256-constance , pouting . "[0-i] So [I]0-i did — [I]0-i do think [her]164-st. john so , " [he]3402-a man rejoins , calmly . "[0-i] If there is some defect in [my]0-i eyes , hindering [me]0-i from seeing things as they are , it is [my]0-i misfortune , not [my]0-i fault . Can not [you]0-i be content , " [he]3402-a man asks , banteringly , "[0-i] with being the next loveliest ? " [She]256-constance turns away [her]256-constance head , too indignant to answer . [He]3402-a man changes [his]3402-a man tone . "[256-constance] [Constance]256-constance , " [he]3402-a man says , gravely , "[256-constance] when [I]0-i proposed to [you]256-constance , did not [I]0-i tell [you]256-constance , honestly , what [I]0-i could give [you]256-constance and what [I]0-i could not ? Love ( odd as it may sound between [engaged people]3185-engaged people ) , and the blind admiration that accompanies love , [I]0-i had not got to offer [you]256-constance ; this is true , is not it ? " "[0-i] Perfectly true , " [she]0-i answers , resentfully ; "[0-i] and as [I]0-i am not , nor ever was , one of [those inflammable young ladies , who think that burning , and consuming , and melting]3186-those inflammable young ladies , who think that burning , and consuming , and melting are essential to married happiness , [I]0-i did not much regret its absence . [I]0-i have always been brought up to think , " [she]0-i continues , having recourse to the high moral tone which is [her]0-i last sure refuge , "[0-i] that respect and esteem are the best basis for [two people]4924-two people to go upon , and [I]0-i think so still . " "[0-i] But do [you]256-constance and [I]0-i respect and esteem [one another]922-one another ? " [he]5786-he asks , half - cynically , half - mournfully . "[256-constance] Is it possible that [I]0-i can respect [you]256-constance , who , though [you]256-constance did not care , or affect to care , two straws about [me]0-i personally — though [you]256-constance knew , at the time [I]0-i asked [you]256-constance to marry [me]0-i , that [I]0-i was madly in love with [another woman]3182-another woman — were yet willing to give [yourself]256-constance to [me]0-i , soul and body — to be bone of [my]0-i bone , and flesh of [my]0-i flesh , because [I]0-i was [a good parti]3190-a good parti , as the vile phrase goes ? And as for [me]0-i , " [he]5787-he ends , in bitter self - contempt , "[0-i] what is there in all [my]0-i idle wasted life , from beginning to end , that [any one]523-any one can respect or esteem ? " "[0-i] Has this struck [you]0-i now for the first time ? " [she]0-i asks , drily . "[0-i] [I]0-i am not aware of any change in [our]3192-our relative circumstances since [our]3192-our marriage was arranged ; [I]0-i suppose [our]3192-our feelings towards [each other]909-each other are much what they were then , when [you]0-i were troubled with none of these scruples . " "[0-i] And what were [our]3192-our feelings then ? " [he]238-sir thomas asks , bitterly ; "[0-i] what brought as together ? Was not it that [our]3192-our properties dovetailed conveniently into one another , as [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas says — that it was advisable for both of [us]3192-our to marry [some one]686-some one — that [we]3192-our were of suitable age , and had no positive distaste for [one another]922-one another : was not this so ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i suppose so , " [she]0-i answers , sulkily . "[0-i] And yet , " [he]238-sir thomas continues , sternly , "[0-i] although [I]0-i had laid bare to [you]0-i all [my]0-i wretched story — although [you]0-i were well aware that [I]0-i was utterly without the safeguard of any love to [yourself]0-i — [you]0-i yet let [me]0-i fall into this temptation — the cruelest [I]0-i could have been exposed to — without a word of warning . Was this fair ? Was this right ? " "[0-i] Since [you]0-i put [me]0-i on [my]0-i defence , " [she]0-i answers , with anger , "[0-i] [I]0-i must repeat to [you]0-i what [I]0-i said before , that it seemed to [me]0-i the best method of curing [you]0-i of [your]0-i ill - placed fancy for [Esther Craven]148-esther — a fancy which [she]148-esther repaid with such disgraceful deceit and duplicity — was to let [you]0-i see for [yourself]0-i what a wreck [she]148-esther had become ! " "[0-i] [You]0-i meant well , perhaps , " [he]5788-he rejoins , with a sigh that is more than half a groan ; "[0-i] but it was terribly mistaken — terribly ill - judged ; it has done [us]3196-us both an irreparable injury . " "[0-i] [I]0-i am not aware that it has done [me]0-i any injury whatever , " [she]0-i answers , coldly , mistaking [his]5788-he meaning "[0-i] [I]0-i was not alluding to [you]0-i , " [he]5788-he replies , curtly . [She]0-i makes no rejoinder , and [he]5788-he , rising , begins to walk up and down [the room]3629-the room with [his]5788-he hands in [his]5788-he pockets . [He]5788-he has made [his]5788-he meaning clear enough , surely , and yet [she]0-i does not appear to see it . As [she]0-i continues resolutely silent , [he]5788-he stops opposite to [her]0-i , and speaks earnestly , and yet with some embarrassment , as one who knows that what [he]5788-he says will be unpleasing to [[his]5788-he listener]5790-his listener . "[256-constance] [Constance]256-constance , [I]0-i must tell [you]256-constance the truth , though [I]0-i suppose it is hardly of the complexion of the pretty flattering truths or untruths that [you]256-constance have been used to all [your]256-constance life . But , at least , it is better that [you]256-constance should hear it now , thar that [we]3197-we should tell it [one another]922-one another a year hence , with mutual , useless recriminations ; there is no use in disguising the fact that [you]256-constance and [I]0-i do not feel towards [each other]909-each other as [husband]3771-husband and [wife]4219-wife should feel . " "[123-pshaw] [Pshaw]123-pshaw ! " [she]0-i says , pettishly , turning [her]0-i head aside ; "[123-pshaw] [we]3197-we feel much the same as [other people]3531-other people do , [I]0-i daresay . " "[0-i] If , " [he]3771-husband continues , very gravely , "[0-i] marriage were a temporary connection , that lasted a year — five years say — or that could be dissolved at pleasure , there might be no great harm in entering upon it with the sort of negative liking , the absence of repugnance for [one another]922-one another , which is all that [we]3197-we can boast ; but since it is a bargain for all time , and that there is no getting out of it except by the gate of death or disgrace , [I]0-i think [we]3197-we ought both to reflect on it more seriously than [we]3197-we have yet done before undertaking it . " "[256-constance] It is rather late in the day to say all this , " retorts [she]0-i , indignantly . "[256-constance] [You]256-constance have known [me]0-i all [my]0-i life ; [you]256-constance must have been well aware that [I]0-i never could enter into those highflown , romantic notions , which [I]0-i have heard [you]256-constance [yourself]256-constance ridicule a hundred times . These objections should have occurred to [you]256-constance before [you]256-constance proposed to [me]0-i , and not now , when [we]3197-we have been engaged two months , and when [our]3197-we marriage has been discussed as a settled thing by all [our]3197-we acquaintance . " "[256-constance] [You]256-constance are right , " [he]5791-he answers , quietly . "[256-constance] [They]3204-they should have occurred to [me]0-i before ; but , in justice to [myself]0-i , [I]0-i must say that they would never have occurred to [me]0-i : [I]0-i should have remained in the same state of supine indifference to everything in which [I]0-i came here , had not [you]256-constance [yourself]256-constance thrown [me]0-i in the way of [Esther Craven]148-esther . " [She]256-constance sits upright in [her]256-constance chair ; [her]256-constance pale , handsome face paler , harder than usual , in [her]256-constance great anger . "[256-constance] The drift of this long tirade , when translated into plain English , is , [I]0-i suppose , that [you]256-constance wish to marry [Esther Craven]148-esther instead of [me]0-i ? " [He]5792-he is silent . "[256-constance] Is it so ? " [she]256-constance repeats , [her]256-constance voice raised several notes above its wonted low key . "[256-constance] When [I]0-i am engaged to [one woman]2108-one woman , " [he]5792-he answers , slowly , reluctantly , yet steadily , "[0-i] [I]0-i hope [I]0-i am not dishonourable enough willingly to harbour the thought of marriage with any other . " The Gerard diamonds flash before [her]256-constance mind 's eye : they are so big , and numerous — necklace , aigrette , stomacher . The idea of seeing [them]5793-them gleam restless in [Esther]148-esther 's hair , on [Esther]148-esther 's fair neck , is insupportable to [her]256-constance . [She]256-constance will not release [him]5792-he , ardently as [he]5792-he wishes it ; [she]256-constance will hold [him]5792-he by a strong chain that will not snap — [his]5792-he honour . "[0-i] [I]0-i am glad to hear it , " [she]256-constance answers , coldly . "[0-i] In common fairness to [me]0-i , [you]0-i could hardly have entertained such an idea . It is a great disadvantage to [a girl]2311-a girl to be engaged , to have [her]2311-a girl engagement as widely known as [mine]0-i has been , and then to have it broken off ; [people]3426-people never think the same of [her]2311-a girl again . " [He]5792-he turns to the window , to hide [his]5792-he bitter disappointment . "[3426-people] Very well , " [he]5792-he answers , calmly ; "[3426-people] things will remain as they are , [I]0-i suppose , then ? [I]0-i only thought it right to warn [you]0-i how small a chance of happiness there is in a marriage so loveless as [ours]3208-us : for the rest [you]0-i must blame [yourself]0-i . " NIGHT 'S black sheet drawn off the other half of [the world]672-the world is thrown over [us]3208-us ; the dark side of the lantern is turned towards [us]3208-us . [Esther]148-esther has fallen asleep , with almost a happy smile upon [her]148-esther soft , parted lips . [She]148-esther is forgiven ; and is there any sweetness like the sweetness of being pardoned , having sinned ? [He]5792-he no longer hates [her]148-esther ! That was not hate that looked out of [his]5792-he quick , keen eyes to - day , as [he]5792-he leant over [her]148-esther while [she]148-esther sat , dizzy and faint , on [that church- yard slab]5795-that church- yard slab , or as [he]5792-he knelt in strong emotion at [her]148-esther knees , And now , though at [her]148-esther own telling , [he]5792-he is going away from [her]148-esther to - morrow — though , when next [they]3209-they meet , either [they]3209-they will have put off mortality 's tatters , [God]435-god will have laid "[0-i] Death , like a kiss , across [their]3209-they lips ; " or else , to look and lean as [he]5792-he looked and leant to - day will be deadly sin — yet creeps there a sorrowful joy about [her]148-esther heart . [He]5792-he has given [her]148-esther back the past — the short , happy Felton past ; [no one]891-no one can take it from [her]148-esther again ; not even [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington , who has taken all else — present and future and all . [She]148-esther is dreaming of [him]5792-he now — dreaming that [she]148-esther is sitting in [the library at [Felton]44-felton]5797-the library at felton , in the fragrant gloom made by the lowered Venetian blinds , by dark oak book- shelves , by plentiful sweet flowers , and so sitting hears the sound of [his]5792-he quick feet coming along [the passage]5265-the passage . [He]5792-he is at the door — [he]5792-he is opening it . But , ah ! what is this — it will not open ; it is stiff on its hinges . [He]5792-he is pushing it — pushing gently , pushing hard — but it will not move . What a stealthy noise it is [he]5792-he makes , as if [he]5792-he were afraid of [some one]686-some one hearing [him]5792-he ! [She]148-esther starts up , broad awake ; it is not all dream ; there is [some one pushing stealthily , yet audibly , against a door]5800-some one pushing stealthily , yet audibly , against a door . For the first bewildered moment of sick fear [she]148-esther imagines that it is [her]148-esther own door on which this attempt is being made ; but a moment 's listening undeceives [her]148-esther . The sound comes from underneath [her]148-esther window , apparently . It is not rats this time ; a rat , with all its ingenuity , would be puzzled to make a noise so distinctly human . Upon [her]148-esther mind there flashes suddenly the recollection of a door leading into [the garden]846-the garden beneath [her]148-esther casement , but not so immediately beneath but that [she]148-esther can see it ; a door that stands wide open all the summer through , when [people]3426-people step from [house]5803-house to [garden]4199-garden , from [garden]4199-garden to [house]5803-house , a hundred times a day , but which in winter is rarely used . [She]148-esther sits up motionless , while round [her]148-esther utter darkness surges . The noise is repeated : push — push ! creak — creak ! it is as if [some one , with hand and knee]5807-some one , with hand and knee , were attempting to obtain entrance . When light is withdrawn hearing becomes preternaturally sharpened ; in an instant [she]148-esther has jumped out of bed , and run barefoot over the cold boards to the window . There , pulling aside the blind , [she]148-esther , trembling all over , peeps out . Moon is there none , but the joint light of countless star - squadrons , faint though it be , is yet strong enough to enable [her]148-esther distinctly to make out the figure of [a man pressing itself against the door in question]5808-a man pressing itself against the door in question . With bodily eyes [she]148-esther at length looks upon [that burglar]5809-that burglar , whom , with the terrified eyes of imagination , [she]148-esther had so often beheld . Whether [he]5809-that burglar wear a crape mask or not it is too dark to discern . What is [she]148-esther to do?—she , in all probability , the only wakeful , conscious being in [all that great house]5810-all that great house . For a minute [she]148-esther stands irresolute , while a rushing sound fills [her]148-esther ears , and [her]148-esther teeth chatter dismally in the cold . Shall [she]148-esther alarm [the servants]4284-the servants ? But how to reach [them]4284-the servants ? [She]148-esther does not even know the way to [their]4284-the servants sleeping - places . [They]4284-the servants are miles away , in the other wing of [the house]687-the house , where [she]148-esther has never been . Shall [she]148-esther go to [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington ? At least [she]148-esther knows the way thither , though it is some distance off . But of what avail would that be ? Of what use would [two girls]5813-two girls be , any more than [one , against the onslaught of daring unscrupulous robbers]5814-one , against the onslaught of daring unscrupulous robbers ? Shall [she]148-esther betake [herself]148-esther to [St. John]164-st. john , whose room is but two doors off ? No sooner does this idea suggest itself to [her]148-esther , than [she]148-esther puts it into practice . Hastily striking a light , and wrapping [her]148-esther dressing - gown round [her]148-esther , [she]148-esther opens [her]148-esther door , and , flying down [the passage]5265-the passage , knocks loudly at [[Mr. Gerard]247-mr. gerard 's]5816-mr. gerard 's . But [Gerard]247-mr. gerard , having a not particularly bad conscience , and a particularly good digestion , is [a sound sleeper]5817-a sound sleeper . [She]148-esther knocks again , more violently , almost to the flaying of [her]148-esther knuckles : "[0-i] [Mr. Gerard!—Mr . Gerard]247-mr. gerard ! " "[247-mr. gerard] Hullo ! who 's there ? " responds a sleepy voice . "[0-i] It 's [I]0-i ! [Esther]148-esther ! " [she]148-esther cries pantingly . "[148-esther] Open the door , please — this minute — quick ! " "[148-esther] Esther!—you ! " says [the voice]5818-the voice , perfectly awake this time . "[148-esther] What on earth is the matter [I]0-i — wait one second ! " [He]247-mr. gerard hurries on [his]247-mr. gerard clothes , and then hastens to accede to [her]148-esther request of opening the door . "[0-i] Are [you]148-esther ill ? " [he]247-mr. gerard asks , anxiously , seeing [her]148-esther lean against the door - post , with death - white cheeks and terror - struck eyes . "[148-esther] No — no ! " [she]148-esther answers , hoarse and breathless , while , [St. John]164-st. john , candle , and door , all seem to be dancing a jig round [her]148-esther . "[0-i] It is not [I]0-i , but there 's [a man]3402-a man — getting into [the house]687-the house — by the garden - door . [I]0-i saw [him]3402-a man ! " "[3402-a man] The devil there is ! " replies [the young man]670-the young man , with animation . "[3402-a man] Here , give [me]0-i [your]148-esther candle , and [I]0-i 'll go and see what [he]3402-a man wants . " "[0-i] No — no ! " [she]148-esther cries , with all [a woman]553-a woman 's unreason . "[0-i] Do n't go ; [you]0-i must not ! " ( though for what other purpose [she]148-esther had sought [his]670-the young man assistance [she]148-esther would have been puzzled to say ) . "[0-i] [I]0-i wo n't let [you]0-i ; [you]0-i 'll be killed ! " and so , gasping , stretches out [her]148-esther white arms towards [him]670-the young man , and , letting drop [her]148-esther candle , falls insensible , in the total darkness , into [his]670-the young man embrace . For a month past or more , the dream that has pursued [Gerard]247-mr. gerard night and day — unchecked in sleep , in waking faintly repressed by considerations of honour — is to hold [that fair woman]5821-that fair woman 's form in [his]670-the young man arms ; and now [he]670-the young man so holds [her]5821-that fair woman in reality . And yet , as the fulfilment of [our]5822-our wishes seldom affords [us]5822-our the gratification [we]5822-our had anticipated , so it is with [him]670-the young man . Now that [he]670-the young man has got [her]5821-that fair woman , [he]670-the young man does not quite know what to do with [her]5821-that fair woman . Shall [he]670-the young man , encumbered by [his]670-the young man beautiful burden , grope [his]670-the young man way back into [[his]670-the young man room]5823-his room , and lay [her]5821-that fair woman down there , while [he]670-the young man goes and investigates into the cause of [her]5821-that fair woman terror and swoon ? But [the household]4727-the household , being alarmed , may find [her]5821-that fair woman [there]594-there ; and , so finding , would not the reputation of [her]5821-that fair woman , most innocent , be endangered ? [Her]5821-that fair woman head droops heavy in its perfect lifelessness on [his]670-the young man shoulder ; [her]5821-that fair woman soft warm hair caresses [his]670-the young man cheek in the blackness of the night . [He]670-the young man looks down [the passage]5265-the passage . From [Esther]148-esther 's open door a flood of light streams ; at all events there is a candle left burning there . In a moment [he]670-the young man has borne [her]5821-that fair woman into [[her]5821-that fair woman own chamber]5827-her own chamber , and has laid [her]5821-that fair woman most gently down upon the ginger - moreen bed . [He]670-the young man has no time to try and revive [her]5821-that fair woman now . "[0-i] Perhaps it was only [her]3212-her own imagination , [poor child!—her]3213-poor child!—her own imagination , and those infernal rats ! " is the hasty thought that has crossed [his]670-the young man mind ; but looking through the window , as [she]5821-that fair woman had done , [he]670-the young man sees , as [she]5821-that fair woman had seen , [a man]3402-a man 's dim figure in the starlight . Without a moment 's delay , without casting another thought even to [the fair swooned woman [he]670-the young man leaves behind [him]670-the young man]5829-the fair swooned woman he leaves behind him , [Gerard]247-mr. gerard runs down [the corridor]5830-the corridor , [his]247-mr. gerard blood pleasantly astir with the thought of a possible adventure — through [interminable dark galleries]5831-interminable dark galleries , down the gleaming cold of white stone stairs , through [hall]5832-hall , [saloon]5833-saloon , [north drawing - room]5834-north drawing - room , and [justicing - room]5835-justicing - room — till [he]247-mr. gerard reaches [a narrow short passage that leads to the garden door]5836-a narrow short passage that leads to the garden door . As [he]247-mr. gerard and [his]247-mr. gerard light draw near , the noise suddenly ceases . [He]247-mr. gerard stands still for a moment , expecting to hear it repeated , but it is not . Setting down [his]247-mr. gerard candle , therefore , [he]247-mr. gerard advances towards the door and unfastens it — it is secured by an old - fashioned catch inside — opens it , and looks out into the night . At first [he]247-mr. gerard can discern nothing but [the chill wintry garden]5837-the chill wintry garden , and the million stars scattered broadcast over [[God]435-god 's one great unenclosed field of the sky]5838-god 's one great unenclosed field of the sky ; but a second glance reveals to [him]247-mr. gerard [a dim figure crouching indistinct in the shadow of a projecting buttress]5839-a dim figure crouching indistinct in the shadow of a projecting buttress . Half - hesitating , as one that stands doubtful on the threshold of [a church]5846-a church , [he]247-mr. gerard opens the door and enters . This swoon is horribly deathlike : "[3237-this bloodthirsty villain] [...........]506-........... But [she]3236-poor little thing liesNot in the embrace of loyal death , who keepsHis bride for ever , but in treacherous armsOf sleep , that sated , will restore to griefHer snatch'd a sweet space from [his]3237-this bloodthirsty villain cruel clutch . " [Her]3236-poor little thing head is thrown back , and [her]3236-poor little thing round chin slightly raised . Over the tossed pillow wander the tangled riches of [her]3236-poor little thing swart hair ; nerveless on the counterpane lie the white , carven hands and blue - veined wrists , on which the faint fine lines make a tender network . " [He]247-mr. gerard leans over [her]3236-poor little thing , gazing with passionate admiration at the heavy shut lids and upward curling lashes — with passionate admiration mixed with sharp pain ; for [he]247-mr. gerard can see , plainlier now in this long quiet look than in the hasty , stolen glances [he]247-mr. gerard has hitherto given [her]3236-poor little thing , the purple stains under closed eyes , the little depressions in the rounded cheek , the droop of the sweet sorrowful mouth . But looking at [a person with ever such warm approbation]3240-a person with ever such warm approbation will not recover [them]3240-a person with ever such warm approbation from a swoon . What is [he]3241-he to do ? [He]3241-he is horribly puzzled , so seldom before has [he]3241-he seen [a fainted fellow - Christian]3242-a fainted fellow - christian . Vague ideas of having heard of burnt feathers held under nostrils recur to [his]3241-he mind . But whence to obtain feathers , unless [he]3241-he takes a pair of scissors and snips a hole in the feather - bed ? There is nothing in all [the great room]5279-the great room more feathery than the stumpy end of an old quill pen , with which [Miss Craven]164-st. john is wo nt to indite [her]164-st. john small accounts . Another specific flashes before [his]3241-he mental eye . Smelling - salts ! [He]3241-he walks to the dressing - table , and carefully overlooks [its]3244-its slender load : brushes and combs , a Bible , and a fat pincushion — neither essence , unguent , nor scent of any kind . [Esther]148-esther 's toilette apparatus is but meagre . Shall [he]3241-he throw cold water over [her]148-esther ? What ! and deluge all the ginger moreen bed , thereby making [it]3245-it an even more undesirable resting - place than [it]3245-it is at present ? Quite at a loss what to do , [he]3241-he returns to the bedside , and begins to chafe [her]148-esther cold hands between [his]3241-he two warm ones . Then [he]3241-he stoops over [her]148-esther , trying to discover any smallest sign of returning consciousness . When [his]3241-he lips are so close to [hers]148-esther , how can [he]3241-he help laying [them]3246-them yet closer ? [Men]595-men seldom do resist any temptation , unless it is very weak , and the objections to it very overwhelming . This temptation is not weak , and there are absolutely no objections to it . [No one]891-no one will ever know of this theft — not even [the person upon whom it is committed]3249-the person upon whom it is committed : it will do [her]148-esther no harm , and to kiss [her]148-esther even thus unknowing , unreturning , gives [him]3241-he a bitter joy . But , having once kissed [her]148-esther , [he]3241-he refrains [himself]3241-he , nor lays [his]3241-he lips a second time upon [hers]148-esther . Something of shame comes over [him]3241-he , as one that has taken advantage of another 's helplessness — one that , for an instant , has let [the brute within [him]3241-he]3250-the brute within him get the upper hand of [the man]3894-the man . Only [he]3241-he caresses gently [her]148-esther two cold hands , and [his]3241-he eyes dwell on [her]148-esther face , watching longingly for the first small symptom of back - coming life . [His]3241-he patience is rewarded , after a time ; after a time there comes a quivering about the eyelids , a tremor about the mouth — then a deep - drawn sighing respiration . Always with a sigh does the soul come back to [[its]3252-its dark cottage]3253-its dark cottage , having journeyed away from [it]3253-its dark cottage for awhile . The curtain - lids sweep back from the spirit 's windows ; and , pale and clear , [her]148-esther eyes ' dark glories shine upon [him]3241-he , conscious yet bewildered . Then a little stealing red , like the tint that dwelt in a sea - shell 's lips , flows into each pure cheek ; then comes full consciousness , and with it recollected terrors . " [Constance]256-constance ! what do [you]256-constance mean by these insults ? How dare [you]256-constance give utterance to [them]5872-them ? "[3255-i] " [You]3255-i must allow that it is at least an equivocal position , "[256-constance] [she]256-constance answers , half - frightened by [his]3255-i stern looks , but keeping resolutely to [her]256-constance text . " It is , "[3255-i] [he]3255-i answers , remorsefully ; " [I]3255-i allow it — [I]3255-i bitterly feel it . [Miss Craven]164-st. john had not recovered from [her]164-st. john insensibility more than two minutes before [you]256-constance came into [the room]3629-the room ; [I]3255-i was in the act of leaving it as [you]256-constance entered . This is the whole plain truth : do [you]3256-you believe it ? "[3255-i] [She]3256-you does not answer . " Do [you]3256-you believe it ? "[3256-you] [he]3256-you repeats , earnestly . The mulish look comes into [her]3256-you face — the look [he]3256-you has begun to know so well . " It can not be of much consequence to [you]3256-you whether [I]3256-you believe it or not , "[3256-you] [she]3256-you answers , still with that freezing calm of voice and face . " [You]3256-you have , at all events , adopted the best method of obtaining [your]3256-you release from that engagement , which [you]3256-you so broadly hinted , only yesterday afternoon , that [you]3256-you wished to be free from . [You]3256-you have [your]3256-you wish — [you]3256-you are free ! "[3256-you] " As [you]3256-you will , "[3256-you] [he]3256-you answers , gloomily . " God knows there never was much love in [our]5876-our connection ; [an iller - mated pair]5877-an iller - mated pair never came together ; it was a mere matter of business on both sides . But , as to saying that the pure accident which has brought [Miss Craven]164-st. john and [me]3256-you into slight and transient collision to - night can have any influence upon the conclusion or continuance of [our]5876-our engagement — it is tantamount to telling [me]3256-you that what [I]3256-you have sworn to [you]3256-you , upon [my]3256-you honour as [a gentleman]673-a gentleman , to be true , is false ! "[3256-you] [he]3256-you says , [his]3256-you face growing white and fierce . " Is it ? "[3257-her] [she]3257-her says , with a quietly enraging smile ; having that confidence in the shield of womanhood , which makes so many [a woman]553-a woman gall [a man]3402-a man to the uttermost , and expect [him]3402-a man to stand by , serene , polite , and smiling . " Unfortunately , "[3257-her] [she]3257-her continues , " [I]3257-her am behind the spirit of the age ; [I]3257-her am shackled with obsolete old notions of propriety and decency ; and therefore — as [you]3256-you have no longer any smallest control over [my]3257-her actions — will [you]3256-you be so good as to allow [me]3257-her to go ? "[3257-her] [He]3256-you drops [her]3257-her hand instantly , and , opening the door for [her]3257-her , bows [his]3256-you head haughtily , saying , " Go ! [I]3256-you have neither the wish nor the power to detain [you]3257-her ; "[3256-you] and as [he]3256-you so speaks [she]3257-her passes out . Meanwhile [Esther]148-esther , having slidden from [her]148-esther bed , stands with trembling limbs , grasping the back of a chair , and gazing from [speaker]3260-speaker to [speaker]3260-speaker with a world of surprise and horror in [her]148-esther great innocent eyes . As [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington leaves [the room]3629-the room , [St. John]164-st. john turns to [her]3257-her : " [[My]3256-you darling]1890-my darling ! "[3256-you] [he]3256-you says , with an accent of passionate remorse , " how will [you]3257-her ever forgive [me]3256-you for having exposed [you]3257-her to this ! "[3256-you] [She]3257-her turns away from [him]3256-you , and covers [her]3257-her burning face with [her]3257-her hands . " Go ! "[3257-her] [she]3257-her says , faintly—"go , this minute ! Do n't say another word ! Do n't give [her]3257-her any more reason for [her]3257-her wicked slanders ! Go ! "[3257-her] And [he]3256-you goes . OF [the three persons whose repose has been disturbed by the]3263-the three persons whose repose has been disturbed by the amours of [Thomas]238-sir thomas [the footman]2286-the footman , [only one]3265-only one is able to take up again the thread of interrupted slumber . [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington , having returned to [[her]258-miss blessington chamber]3266-her chamber , and having meditated calmly for a quarter of an hour on the knot in [her]258-miss blessington destiny [she]258-miss blessington has just untied , and having given one great sigh to the memory of [the Gerard diamonds]3267-the gerard diamonds , lays down [her]258-miss blessington golden scented head on [her]258-miss blessington pillow again , and sleeps the sleep of the just . [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington has well nigh mastered the secret of eternal youth and perennial beauty — incapacity for feeling any emotion . It is hardly likely that [the god Sleep]3268-the god sleep , who loves [a quiet house]3269-a quiet house , will visit [two such unquiet temples as the brains of [St. John]164-st. john and [Esther]148-esther]3270-two such unquiet temples as the brains of st. john and esther : [he]3256-you goes away from [them]3270-two such unquiet temples as the brains of st. john and esther utterly , taking [his]3256-you gentle poppyheads with [him]3256-you . [St. John]164-st. john walks miles and miles up and down [[his]3256-you bedroom]3271-his bedroom carpet , pondering , deeply and vexedly , not on what [his]3256-you own course of conduct shall be — that [he]3256-you is already determined upon — but on what effect [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington 's coldly sceptical reception of [his]3256-you wildly improbable yet true tale is likely to have upon [Esther]148-esther . And [Esther]148-esther [herself]148-esther , having conceived a mortal aversion for the shelter of [the ginger - canopied pavilion]3272-the ginger - canopied pavilion , wraps a great shawl round [her]148-esther , and , sitting down on the deep window - seat , watches for the first streaks of dawn , which , on these winter mornings , are long , long coming . Though it is a winter night , [her]148-esther hands burn hot and dry ; for the last few days [she]148-esther has had a sharp pain in [her]148-esther side — to - night it is getting yet sharper ; it begins to hurt [her]148-esther to draw [her]148-esther breath . Two thoughts keep buzzing about [her]148-esther brain : " [I]148-esther am going to be ill , "[148-esther] and " [I]148-esther am going to be turned away . "[148-esther] [She]148-esther throws aside [her]148-esther shawl , but the dry burning still continues . [She]148-esther has sat [here]3398-here for hours now , and the dawn 's feet are beginning slowly to climb the steps from the eastern gate . The battle between day and night is yet undecided ; almost equally they divide the sky between [them]3274-them . Perhaps it is the night 's excitement that has given [her]148-esther this fever ; perhaps the cold morning air would refresh [her]148-esther . [She]148-esther waits until day 's victory is complete , and then — being already dressed — puts on [her]148-esther hat and jacket , and steals noiselessly [downstairs]1293-downstairs , to the garden door that has been the cause of so much mischief , out into [the garden]846-the garden between the brown earthed beds , where [the winter aconite]3277-the winter aconite 's small yellow heads and green tippets are beginning to push themselves into sight , and thence into [the park]3880-the park . There is no wind abroad , only heavy rain - clouds outwalling the infant sun , and the unarmed air has a piercing chillness in it . [Esther]148-esther has not proceeded far , and is standing thoughtful on the brow of [a little knoll]3279-a little knoll , from whence [one]559-one looks down on [the dark flag - fringed pool]3281-the dark flag - fringed pool , when [she]148-esther is aware of a footstep behind [her]148-esther ; and the next instant [St. John Gerard]455-st. john gerard stands by [her]148-esther side . " What have [you]455-st. john gerard come here for ? Why have [you]455-st. john gerard followed [me]148-esther ? "[148-esther] [she]148-esther asks , turning upon [him]455-st. john gerard in hasty dismay . " [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington 's windows look this way — [she]148-esther will see [us]5880-us together . "[148-esther] " Let [her]148-esther see [us]5880-us , "[455-st. john gerard] [he]455-st. john gerard answers , doggedly . " [She]148-esther will never believe that it was by accident [we]5880-us have met , "[148-esther] cries [poor Esther]148-esther , in great agitation . " [She]148-esther will be right , then ; it is not accident , "[148-esther] " [She]148-esther will think that it was an appointment ! "[148-esther] " It is very well for [you]455-st. john gerard to talk in this way , "[148-esther] [she]148-esther says , with passionate reproach . " [You]455-st. john gerard are [a man]3402-a man — [you]455-st. john gerard may defy the opinion of [the world]672-the world ; but is it so easy for [me]148-esther ?
