" What is [she]148-esther to [either of [us]5884-us]5883-either of us ? " [I]148-esther think not ; to tell [you]455-st. john gerard the truth , [I]148-esther do n't mean to ask [her]148-esther . "[455-st. john gerard] [He]455-st. john gerard looks down , frowning heavily . " When [a galley - slave]5885-a galley - slave 's chains have been knocked off , must [he]5885-a galley - slave handcuff [himself]5885-a galley - slave again ? "[148-esther] " Because , "[455-st. john gerard] [he]455-st. john gerard answers , with emotion , fixing [his]455-st. john gerard upbraiding eyes upon her—"because [I]148-esther was smarting miserably under the blow [you]455-st. john gerard had just given [me]148-esther — [you]455-st. john gerard , who had made [me]148-esther mistrust everything attractive , and womanly , and innocent - seeming . [I]148-esther was obliged to marry [some one]686-some one ; that is one of the many curses attached to being [an eldest son]5887-an eldest son , and [the last male heir of [an inconveniently old family]5889-an inconveniently old family]5888-the last male heir of an inconveniently old family . "[148-esther] The words of [his]3282-you defence came quick and hurried . [The deer - barn]3286-the deer - barn is near — [the deer - barn]3286-the deer - barn , with steep red roof , lichen - painted , standing on a little rise , among a company of ancient hornbeams , whose twisted trunks lean this way and that . At length , rousing [himself]247-mr. gerard , [he]247-mr. gerard approaches [Esther]148-esther , and speaks , calmly at first , but with increasing vehemence as [he]247-mr. gerard proceeds : " [Esther]148-esther , [I]3293-i have been thinking what a short section of [my]3293-i life , counting by days and weeks , the time that [I]3293-i have known [you]148-esther forms ; that month at [Felton]44-felton , when [we]3285-we had scarcely eyes or ears for any one but [each other]909-each other , and this month here , when [we]3285-we have hardly exchanged two words . [I]3293-i suppose [I]3293-i know very little about [you]148-esther , really ; [you]148-esther may be [a very bad worthless girl]5897-a very bad worthless girl , for all [I]3293-i know to the contrary . [God]435-god knows [I]3293-i have not had much reason to think [you]148-esther [a very good one]5898-a very good one ; and yet , good or bad — well , as [you]148-esther say , and as [I]3293-i have no reason to doubt , that [you]148-esther can get on without [me]3293-i — [I]3293-i can not , for the life of [me]3293-i , bear any longer the dragging of the endless empty days without [you]148-esther . [Esther]148-esther ! "[3293-i] [he]3293-i says , with passionate hunger in [his]3293-i eyes , " [I]3293-i want [you]148-esther ! [I]3293-i must have [you]148-esther for [my]3293-i own ! Is there now any reason why [I]3293-i should not ? "[3293-i] " Have [you]3293-i forgotten , "[3294-you] [she]3294-you asks , with a melancholy smile , " the night when [you]3293-i told [me]3294-you that [you]3293-i would never forgive [me]3294-you , either in [this world]549-this world or the next ? What have [I]3294-you done since to make [you]3293-i change [your]3293-i mind ? [I]3294-you am no different to what [I]3294-you was then — unless , perhaps , [I]3294-you may be a little wickeder ; [I]3294-you have been most unhappy , and adversity makes one wicked . "[3294-you] " [I]3295-i suppose [I]3295-i have lost [my]3295-i senses , "[3295-i] [he]3295-i answers , with excitement ; " but it seems to [me]3295-i now that , even were [you]3294-you to deceive [me]3295-i again , as [you]3294-you did at [Felton]44-felton — if [you]3294-you were to cheat [me]3295-i , and tell [me]3295-i falsehoods with the same baby - innocent face that [you]3294-you did there — that even then [I]3295-i should not repent of [my]3295-i bargain . Of two evils it would be the least ; it would be better than never to have possessed [you]3294-you at all . Only , [child]3639-child , one thing [I]3295-i beg of [you]3294-you , "[3295-i] [he]3295-i continues , with reproachful entreaty : " if [you]3294-you mean to trick [me]3295-i a second time , do n't let [me]3295-i find it out for a little while ! Let [me]3295-i be happy for a year — a month — a week ! "[3295-i] [Her]3296-you eyes rest on the ground , and a painful red spreads on either cheek . Despite the honest yearning love that vibrates along [his]3295-i voice , [she]3296-you can not cast out from [her]3296-you heart that galling suspicion that has stolen there . " [You]3295-i are very good , "[3296-you] [she]3296-you makes answer , in a constrained voice ; " and it is very generous of [you]3295-i trying to hide [your]3295-i real motive ; but [I]3296-you can see it : it is pity ! " Is it , "[3298-you] [he]3298-you says ( a heavy fear quickening [his]3298-you pulses , and making [his]3298-you voice come thick and harsh ) , " that [you]3297-you want to tell [me]3298-you by signs , what [you]3297-you dare not tell [me]3298-you in words to [my]3298-you face , that [the old love]5905-the old love is dead , killed by [my]3298-you hard words that miserable night at [Felton]44-felton Oh , love ! it must have been but a weakly thing , if a few rough words could kill it . "[3298-you] [She]3297-you does not answer . " [You]3297-you did love [me]3298-you once , [Esther]148-esther , "[3298-you] [he]3298-you continues , vehemently ; " [I]3298-you know [you]3297-you did ! [I]3298-you knew it then , only , in [my]3298-you blind rage , [I]3298-you affected to disbelieve it . [You]3297-you must have loved [me]3298-you , when [you]3297-you , who had always been so shy , so reserved , so maidenly to [me]3298-you , of [your]3297-you own accord — do [you]3297-you recollect , sweet?—held out [your]3297-you arms to [me]3298-you , and flung [yourself]3297-you upon [my]3298-you breast . God only knows how hard it was for [me]3298-you to put [you]3297-you away ! "[3298-you] At the recollection [his]3298-you speech calls up , [her]3299-me face is stirred with a convulsive emotion ; but still [she]3299-me holds [her]3299-me peace . " [Esther]148-esther , speak!—and yet , perhaps , when [you]3297-you have spoken , [I]3299-me shall wish that [you]3297-you had kept silence . Say anything [you]3297-you will , do anything [you]3297-you will , only do n't kill [me]3299-me by telling [me]3299-me that so sweet a thing can be dead ! "[3299-me] [She]3299-me lifts [her]3299-me heavy eyes to [him]3298-you , and in them is the look of a hunted animal . " Why do [you]3298-you torment [me]3299-me with these questions ? "[3299-me] [she]3299-me asks , passionately . "[3299-me] " If [you]3299-me think so , it must indeed be dead , "[3298-you] [he]3298-you answers , deeply wounded . " Why will [you]3298-you insist on driving [me]3299-me into a corner ? "[3299-me] [she]3299-me asks , with the accent of [a person rendered irritable by pain]3300-a person rendered irritable by pain . "[3298-you] [he]3298-you repeats ; unable , in [his]3298-you immense surprise , to do more than say [her]3299-me own words after [her]3299-me . [A man]3402-a man is always overwhelmed with astonishment at the idea of [any woman]3070-any woman not being overjoyed to espouse [him]3402-a man . " Never to marry [you]3298-you ! "[3299-me] [she]3299-me reiterates , steadily . " [I]3299-me was a bad - enough match for [you]3298-you before — without fortune , position , or connexion ; [people]3426-people would have pitied [you]3298-you then for being drawn into such a marriage ; but now — "[3299-me] " But now , what ? "[3299-me] " But now that [I]3299-me am [a companion]5606-a companion , "[3299-me] [she]3299-me continues , with a bitter pride—"an anomalous animal , just two shades higher than [the lady's - maid]5909-the lady's - maid in [my]3299-me own estimation , and probably not that in [any one else's]5910-any one else's — [a companion]5606-a companion , too , of whom [people]3426-people can say the things that [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington will say of [me]3299-me now — "[3299-me] " What do [you]148-esther mean ? What sort of things can [she]258-miss blessington say ? "[3299-me] But [Esther]148-esther maintains a shamed red silence . " That [you]148-esther are completely passé "[148-esther] " No , not that!—that would not concern [me]3299-me much . "[3299-me] " That the way [you]148-esther cough in the evening fidgets [her]258-miss blessington to death ? "[3299-me] " No , not that . "[3299-me] " That [you]148-esther are over - sensitive , as [these sort of people]5913-these sort of people always are ? "[3299-me] ( with a faint mimicking of [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington 's slow languor of articulation ) . " No , not that . "[3299-me] " What then ? "[3299-me] " [You]148-esther must remember the things [she]258-miss blessington said ; [you]148-esther were there , and it is not more than five hours ago , "[148-esther] [she]148-esther answers , with some impatience . " [I]148-esther forget every word [she]258-miss blessington uttered except three . "[148-esther] " And what were [they]5914-they ? "[3299-me] " [You]148-esther are free . "[3299-me] " [She]258-miss blessington did not mean [them]5914-they , "[148-esther] says [Esther]148-esther , trying to speak with dispassionate calmness ; " [she]258-miss blessington was under an erroneous impression when [she]258-miss blessington said them ; [she]258-miss blessington will take [you]148-esther back again . "[148-esther] " Take [me]3303-me back again ! "[3303-me] [he]3303-me repeats , angrily . " Good heavens , [Esther]148-esther ! are [you]148-esther bent on driving [me]3303-me mad ? Not satisfied with refusing [me]3303-me point - blank [yourself]148-esther , are [you]148-esther determined to insult [me]3303-me , by forcing upon [me]3303-me [a woman for whom , as [you]148-esther know — as [you]148-esther must have known from the first moment [you]148-esther saw [us]5916-us together]5915-a woman for whom , as you know — as you must have known from the first moment you saw us together — [I]3303-me have never felt anything but the profoundest , coldest indifference ? "[3303-me] " [I]3304-i meant no insult , "[3304-i] [she]3304-i replies , apologetically : " [I]3304-i only meant to say what is true — that [she]5915-a woman for whom , as you know — as you must have known from the first moment you saw us together is a suitable match for [you]3305-i — that [she]5915-a woman for whom , as you know — as you must have known from the first moment you saw us together is [[your]3305-i equal]5917-your equal . "[3304-i] " Is [she]5915-a woman for whom , as you know — as you must have known from the first moment you saw us together ? "[3305-i] [he]3305-i retorts ironically . " [You]3304-i are very good , [I]3305-i 'm sure ; [I]3305-i ask for bread , and [you]3304-i give [me]3305-i a stone . For [God]435-god 's sake , [Essie]180-essie , if [you]180-essie will have nothing to say to [me]3305-i [yourself]180-essie , at least spare [me]3305-i the degradation of listening to [your]180-essie kind and disinterested plans for [my]3305-i welfare ! "[3305-i] Under this severe snub , [Miss Craven]164-st. john remains silent . " Is it , "[3305-i] [he]3305-i continues , presently , [his]3305-i indignation being a little cooled , " the mere fact of [my]164-st. john being well - off that damns [me]164-st. john in [your]180-essie eyes ? If so , [I]164-st. john think [I]164-st. john may plead ' not guilty , ' seeing that this oppressive wealth of [mine]164-st. john lies on the other side of [Sir Thomas]238-sir thomas 's death — an event probably , at least , as distant as the millennium . "[164-st. john] [She]164-st. john gazes out ( not seeing it the while ) at the driving rain , while a troubled look flits over [her]164-st. john small grave face ; but [she]164-st. john says neither " Yea "[164-st. john] nor " Nay . "[164-st. john] " When [I]3305-i am asking [you]164-st. john to give [me]3305-i [your]164-st. john whole sweet life , "[3305-i] [he]3305-i cries , impulsively , snatching one of [her]164-st. john little cold hands , " are [you]164-st. john so ungenerous as to wish [me]3305-i to have absolutely nothing to offer [you]164-st. john in return ? "[3305-i] Still silence . " [Essie]180-essie ! "[3305-i] [he]3305-i says , drawing [her]164-st. john nearer to [him]3305-i , and looking resolutely down into [her]164-st. john timid reluctant eyes , " [I]3305-i do n't ask [you]164-st. john to have pity upon [me]3305-i — that is a puling , cowardly way of making love , [I]3305-i always think ; if the only road to [a woman]553-a woman 's heart lies through [her]553-a woman compassion , [I]3305-i had rather never get there at all — but [I]3305-i ask [you]164-st. john to pity [yourself]164-st. john . To be [[my]3305-i wife]3795-my wife , ill - tempered and jealous as [I]3305-i , no doubt , should often be , would be distinctly a better fate than to be [[old Blessington]258-miss blessington 's drudge]5920-old blessington 's drudge . [Child]391-child ! have [you]391-child no pity for [yourself]164-st. john ? "[3305-i] " None whatever , "[164-st. john] [she]164-st. john answers , with emotion . " [I]3306-you am not in the least sorry for [myself]3306-you ; [I]3306-you richly deserve everything that is come to [me]3306-you . "[3306-you] [He]3306-you drops [her]164-st. john hand suddenly , with a gesture of anger . " [I]3306-you have been sacrificed to [him]3306-you once already , "[3306-you] [he]3306-you says , fiercely ; " am [I]3306-you to be sacrificed a second time to a sentimental recollection of [him]3306-you — to the mere memory of [his]3306-you perfections ? "[3306-you] [She]164-st. john raises [her]164-st. john rejected hand and its fellow deprecatingly towards [him]3306-you . "[164-st. john] " Never ! "[3306-you] [he]3306-you replies , emphatically ; and with that , [she]164-st. john standing nigh , and the temptation being mighty , [he]3306-you flings [his]3306-you arms sans cérémonie about [her]164-st. john supple body , and strains [her]164-st. john to [his]3306-you breast . Outside , the rain streams down with a continuous quiet noise ; the dappled deer are herding [their]3307-their branchy heads together under the old leafless hornbeams for shelter . For one moment [Esther]148-esther lies passive in [[her]148-esther lover]683-her lover 's arms , yielding to the bliss of that rough embrace ; and , after all , among the blisses that [we]3309-we wot of , what is there so great as , " After long grief and pain , To feel the arms of [your]3306-you true loveRound [you]3306-you once again ? "[3306-you] Then [her]164-st. john recollected resolution comes back . " Let [me]164-st. john go , "[164-st. john] [she]164-st. john says , faintly ; " this is not right ! "[164-st. john] " Right or wrong , "[3306-you] [he]3306-you answers , doggedly , " it is the one moment worth being called ' life ' that [I]3306-you have spent since [I]3306-you was fool enough to cut [my]3306-you own throat by parting from [you]164-st. john . "[3306-you] " Let [me]164-st. john go ! "[164-st. john] [she]164-st. john says , again ; and [he]3306-you , holding [her]164-st. john still prisoner , but putting [her]164-st. john a little farther from [him]3306-you , that [he]3306-you may the more distinctly see the workings of [her]164-st. john countenance , says steadily : " [Essie]180-essie , [I]3306-you am not unjust ; [I]3306-you will let [you]180-essie go this instant , to [any quarter of [the world]672-the world]5922-any quarter of the world that [you]180-essie wish , without a word of remonstrance , if [you]180-essie will only look up in [my]3306-you face and say , ' [St. John]164-st. john , [I]3306-you do n't love [you]180-essie . ' "[3306-you] [She]164-st. john lifts , with infinite difficulty , eyes in which pride and shy passion are fighting a duel to the death , and falters : " [St. John]164-st. john , [I]164-st. john do n't — "[164-st. john] but , in the mid - utterance of that falsehood , [her]164-st. john voice fails suddenly , and [she]164-st. john buries [her]164-st. john burning shamed face on [his]3306-you breast . " [I]3306-you knew it , "[3306-you] [he]3306-you cries , triumphantly , dropping a light kiss — for has not [her]164-st. john hesitation confessed [him]3306-you [her]164-st. john owner?—upon [her]164-st. john bent head . " Oh love ! "[3306-you] [he]3306-you cries , with an accent of impatient but tender upbraiding , " are [you]164-st. john struggling to get away from [me]3306-you still ? "[3311-you] " [I]3312-i do not love [you]3311-you perfectly , then , [I]3312-i suppose , "[3312-i] [she]3312-i answers , calmly ; " for not even the enormous happiness of being with [you]3311-you always , of being half [your]3311-you life , could compensate [me]3312-i for the degradation of bringing [you]3311-you a sullied name . " [St. John]164-st. john , "[3312-i] [she]3312-i says resolutely , laying [her]3312-i hand upon one of [his]3311-you , " [you]3311-you have made [me]3312-i two promises — one that [you]3311-you will go away and leave [me]3312-i to - day , and one that [you]3311-you will leave [me]3312-i never until [I]3312-i send [you]3311-you away . "[3312-i] " But [I]3311-you will not be sent , "[3311-you] [he]3311-you cries fiercely , giving the reins to [his]3311-you passion . " The conditions under which that promise was made are utterly changed ; the obstacle that parted [us]5942-us then no longer exists : there is none between [us]5942-us now but what is of [your]3311-you own raising . [I]3311-you am , therefore , no longer bound by that oath ; [I]3311-you will not go ! "[3311-you] " Very well , "[3313-i] [she]3313-i answers , sighing : " then [I]3313-i must ; and when one is to have a foot or a hand cut off , it is best to do it at once . " [You]3313-i may say ' goodbye ' to [me]3313-i , but [I]3313-i will never say ' goodbye ' to [you]3313-i : death is the only ' goodbye ' [I]3313-i will accept as valid between [us]5943-us . " [Esther!—Esther]508-esther!—esther ! THE rain ceases , and [St. John]164-st. john endeavours to work off [his]3311-you disappointment and rage in a very long walk . When [he]3311-you at length re - enters [the house]687-the house , [the two old people]3317-the two old people are hobbling into luncheon , and [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington sweeping , slowly and alone , after [them]3317-the two old people . [Her]258-miss blessington face is serene , and , to [his]3311-you surprise , wears no bellicose expression towards [himself]3311-you . To tell the truth , during three hours of point - lace work , [the Gerard]258-miss blessington diamonds have kept flashing and gleaming , restless - bright , before [her]258-miss blessington mind 's eye . " Does [Miss Craven]164-st. john know that luncheon is ready ? "[3311-you] Luncheon over , [the old people]5196-the old people are convoyed back to [their]5196-the old people arm - chairs . " [I]256-constance have been telling [[my]256-constance aunt]5504-my aunt about [our]5947-our alarm last night , [St. John]164-st. john , "[256-constance] [she]256-constance says , as sweetly as usual . "[256-constance] " [I]256-constance am afraid [I]256-constance was unreasonably angry with [you]3311-you for what was evidently a mere accident ; but when [one]559-one is nervous and frightened , [one]559-one really does not know what [one]559-one says . " [You]3311-you do n't bear malice , [I]3322-i hope ? Things are much as they were before , [I]3322-i suppose ? "[3322-i] [He]3322-i lays down [his]3322-i paper , and looks at [her]256-constance steadily with [his]3322-i clear grey eyes . " Things are between [us]5951-us as they have been all [our]5951-us lives up to last October ; as they have been since then , they will never be again . "[3322-i] [She]256-constance turns away quickly , to hide the mortification which even the cold pure mask of [her]256-constance face can not wholly conceal . " That is what [I]256-constance meant , "[256-constance] [she]256-constance answers , quietly — with great presence of mind endeavouring to prevent [her]256-constance defeat from being converted into a rout ; and though [she]256-constance deceives neither [herself]256-constance nor [him]3322-i , the effort to do both is at least laudable . And [Esther]148-esther , interrupted midway in the packing of [her]148-esther few and paltry goods by the sharper recurrence of that pain in [her]148-esther side , lies on [her]148-esther bed , shut out by the strength of that bodily agony from all power of mental suffering . The excitement of the night — the exposure to the chill morning air — the thorough wetting undergone in [her]148-esther wild run through [the park]3880-the park , amid the driving rain , have hastened the coming of that great sickness with which for weeks past [she]148-esther has been threatened . Darkness falls : dinner - time comes . Presently [the housemaid]647-the housemaid , who had formerly given [her]256-constance the laudanum , knocks at [her]256-constance door . " Dinner , please , [miss]1911-miss . "[647-the housemaid] " [I]5258-the poor child can not go down , "[5258-the poor child] answers [the poor child]5258-the poor child , rather piteously , sitting up , and pushing away the tumbled hair from [her]5258-the poor child flushed cheeks , while [her]5258-the poor child eyes blink in the candle . light . " [I]647-the housemaid do n't want any dinner ; [I]647-the housemaid 'm ill ! "[647-the housemaid] " Dear [me]3893-the woman , ' m ! [you]256-constance do look bad ! "[3893-the woman] exclaims [the woman]3893-the woman , drawing nearer to the bed , and speaking with an accent half - shocked , half - pleased ; for , in [a servant]3327-a servant 's eyes , the next best thing to a death in [the house]687-the house is a serious illness . " Would not [you]256-constance like to have [Mr. Brand]166-mr. brandon sent for ? "[3893-the woman] " Oh , no — thanks ! "[682-the girl] replies [the girl]682-the girl , sinking wearily back on [her]682-the girl pillow . " [I]682-the girl daresay it will go of itself . "—"If[682-the girl] [I]0-i did send for [him]3330-him , [I]0-i have no money to pay for [him]3330-him , " is [her]0-i mental reflection . The evening drags away about as heavily as usual in [the saloon]2552-the saloon . About nine o'clock [[Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington 's maid]5955-miss blessington 's maid appears at the door . "[0-i] Please ' m , might [I]0-i speak to [you]0-i for a moment ? " "[0-i] Certainly , " answers [Constance]256-constance , graciously , rising and walking off to [the demanded conference]5956-the demanded conference . [Constance]256-constance is always polite to [[her]256-constance servants]5957-her servants ; it is a bad style , middle - class to be rude to [one 's inferiors]5958-one 's inferiors . " "[164-st. john] What is the matter with [her]164-st. john ? " inquires [the other]1100-the other , placidly ; "[164-st. john] nothing but influenza , [I]0-i daresay ; it always goes through [a house]4042-a house . " "[0-i] Indeed , ' m , [I]0-i do n't know ; but [she]164-st. john has a hawful pain in [her]164-st. john , side , and [she]164-st. john can scarce draw [her]164-st. john breath , and [she]164-st. john is hot — as hot as fire . " "[164-st. john] Good heavens ! " cries [Constance]256-constance , thoroughly roused by this gay picture ; "[164-st. john] [I]0-i hope it is not anything catching ! " Reassured on this point , and having ordered the attendance of [Mr. Brand]166-mr. brandon , [she]256-constance returns unruffled to the fireside . "[164-st. john] What was that mysterious communication , [Constance]256-constance ? " asks [St. John]164-st. john , lazily , quite willing to be amicable now that [their]5960-their relative positions are made clearly evident . "[0-i] [I]0-i really do n't know , " [she]0-i replies , drily ; "[0-i] [you]3334-he had better wait till [Mr. Brand]166-mr. brandon comes , and ask [him]166-mr. brandon . " Ten o'clock ! [The old couple]5961-the old couple are trundled off to [[their]5961-the old couple separate apartments]5962-their separate apartments : and [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington , having bidden [St. John]164-st. john a cold "[166-mr. brandon] good - night , " sails , candle in hand , up [the grand staircase]5963-the grand staircase , to that sleep that never fails to come at [her]164-st. john calm bidding . [Gerard]258-miss blessington foregoes [his]166-mr. brandon evening pipe , because [the smoking - room]5675-the smoking - room does not look to the front . In painful unrest , [he]166-mr. brandon unfastens the shutters of one of [the saloon]2552-the saloon - windows , and , raising the stiff and seldom - opened sash , leans out , looking and listening - looking at the maiden moon that rides , pale and proud , while black ruffian clouds chase each other to overtake [her]164-st. john . [Mr. Brand]166-mr. brandon is out , apparently ; for half - past ten has been struck , in different tones — bass and treble , deep and squeaky — by half - a - dozen different clocks , and still [he]166-mr. brandon has not arrived . At length , to [the watcher]5966-the watcher 's strained ear , comes the sound of wheels descending the steep pitch , from [Blessington village]256-constance ; then a brougham 's lamps gleam , issuing from between the rhododendron banks , and roll , like two angry eyes , to the door . In [his]166-mr. brandon feverish anxiety , and impatience at the long tarrying of [the sleepy footman]5967-the sleepy footman , [St. John]164-st. john [himself]164-st. john admits [the doctor]4046-the doctor ; and , following [him]4046-the doctor at a little distance , as [he]166-mr. brandon is ushered [upstairs]3979-upstairs , sits down in [[his]166-mr. brandon own bedroom]5970-his own bedroom , with the door wide open , ready to pounce out upon the small Æsculapius , as [he]166-mr. brandon passes along [the gallery]4566-the gallery at [his]166-mr. brandon departure , and learn [his]166-mr. brandon verdict . The visit is rather a long one ; to [St. John]164-st. john , sitting still in [his]166-mr. brandon idle impatient misery , it seems as though the sound of [Esther]148-esther 's opening door would never come ; but never is a long day . At length the welcome sound is heard ; and [the young man]670-the young man , precipitating [himself]670-the young man into [the passage]5265-the passage , comes face to face with [a small elderly gentleman]5974-a small elderly gentleman , shiveringly taking [his]670-the young man way down [the unwarmed ghostly old corridors]5975-the unwarmed ghostly old corridors . "[166-mr. brandon] Is it a serious case ? " [he]670-the young man asks , abruptly , framing the simple words as they rise from [his]670-the young man full heart . [Mr. Brand]166-mr. brandon stares , surprised , at [[his]166-mr. brandon questioner]5976-his questioner 's blanched face . [He]166-mr. brandon had imagined that [[his]166-mr. brandon patient]5977-his patient was [a little friendless orphan companion , whose life or death — save as a mere matter of compassion]5978-a little friendless orphan companion , whose life or death — save as a mere matter of compassion — were subjects of almost equal indifference to [the people under whose roof [she]5977-his patient lies , panting out [her]5977-his patient young life]5979-the people under whose roof she lies , panting out her young life . "[166-mr. brandon] Serious ? Well — oh ! [I]0-i assure [you]0-i there is no cause for alarm , [[my]0-i dear sir]3335-my dear sir , " [he]166-mr. brandon says , imagining that [he]166-mr. brandon has got the key to the mystery ; "[0-i] it is nothing infectious , [I]0-i assure [you]0-i — nothing whatever ! " "[0-i] That is not what [I]0-i asked , " rejoins [Gerard]258-miss blessington , bluntly . "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't care whether it is infectious or not ; is it dangerous ? " "[0-i] Are [you]0-i any relation of [the young lady]4110-the young lady , may [I]0-i ask?—brother , perhaps ? " inquires [the little doctor]5980-the little doctor , peering inquisitively , though under difficulties — for the abundant wind is playing rude tricks with the flame of [his]5980-the little doctor candle — into [St. John]164-st. john 's sad brown face . "[0-i] No — none . " "[0-i] Well , then , to be candid with [you]0-i , it does look rather serious , " [he]5980-the little doctor answers , with the careless deliberate calmnesa which those whose half - life is spelt in pronouncing death- warrants seem insensibly to acquire : "[0-i] a sharp attack of inflammation of the lungs , brought on by neglect and exposure . By - the - by , can [you]0-i inform [me]0-i whether there is any predisposition to lung - disease in [Miss]3337-miss — [[Miss Craven]164-st. john 's family]3338-miss craven 's family ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i know nothing about [[her]164-st. john family]3339-her family , " replies [the other]1100-the other , gloomily . [He]1100-the other has no reason , beyond the probability of the thing , for supposing that [she]164-st. john had ever had [a father]5982-a father or [mother]826-mother , much less [a grandfather]5984-a grandfather or [grandmother]2368-grandmother . [Mr. Brand]166-mr. brandon retires , completely mystified ; and [St. John]164-st. john , re - entering [[his]5986-his room]5823-his room , throws [himself]5986-his into an arm - chair , and , covering [his]5986-his face with [his]5986-his hands , sends up violent voiceless prayers for the young life that is exchanging the first passes with that skilfulest of fencers , whom [the nations]5988-the nations have christened "[0-i] Death ! " In all [his]5986-his rough godless life [he]5986-his has had small faith in the efficacy of prayer ; but , on the bare chance of there being some good in it , [he]5986-his prays wordlessly in [his]5986-his stricken heart for [her]164-st. john . Before [they]5989-they have done with [him]5986-his , [the inmates of [Blessington Hall]128-blessington hall]5990-the inmates of blessington hall have grown very familiar with [Dr. Brand]509-dr. brand 's face night and morning , night and morning , coming and going , coming and going , through many days ; for [the adversary with whom [the child]5047-the child is wrestling]5991-the adversary with whom the child is wrestling has thrown many a better and stouter than [she]164-st. john — and the battle is bitter . It is of little use now that [she]164-st. john hate the shadowing ginger curtains of the vast old wooden four - poster ; there must [she]164-st. john lie , through all the weary twenty - four hours , in paroxysms of acutest pain , in fits of utter breathlessness , in agonies of thirst . Grief for [Jack]146-jack , love for [St. John]164-st. john , shamed concern at [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington 's damaging story and insulting words , are all swallowed up in the consuming craving for something to wet [her]164-st. john parched lips , to cool [her]164-st. john dry throat — something to drink ! something to drink ! By - and - by , with the pain , [she]164-st. john becomes light - headed — wanders a little — "[0-i] babbles of [green fields]3340-green fields ; " babbles to the uninterested ears of [the sleepy tired nurse]5993-the sleepy tired nurse , of the twisted seat under the old cherry - tree , of the tea - roses up the [kitchen - garden walk]724-kitchen - garden walk , of the yellow chickens in the rickyard . Then [her]164-st. john delirium grows wilder : the green flabby Cupids on the walls come down out of the tapestry , and make at [her]164-st. john . [One , that is riding on a lion and blowing a horn , with fat cheeks puffed out]5995-one , that is riding on a lion and blowing a horn , with fat cheeks puffed out , comes riding at [her]164-st. john — riding up the bed - quilt , riding over [her]164-st. john . Then the black and gold cocks on the old japan - chest , that , with neck - feathers ruffled , and heads lowered , stand ever , in act to fight , change [their]5995-one , that is riding on a lion and blowing a horn , with fat cheeks puffed out attitude : come pecking , pecking at [her]164-st. john — pecking at [her]164-st. john eyes ; and [she]164-st. john , with terrified hands stretched out , fights at them — thrusts them away . And it comes to pass , that there falls a day when [these sick fancies]5996-these sick fancies pass — when the pain and breathlessness pass — and when [Esther]148-esther lies in utter exhaustion , weak as [a day - old babe]5997-a day - old babe , whiter than any Annunciation lily , between [her]164-st. john sheets . Eyes and ears and power of touch are still [hers]164-st. john : but it seems as though all objects of sensation , of sight and sound and touch , reach [her]164-st. john only through a thick blanket . [She]164-st. john can see , as if at an immense distance off , shrouded in mist , the faces of [doctor]5998-doctor and [nurse]5999-nurse as [they]5995-one , that is riding on a lion and blowing a horn , with fat cheeks puffed out lean over [her]164-st. john , and then , turning away , whisper together . [She]164-st. john can not hear what [they]5995-one , that is riding on a lion and blowing a horn , with fat cheeks puffed out say ; [she]164-st. john has no wish to hear — [she]164-st. john has no wish for anything ; only [she]164-st. john lies , staring , with great eyes , straight before [her]164-st. john at the bed - hangings , at the ceiling , at the little countless pigeon - holes in [her]164-st. john toilet - table . One of the windows is open ; and heaven 's sweet breath circulates fresh and slow through [the quiet room]3744-the quiet room . It is Sunday ; [the village people]6001-the village people are clustering about [the church]1613-the church - door ; the violets , like blue eyes that have slept through winter 's night , are opening under the churchyard wall . The bells are ringing ; now , loud and clear — "[0-i] ding - dong bell ! ding - dong bell ! " almost as if [they]5995-one , that is riding on a lion and blowing a horn , with fat cheeks puffed out were being rung in [the still chamber itself]6003-the still chamber itself — [they]5995-one , that is riding on a lion and blowing a horn , with fat cheeks puffed out come ; now , faint and far ; the wind has caught the sound in [his]5998-doctor rough hand , and carried it otherwhither . Whether they ring loud or faint , whether they ring or ring not at all , [she]164-st. john has no care ; [she]164-st. john has no care for anything . [She]164-st. john is very weary : it seems as if there were but a faint life - spark left in [her]164-st. john ; [she]164-st. john can scarce lift [her]164-st. john hand to [her]164-st. john head . Now and then [they]5995-one , that is riding on a lion and blowing a horn , with fat cheeks puffed out raise [her]164-st. john up , and , without asking [her]164-st. john consent , pour brandy and beef - tea down [her]164-st. john reluctant throat . [She]164-st. john is so tired ! Oh ! why can not [they]5995-one , that is riding on a lion and blowing a horn , with fat cheeks puffed out leave [her]164-st. john alone ! The slow hours roll themselves round ; [the people]1500-the people have gone into [church]3708-church , and have come out again . [Mr. Brand]166-mr. brandon is here still ; [he]166-mr. brandon is entering at the door ; [he]166-mr. brandon is leaning over [her]164-st. john . "[3343-they] [[My]0-i dear young lady]3344-my dear young lady , " [he]6009-the good man says , very gravely , "[3343-they] it is very painful for [me]0-i to have such a sad task to perform ; but [I]0-i can not reconcile it with [my]0-i conscience not to tell [you]164-st. john that , in all human probability , [you]164-st. john have not many more days to live . " Through the thick veil of [her]164-st. john weakness and its attendant apathy pierces the sting of that awful news : [her]164-st. john eyes dilate in their horror and fear , and [she]164-st. john falls to weeping , feebly and helplessly . "[164-st. john] Do n't say that — it is not true . How unkind [you]164-st. john are ! [I]0-i do n't want to die ; [I]0-i 'm so young ; [I]0-i have had so little pleasure ! " "[3345-we] [We]3345-we must submit to [God]435-god 's will , " says [the doctor]4046-the doctor , a little tritely . It is so easy to submit to [God]435-god 's will towards [[one]559-one 's friends]6012-one 's friends and [acquaintance]6013-acquaintance . [She]164-st. john does not answer , but raises [her]164-st. john hands with difficulty to [her]164-st. john wasted face , while the tears trickle hot and frequent through that poor white shield . "[3345-we] Have [you]164-st. john any relations that [you]164-st. john would like to have sent for ? " inquires [Mr. Brand]166-mr. brandon , not unkindly ; stooping over [her]164-st. john , rather moved , but not very much so . Often before has it been [his]166-mr. brandon portion to say , to [youth]615-youth and [maid]5693-maid and [stalwart man]6016-stalwart man , "[3346-thou] [Thou]3346-thou must die ! " "[0-i] [I]0-i have no relations , " [she]164-st. john answers , almost inaudibly . "[0-i] [Any friends]3347-any friends ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i have [no friends]989-no friends . " "[989-no friends] [You]0-i have , then , no wish to see [any one]523-any one ? " "[0-i] No . " ( [Her]164-st. john lips quiver , and a slight shudder passes over [her]164-st. john form , as [she]164-st. john utters the words , "[0-i] Is it quite certain ? " ) "[0-i] It is impossible to be quite certain in any case , " [he]166-mr. brandon answers , slowly ; "[0-i] while there is life , there is hope , [you]0-i know ; but — but — [I]0-i can not buoy [you]0-i up with a false confidence . " [She]164-st. john lies quiet a moment or two , regathering [her]164-st. john spent strength . "[0-i] How long do [you]0-i think [I]0-i shall live ? " "[0-i] It is impossible to say exactly , " [he]166-mr. brandon replies , gravely . "[0-i] A few days — a few hours ; [one]559-one can not be certain which . " Again [she]164-st. john is silent , exhausted with the slight effort of framing a sentence . "[0-i] Ask [Mr. Gerard]247-mr. gerard to come and see [me]0-i — now — at once — before [I]0-i die ! " [He]166-mr. brandon looks at [her]164-st. john in astonishment , with a half - suspicion that [she]164-st. john is light - headed ; but [her]164-st. john eyes look back at [him]166-mr. brandon with such perfect sanity in their clear depths , that [he]166-mr. brandon must needs abandon that idea . [He]166-mr. brandon can not choose but undertake [her]164-st. john commission at [her]164-st. john bidding . And [St. John]164-st. john comes . [They]6017-they are singing the "[247-mr. gerard] Nunc Dimittis , " which , saith [Bacon]511-bacon , "[247-mr. gerard] is ever the sweetest canticle " in [the Church]1613-the church , as [he]166-mr. brandon crosses the threshold of [that room]6019-that room , and draws near that bed on which , but a few short nights ago , [he]166-mr. brandon had seen [her]164-st. john , with [[his]166-mr. brandon covetous lover]6020-his covetous lover 's eyes , lying in all [her]164-st. john round dimpled beauty . There comes no greeting blush now into [her]164-st. john cheeks — the cheeks , that the sound of [his]166-mr. brandon far - off footfall had been wo nt to redden . How can [she]164-st. john , that is the affianced of great Death , blush for [any mortal lover]6021-any mortal lover ? [Her]164-st. john eyes lift themselves languidly to [his]166-mr. brandon face ; and , even in [the "[0-i] valley of the shadow]6022-the " valley of the shadow , " dwell there comfortably ; though in that countenance — never beautiful , and now made haggard by watching , with reddened eyelids and quivering muscles — [a stranger]2869-a stranger would have seen small comeliness . "[0-i] So [I]0-i am going to die , [they]3351-they tell [me]0-i ! " [she]164-st. john says , whisperingly — says it simply and mournfully . [Gerard]247-mr. gerard can not answer ; only [he]247-mr. gerard flings [himself]247-mr. gerard forward upon the bed , and devours [her]164-st. john thin hand with miserable kisses . "[3351-they] Perhaps it is not true ! Oh , [I]0-i hope it is not , [St. John]164-st. john ! " [she]164-st. john says , falling to weeping ; in [her]164-st. john feebleness and great dread of that goal to which all [our]6024-our highways and byways and [field - paths]6025-field - paths lead : Still no answer . "[164-st. john] Can not [they]3351-they do anything for [me]0-i ? " [she]164-st. john asks piteously . [He]247-mr. gerard lifts [his]247-mr. gerard head ; and in [his]247-mr. gerard eyes — the eyes that have not wept more than twice since [he]247-mr. gerard was [a little white - frocked child]6026-a little white - frocked child — stand heavy burning tears . "[3351-they] Nothing , [darling]2012-darling , [I]0-i 'm afraid , " [he]247-mr. gerard answers , in a rough choked voice . "[0-i] There is no hope , then ? " "[3353-poor little one] Oh , [poor little one]3353-poor little one ! why do [you]0-i torture [me]0-i with such questions ? [I]0-i dare not tell [you]0-i a lie ! " "[0-i] [You]0-i mean that [I]0-i am sure to die ! " [she]0-i says , faintly , with a slight shudder , while a look of utter hopeless fear comes into [her]0-i wan face . [He]247-mr. gerard throws [his]247-mr. gerard arms about [her]0-i in [his]247-mr. gerard great despair . "[0-i] Why do [you]0-i make [me]0-i tell [you]0-i such news twice ? Is not once enough ? " "[0-i] It is quite sure ! Oh , [I]0-i wish [I]0-i was not so frightened ! " [His]247-mr. gerard features contract in the agony of that moment ; an overpowering temptation assails [him]247-mr. gerard , to tell [her]0-i some pleasant falsehood about [her]0-i state ; but [he]247-mr. gerard resists it . "[0-i] As far as [anything human]3354-anything human can be sure , it is so , " [he]247-mr. gerard says , turning away [his]247-mr. gerard head . "[0-i] Are [you]0-i sure there is no mistake?—is it quite certain ? " "[0-i] Quite . " "[0-i] Then"—essaying to raise [herself]0-i in the bed , and reaching out [her]0-i slight , weary arms to [him—"then]247-mr. gerard[0-i] kiss [me]0-i , [St. John]164-st. john ! " Without a word [he]247-mr. gerard gathers [her]0-i to [his]247-mr. gerard breast ; fully understanding , in [his]247-mr. gerard riven heart , that this embrace , which [she]0-i [herself]0-i can ask for , must indeed be a final one ; [his]247-mr. gerard lips cling to [hers]0-i in the wild silence of a solemn last farewell . "[164-st. john] [I]0-i 'm glad [you]3355-you are not angry with [me]0-i now , " [she]0-i whispers , almost inaudibly ; and then [her]0-i arms slacken their clasp about [his]247-mr. gerard bronzed neck , and [her]0-i head droops heavy and inert on [his]247-mr. gerard shoulder . And so [they]6027-they find [them]6027-they half an hour later : [he]247-mr. gerard , like one crazed , with a face as ashen - white as [her]0-i own , clasping [a lifeless woman]6028-a lifeless woman to [his]247-mr. gerard breast . LIFELESS ! Yes ! But there are two kinds of lifelessness : one from which there is no back - coming — one from which there is . [Esther]148-esther 's is the latter . Although [a member of that fraternity whose province it is to kill and to make alive]6029-a member of that fraternity whose province it is to kill and to make alive has sapiently said of [her]3356-she , "[3355-you] [She]3356-she will die!—she has not a week to live ! " [Mother Nature]162-nature has made answer , "[3356-she] [She]3356-she shall not die ; [I]0-i will save [her]3356-she alive ! [She]3356-she has yet many years . " And [Esther]148-esther lives . For many days , it is hard to predicate of [her]148-esther whether [she]148-esther be dead or alive ; so faintly does the wave of life heave to and fro in [her]148-esther breast — so lowly does life 's candle burn . But though the candle burn low , it is not blown out . By - and - bye strength gathers itself again , and comes back to pulse and vein and limb . At seventeen life holds [us]6030-us so fast in [his]247-mr. gerard embrace that [he]247-mr. gerard will hardly let [us]6030-us go . To [the sick child]6031-the sick child there come sweet sleeps ; there comes a desire for food — a pleasure in the dusty sunbeam streaming through the window — in the mote playing up and down on ceiling and wall . [I]3356-she marvel will the bliss of spirits at the Resurrection dawn , feeling the clothing of pure new bodies , surpass the delight that attends the renewal of the old body at the uprising from a great sickness ? The blanket that hung between [Esther]148-esther and all objects of sensation is withdrawn : full consciousness returns , and remembrance ; and in [their]6032-their company , untold shame — shame at not having died ! The celandine 's greenish buds are unclosing into little brazen wide - awake flowers in the hedge - banks : the crocuses in [the garden]846-the garden - borders hold up their gold chalices to catch the gentle February rain and the mild February sunbeams ; in the wood - hollows the mercury — spring 's earliest herald — flourishes , thick and frequent , its stout green shoots . About [the meadows]4591-the meadows , small gawky lambs make a feeble "[3356-she] ba - a - a - ing . " It is drawing towards sundown . The window is open ; and near [it]6035-it , on a beech bough , a thrush sits , singing a loud sweet even - song . [Esther]148-esther has been fully dressed for the first time , and has been moved into [an adjoining dressing - room]6036-an adjoining dressing - room . In the small change of scene , there is , to [her]148-esther , intense delight — delight even in the changed pattern on the walls , in the different shape of the chairs — even in the brass handles of the old oak chest of drawers . Every power seems new and fresh — every sensation exquisitely keen ; in every exercise of sight and sound and touch there is conscious joy . [She]148-esther has been amusing [herself]148-esther making little tests of [her]148-esther strength . [She]148-esther lifts a book that lies on the table beside [her]148-esther ; it is small and light , but to [her]148-esther it seems over - heavy ; [she]148-esther has to take two hands to it . [She]148-esther makes a pilgrimage from [her]148-esther arm - chair to the window — [she]148-esther has to catch at the wall , at the furniture , for support ; but [she]148-esther gets there at last , and , sitting down on the window - seat , looks out at the quiet sky , blackened with home - coming rooks — at the pool made flame - red by the westering sun — at the peeping roof of [the distant deer - barn]6037-the distant deer - barn . That little bit of roof brings a flood of recollections to [her]148-esther , and first and foremost amongst them stands [St. John]164-st. john and [her]148-esther last interview with [him]3357-he . Although [she]148-esther is quite alone , a torrent of red invades cheeks and throat and brow , even to the roots of [her]148-esther hair . "[3356-she] [I]0-i sent for [him]3357-he , " [she]148-esther says to [herself]148-esther , with a sort of gasp ; "[0-i] [I]0-i asked [him]3357-he to kiss [me]0-i , and [I]0-i did not die ! How horrible ! [I]0-i must never see [him]3357-he again . " Then [she]148-esther falls to thinking about [him]3357-he : whether [he]3357-he is still in [the house]687-the house ? whether [he]3357-he has made up [his]3357-he differences with [Miss Blessington]258-miss blessington ? whether [he]3357-he is very joyful at [her]148-esther own recovery ? whether [he]3357-he is not penetrated with the ridiculousness of [her]148-esther impressive leave - taking , which , after all — oh bathos!—was no leave - taking at all ? "[3357-he] [He]3357-he must never hear [me]0-i mentioned again , " [she]148-esther says , twisting [her]148-esther hands nervously together . "[3357-he] Perhaps [he]3357-he will forget it in time ; perhaps [he]3357-he will not tell [any one]523-any one about it . How soon shall [I]0-i be well enough to go?—in a week ? five days ? four ? three?—and whither am [I]0-i to go ? " Aye , [whither]512-whither , [Miss Craven]164-st. john ? There are but two alternatives for [her]148-esther — the Union and [Plas Berwyn]38-plas berwyn . [She]148-esther must swallow [her]148-esther pride , and return to [the Brandons]232-the brandons : to the long prayers ; to the half - past six tea and bread and scrape ; to the three bits of bacon at breakfast ; and to the perusal of the Record and the Rock : [she]148-esther must induce [Mrs. Brandon]201-mrs. brandon again to advertise for a situation in [a pious family]2338-a pious family . This morning 's post has brought [her]148-esther four pages of doctrine , reproof , and instruction from [Miss Bessy]202-bessy , and , lurking within them , has come a short , sweet , metrical prayer , adapted to every [Christian]181-christian 's daily use : There is no time like the present ; [she]148-esther will write now . [She]148-esther has drawn paper and pens towards [her]148-esther , when the door opens , and [[her]148-esther friend]6040-her friend [the housemaid]647-the housemaid enters . [Doctor]5998-doctor and [nurse]5999-nurse have fled , "[3359-you] If [you]3359-you please , [Miss Craven]164-st. john , do [you]3359-you feel well enough to see [visitors]4039-visitors ? " [She]0-i looks up astonished . "[0-i] [I]0-i 'm well enough for anything ; but [I]0-i 'm sure [I]0-i do n't know who is likely to visit [me]0-i . " "[247-mr. gerard] [Mr. Gerard]247-mr. gerard was asking whether [he]247-mr. gerard might speak to [you]3359-you ' m ? " "[247-mr. gerard] Certainly not — [I]0-i mean yes — [No.—Yes]513-no.—yes , [I]0-i suppose — if [he]247-mr. gerard wishes , " replies [the girl]682-the girl , stammering hopelessly . [Miss Craven]164-st. john looks rather small , and excessively childish , sunk in [her]164-st. john huge elbow - chair ; a white wrapper envelopes [her]164-st. john figure ; [her]164-st. john hair , which [she]164-st. john has not taken the trouble to dress properly , is twisted up in the loosest , unfashionablest , sweetest great knot at the back of [her]164-st. john neck ; while a cherry - coloured ribbon coquettishly snoods [her]164-st. john noble small head : [the innocentest , freshest , shyest rosebud - face]6045-the innocentest , freshest , shyest rosebud - face , and the liquidest southern eyes , complete the picture . [St. John]164-st. john apparently treads hard upon the heels of [the messenger]6046-the messenger , for , before permission is well accorded [him]6046-the messenger , [he]6046-the messenger is in [[his]6046-the messenger mistress]6047-his mistress 's presence . Upon [his]6046-the messenger brown face is untold gladness — in [his]6046-the messenger eyes enormous love ; and in them lurks also a look of half - malicious , half - tender mirth . [She]164-st. john rises , and then sits down again , in unutterable confusion ; and at length holds out [her]164-st. john hand with distant diffidence to [him]6046-the messenger , while as intense a blush as ever made [mortal woman]6048-mortal woman call upon [the hills]6049-the hills to cover [her]164-st. john , bathes every inch of [her]164-st. john that is visible . [Her]164-st. john cheeks feel like gigantic red globes ; over which [her]164-st. john eyes have difficulty in looking . [His]6046-the messenger eyes , laughing , pitiless , yet impassioned , refuse to leave [her]164-st. john . "[247-mr. gerard] [You]3361-you did not give [me]0-i so cold a greeting when [I]0-i last saw [you]3361-you , [Essie]180-essie ? " [he]6046-the messenger says , with an enraging smile of passionate triumph . [She]164-st. john turns away [her]164-st. john head , and covers [her]164-st. john face with both hands ; but , in the interstices between [her]164-st. john fingers , the lovely carnation blazes manifestly vivid . "[180-essie] Oh , don't — don't be so cruel ! " [she]164-st. john murmurs , in a stifled voice . "[180-essie] The truth can never be cruel ! " [he]6046-the messenger says quietly , smiling still ; and so kneels down on the floor beside [her]164-st. john . But [she]164-st. john only murmurs , "[180-essie] Go away ; please go away ! please let [me]0-i alone ! " — the words coming half - broken , half lost , from behind the covering of [her]164-st. john hands . [He]6046-the messenger puts up [his]6046-the messenger , and tries to draw away the screen from [her]164-st. john shamed discomfited face , saying , "[180-essie] Look at [me]0-i , [Essie]180-essie ! " But [she]164-st. john , with all [her]164-st. john feeble strength , resists . "[180-essie] [I]0-i cannot!—I can not ! " [she]164-st. john cries , vehemently ; "[180-essie] do n't ask [me]0-i ! Why did n't [I]0-i die ? When [they]3362-they saw [I]0-i was getting well , [they]3362-they ought to have killed [me]0-i . Oh , [I]0-i wish [they]3362-they had ! " "[3362-they] [I]0-i 'm rather glad , on the whole , [they]3362-they did not , " [he]6050-he answers , gravely ; and so , with one final effort , [he]6050-he being strong , and [she]164-st. john being weak , [he]6050-he obtains possession of [her]164-st. john two hands , and [her]164-st. john face lies bare , unshaded — dyed with an agony of shame — clothed with great beauty — under the hungry tenderness of [his]6050-he happy eyes . "[3362-they] To think of making [one]559-one 's last dying speech and confession , and then not dying after all , " [she]164-st. john says , in torments of confusion , yet unable to restrain an uneasy laugh . "[3362-they] It is too disgraceful ! [I]0-i shall never get over it ! Never ! — NEVER ! — NEVER ! ! " "[3362-they] Time , which mitigates all afflictions , may mitigate [yours]3364-yours , " [he]6050-he replies , gaily , unable to resist the exquisite pleasure of teasing [her]164-st. john . [She]164-st. john turns from [him]6050-he with a petulant movement of head and shoulder . "[3362-they] Why do n't [you]0-i go ? " [she]164-st. john cries , the angry tears flashing into [her]164-st. john eyes ; "[0-i] [I]0-i hate the sight of [you]0-i ! " At that [he]6050-he grows grave . "[180-essie] [Essie]180-essie , " [he]6050-he says , slipping [his]6050-he arms round [her]164-st. john as [she]164-st. john sits , shrinking away from [him]6050-he in the deep chintz chair , "[180-essie] in that awful moment , when [you]180-essie thought — and [God]435-god knows [I]0-i thought so too — that [we]3365-we were saying ' goodbye ' to [one another]922-one another for always , the barriers that [your]180-essie wretched false pride had built up between [us]3365-we were knocked down ; try as [you]180-essie may , [you]180-essie can never build them up again . " "[0-i] [I]0-i knocked down plenty of barriers , [I]0-i 'm aware , " [she]164-st. john answers , ruefully . "[0-i] [You]0-i need not remind [me]0-i of that ! " "[0-i] Never to be built up again any more — never any more ! " [he]6050-he says , [his]6050-he mirth swallowed up in great solemn joy . [She]164-st. john has fallen forwards into [his]6050-he embrace ; [he]6050-he holds [her]164-st. john little trembling form against [his]6050-he heart — a posture to which [she]164-st. john submits , chiefly because it affords [her]164-st. john an opportunity of hiding [her]164-st. john face upon [his]6050-he shoulder . "[0-i] Never any more ! " [she]164-st. john repeats , mechanically , and then there is silence , save for the thrush , that trills ever [his]6050-he high tender lay . [Presently Essie]514-essie stirs , and whispers , with uneasiness , "[164-st. john] [St. John]164-st. john ! " "[164-st. john] Well ? " "[164-st. john] [You]0-i wo n't tell [any one]523-any one , will [you]0-i ? " "[0-i] Tell [them]523-any one what?—that [you]0-i and [I]0-i are going to be married ? By this time to - morrow [I]0-i hope to have told every one [I]0-i meet : [I]0-i am not so selfish as to wish to keep such good news to [myself]0-i . " "[0-i] No — [I]0-i do n't mean that ; but [you]0-i wo n't tell [any one]523-any one about — about — about that ? " This is the nearest approach [she]0-i can bear to make to the abhorred theme . "[148-esther] [Esther]148-esther ! " "[148-esther] And [you]0-i 'll promise never to joke about it ? " "[0-i] Never , by the holy poker ! " "[0-i] And [you]0-i wo n't twit [me]0-i with it when [we]3369-we quarrel ? " "[0-i] What ! [you]0-i contemplate [our]3369-we having little differences of opinion ? " "[0-i] Of course , " [she]0-i answers , laughing ; "[0-i] when [two such ill - tempered people]3370-two such ill - tempered people come together , how can it be otherwise ? " "[0-i] Quarrel or no quarrel , " [he]6051-his cries , passionately kissing [her]0-i sweet shy lips , as one that can never be satiated with [their]3369-we tender warmth , "[0-i] [we]3369-we are together now , for bad and good , for fair weather and foul , till death [us]3369-we do part ! Say it after [me]0-i , [Essie]514-essie ; do n't let [ours]3369-we be a one - sided compact . " And [Essie]514-essie , obedient , murmurs after [him]6051-his , "[514-essie] Till death [us]3369-we do part ! " And so it comes to pass that in the sweet spring weather , when the ground is a carpet of strewn cherry - blooms , when the cows stand knee - deep in buttercups , and the brake - fern is uncrumpling its tender fronds , the church - bells ring out , and they two are [we]3369-we d. And the sun , that shines down on the bravery of the wedding pomp , as [bride]6052-bride and [groom]6053-groom pace by , shines also hotlier , with a more brazen sickly glare , on [[a soldier]886-a soldier 's grave]6055-a soldier 's grave , over which , three days ago , [[his]6051-his comrades]6056-his comrades fired the parting volley on [[Bermuda]33-bermuda 's sultry shore]6057-bermuda 's sultry shore . The name of [the soldier to whom [Heaven]182-heaven has granted [his]6051-his discharge]6058-the soldier to whom heaven has granted his discharge is [Robert Brandon]147-robert . [Esther Gerard]516-esther gerard may spare [her]3371-her remorse now ; treachery of [hers]3371-her can wound that loyal heart , on which the worm feeds sweetly , never more ! Not unknowing of the good fortune of [the woman [he]3372-he had so madly , miserably , nobly loved]6059-the woman he had so madly , miserably , nobly loved , has [he]3372-he passed away . In [his]3372-he poor schoolboy scrawl [he]3372-he had written [her]3371-her a little simple , badly - worded note , bidding , "[514-essie] God bless and speed [her]3371-her on [her]3371-her way ! " The tears had fallen hot and thick upon the paper ; but [he]3372-he had wiped them off , and [she]3371-her had never guessed them . [He]3372-he has hoarded [his]3372-he scant pay , has denied [himself]3372-he many of the small comforts that to [[his]3372-he brother]3522-his brother - [officers]3374-officers are bare necessaries of life , that [he]3372-he may send [her]3371-her a wedding - gift befitting [[Gerard]516-esther gerard 's bride]3375-gerard 's bride . And [he]3372-he had gone about [his]3372-he wonted ways with [no moping martyr]3376-no moping martyr 's airs , unshaken in [his]3372-he simple creed that , since [God]435-god wills it , all must be for the best . [His]3372-he honest laugh , if it come seldomer than it used , yet is none the less hearty and genial when it does come . And then , that pestilence which , at stated seasons , never forgetting its appointed periods , visits that tropic clime , comes and lays its heavy hand on the shoulder of [many a fair - haired youth]3377-many a fair - haired youth ; and , among the first , upon the stalwart shoulder of [Robert Brandon]147-robert . And [he]3372-he , with no life - hating madness , with no quarrel against fate , yet not all unwilling , having stoutly fought life 's hard battle :
